title: Lovely, quiet boutique hotel 2 blocks from Times Square
text: We truly enjoyed our recent return visit to NYC, staying for 5 nights at Hotel Scherman. If you are looking for a big, steel and glass hotel, this is not it. It is very much a European style boutique hotel. Located right in Hells Kitchen area,  it is surrounded by jazz clubs and restaurants. Even though it is just 2 blocks from the theatres and Times Square, the hotel rooms are extremely quiet, very unusual for NYC! There is no lobby, but the rooms are large and yet cozy, and the bathroom and walk in shower have lots of room to move around in. A very large continental breakfast is provided each morning on the charming mezzanine with lots of choices of breads, fruits, cereals and hard boiled eggs. We had some unexpected issues with the plumbing and the manager quickly moved us to a new room and provided a nights refund. We would definitely choose this lovely hotel again for its comfort and great location for attending the theatre and great restaurants!

title: Lovely hotel in NYC
text: Lovely, clean, quiet boutique hotel that I would highly recommend. So close to Times Square and restaurant row. Walking distance to many places, Broadway shows. It felt very safe and secure. The rooms are a good size, very clean, comfortable beds. Handy fridge, Keurig and microwave in room. The rooftop patio is such a great feature, highly recommend bringing a drink up top and watching the sunset over city- the views are spectacular. We would stay here again and will recommend to anyone we know visiting NYC.

title: Great hotel with lovely staff
text: This is a great hotel! It's perfectly situated for Broadway shows and is a short walk from 42nd Street subway station. The staff are charming and helpful, our room was lovely and spacious and it was great being able to eat breakfast in the hotel at no extra cost. This will be our first choice if we ever come back to New York

title: Very good, super clean, lovely staff
text: The hotel is really good. Great location beside Times Square and restaurants and theatres. Lovely friendly staff.  I had a double twin which was ample size and included a small kitchen set up.  It had all the amenities I needed.  The breakfast was a buffet style continental. I really liked the hotel and would consider it again for an NY trip. Perhaps the only down side is no common area to sit and have a coffee or drink, though there is easy access to the bar next door via the elevator.

title: A Charming Hotel close to Time Square
text: The hotel is very clean, quaint, and beautiful.   The black and white tile adds a beautiful charm to this old hotel.  They have kept the hotel up to date.  The continental breakfast was a bonus and in a nice area.  There is a beautiful restaurant open in the evening.  We did not eat there, but the atmosphere was nice.  The roof top sitting area was nice but chilly while we were there. This hotel is within walking distance to everything around Time Square.   The only down side is the room was small which is to be expected in an older hotel.  But, the cleanliness, hospitality, and charm helped make our trip delightful.  We would definitely stay again.

title: Small pearl in the center
text:
The hotel is a small Boutique Hotel in Mid Town a stone's throw from the best Broadway theaters and Hell's Kitchen
The rooms are very large, very clean and well furnished
Being very small it has no services and the breakfast is also very modest but the environment, tranquility and peace of this hotel make it its strength
It is not a classic modern hotel but this particularity makes it unique and different from everything else
Very good rates given the centrality

title: Comfortable clean and friendly!
text: So comfortable, very clean, quiet and overall just amazing! The breakfast was great too. We loved the whole vibe at hotel Scherman. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The rooftop terrace is awesome. Perfect location for food, theater and exploring this part of nyc. We will definitely be back!

title: Good stay
text: Very friendly and helpful staff.  Clean, unique, old style room.  Comfy bed and pillows (and I tend to be very picky).    Close to Times Square.  Decent continental breakfast.  I don’t eat gluten or dairy and had a nice, filling breakfast.  Would stay here again.

title: Great Theater District Boutique Hotel
text: Great surprise! Large room with kitchen and nicely sized bathroom. Very clean. King sized bed was comfortable with good pillows Right in Restaurant Row so if you are coming in for theater, it’s perfect. Staff was very helpful and welcoming.

title: Perfect !
text: In the top ! Perfect hotel due to its location, its very smiling and friendly staff, the space in the rooms, the bedding, the cleanliness. The breakfast lacks a little saltiness but is excellent. Our flight was in the evening they allowed us to change in the adjoining restaurant and stored our suitcases. In the top ! In short, don’t hesitate any longer, go for it!

title: Recommend
text: Wonderful.  All was well. Good continental breakfast. Room was very clean a n quite for New York. Service desk was very helpful. Call and they bring you ice and water. Very nice service and very helpful.

title: Hotel Scherman: Next time again our hotel
text: Great location in Restaurant Row, short distance to Times Square. Subway at Times Square or 8th Av. can be reached in a few minutes. Very friendly staff and very clean. Family atmosphere. The continental breakfast buffet is simple but it has everything you need. I just missed the pancakes :). We had a double room at the back and it was very quiet. Our colleague had a room facing the street, which was a bit noisy at times due to the traffic and the bar opposite. Conclusion: Still highly recommended!

title: Brilliant
text:
This hotel was a great find. The staff are attentive and on the ball. The rooms are great. Beds… sooo comfortable, great pillows. We has fantastic sleeps
 It’s unusual to find d a hotel in NY to include breakfast. It was amazing. We would highly recommend. It’s fairly central..

title: Great Hotel in Fantastic location
text: Small boutique hotel in walking distance of all main attractions with lots of good restaurants around. Brilliant staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms have everything you need. We will recommend to family and friends visiting New York.

title: A perfect place to stay i NYC
text: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights, and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is quite cozy and nice, and our rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. We had an upgrade to a standard king room with a huge bed and a big bathroom. There is not much noise from the street, and we slept very well every night. There is an amazing roof top terrace with a great view of the city, and even in october we could sit up there eating takeaway and enjoying a beer. The breakfast here is also very good with a nice selection. The breakfast restaurant is spacious and cozy and we enjoyed sitting there in the morning before going out. The staff in the breakfast restaurant were attentive and friendly, and we felt very welcome. The location of the hotel is just perfect. Close to many sights in the city and with many nice restaurants in the same street. Everything was just perfect!

title: Fantastic
text:
Very smooth check in allowing us to store bags until our room was ready and also leave them for the day on departure. 
Really friendly staff on reception who even emailed when our room was available - a nice added touch. 
We were over the moon to find we had been upgraded to a balcony room with a glass of Prosecco to celebrate running New York marathon and as part of our mini moon. It was such a nice gesture that was massively appreciated and brought a huge smile to our faces. No complaints whatsoever about this staff.
Thank you very much for making us so welcome and comfortable

title: 70th Birthday Treat!
text: Awesome location, nicely designed.  Really cool rooftop area.  Breakfast was nice and a beautiful room.   Lots of great restaurants on the same street.  They also gave my Mom a little bottle of champagne to celebrate her 70th birthday and were patient with us when we locked ourselves out of the safe (our fault).  Would definitely go back and highly recommend!  Coffee in the room!

title: Chaleureux
text: Petit hôtel pittoresques.. confort et propreté.. personnel très gentil .. dans un bâtiment qui date de l ancien NY .. on pourrais y rencontrer des caïds de la prohibition si on remontait le temps .. faisant partie du même bâtiment un restaurant qui communique avec l hôtel .. très bien placé on est proche des trucs à voir à NY …

title: Nice place!
text: We stayed in the 2 bedroom apartment.  It had 2 bedrooms and two full bathrooms, a kitchen, and a small living room. The best part is the large furnished private balcony. Everything was very clean, which is very important to me. The staff here is friendly and helpful. Very close to the theaters.

title: Clean and good location!
text:
Clean and comfortable and good price I think. 
Hotel staffs are very helpful and friendly. 
Location is perfect for walk to hot spots. 
I really worried about my mother. 
She is 72 years old and has some sickness.
So it was important to search a hotel. 
Thank you for our best time and see you next time!

title: Perfect location for a New York stay
text:
Don’t get me wrong.  You’d drive down West 46th Street and miss this hotel.  But honestly, it’s one not to miss.  A brilliant location 20mins walk from Grand Central, Central Park,  Hudson Yards and USS Intrepid and everything inbetween.
The hotel clean and well presented, rooms are ideal with en-suite, kitchenette with fridge and microwave. Amenities such as a safe, iron & board, USB ports either side of a queen sized bed and a large flatscreen TV.   
We had a room to the rear of the hotel on the second floor, and it was lovely and quiet. 
The adjoining Tito Murphy’s bar provided the breakfast and was a nice place to eat in the style of an old Irish bar with a Mexican twist.  
Can’t rate this hotel
Highly enough, if I could provide one suggestion. It would be to offer a cooked breakfast via a buffet service or otherwise.   The breakfast was ample, but definitely an area which could be improved,  either way, this wouldn’t stop me eating the over stay 5 out of 5.

title: Very good, cosy hotel with great value
text:
We felt really comfortable as a family: This is a very clean and small Hotel in a VERY busy area. It was actually quite calm.

Nice little rooftop terrace as well.

The breakfast offering was better than we expected - great for starting the busy day!

title: Price gouging at it's finest
text: During my stay at the hotel for NYCCC, our party consisted of four individuals. I had specifically reserved a room with two queen beds, which, according to the website, was advertised as accommodating four occupants. To my surprise, upon receiving the invoice, I noticed an additional charge of $45 for an extra person. Perplexed by this, I sought clarification from the hotel staff, who explained that their pricing structure was based on a three-person occupancy rate, even though the room was designed to comfortably accommodate four guests. I find this discrepancy both puzzling and unreasonable. Consequently, I have decided that for my future visits to New York City, I will seek accommodations elsewhere.

title: Perfect location for seeing a show and Time Square. Within walking distance to the port authority bus terminal.
text: Amazing location, rooms with modern amenities, vintage charm and friendly staff. This hotel is literally in the middle of the theatre district and within walking distance to the port authority bus terminal, Times Square and tons of restaurants, clubs, bars and places to shop. Three of us stayed in a 2 queen room on the first floor that faced the street and didn’t have any issues with noise from the clubs and bars around us which was a pleasant surprise! The room had plenty of room for us and the amenities were awesome. We had the standard coffee machine, mini fridge and glassware but this room also had a small counter with kitchen sink, complete set of dishes, cutlery, a small hot plate and a microwave.  There is a rooftop lounge area that is the perfect spot to unwind with a glass of wine …or two after a long day seeing the city. I highly recommend this hotel and definitely plan to stay here the next time I visit NYC!

title: Hôtel confortable de taille humaine et idéalement placé
text: Petit hôtel plutôt calme, proche de Times Square à proximité de nombreux petits restaurants mexicain, italiens, coréen, japonais... Il y en a pour tous le goûts. Les chambres sont simples, très propres et les lits très confortables, salles de bain avec douche agréable. Les petits déjeuners, inclus dans le tarif, de type continental, sont simples mais de qualité et copieux. Hôtel non loin du nouveau hall de PennStation (Moynihan Hall), pratique pour sortir de New York vers les aéroports  JFK ou Newark ou s'échapper vers Boston ou Washington avec Amtrak. Excellent rapport qualité prix !

title: Spacious, Quiet, and in the Center of it All
text:
Scherman Hotel was an absolute gem. The rooms are spacious, super clean, and come with all the amenities needed for tourists or business professionals. We loved this hotel, especially after being crammed into Pod 39 Hotel and receiving poor service. 

The staff at Scherman Hotel were absolutely delightful. They were flexible, accommodating, and provided loads of useful information. We loved that it was located on Restaurant Row in Hell's' Kitchen and, surprisingly, it was quiet in comparison to other parts of the city - even on 46th Street unless an ambulance rolled by. 

We'll definitely be back at the Hotel Scherman. It was perfect during our stay.

title: A hidden gem in the heart of Manhattan
text: We stayed for two nights at the superb Hotel Scherman. The staff were lovely and, although our room (Room 101) was a little on the small side, it was  spotlessly clean and well decorated with a comfy bed too. The hotel was also in a great location (c. 5 minute walk to Times Square). We would not hesitate recommend this hotel or to to stay here the next time we visit NYC - thank you Hotel Scherman!

title: Amazing experience for our wedding
text: Amazing hotel, we booked the 2 bed 2 bathroom for our wedding. We couldn’t have asked for more. The rooms are spacious we had our own balcony and there is a roof terrace! The hotel staff we fantastic the rooms clean and breakfast was great. Would go back tomorrow

title: This hotel is a gem!
text: What a wonderful find - a beautiful and comfortable hotel on a quiet street near Times Square. The rooms were spacious and clean, and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was really good - in a beautiful atrium. There were plenty of choices, even for me (I'm gluten free). We will definitely stay here again.

title: Very nice place to stay!
text:
I traveled with my family and YES, we are very happy with our choice!  The location (Hell´s kichen) is  superb, many great restaurant and not noisy at all despite being only 4 minutes from Timesqare. In fact, hotel is in walking distance to many attractions ( observatory decks, famous buildings, central park etc.).  We stayed in 2 bethroom suite with private terrace and it was very comfy, spacious, clean and the views were simply amazing. Staff were very friendly and  helpful (we had some issie with safe at arrival which was solved in a minute). There is only one area that (and it is highly subjektive) I would wellcome some minor improvement - for breakfast we would like to have selection of anything like sausseges, ham, omelette or salami. 

In summary : we highly recommend this hotel and we re looking forward to come back in future!

title: Excellent find for 2BR!
text: Couldn't be happier with this find! We were in the two bedroom which was perfect for our family of 4. Clean, quiet (if you can believe it), loved the balcony and the included continental breakfast! Staff was friendly and the location was just perfect. Will stay again!

title: Great location
text:
This is a great find and very central! The hotel is on a street full of lots of restaurants, and a 5 min walk to Times Square and theatres. It's a 5 min walk to a subway station so easy to navigate around the whole of NY. 
The hotel itself was clean and well decorated, the room was a good size as it was just me. The bathroom was also really nice. 
Breakfast was fairly simple with cereals, pastries, toast, bagels and boiled eggs to choose from. 
I found it fairly quiet at night even though my room was facing the street, but maybe take earplugs if required.
The staff were very friendly and helpful too.
The only issue I had was my keycard stopped working a few times, and I was advised that they're sensitive and shouldn't be kept near my phone or credit card. I kept it in a separate pocket of my rucksack away from these items and it still stopped working, which wasn't a huge problem as I could be buzzed into the hotel, but an inconvenience. 
If you're after a cosy hotel in central NY then this would be a good one for you.

title: EXCELENTE EN EL ALMA DE NY
text: En pocas palabras un hotel maravilloso en NY. Muy bien ubicado en una zona de restaurantes (Hells Kitchen), a tres cuadras del Time Square, perfecto para moverse en Manhattan. Hermosas habitaciones para descansar, buen restaurante mexicano y bar.  Todos muy amables y solucionaban los pedidos rápidamente. Un poco flojo el desayuno sin ser malo.  Recomendadisimo.

title: Disappointing
text:
Not a great experience. 
The staff is friendly and helpful and the location is a less frenetic street near Time Square with a ton of good restaurants but the facilities are tattered and not at all as updated as the photos online. 
All of the surfaces are scratched and stained. The lighting is poor…one 60 watt bulb ikea like desk lamp per room. Hallways are tight and checking desk is in a tiny entryway hall…where the elevator door opens..there is no room to walk around people. 
Breakfast is all carbs and processed food …stale croissants, toast, packets of instant oatmeal…with exception of a few pieces of whole fruit. 
For the price I felt ripped off. 
Definitely would NOT advise this hotel. 
Also in general staying on this side of Time Square is gritty and chaotic. 
Bryant Park area is much less crowded and a lot cleaner but still close to theaters.

title: Sehr empfehlenswertes  ruhiges Hotel in Manhattan
text:
Zentral gelegenes Hotel mit nur wenigen, sehr schön eingerichteten Zimmern und großen Bädern.
Die roof Terrasse ist sensationell und nur für Gäste des Hotel. Ein Ort der Entspannung 
Das Frühstück könnte durch Obstsalat und Rührei aufgewertet werden.i

title: Perfect NYC bolthole.
text: Small ‘boutique’ hotel on restaurant row, perfectly positioned to explore Times Square, Broadway and everything else Manhattan has in store. Extremely friendly staff, the comfiest beds imaginable, plus good AC and Wi-Fi! If I was being really picky then perhaps the breakfast offering could have been more varied, however it was fresh and adequate so by no means a reason for complaint!

title: Perfektes Hotel mitten in Manhatten, besonders freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal
text: Ein wunderschönes Hotel mitten in Manhatten, sauber und gepflegt, trotz der  zentralen Lage ziemlich ruhig (aber in New York ist es NIE ganz ruhig...). Das Zimmer bot sogar eine praktische kleine Kitchenett mit Waschbecken, Kaffeekocher und grossem Kühlschrank. Das Zimmerservice war einwandfrei. Das Frühstück war ausreichend und schmackhaft, allerdings kein riesiges Büffet - für uns hat es voll und ganz gereicht.  Wir hätten uns lediglich eine etwas frühere Frühstückszeit gewünscht, offiziell gab es Frühstück erst ab 08:00 ...Besonders zu erwähnen ist das ungewöhnlich freundliche und hilfsbereite Personal! Wir können dieses Hotel ohne Abstriche weiter empfehlen und würden bei einem weiteren NewYork Besuch in jedem Falle wieder hier ein Zimmer buchen!

title: Excellent find!
text: Excellent location, near Time Square! Superb 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite which worked great for us with 2 teenagers. Extremely clean, great front of house. Beds were extremely comfortable and we all slept very well. Breakfast was good, just what you need before you start your day, our girls loved the breakfast, simple yet satisfying. The balcony to our suite was a very nice addition, sun there most of the day. The roof top terrace was great for photos, especially at night time. Can’t rate this establishment high enough!

title: Awesome place
text: A Hidden Gem- I would definitely come back and stay here- great spot, great breakfast, really nice room. My daughter and I had a blast. Front desk was so helpful and breakfast staff really sweet. I can't wait to go back.

title: Great hotel in a busy but great location.
text:
Glad I researched the area and chose this hotel. It’s right in the centre of the Hell’s Kitchen and Theatre areas. Which was the perfect location for us. 
It’s a 5 minute stroll to Times Square  and is central to all the attractions/places of interest which we’re within walking distance. 
We only had to get transport to the Twin Towers and 9/11 Memorial Museum Downtown as everything else was in walking distance. 
The hotel is lovely and quirky. It’s attached to a bar and the breakfast is served on the Mezzanine level which is open air. The continental breakfast was plentiful. 
Due to its location it is noisy outside - but it’s what you would expect! I read some of the other reviews and took some earplugs with me. Had 5 very sound nights sleep! 
The room wasn’t huge, but it had everything you needed, including a small kitchenette area, full sized fridge, coffee maker, hot plate and microwave! 
Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: A true gem in New York City
text:
We decided on a spur of the moment trip to NYC and found the Scherman at the last minute.. And what a wonderful find!
It is truly a gem - an oasis in the busy city. Our queen room was small but absolutely adequate, tastefully decorated and very comfortable. The continental breakfast was lovely, definitely exceeding our expectations.
A warning:  If you like the bustle of a large hotel with a big, crowded lobby, the Scherman is definitely not for you. If, on the other hand, you'd like to stay in a lovely inn right in the middle of The Big Apple - definitely reminiscent of a European penzione - then the Scherman is your perfect stay in New York.

title: Perfect in every way!
text:
Can’t fault our stay.
Our family of 2 adults and 3 teenagers were in penthouse room 502 - two bedrooms, one bathroom. It was immaculately clean and well presented. 
EXTREMELY comfortable beds with crisply laundered sheets. 
Kitchenette well equipped with cutlery, crockery, fridge (well stocked with complementary water on our arrival), microwave and coffee machine. 
Tasteful decor and absolute luxury to have a balcony with a skyline view. It was lovely to be able to sit outside at the end of a busy day of sightseeing and relax with these views.
Despite the hotel’s superbly central location (very short walk of 1.5 blocks to Times Square, and on restaurant row - too many fantastic restaurants to chose from), our room was completely quiet at all times except for the hum of the air conditioning. We didn’t need the ear plugs we’d brought and slept fantastically well with no disturbance at all. This was a really pleasant surprise. 
The bar downstairs is great - we were able to leave the teens in our room and go downstairs for a drink in the evening, which was a big treat. We also had some Mexican food in there one night, which was delicious. 
Fantastic breakfast included in room rate - really plentiful, continental style. Sets you up for the day ahead. 
Front desk was manned at all times, which is reassuring and helpful in case of needing advice or assistance. 
We felt safe when coming and going from the hotel both day and evening. 
We paid around £630 per night, which included breakfast. We thought this was exceptionally good value for the experience, having researched a lot of other hotels in the city. We wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Hotel Scherman to family or friends and very much hope to visit again. We wouldn’t even bother looking at anywhere else for a future visit. 
Thank you so much for being a big part of our holiday of a lifetime. We loved it.

title: Fantastic Stay in NYC!
text: Stumbled on this hidden gem by luck.  What an absolute perfect space to stay in NYC!  The location is excellent, the room was huge by NYC standards.  Clean, well appointed, quiet and comfy.   The staff were so helpful every time we passed the desk.   Having a rooftop to retreat to for a BYO happy hour was fantastic.  Did I mention the location?   This is our new favorite spot to stay in NYC!

title: Great hotel - highly recommended
text: Excellent price and value for money. Very clean and comfortable hotel with pleasant and helpful staff. Rooms were a good size compared to other city hotels we’ve visited in the past. Great continental  breakfast with good choice. Fantastic location for all tourist attractions and great restaurants in same street. Road outside a bit noisy but then staying in ‘the city that never sleeps’ so? Highly recommended.

title: NY boutique hotel super clean and well done
text: Wonderful experience, the assistant manager Reet was super helpful as was all the staff.  Our family found the space unique and charming, just what we needed after a day of seeing the sights!  And the breakfast in the Lower floor restaurant was yummy and really quaint.  We will stay again when we come to NY.  Affordable for a two bedroom two bath unit, room 402!

title: Hidden Gem
text:
I would highly recommend this hotel. Stayed here for 6 nights in a queen room. The room was well equipped with sink, fridge, microwave and coffee machine . Bed and pillows were so comfortable. The room was immaculate on arrival and was cleaned every day with fresh towels. Breakfast is provided, it mainly consists of bagels, bread and pastries. There were no meats or cheese provided. Fruit and yogurt were also available. 
The staff were very friendly and helpful especially Guisc ( hope that’s right) on Reception . It’s only a block away from Time Square.

title: Quiet, clean and beautiful right in the middle of it all!
text: Wow what a great time. One of the nicest and cleanest hotels I have ever stayed at. Quiet, clean and  friendly. Perfectly located, the next time I am in the city  this will easily be my hotel of choice!!

title: I loved this boutique hotel in the heart of the city!
text:
This charming hotel was exactly what I wanted to find. I would love this hotel no matter where it was located but it was especially important for me to find a hotel with these qualities while in the heart of NYC. Walking distance to theaters, restaurants, subways and neighborhoods. I traveled alone and felt safe and welcome and comfortable here. Staff is professional, friendly and efficient. All communications were accurate and prompt. The included breakfast was perfect-served in a sunny space on the mezzanine level 8-10am daily. The hotel is located on W 46th (Restaurant Row) so you do not have to go far to find a full array of dining options. I liked the restaurant next door with the Mexican theme where I had a pre show dinner during happy hour, 2 small shrimp tostadas, for 12 bucks-in NYC!  
Can you tell I loved the entire experience?  It’s true- I did and I will return for sure.

title: Beautiful boutique hotel
text: Beautiful boutique hotel, a very short walk from Times Square, facilities felt safe and more than comfortable. Staff were very accommodating, room cleaned every day, great continental breakfast. Lovely place to stay, when we return to NYC this will most definitely be our hotel.

title: Hidden gem
text: Absolutely loved our short stay here! Quaint little boutique hotel, great location, super clean, excellent customer service and delicious breakfast! Would definitely recommend and will definitely be staying here next time I’m in NYC!

title: New Year in New York 2022/23
text: We stayed at the hotel over New Year 22/23. Our airline cancelled our outgoing flight and had to add an extra day, and the hotel sorted it swiftly and without issue. Our room was a good size, and was cleaned every single day. The beds were very comfy, and we don’t have a single complaint! The roof terrace was a great place to chill, and the included breakfast was plentiful, setting us up each day for our travels. I would definitely return, and highly recommend to anyone wanting a centrally based hotel in Manhattan!

title: A great hotel - big rooms and perfect location!
text: This was a great choice for our trip to NYC! We recently stayed for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon and had a great time. The room is very generous in size, particularly for NYC standards which was perfect for a longer stay - plenty of room to unpack everything, have a wine in the room before dinner etc. The bed was big and super comfortable. The location was fantastic, easy walking distance to key sites and two different metro lines close by. Service was great, daily housekeeping and lovely friendly staff. Breakfast was coffee, fruit, bagels etc, I think in New York any breakfast is a bonus! We also checked out the rooftop which was an added bonus. Would highly recommend, a great find for future trips to NYC!

title: Show and a stay this was the perfect place.
text: a one night stay has me planning another stay in the future. This small hotel is nice and in a great location for a visit to Broadway for a show. The room was very nice and the breakfast was a nice touch to get us going in the morning. I will stay there again the next trip for a show.

title: Fantastic location
text:
Fantastic location, lovely staff, stunning rooms and great value for money
Jewel in Manhattan Crown
Would definitely return. Quirky restaurants on your door step, not far from Time Square without the Time Square prices.
We wished we stayed longer.

title: 346 W 46th St
text: Nice, hidden gem.  Very nice people running this small hotel.  Rooms are OK and probably a bit larger than typical NYC.  Would recommend to anyone wanting to stay in boutique property.  Many places to eat and drink, all within easy walking distance.  Times Square and theaters all close by as well.

title: Great customer service!
text: I spoke with Reet on the phone, SUPER pleasant and helpful.  I was able to get a refund/credit for a non-refundable room due to a family emergency.  Thank you Reet - excellent customer service!  We are already returning customers and will continue to be!

title: A true find!
text: I can’t wait to return to the Hotel Scherman.  It is a real gem, a find in a city with hotels on every block.  I was born in nyc and always want to experience real ny when I visit as opposed to big chains.  This place is amazing, reminiscent of a small European hotel. General mgr Ruth with a beautiful smile and laugh was so helpful as was top level Niko who was everything everywhere all at once.  Room was immaculate, breakfast with fresh croissants and the gorgeous rooftop views are highlights of what was a wonderful too short stay.

title: Beautiful boutique hotel near everything
text: We loved our stay at this hotel. The rooms were spacious by New York standards. It is centrally located in Hell’s Kitchen but close to the Theater district and Times Square. The beds were comfortable and everything was updated. The roof top area was night to hangout at night.

title: Très bon hôtel avec un emplacement idéal pour visiter New-York
text:
Cet hôtel est confortable et son emplacement est idéal. Le quartier réputé animé , voire bruyant,  était finalement relativement calme.
Les équipements de la chambre sont très satisfaisants (cafetière, réfrigérateur et four micro-ondes)
Le personnel est agréable et serviable.
Le rapport qualité-prix est très bon.
Un seul point faible, le petit-déjeuner qui est à améliorer.

title: Quaint comfortable hotel in restaurant row
text: Great service with a smile awaited us on check in.  The hotel is very clean, with large rooms,  and comfortable beds. Ideal location in restaurant row. And within reasonable walk to Times Square and Intrepid Air and Space museum. Would definitely stay there again!

title: A very nice B&B-style hotel in NYC
text: We stayed at Hotel Scherman in late August 2022 for an 8 day/7 night trip to NYC. This is a small, but very charming hotel that is in the Hell's Kitchen location of NYC so is close to tons of restaurants and is within walkable distance to Times Square. The staff at this hotel was very nice. Housekeeping was available and did a great job cleaning our room. The hotel also offers free breakfast which my daughter and I took advantage of. The rooms are a little tight because of a lot of furniture, but we had a room with two queen beds. We took advantage of the microwave that was in the room. There was also a coffee maker, but we didn't use it since we ate breakfast in the dining hall. There is a Mexican restaurant conveniently located in the basement. I highly recommend this hotel to other travelers visiting NYC.

title: New York Gem
text:
Fantastic experience at the Hotel Sherman for my daughter's first trip to NYC. This boutique hotel reminds me of a quaint European boutique hotel or B&B. Our room was very cute, clean and quiet. It's  right on Restaurant Row so there are a variety of delicious options just steps away. We recommend  choosing take out and enjoying your dinner on the cozy roof top terrace which has a beautiful view above the roar of street level. 

 The staff was friendly, gracious and helpful.  We appreciated their willingness to store our luggage before and after check in/check out.  The continental breakfast had a good array of options. The croissants in particular melted in your mouth.  My daughter is gluten free but had plenty of options with hard boiled eggs, yogurt and fruit. We did pick up some gluten free bread nearby.  The rooms also have a mini fridge, coffee maker and microwave which are nice amenities to have. 

Just steps away from Times Square, the Theater District, the Port Authority and so many midtown sites, I would highly recommend this gem.  The only critique I would have is the carpet in the elevator and hallways are a bit worn, but the charm of the rooms and gracious hospitality more than makes up.

title: Great location
text: Location was fantastic - able to see Times Square from roof terrace. Slightly tatty around edges but staff are super friendly. Breakfast was really pleasant and overall fantastic location for stay in NYC

title: Fantastic Stay in NYC!
text: I’ve stayed in this area several times, and Hotel Scherman is my favorite hotel. The hotel offers a personalized touch. Everything was perfect; the decor, cleanliness, comfort, room amenities, and location couldn’t have been better.  I will be sure to return!

title: Stunning hotel!
text: Awesome awesome hotel! Brilliant location in the heart of NYC. The rooms and bathrooms are beautiful and recently redone and the staff are super helpful and friendly. Our room was much bigger than we anticipated. The rooftop is just lovely and a really nice addition. Would definitely recommend Hotel Scherman!

title: Excellency
text: Stayed at this hotel for one night. The only reason for 4 star in lieu of 5 star rating  is that they offer no valet or parking. Otherwise, clean and great location. The room assigned was small but more than sufficient. Breakfast was included in a clean and spacious area. Would return.

title: Simply the best
text:
We have just had a four night stay in the Scherman and found it exceptional. This is our third visit to NYC and have previously stayed in bigger hotels, none were a patch on Hotel Scherman. This is not a big flashy hotel and much better for it. The room was lovely with a fabulous decoesque bathroom. Very spacious, plenty of towels and nice wee toiletries. The room and bathroom were as clean as a whistle on arrival, absolutely spotless. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room facilities were great with a nice wee balcony overlooking the street (and gorgeous ginkgo leaf wallpaper). While the street is noisy at night (very vibrant with lots going on) the French door provided reasonable deafening. If your a light sleeper bring earplugs. It’s New York City after all. The air conditioning was good and necessary in the July heatwave. The included breakfast was a real treat and hard to come by in New York. A good choice of croissants, toast, bagels with a variety of spreads and cream cheese amongst other things. The breakfast space was cheery and bright. The locality is fab. Easy reach of lots of places you’ll want to see including all the main theatres. I’m not a big fan of Times Square but if you like it’s hustle and bustle then is just round the corner. The hotel is in restaurant row and we ate at two restaurants in the block. 
The hotel roof terrace is a great space for a pre going out glass of wine. So saving the best till last - the staff. The owners should be very proud of their workforce, every single staff member we came in to contact with was welcoming, cheerful and helpful. They are one of the best things about this hotel. We required our luggage stored prior to check in. When we returned our luggage was already in our room with a nice wee welcome note from the staff. I would highly recommend this hotel for your NYC stay.

title: Our personal go to boutique hotel in Manhattan.
text: This was our second stay here and we were just as pleased the second time around. The location is great with convenient access to restaurants, Broadway, and public transportation. If you are looking for a big showy lobby presentation, this likely won’t  be to your liking. This is a small boutique hotel that you might miss driving buy, just a single entrance door at the front.  The standard King room offers plenty of space to relax, a luxurious bed, and a large bath with walk-in shower (with fire hose water pressure). A complementary continental breakfast from 8-10… what a great perk. And on top of that…great people, staff AND management. We love patronizing businesses like this one. We selectively recommend this hotel to friends and family…we know far too many people who are nit picky, ego centric, chronic complainers. We would not want to steer those types to this great place.

title: NYC long weekend birthday trip
text: We loved everything about Hotel Scherman. Our room was so spacious, comfortable, and had all of the high end furnishings and deco. We had a nice armoire that had a place to hang clothes, drawers, and shelves. We had a nice kitchenette with a good size refrigerator, sink, and even plates and utensils. The bathroom was roomy, pretty, and a lot of light and storage. The A/C ran perfectly and the bed was great and slept like a dream. We had a cute little balcony with two little cute chairs on it. The staff were all friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. They even provided umbrellas if it happened to rain during your stay. The location is awesome. Little restaurants all around the hotel. We walked to 3 different plays. The room was quiet. We definitely would stay here again on our next trip.

title: Good night’s sleep
text:
Great location.  Lovely room and great service. The continental breakfast was typical but mostly we had a good night’s sleep and that is why I give it a 5.  

The roof top lounge area is so relaxing.  We live in Syracuse and drove in. Parked a block away and went for a show at Birdland with our nephew.  It was a little more expensive but worth it.

title: Disappointing
text:
Our first experience of this hotel was so good we went back. This time was different. 
The name has changed/maybe ownership. Breakfast was not as good as before - nor as shown in pictures. 
Our room was tiny and very noisy. We asked for a room change and was told non available but that our issues had been mentioned before (bed against the wall) especially by older visitors (I'm 56). 
The whole place is looking tired. The only place to sit outside of your room  is the terrace and the furniture is filthy dirty. Having such a tiny room this was an issue.
Also - value for money? We paid £8000 for 4 rooms for a week... and this is what we got. We could have got much bigger, much better in the same area. 
Actual rooms we were given don't appear in any of the hotels photos, wonder why?!

title: Hidden gem
text: We stayed in room 401 (the 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom suite at the front of the hotel) and it was perfect for us. Plenty of space, convenient kitchenette and the enormous balcony was fantastic. The view gets even better from the shared rooftop, which has plenty of tables and chairs, and it's great to be able to bring your own food and drinks. Breakfast was much more comprehensive than expected and service was super friendly throughout. Perfect location for a Broadway-centred break.

title: Great little find
text: Small but pleasant modern room! Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was good! The rooftop terrace was a really pleasant addition!  Our room was on the first floor at the front, but any street noise was not loud enough to stop us sleeping. Near to so many things, we would highly recommend a stay here.

title: Perfect little hotel in a great spot
text: This past week my wife and I took a quick trip to New York City to take in the sights and sounds. We stayed at the Hotel Scherman which was great. It was clean, located in a perfect spot to access Broadway or times  square, and the staff was very receptive and friendly. The building has a lot of character with a great little rooftop sitting area.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Best hotel experience I’ve had in NYC
text:
We live in New Jersey, so we come to NYC pretty frequently, and have stayed in a lot of hotels. This was hands-down my favorite! It’s very conveniently located if you’re seeing a show, and there are a number of great food options in the immediate vicinity. The room was HUGE for the city, and beautifully appointed; it’s clearly been redone recently, with USB outlets by the bedsides. I really appreciated the mini fridge and Keurig, too. The bathroom was lovely and had a fantastic shower.

Very impressed overall with the amenities, level of service, and experience. We’ll be back next time we’re in the neighborhood for a show!

title: A gem of a hotel in a fantastic location!
text: I stumbled upon this charming boutique hotel while conducting an Internet search. Wow!  Kudos to the warm, welcoming staff. Rooms are beautifully appointed, with a small kitchenette (a rarity in NYC), comfy beds and a wonderful bathroom. Plus, no carpeting!  Mornng coffee was excellent and the continental breakfast was adequate. We struggled with cable access on the TV and called the hotel desk. Less than five minutes later (impressive!), someone came to our room and resolved the issue. My sister and I were able to walk everywhere and were minutes from both Broadway theatres. Make sure to catch the view from the lovely rooftop terrace. I will definitely return. Highly recommended!

title: Perfect Hotel for families visiting NYC
text: Hotel Scherman is a gem! As a family of 6, We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite, which included 2 bathrooms, a living room with a pull out couch, a kinchette area and an outside balcony with seating for 6. The accommodations were clean, bright and very comfortable. The location on 46th street was convenient to Times Square, Broadway shows, the subways, and many amazing restaurants. The staff  worked hard to help provide anything we needed and were most accommodating. The location was super convenient, and the room was spacious and most comfortable and clean. It was great to be able to have a perfect space to gather as a family. I would highly recommend staying at the Hotel Scherman!

title: Convenient Hotel-Family Friendly
text: Great hotel for our family. We had the 2-bedroom/2-bath suite on 4th floor, and we plenty of space for our family of 6. So conveniently located, easy walk to Times Square, Broadway shows, etc and subway. Great restaurants nearby. Enjoyed the balcony for drinks in the evening, and a family pizza dinner after a long day on our feet. Management was courteous and efficient, eager to help with whatever we needed. Would definitely stays here again.

title: Comfortable and welcoming!
text: Great, friendly, helpful, attentive staff. Clean. Beautiful rooftop deck with views, near delicious small restaurants, and comfy beds. Rooms are designed well with a fridge, sink, and complimentary coffee and tea. Delightful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Perfect location for shows!
text:
We took my dad to NYC for a weekend of Broadway and cabaret, and this location was perfect. It's directly across the street from Don't Tell Mama, a 10 minute walk to Feinstein's/54 Below, and minutes away from Moulin Rouge and Six! We didn't have to take a cab all weekend. It's just feet away from tons of restaurants, including Sicily, a brand new Italian restaurant that we went back to repeatedly to taste the whole delicious menu.

We had a suite on the 4th floor, facing away from Restaurant Row, and it was unbelievably quiet! You couldn't hear a thing! We didn't even know there were small kids in the room next door until we met them at the elevator. And you couldn't hear any of the restaurants around blasting music until you opened the front door downstairs. 

The entire staff was lovely. The front desk remembered what shows we were seeing and asked us how we liked them. Breakfast staff and housekeeping were also kind and friendly. 

The 2 bedroom suite was great. The rooms were spacious, the bathrooms huge, and the balcony was gigantic! We peeked at the rooftop patio but didn't spend any time there. It looked great, but we didn't have time. Wifi and ac worked wonderfully. All and all, we had a fantastic weekend.

title: Incredible NYC Find
text: This hotel surpassed our expectations. Pros: helpful, kind and personable staff before and during our trip; perfect location in walking distance to theaters, Times Square and more; clean; safe; spacious room; great breakfast with many options and a big plus was that they also had a plant based milk option and a microwave; renovated; the breakfast room was spacious and aesthetic; beautiful rooftop terrace with great views. I truly felt the hotel staff went above and beyond. Cons: none.

title: Charming hotel; lovely spacious, clean rooms, friendly staff
text:
This hotel was just lovely - from the staff, to the room, to feeling like you were in your own hideaway. Our room was located on the 2nd floor in the adjacent building. High ceilings, huge windows that overlooked the streets below. You don't feel boxed in when you look out the window because there isn't a high-rise across the street - just other restaurants and business that don't go above 5 or 6 floors. 

The room was spacious - tv, mini fridge, keurig, microwave, little desk and three chairs to sit in to read or lounge in. Room was very clean and the bathroom was awesome - this place was either renovated recently or maintained really well. 

My only complaint were the meager choosings for breakfast - as another commenter said, not a place if you are trying to eat low-carb.

Lots of restaurants to choose from immediately outside the door. Try the Tex-Mex place next door. Or Dim Sum, or any number of other places. 

I would definitely stay here again. Location is very close to everything. It was great that we could store our bags both at the start (we arrived hours before check-in) and after checkout - (train scheduled to leave at 3pm, long after the 11am check out time).

title: My stay at the Hotel Scherman
text:
I arrived at the hotel and found it to be like a small European hotel-- No real lobby. I was escorted to the adjoining bldg for my room on the first floor. There was a set of stairs that I had not expected, being older and having luggage to carry.

 I walked in to find a charming room with everything that I need in a hotel room- beautiful bathroom- fridge-microwave and two chairs, one high-back.

I quickly realized that I was cold, even though the temp was  at 78. I did not call the desk and that was my fault.If I had called, I would have found a solution. So, I endured a cold night, not being able to shower in the morning. In addition, I was treated to  loud music of the club below until all hours of the morning.

The staff was incredibly accommodating in the morning. I spoke to them about my situation and they were very nice, even accompanying me to the beautiful breakfast room with a buffet that was truly incredible, but not for people who cannot do carbs. I was really struck by how much this little room changed my point-of-view...

I am really against "resort fees" and do not understand why any hotel has a resort fee. At this hotel, they said that it was for luggage storage and other incidentals... It is a bait and switch situation for me. 

On the corner of 8th and 46th St., there is a café on the corner which is very nice.  frankraffa @aol.com

title: Good hotel, but charges resort fees
text:
Great hotel, wonderful staff, and fantastic location. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. We had arrived early, and it was no problem to hold our luggage. It was also taken up to our room by the time we had come back. Rooftop is a nice hangout place.

Knocking off a star for the "resort fee" of ~11% of daily room rate on top of what I had booked the room for. Just charge the 11% extra, so it's not a surprise, or make it optional in case it's meant to cover some specific amenities. There are at least 2 bodegas half a block down if one wants water. The location is great though, but I'd feel better paying the extra 11% as an agreed-upon room rate, rather than finding that out from my CC bill.

title: great hotel in a great location
text: We were going to a Broadway show and spending the day in the city so we wanted to stay over.  We found this hotel and decided to give it a shot since the location was perfect.  I'm SO glad we did!  The hotel was clean and comfy.  The staff were friendly and accommodating.  We showed up to drop off our bags and when we came back they were sitting in our room waiting for us.  They provided a small breakfast and were connected to an excellent Mexican restaurant.  They also had a rooftop that was accessible and the kids went up and checked it out.  I have absolutely nothing to complain about.  It was all good.

title: Great Trip
text: This hotel is clean, has a nice bathroom, friendly staff, breakfast included and is in an amazing location. Lots of little touches like a Keurig in the room with real cups and a selection of coffee or tea. If you want to explore Manhattan this location is perfect! Walking distance between Times Square Station and Rockefeller Plaza station. So many great places to eat just right a few feet from the hotel door! Highly recommend!

title: location ,location.location!plus a safe clean place....
text: The hotel is  super clean, nice linens, nice rooms, and and excellent location.I MUST SAY THE HELP IS QUITE HELPFUL AND FRIENDLY.I find the continental breakfast less than stellar.It's much to too  high carb..Everything is high carb except the eggs. But how old can hardboiled be kept at room temp?The neighborhood I've only seen at nite...It's not pretty in daytime.But your are walking distance to really all the important  performances venues in NYC !My new favorite restaurant is Becco across the street..

title: Great small hotel in the heart of Restaurant Row
text: Went for a night to see a couple shows.  From when we first got to the hotel until we left the staff was friendly and helpful.  They offered to hold our bags before and after checking in and out which was a huge help.  Their complementary breakfast was just enough to start your day.  The place was clean and quiet.  One of the best places we have stayed and definitely will stay again on future trips to the city.

title: Best kept secret in NYC
text: I love this unique boutique hotel. Stayed here twice with friends and could not be happier. You can’t beat the location and the staff and amenities are fantastic. Walking distance to shows, great restaurants, Times Square, subways, etc.  will definitely stay here anytime we are in NYC!

title: Great location and staff!
text: Room was very comfortable and there was plenty of room for three of us (2 adults 1 child). Wonderful location! Walked to our Broadway show, Time Square and tons of great restaurants to choose from on the same street. Staff were friendly and helpful. Plenty of hot water in the shower as well and water pressure was fine.

title: Must stay hotel!
text: Hotel Scherman is the cleanest place we’ve ever stayed, with the friendliest staff! Best breakfast at a hotel in New York City!! Thank you Gustavo and Reet at the front desk, and Jayson at the breakfast bar for being so welcoming and helpful. We will definitely stay at Hotel Scherman again!

title: Charming boutique hotel in the heart of the theater district
text:
Spent three nights at the Hoel Scherman and we were impressed with the professionalism and friendliness of the staff from the very first. It’s a small hotel tucked into Restaurant Row on West 46th, and so convenient to many attractions. 

Spotless rooms, generous amenities, and a wonderful breakfast each morning (we were expecting only a grab and go, as so many other hotels have been doing during Covid) In addition, we took advantage of the charming rooftop terrace—brought drinks up and watched the sun set. 

This is a family owned-old world style hotel with all the modern conveniences you expect to find in New York. We will definitely return.

title: Amazing Boutique Hotel
text: We can only write a rave review about this hidden gem, just off Broadway. Everything is immaculate. Our room and bathroom were both spacious and beautifully furnished. Niko, Romy, Gustavo, Ruth, Fanny and all the amazing women that kept our room beautifully clean, thank you!!! You made our stay in New York, so wonderful! See you soon

title: Family Stay in 2 Rooms
text: Loved staying here! We have 3 college aged kids so got two rooms. One faced the street, ours faced the back, both on the 1st floor. The rooms were really well furnished, plenty of space, clean and modern with a great vibe. We were worried we might hear street or bar noise but it wasn’t an issue at all. The front desk held our luggage since we got in early, so that was super handy. Very friendly staff at the desk and housekeeping. We ate the first night at the adjoining Mexican restaurant which was really good and worked well to get in and out before a show. The hotel is surrounded by other great bars and restaurants (we also went to Hold Fast Kitchen, and Mercury Bar). This location is super close to all of Broadway, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Central Park stuff, walkable to the Highline and Madison Square Gardens, easy to take the subway from here, and easy in and out if you’re driving into the city like us. We parked a block a way and left our car for our 3 night stay. Highly recommend!

title: Excelente hotel boutique para parejas
text:
Es la tercera vez que nos quedamos en este Hotel, es nuestra opción preferida cuando visitamos Nueva York.

El personal es muy amable y dispuesto ayudar en todo. 

Hay un gran cuidado por los detalles y las habitaciones son todas muy lindas y bien equipadas.

La ubicación es excelente, y si bien la calle tiene mucha vida nocturna los ruidos no son demasiado molestos.

Muy recomendable hotel romántico

title: Perfect weekend seeing Broadway show
text:
Manager welcomed us warmly. Upgraded us to a room with a nice patio/view of street. Rooftop has a lot of space and beautiful view. Continental breakfast and housekeeping while we were out was great. Refrigerator in room was useful. 

Perfect location if seeing a broadway show/visiting Times Square. Plenty of restaurant/bars around. Everything was seamless. Would recommend and return next time Im visiting.

title: Immaculate and great location
text: We only stayed one night but it was so clean and perfect location.  Reminded me of the small boutique hotels in Europe.  Didn’t cost an arm and a leg and the breakfast was very good as well. We shall be back!

title: Oasis in the middle of the city
text: We spent four nights in one of their 2 BR suites. Truly one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Spotless room, fabulous linens, warm, courteous, and helpful staff! Also enjoyed a 25+ foot long deck where we spent a ton of time in the morning and evening. They have a delightful breakfast each morning as well as coffee in the room. This place is a hidden gem. Gustavo went above and beyond our first night with coming down to the street to get our bags so we could return our rental car. This place is perfect!

title: Great boutique hotel in the heart of NYC!
text:
We absolutely loved our stay here. Really cute and cozy boutique hotel conveniently located in the city. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The Balcony Suite (2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms) was perfect for the 5 of us. The balcony was the perfect spot for morning coffee or a glass of wine at night. And the rooftop terrace was even better with it’s breathtaking views of the city. It was so adorable and romantic!

The service was great! Staff was polite and friendly. The GM Niko was so kind and accommodating. He went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. 

Thank you Niko and staff!!!

Definitely coming back. Do you have a loyalty program?

title: 2 night trip to NYC
text: My husband and stayed in room 105.  The room is at the back of the hotel directly across from the elevator.  There was no view, but the  room was clean, quiet at night, the bed comfortable and larger than expected.   The bathroom was a good size with a large stand up shower.  There was a mini fridge and coffee maker on the counter.  In the cabinet we found a microwave, hotplate, dishes, mugs, glasses and cutlery, none of which we used.   The location was great, 4-5 blocks from the subway in a populated area.  I felt safe walking alone at night.  The staff was wonderful.  They will hold your luggage before check in and after checkout at no additional charge. We never made it downstairs to try the free breakfast.  We would stay ere again.

title: Wonderful NYC boutique hotel
text: Absolutely loved our stay. It reminded me of a European hotel which I loved. We will definitely be back. Our family of 5 booked the 2 bedroom 2 bath suite with a private balcony - loved all the space in the suite, the modern furnishings and the bathrooms were all very nicely updated. The absolute best part was the balcony that overlooked the street, we took some great pictures out there and really enjoyed having the outdoor space. We went to see Hamilton and this hotel is right down the street from the theatre, we couldn’t have asked for a better location. They even had a small continental breakfast which was unexpected. I have told all my friends about this gem and it’s going to be our spot of choice in NYC. Small con that’s not really a con just more to be aware - no parking and the lot we thought we could use didn’t do overnights so I would just look in advance.

title: Mixed experience
text: There was a musty, moldy odor throughout the hotel, which was off putting The loud music blasting into late hours from the street out front made sleeping extremely difficult I'd suggest bringing earplugs if booking. The deskstaff were friendly, and helpful which was a plus. After reading hotel responses to any negative reviews, I assume I'll receive a bullying respons from the owner as well, but despite that, this was my experience.

title: The perfect Place to Stay
text: The Hotel Scherman is the perfect place to stay while visiting NYC. The staff are extremely friendly, attentive and fun to be around. The location is great being right on Restaurant Row (46th between 8th&9th) so lots of places to eat. A very short walk to Central Park and of course all the theaters are near by. The rooms are clean and well kept and the roof deck is a must! Great views of midtown and beautiful sunsets over the Hudson. We have stayed there several times and have never been disappointed.

title: Unique and convenient
text:
This was our first time back to visit NYC since covid.  We were looking for something convenient and walkable that would allow us to maximize our time and reduce travel time during our 3-day stay.  Hotel Scherman is a beautiful, historic small hotel right in Hell's Kitchen, on Restaurant Row.  We were easily able to walk or take the subway to many destinations throughout the city.  Having read other reviews about the noise of the active street below, we asked for a quieter room in the back of the building.  It was  extremely quiet, and easily accommodated our party of 4.  The private outdoor space outside our suite was lovely, and there were gorgeous views in all directions.  There is also a roof deck which was equally relaxing and gorgeous.  The kitchenette was very convenient for storing and eating leftovers.

The staff was very professional and polite, and offered restaurant suggestions.

The breakfast was very convenient and the indoor/outdoor patio setting was absolutely beautiful.  The food wasn't anything extensive or cooked, but it was plenty to get you started in the morning before heading out for more meals in NYC.  

It was a great stay, and we hope to return before too long!

title: Great stay and great location!
text:
Nice place to stay! 

Since we arrived until the day we left, the attention given here was wonderful. Gustavo was really nice to us, even he got us a taxi to ger back to the airport and carried our luggage the entire block! 
The rooms are nice, the beds are comfy and everything was very clean. They changed the towels every single day wich was nice, remembering that many hotels dont offer this service during covid. 
The rooftoop is beautiful! We used it two times and it was epty, just for us! It has some really nice views during day and night. 
The breakfast was ok. It would be nicer if they had offer some variations because everyday was served the same. Also the cutlery was washed with a dishwasher and they werent sooo clean… but everything was good anyways
The street also is nice, very quiet and closed to the vehicles during the afternoon and night, so the street is pretty quiet almost all the time. And most important, it was a really safe place to stay, in comparison to other hotels in the same price range. 

Definitely would come back!

title: Cute French Hotel with Rooftop Access
text: We had a lovely 4 night stay at Hotel Scherman. The staff was friendly and cordial, at all times. Cov-id protocol was followed by the staff and guests. Outdoor dining is easy and convenient as you can order take out on restaurant row and eat on the rooftop which was surprisingly empty during our stay. Views from the rooftop are nice. We booked the penthouse which was relaxing for our party of 3 and provided another location for outdoor dining. (Photos from the hotel's website are more current and accurate than the photos on tripadvisor.) We will be back again!

title: Small Boutique Hotel with Excellent Free Breakfast, Impeccable Service & Extremely Clean Room
text: At first I almost overlooked this hotel because 1) Their website was still under construction and I had to call to see how to making a reservation which they suggested 2 methods one of which was through booking.com.  As I searched online to other NY hotels I was disappointed by the choice of so many corporate chain hotels and reviews of bed bugs and was looking for a smaller boutique personalized hotel, so I came back and booked this one.  Let me just say, that EVERY single person who worked in this hotel was very polite, and hospitable. 5 reasons to book this hotel: 1) Free breakfast (includes buttery fresh croissants, breads, nutella, honey, cream cheese, marmalade/jam instant coffee, oatmeal milk, Organic milk, fruit choices, teas, muffins, cereal, hard-boiled egg, etc  2) Impeccable team, sorry I don't remember names, at least 6 people (young friendly man breakfast person, polite tall German/American manager perhaps who dusted off a crumb at the breakfast area (attention to detail person which I appreciate), two friendly polite women (blonde hair /curly hair) next to elevator, and the gentleman who helped me book my Uber on the last day.  3) Very clean room and bathroom:  I should add that though I did not interact with the housekeepers at this facility (since I was out most of the day), they deserve credit too as the room was spotless, pillows/sheets smelled cleaned and the bathroom was spotless which is not easy with mostly white tiles!  Yes, even our mini-fridge and air vent was clean.  So if cleanliness, especially in COVID times is important to you, then this hotel is doing their best. They also offer hand sanitizer and masks when you walk in.   As a healthcare business owner, I appreciate a service-oriented business who makes an effort of cleanliness and offering masks/hand sanitizers at different areas in the hotel.  LOCATION:

title: PERFECT location, best staff, spacious penthouse - Will stay again
text:
Perfect rating on many levels.  Location of course, but more so than you would think.  It’s on restaurant-row, so lots of good options out your front door.  And even though food-critics aren’t fans of most places on restaurant-row, we ate at / had drinks at 3 places, and all three were as good as anywhere else in town.  Walking distance to mid-town and broadway shows, Hudson yards, and Central Park, you can’t beat it.

Our family of four stayed in the penthouse, which was plenty spacious.  It only had one bathroom, but it was very nice and the living space / outdoor terrace more than made up for it.  We just split the shower time between evenings and mornings.   Plenty of closet space, multiple TVs, refrigerator and microwave all came in handy after long days touring the city and with leftovers. 

The staff was friendly and attentive.  It was hard to count how many were there, but it seemed like more than you would think.  Front desk check-in was easy, elevator always quick and available, all Covid-cautious and clean.  

Breakfast was plentiful and had wonderful variety.  Thanks for being such amazing hosts!

title: Mi gran casa en Nueva York
text: Para escapar a la gran manzana y sentirse como en casa, un pequeño hotel en el corazón de Manhattan , habitaciones muy cómodas y amplias, camas cómodas para un buen descanso después de las largas caminatas.al rededor del hotel buenas opciones para tomarse un trago o disfrutar de una comida, tiene una linda terraza dispuesta con mobiliario como para disfrutar el fin de tarde, desayuno de muy buena calidad, atención magnifica, amabilidad de parte de sus empleados. Cerca del metro. En cuanto al precio esta muy bien.

title: Poor Customer Experience
text:
I was hesitant to write this review out of fear of the backlash from the clearly unstable general manager who threatened to get me banned from booking.com for writing this review. However, I feel that in good faith I need to warn others. 

During my stay I was stuck in your elevator for 30 minutes with 3 other guests. The elevator jolted and then got stuck between two floors and the buttons stopped working. We pressed the “help” button numerous times, called out loudly for help several times, banged on the door, and called the front desk by phone several times with no response.  We had to seek help from another guest that we knew who was staying at the hotel who walked down the stairs to the front desk to alert the associate. At that point, an unmasked front desk associate was able to get us out but acted extremely unapologetic about the situation.  We were very upset by this experience, mainly because we could not get in touch with a staff member and we had no idea when we were going to get let out. I do want to add that it was a 90+ degree day. 

I am fully aware that the owner/general manager of this hotel will give a snarky and unprofessional reply to this review, as he has done with several other poor reviews, and that he will make it seem as though my group was was “challenging” and therefore they didn’t owe us the common decency of a sincere apology or any form of reparation for this traumatic event that happened under their roof. When I did raise this concern to them directly, that was exactly the response I received which was a surprise considering we were not in any way the rowdy hooligans that they tried to make us feel like. We are not a difficult group of people and any hotel that we have previously stayed at can attest to that. 

Trust that if you are staying at this hotel and any sort of incident occurs, they will refuse to take accountability and they will make you feel like you were the problem.

title: Bathroom in poor repair
text: The bathroom had a couple things broken. Air vent was FULL of dust. And our room keys weren't working so we were locked out in the cold street at night for 5 minutes because the doorman wasn't at the desk. Then when he finally let us in, he told my friend that if she wasn't "wearing such a small dress at night with that body" that she wouldn't have anything to worry about. When I told the manager about it the next day, he said we were lying and if we didn't like it, we could check out.

title: Location location location
text:
So, first and foremost, hats off the Hotel Scherman for their strict adherence to COVID-19 precautions. The hotel's top priority is the safety and health of guests and staff, and they do the best they can at balancing these concerns with creating a pleasant stay.

Hotel Scherman is a great choice, particularly for travelers without children. The location couldn't be better, right on Restaurant Row, which is lined with restaurants and bars to match any taste. To facilitate outdoor dining, the street is closed to vehicular traffic, which makes for a fun vibe (lots of drinking and carousing, so not really "kid friendly"). 

Be aware that the location is VERY noisy during evening hours (particularly on weekend nights) as you get to enjoy (?) the music and conversation from the restaurants on the block. If it's 9 pm, and you want some relaxation and quiet, you won't get it. New York City now has a curfew, so the noise ends promptly at 11 pm.

The room was nice, recently renovated and relatively large for a New York hotel. The refrigerator and sink are greatly appreciated. A downside for me is that some locations in the hotel are rather dark and have no view. My room had no direct sunlight, which was a downer.

There is a REALLY nice roof deck that would be divine in good weather. Spectacular view, lots of seating.

As with most hotels in the city right now, rates at the Hotel Scherman are a steal. Check online booking sites before paying full price.

title: Perfect location, great value
text:
We had a fantastic stay at Hotel Scherman. The hotel is done up really nicely, very moden. The amenities are great. I understand that it could be noisy when there isn't a pandemic going on but we had no issue with noise. If you want a lovely hotel on Restaurant Row, just 2 blocks from Times Square it is a tiny price to pay.

Negatives: The king room was a little small. We had to ask twice before the toiletries and coffee pods were refreshed.

Positives: location location location, friendly staff, SUPER comfy bed, great smelling toiletries - and the microwave was really handy for those having to quarantine.

title: Midtown Gem
text:
I must first disclose that I am a front desk agent at a legendary luxury NYC hotel. So I'll admit,  I can be QUITE observant and quietly critical. Having said that...... what a wonderful stay! 

It felt like I was right back at The William Gray Montreal! 

Safety, security, and serenity is a top priority here. Drama, nonsense, stupidity isn't wanted, welcomed, needed, or tolerated here........ so, if you fit into this category, you best find yourself another property to stay at. You've been warned. Now, having said that........ 

Eric, the General Manager, has paid attention to every last detail to make his guests' stay comfortable. I also appreciate that he has a fully empowered team working for him. 

Tastefully decorated rooms, a nice kitchenette (with keurig, coffee & tea selections, creamers,  sugar, mini fridge, hot plates, flatware, mugs & glasses, toaster oven all very neatly stored), oh my God and that shower with all its different settings. Can someone please email me and tell me what shower head that was.....I want one! I didn't want to get out the shower! 

The staff was amazing. Out of the 4 agents we met, 3 of them went over and wayyyyy beyond to make us feel welcome. Front desk agents Eric and Rami (I'm not sure of the spelling, sorry) were AWESOME........ the overnight agent too.......he was a sweet heart I just can't remember his unique name, I think it was Takbir! We had lively extended chitchats and laughs like we had always been friends. And GM Eric....... what a pleasant hotelier!  I wish him MUCH success. Eric thank you so much for your consideration of our personal situation when assigning us the room that you did. It was EVERYTHING! 

I HIGHLY recommend staying here. You will not be disappointed. I definitely will be returning in the future!

P.S. - how could I forget?! Location, location, location. There's an entire selection of restaurants and bars literally starting right outside the hotel door!

title: Exceeded expectations!
text: The property is modern (due to their recent renovations) but with a old New York/European flair. I had the two bedroom, two bathroom suite with a balcony and it was to die for. We literally spent all of our time in the suite. Location was great! The GM Eric and the Front Office Supervisor (I forgot his name) were very helpful and accommodating. I'll definitely be back again.

title: Inflexible hotel during COVID given fast changing NYC restrictions
text:
Review is all about customer experience during COVID. Unfortunately, I never got a chance to experience the physical hotel itself. 

If you want understanding from this hotel, dont expect it. 

All I asked for was to move my booking at least a month or two given fast rising COVID rates in NYC and mayor recently discouraging visitors. They refused to budge from their 48 hour policy while other fancy hotels have been more than conciliatory in this regard. Unfortunately, due to travel in my last 24 hours, I was unable to cancel this reservation in time (after I heard the Mayor's new restrictions).

title: Best Service Ever !!!
text:
The hotel isn’t big I actually missed it because of the outdoor seating for businesses around it. Despite that it’s compact when you first come in. It has a apartment feel to the place. 

You have to give it up for their service that’s the most important selling point of this hotel if you’re trying to decide. I didn’t get the guy’s name at the front desk who checked in. He was very cool, down to earth & helpful. He offered to bring my food upstairs to me I declined but he also brought up ice for my girl. 

Regarding covid when you enter the place they have hand sanitizer & mask there already for you. Even in the hallway to the room it was the same so Covid wise they got you covered.

The room was very modern and has a apartment feel to it. They had a smart tv, sink, iron, shelf to hang your clothes & store bags. Bathroom was very clean, with the general amenities like body wash, soap, lotion etc. The bed felt amazing after being at the spa coming from Jersey I got quality sleep. 

Overall you don’t have to hesitate to buy a room definitely coming back.

title: Это волшебный отель!
text: Знаете, сказать, что это отличный отель, это ничего не сказать. Хочу от всей души сказать спасибо. Отель уютный и находится в самом центре Манхеттена, но не на шумных его улицах. Потрясающее месте. Это улица очень вкусных ресторанов и баров, но в отеле тихо и спокойно. Есть всё для отдыха. У меня был маленький номер с видом во двор. В номере огромная кровать с супер матрацем. Всё новое и частое. USB розетки для тех, кто забыл, что это штаты. Для девочек, которые с дополнительными дивайсами для укладки волос принесли переходник. Вообще все просьбы выполняются в один миг. Ребята просто супер! Меня проводили и вызвали на улице NY такси. Объяснили, что если заказать из отеля, будет дороже. Кстати, утром что-то случилось с лифтом, и мы с ребятами из Аризоны застряли 😎 нас очень быстро спасли, а вечером в номере ждал подарок от отеля - бутылочка шампанского. Хочется сказать, вы большие молодцы!!!! Спасибо!!! Эти несколько дней были как дома!!!!

title: BED BUG PLACE and Amsterdam Red Light District Style Bouncer run hostel
text: Worst hostel i have ever seen. A french patron with a redlight district tone, is the most assaulting and unfriendly hotelier of town. Shady people and run down hostel that had to rename obviously due to their reputation and is now even worse. What a bad decision and definitely a no go. You cant access by cab, car or uber and will get hit by drunk criminals on the road when you enter this hostel. The rooms are dirty and the location is absolutely terrible of this run down hotel. I am terrified and waking up BED BUGS bites all over my body. This place should be closed. Mister Scherman does a terrible job.

title: Fantastic Service, Safety and Personality
text:
NYC is certainly a different place during the pandemic, but it was nice to find a brilliant oasis in midtown NYC. I had business in NYC and was also going to meet with friends and the Hotel Scherman provided a fantastic hotel experience. The hotel is on Restaurant Row, which is now lined with outdoor dining, so you'll certainly find a cuisine that meets your needs.

I had reserved the penthouse suite, which offers a great view of the East side from the personal balcony. The bedrooms were spotless and super comfortable, with a sitting area and big screen tv that offers a very relaxing environment. There's a roof terrace as well.

While the rooms and amenities were great, the what makes The Hotel Scherman truly memorable are the staff, led by the GM Eric. In a Covid world you certainly want to feel safe in the environment and their team has taken every precaution for their guests' safety. Masks, hand sanitizers, wipes are all available.

I'm not sure when I will be back in NYC again, but I will book The Hotel Scherman when I do return.

Thank you for a great stay

title: A hidden gem!
text: Just back from a weekend stay at Hotel Scherman their first weekend back.  The Hotel Scherman is a beautiful home away from home and the staff is welcoming and accommodating. Eric and his team have taken every pandemic precaution (sanitizing wipes and hand sanitizer on each floor by the elevator) and guests should feel very confident in their stay at Hotel Scherman while in New York. I look forward to my next stay.

title: My new HOME away from HOME in NY !
text:
Just back from a 5 day trip to NYC . Loved (again) our stay at this lovely hotel. The best location for easy access to the BEST restaurants. The BEST staff that trully made up feel like home . Rooms , charming nicely appointed and .....such a comfy bed! Will make this HOMEfor my twice a year bussiness trips! 
Thanks Eric and staff!
