title: A Hidden Gem: NYC's Finest!
text: I was a fan of the Chelsea Townhouse Inn, but when the Inn was demolished and Eric moved to the French Quarters, a chic and inviting little boutique hotel with it's grand location (restaurant row and the theater district) my NYC visits got even better. My husband and I stayed at the French Quarters last night and we couldn't have been happier. Our room was lovely, with a kitchenette that included good coffee and chilled water. The bathroom was elegant and spacious and the king sized bed very comfortable. I even took a picture of the pillow label so I could buy my own!  Best of all, our stay included a special morning visit with Sophie and Max, Eric's two adorable bull dogs. Though reluctant to share this secret, I can't help but give the highest recommendation for this charming boutique hotel.  P.S. If you want to meet Sophie and Max you may need to put in an early request. Enjoy!

title: Chic Gem
text: It’s so easy to stay in the big concrete chains in New York, but I would highly recommend trying something different at The French Quarters. Situated in Hell’s Kitchen, handy for Broadway, Central Park, The Rockefeller Centre and the Port Authority Bus terminal (v useful public transport hub) , the hotel has gorgeous rooms in a sort of French New Orleans vibe. Clean, roomy, well appointed, with a little kitchenette if you want to self-cater. But there are loads of restaurants nearby. Plus nice touches like guest umbrellas and really helpful reception staff. We loved it.

title: NYE IN NYC!
text:
I hate to post great reviews because it won’t be a wonderful little secret. This place wasn’t huge, it wasn’t a party type atmosphere, just a wonderful boutique hotel! The staff was wonderful, and the rooms had everything we needed. Eric, Thank you and we look forward to our next visit! 
Ron & Letty Clark

title: Perfect stay & location
text:
We recently stayed for 2 days midweek. While we arrived earlier than expected, Eric said our room would be ready in 20 minutes. A pleasant surprise since we had not asked for early arrival. In the mean time we lunched next door at Tito Murphy’s which was just a level down from the lobby on the elevator (also where the Continental breakfast was served).
Our room was spacious, quiet and nicely decorated with a comfortable bed and big bathroom. They are in the middle of renovations, although we did not hear or see any of this. My only hope is that the ‘feel’ of the place doesn’t change too much.
The location was great; right around the corner from our theater reservations and along Restaurant Row.
The staff were very friendly and helpful. We look forward to staying here again.

title: Wonderful hospitality!
text:
I am so glad I booked this hotel for our stay in New York. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very cosy. They're also pretty large for NYC rooms, and the smaller rooms have a stovetop and fridge you can use to prepare some of your own meals (a life saver in a very expensive city). 

But the star of our stay was the staff. We fell ill on our last day and weren't able to fly home for another two days. The staff were wonderful about putting us in another room to extend our stay and even helped us book a nearby hotel when they were all booked out for our last night. Every staff member was friendly and helpful throughout our stay, with great advice and recommendations about the city. They went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and had every thing we needed.

title: The hotel I had always hoped I could find in NYC
text: After going to NYC tons of times and trying to find an ideal spot, I finally have.  The rooms are spacious, charming and thoughtful.  The location ideal among tons of restaurants but not loud and steps to Broadway.  But most of all, the owner and staff are  warm, engaging and make you feel wanted and welcome.  From the moment we walked in and asked for an early check in to the time we had to sadly leave, we felt at home...I can't wait to go back.

title: Great location, friendly staff, and cute decor
text: First of all, the location was perfect, only about a 7 minute walk to Times Square, so really in the middle of everything. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the room was clean with very cute decor. The only thing is I would recommend bringing earplugs if you're a light sleeper, as noise from the street can be a little loud at night (but that's the cost of being so close to everything in New York)! Would definitely stay here again!

title: Family Christmas vaca
text: Great hotel within walking distance to Times Square but far enough away from the crowds. Just 2 blocks away from the E train which we took straight from JFK. Got the 2 room suite, wife and 3 teenagers, and it worked great. Met the owner Erik at breakfast and he gave some great advice. Would stay here again

title: 3 day stay
text: Me and my husband stayed here the 9 dec to the 12 dec we had a lovely stay at this fab hotel.  The rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast was lovely we would definitely return. You are so close to everything here. Wonderful hotel.

title: Charming Hotel on Restaurant Row
text: After years of staying in large impersonal NY hotels we were thrilled to find The French Quarters. From the minute we arrived and were greeted by General Manager Eric it felt like home. Our two bedroom two bath apt (#402) was clean and comfortably accommodated 4 adults.  The large balcony was a nice addition even though it was too cold to utilize. The location was exceptionally quiet for NYC. There is a very nice continental breakfast available - includes juices, coffee (no decaf), teas, pastries, boiled eggs, etc. The room refrigerator was also stocked with bottled water and creamers for Keurig coffee maker. (Also plenty of coffee pods to chose from.)  Location is very convenient to theaters and restaurants.

title: Sister trip to NYC
text:
This was our second visit to the French Quarters Bed and Breakfast.  The accommodations were awesome.  The location is excellent for the street is named Restaurant Row.  Many wonderful restaurants are across the street from the B & B. 
Wonderful breakfast with fruit and pastries.  Currently, doing some remodeling so no hot breakfast fare.

title: Rooms "over the bar"!
text:
My wife and I stayed on the French Quarters last week, Thursday and Friday nights Dec 12 & 13.  Without any awareness, we stayed in an “over the bar” room, #105, which was NOT made known to us … but we discovered when we came back to our room for the night at midnight and listened to the base amp through the floor and walls until 4AM.   I complained to the receptionist and she said “the music is supposed to stop at 11PM”, which would be fine but of course seems really unlikely for a Manhattan bar.

We have stayed here previously, and loved the experience (so we chose the hotel again).  But "over the bar" is no way to sleep.  And eMail complaints to the GM have gone unanswered.

title: Homey, comfortable and well appointed
text:
Family trip to New York for the holiday to take in dinner and a show. This is a beautiful hotel. Well appointed rooms that are clean and accommodating. We had a two bedroom suite so we all slept comfortably. Delicious and simple continental breakfast. Close to theaters and Times Square. We love to walk in New York City so easily walked to all destinations Central Park and fifth Avenue.
General manager is on site and very attentive 
We will be back

title: Perfect cute place!
text: Stayed there for a girls weekend. Was great. Room was clean, bathroom was clean. Great customer service. In a safe area. We checked in in the early morning prior to our room being available, they kept our bags and then brought them up to our rooms when it was ready. What a quaint and pretty place. Will be staying there next time we are in the city! Place was perfect!

title: Nice place
text: Decided to stay at a smaller hotel this time on our mini trip to NYC.  We were very happy with our stay.  We dropped our bag off prior to check in at 10 am so we wouldn’t have to carry it around while sightseeing.  We preregistered and around 2 got a call that our room was ready.  So we got our keys and our bags were already in the room waiting for us.  We were welcomed with a lovely handwritten note from the owners of the hotel.  The room was really nice, with a mini kitchen.  Everything was clean and comfortable.  Less hustle and bustle then the large hotels and was very relaxing & close to wonderful restaurants.  The only minus is we could hear the beat from the music of a band playing nearby.  My 2 teenagers fell asleep right away without even noticing -  so it wasn’t a big deal. Breakfast in the connected restaurant was nice-beautifully decorates for the holidays.

title: Nice Bar, Great Room, Can have a better Customer Service
text: A rustic looking place along a rustic looking avenue, but its uniqueness is what actually made it..well, unique. Reception area is a bit small, which made me wonder how it will be like during peak season when there are tons of people booking a room. The room is what made me say hey, this is not a bad place! Room is very clean, & the vintage touch added to the distinct experience. The following day we had our breakfast, which is mostly bread and fruits, plus drinks, although I prefer having bacon, but I guess they just want to stay true to the French experience. We decided to check out early to watch Macy'sparade since we didn't know if we can be back before the 11 AM checkout time. However, we found the Macy's parade too crowded, so we went back to the hotel.  That's around 9 AM. Now, this is where the 5 stars became 4 stars. We asked the staff if it's possible to go back to the room so we can rest. The staff just said "No, you already checked out, we already stripped the room". That's it. Yes, we know we checked out, but no options given? If I am a staff there I would probably say, "I'm sorry your room is no longer available, however, if you want to rest you can stay at our bar. You'll enjoy it there, and you can even try our wine. For a fee of course". We would have probably really tried it. Or the customer service stops once the guests already checked out? Makes me wonder. Still, it's a great place, I wouldn't deny that. But probably not recommend it to friends.

title: Perfection
text: Absolutely perfect stay!!! I’ve stayed in hundreds of hotels, and this was by far the best experience I’ve ever had. You would never know you were in the city because of how quiet the suite was...I never once heard a siren, horn, construction, doors slamming, etc. The suite was perfectly appointed, clean, stylish, and had awesome views from every window. I’ve already highly recommended this hotel on my FB page and I’m so happy to have this place as my home away from home from now on!!!

title: Wonderful stay
text:
The French quarters is a boutique hotel located 5 min from the times square. Rooms are cozy clean and nicely furnished
Breakfast was great. Stuff friendly and helpful
I definitely recommend it
Located close to restaurants and theatres of Broadway

title: UN REFUGIO AGOGEDOR A CINCO MINUTOS DE TIMES SQUARE
text: Un hotel pequeño pero acogedor ,muy  tranquilo a pesar de estar a cinco minutos de Times Square la decoración preciosa ,con una pequeña cocina, camas cómodas y amplias muy limpio y sobre todo un personal excelente

title: New york
text: Stayed at this hotel based on very good trip advisor reviews and we were certainly not disappointed, friendly efficient staff, knowledgeable about the area, room whilst a bit dated was spotlessly clean and kept that way all through our stay, breakfast was continental in style and very tasty, plenty to choose from , however pretty much the same offerings each morning, but everything was fresh and well presented, I would unreservedly recommend this hotel on value for money great staff and great location on the corner of Times Square and Broadway

title: Perfect accommodation for our trip to NYC
text:
Our city break holidays usually see us in a decent chain hotel that is well located to go sightseeing. When we go out in the morning that is usually us until we get back late in the evening.

However as this was a surprise birthday treat from Mrs C she had looked at something different and that would mean that our son (24) could also come along.

We were booked into the Penthouse suite which is probably the only penthouse in NYC that is on the 5th Floor! Our suite was great. Quaintly decorated in NO/French style. Two good sized beds and bedrooms, living area with small kitchen and fridge.

We also had a balcony which looked over the street and despite the chill we still manged to sit out at night to enjoy the sights and sounds of the city.
From the balcony you can look one way towards Times Square and all the skyscrapers and the other way you can see the older area of Hell's Kitchen.

The hotel is situated on Restaurant Row in Hell's Kitchen which is a great location for accessing Times Square and Broadway as well as the Subways.

The staff are pleasant and helpful and we appreciated their assistance as we had to deal wit our credit card company on arrival as they apparently couldn't conceive of us being in Glasgow one day and then being in NYC 2 days later. Despite the fact that we told them we were going 2 days previously.

There is a lift but it is so slooooow.

Breakfast is continental style and served in the adjoining restaurant. This used to be a French/NO style restaurant. While a separate entity from the hotel they had a kind of understanding which got lost somewhere along the line as the restaurant is now a Tex Mex place with with every piece of cliched decor you would expect to see.
However while we ate breakfast the hotel seem to have control of the sound system and French singers provided a crooning soundtrack.

We found the rooms clean and the beds comfy which after some intense sightseeing we really appreciated.

title: Convenient, clean, pleasant
text:
A very nice discovery! The room for one was typical for New York City, but more spacious than many.  Spacious bathroom, very clean. Unique breakfast area (pictured).
The elevator is slow, so plan to potentially use steps.

title: Lovely taste of Europe in New York City.
text: Really nice small hotel, oozes charm, very lovely decor, not chain like at all.  Excellent location for catching the hop on hop off buses and Times Square, lots of good restaurants all around. Highly recommend it.

title: Scandaleux - Scandalous !!!
text:
The French Quarters hotel à New York, 
Cet établissement ne tient pas compte des demandes des clients.
Nous avons étés installé dans une chambre et bâtiment autre que celui décrit sur le site  et ne correspondait pas notre réservation.
Nous avions réservé une chambre double avec kitchenette.
Dans les commentaires prévus sur Booking.com, j’avais demandé d’être loin des machineries et distributeurs et dans les étages supérieurs de l’hôtel, 3 mois avant notre arrivée !
L’établissement a donc eu le temps de trouver une chambre correspondant à notre demande ou de nous prévenir si cela n’était pas possible.
Nous aurions pu annuler la réservation et choisir un autre hôtel.
Au matin, J’ai demandé au manager Eric Ord de nous donner immédiatement une autre chambre correspondant à notre réservation.
He could not find anything better than telling me that if it did not suit me, I could leave !!! 😤 
Nous avons donc été mis au pied du mur sur base de publicité mensongère de la part de cet hôtel.
Nous étions installés au premier étage, dans un autre bâtiment sans ascenseur à côté des grands ventilateurs extérieurs (voir photos et vidéo).
Nous avons dû subir le bruit des ventilations durant 7 nuits, mais aussi les soirées musicales de la taverne sous l’hôtel, nous étions à côté de la verrière. (Halloween et weekend)
Le matin nous devions nous habiller et sortir dans la rue pour aller vers un autre bâtiment pour déjeuner.
Il est temps que Booking.com prend c’est responsabilité vis-à-vis des hôteliers qui prennent les clients en otages, sachant très bien, qu’il n’y aura aucun suivi judiciaire.
À mon retour, j’ai écrit à la propriétaire Madame Léa Sherman expliquant que cette situation n’était pas normale et j’ai demandé une réparation financière vu que nous n’avions pas eux la chambre qui nous avions réservé et les inconvénients que nous avons subi suite à leurs publicités trompeuses et mensongères.
Je n’ai reçu aucune réponse de sa part… 🤔

A 3000 Euros les 7 nuits, cela fait mal …

title: The best place to stay
text:
Clean rooms, good location, good AC.
Managers are very nice and accomodating. 

The place is very convenient with so many places to eat nearby. Just a few minutes walk and you can access the subway.

Eric is the best GM btw. He knows every guest and walks the extra mile for everyone.

title: Not so charming anymore
text:
Having stayed here previously, we decided to come back, since the location is excellent. This time our experience was different.
Our room was in the next door building, quite small, first floor above a noisy bar where the music only stops after 11pm.
If you’re a light sleeper, earplugs are necessary to get a good nights sleep. Continental breakfast is still part of the deal and provides a good start into your day. Our room was basic, a coffee maker and a fridge are provided, the wardrobe only had 2 hangers. This place only works for travelers that are tired of the big hotel chains.

title: A Nice Place
text: I've stayed here several times and always had a good experience. Quaint rooms, reasonable prices and a great location, a couple of blocks from the theatre district and right in Hell's kitchen. Central park is an easy walk and if you're so inclined so is Times Square. There's a restaurant/bar downstairs with pretty good food or there's all the restaurants along the street (try La Tanzi!).

title: Like Being @ Home ❤️
text:
Lovely boutique hotel on Restaurant Row NYC! Upon arrival to The French Quarters we were able to pre-check-in and have them hold our luggage so we go out and explore Manhattan.
When we returned our room was ready and they had placed our luggage in our room. What an impression! Our room was beautiful! My husband and I were in NY to celebrate our 17th anniversary, and the staff went out of their way with some little extras that made our stay so romantic and memorable! (THANK YOU!!!)
The room was clean and beautifully decorated: great attention to detail right down to the window treatments! We had a King bed that was very comfortable. The bathroom and walk-in shower was good size (no hair dryer, so bring your own). There was a small kitchenette in our room as well. There was a Keurig coffee maker, along with several K-cups, cream, and sweetener. It felt more like we were staying in someone’s home... so much better than the large, noisy, crowded hotels east of 7th Avenue! Don’t focus so much on hotel views! You’ll be so busy you’ll never have time to go to your hotel and look out the window. Besides, I rather liked the view from our room. Plus we spent every moment of each day viewing the skyline from land & water.
There is also a good continental breakfast on the restaurant level — Again, hosted by very friendly and helpful staff!
I will definitely be returning to The French Quarters on my next trip to NYC!

title: Charming, Family-Run Hotel
text: The desk staff were very friendly and helpful. They took care of our bags before our room was ready and after we checked out until time for us to leave for the airport. They did not arrange transportation or hail a taxi, but they did check fares so we could choose the most cost effective transport. They did have an arrangement with a service but required three hours notice and were more expensive than what we chose. The room was attractive, clean and comfortable. There was a kitchenette with a fridge and cooktop. Some dishes and supplies to make coffee and tea were available. The bathroom was large and updated. There was a folder containing a travel guide of sorts and information about the hotel. A continental breakfast was served in the adjoining bar which was a beautiful place with carved woodwork and seasonal decorations. The location is a short walk to Broadway shows and lots of restaurants. We thought ourselves lucky to have found this gem.

title: Intimate Hotel in a Great Location
text: I recently visited NYC with my daughter, granddaughter and one of my granddaughter's friends. I choose this hotel because we needed a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. I was not disappointed! The location between 8th and 9th Avenues was perfect. The staff, friendly and helpful. A beautiful balcony was a huge plus. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Magnifique et proche de tout.
text:
Je vous recommande grandement cet hôtel, pour son accueil, sa proximité de la plupart des sites touristiques, à deux pas de times square....
Petit déjeuner très copieux et les chambres sont splendides, propres et très confortables.

title: Lovely hotel. Fantastic team!
text:
(note: this review is for a 2 bedroom penthouse)

It's obvious that the location of this hotel is absolutely perfect, no question about it. We had a rather expensive penthouse, so we were a bit hesitant if it's worth the price. It's totally worth it. Dining on our large private balcony observing Times Square lights and feeling the mid-town vibe - is a unique experience.

What makes this hotel truly great - is the team. There's a personal attention feeling which is rare in NY (our kids learned all the stuff names and were somewhat excited each time before returning to hotel trying to guess whom they will meet this evening)

Special thanks to Alexis for taking care of the fridge and our other little requests.

(note to management: the (great) heavy metal chairs on the balcony, when moved around, make noise to the lower level rooms. Not sure if can be replaced with less noisy chairs, but at least - makes sense to ask guests to be aware of that and try to move them more quietly. We only realized this once lower-level neighbor told us)

title: Comforts of home
text: The French Quarters is nestled in the middle of a block on West 46th Street surrounded by restaurants and shops. On a recent stop in New York City, I stayed at the French Quarters and found it friendly and comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and went out of its way to show me its hospitality. A notecard on my bed welcomed me by name. My room was small, but had all the comforts of home including a USB charging hub for my phone and tablet -- very thoughtful and something I wish more hotels would provide. The bathroom was spotless. I will be sure to stay at the French Quarters on my next trip to New York.

title: Local hotel - totally central location
text:
We stayed 2 nights at the French Quarters. The room was surprisingly large for being central NYC - and nice, clean and old style French.
Even though it’s 1 1/2 block from Times Square it very quiet.
Breakfast was served at the neighbor restaurant - continental with a simple and OK choice of bread and cereal.
The air con was noisy which resulted in warm nights.

title: Perfect in every way!
text: This hotel is fantastic in so many ways. The  room was spacious & clean. It is just a couple of blocks from Times Square and only four blocks from the main bus/subway station. The Irish/Mexican fusion restaurant (Tito Murphy’s) is lively and the food is great. Also, little touches like having umbrellas in the room (these were needed!!), a personalised welcome note and the most detailed guide to New York being in our room made the stay even more exceptional. What’s more is the hotel is located on Restaurant Row, a lively tree lined street packed with fantastic restaurants. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Muy buena experiencia
text: Es la segunda vez que nos quedamos y ambas veces supero nuestras expectativas. Muy lindas habitaciones, la que nos toco especialmente linda. Creo que la 207. Muy buena atención de todo el personal. Excelente ubicación a dos cuadras de los teatros. Desayuno bien aunque me hubiera gustado que tuviera opciones calientes como ser bacon y huevos revueltos. El precio nos pareció un poco elevado pero lo vale.

title: Surprise in Hell's Kitchen
text: We were delighted with this little gem. Our room was a good size, bed comfy, two sinks (a blessing for two prima donnas) and the staff was pleasant. Breakfast was nicely presented and hearty. It was even quiet.

title: Amazing Stay!
text: I had the pleasure of staying at the French Quarters this past weekend and I don’t think I will ever stay anywhere else in the city if I have my choice! It was quaint, extremely friendly, superbly clean and cozy. I can’t wait to return!

title: Love, Love, Love!
text: I'm almost afraid to put the word out because I want to keep this place to myself...but I promised the staff I would write.  What a terrific stay.  This hotel is so homey, so comfortable, so accomodating...we literally felt like we "lived" in New York during our stay.  We were first time visitors and this location was perfect as I was scheduled to perform at Don't Tell Mama Cabaret across the street.  I booked it because of the proximity to the club but had no idea I was putting us right in the middle of where we wanted to be!  A short walk to Time Square, theaters, tons of restaurants ("Restaurant Row" is aptly named!).  Easy access to cabs, Uber and trains.  The staff was absolutely lovely - every single one of them.  We also didn't realize there would be a wonderful high end continental breakfast each morning.  I wish I'd thought to take pictures of it but it was terrific.  Can't wait to get back to NYC and French Quarters, our new home away from home.  Thanks Eric, Lana, Lea, Alexis, Ryu, and everyone else I'm forgetting.

title: First Time Visitor to French Quarters NYC
text: Last Thursday my husband and I had the pleasure of staying at your wonderful establishment.  The front desk service was friendly, professional and they went out of their way to answer questions.  The location was perfect for walking to our theatre and to find good restaurants.  The adjoining restaurant is now a Mexican/Irish place!  We had a very good dinner there and thoroughly enjoyed our drinks after the performance.  We will definitely be back and will recommend your place to anyone. Our new NYC place to stay.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel with a French atmosphere
text:
This was our Fourth visit to NYC but the first time at the French Quarters. We decided to stay here because of the great location and to have a different experience vs the big chains hotels. 
We had an amazing vacation with my wife and 2 kids (12 and 9 y/o). The hotel staff is very warm and they are in all the details. While the check-in time is at 3pm, we flew in an International flight overnight and after we left our luggage we received a message at noon  saying that our room was ready. 
Im addition, on one night we were celebrating our 13th wedding anniversary and when we came back from a long day visiting the Soho we found a Bottle of Champagne with a warm note from Eric and the team. This little details mean a lot to us and made a big difference.  
The pros: Location, comfy beds (with premium linen), breakfast (Cofee and Bagels were delicious), all the hotel team (Eric, frontdesk team, housekeeping, etc) and the L’Occitane products at the room. 

Thanks Eric and the team for making our stay very pleasant. Will come back for sure !

Jose Toscano, Natalia, Bianca and Benicio

title: Very convenient to Times Square
text: We had a family of 6 and stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with a sofa bed. We had a very nice balcony and it is super convenient to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and theaters. Staff was friendly and our only issue was we had trouble with the key cards not working multiple times. Enjoyed the atmosphere so much more than a chain hotel!

title: Amazingly horrible experience with this hotel
text:
My fiance actually booked this hotel for an all girls trip because of the great reviews it had received, the hotel's location to the Theater District, and the hotel's website description of the rooms and amenities.  My daughters (ages 26, 22, and 12) and I were really excited about spending five days in Manhattan together before school began in mid-August.  Unfortunately, we left this hotel after only one night due to the extremely poor customer service we experienced by the night clerk and the owner/manager of the property. 

When we asked for bottled water (which is listed as a service offered by the hotel on its website), we were told 'to drink out of the tap" by the night clerk.  He did not offer us any assistance in finding any nearby stores which sold bottled water either.  While my older daughters went out to find bottled water, my youngest daughter and I went up to the room.  I noticed there were only two sets of towels in there for four of us, so I went downstairs to ask the night clerk for more towels.  He was busy chatting up two young ladies who were explaining how far they had to walk to find grapes in the city at this time of night.  I finally had to excuse myself for interrupting their conversation, and asked for extra towels for the room.  I offered to take them now if the towels were on hand so as to not interrupt his conversation further.  The night clerk explained that he would have to go up to the fourth floor to get them and would bring them to the room.  He did so in a relatively timely manner.

The air conditioning thermostat in our room could not be lowered past 70 degrees.  I have a difficult time sleeping in temperatures above 68 degrees.  I went downstairs to ask about the temperature setting, and the night clerk told me he would have to manually adjust the temperature in our room.  He was watching a movie on his laptop, and let me know that it was okay to use the telephone in the room to call him instead of coming downstairs to speak with him directly.  This was sometime around 3 a.m.  Exhausted from a long day of travel, I finally fell asleep.

The next morning after breakfast, I decided to let senior management know of the rude treatment I had received from the night clerk.   This led me to speaking with the Owner/ Manager, Eric Ord.  Eric told me there was no customer service issue, and that he had received complaints about me from other guests on how I treated the night clerk.  Further, he told me that his hotel does not supply bottled water because New York has spent an ENORMOUS amount of money to have the best tap water in the world.  He also told me the night clerk was correct in asking me to use the telephone instead of coming downstairs to speak with him.  Finally, he said that I owed him extra money for the two additional guests in my room who were not on the initial reservation and for whom towels were not supplied.  I had to show him a copy of my prepaid Expedia reservation which listed FOUR people as hotel guests.  This was the only apology I received, but it was made clear that this was Expedia's fault -- not the hotel's.

Being thoroughly insulted, I did the one thing that any person with a modicum of self-respect would so:  we found other accommodations and left.  When I informed Eric of our intent to leave, he said it was fine with him but our reservation was non-refundable.  He told us, "Good luck" as we handed in our three room keys and left.

It would seem that our experience is completely out of character with that of others' experiences with this hotel given the overall ratings.  However, if one reads other reviews posted on this and other business review websites about French Quarters NYC, one will see first-hand the way this hotel's staff interacts with its guests.  If you say there weren't enough hangers in the closet, Eric will kindly tell you it's because you didn't ask for more.  If you had a problem with your room, Eric will tell you it could be easily remedied by lowering your expectations for they are a modest, but chic boutique hotel.  If you had a less than stellar encounter with staff, it's basically YOUR problem.

I really hesitated leaving such a negative review, but my experience with this hotel was so horrible that I feel it necessary to warn others.  My fiance and I thought it was over when we successfully reversed the unused portion of the hotel reservation with our credit card company.  But, alas...no, it isn't.  We found out yesterday that French Quarters NYC has charged the remaining balance on my daughter's credit card which was put up for room incidentals at check-in.  She and her husband are active military and stationed at Ft. Meade in Maryland.  
My daughter was told, "You ladies behaved so appallingly at our front desk, abusing staff, that other guests came to me afterwards to complain about your conduct. ...We are a small elegant old world Boutique B&B, not a flashy party hotel with mini-bar and room service.  Thanks, Eric"  Not quite sure how a mother and her 3 daughters (including one minor child) could be characterized as "party girls" for asking for bottled water and a little a/c in NYC during the summertime....but, okay....

Let this review serve as a prime example of exactly what kind of people one is doing business with when staying at the French Quarter NYC.

title: Bussines
text: Friendly helpful staff, close to Theatre District, Times Square and transport options. Room was clean, fresh with old world charm. Although our room was on the 1st floor we had been warned that the bar underneath was loud at night and may ……

title: Great hotel in a fantastic location.
text:
Just returned from a great trip to New York and our 3rd stay at the French Quaters. I really can't find fault with this hotel. It is in a great location, close to Times Square and numerous bars and restaurants.
The rooms are charming and spotlessly clean with the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in at a hotel.
There is a good range of breakfast foods and it's plentiful.
All the staff we met were friendly and helpful- thank you.
I would highly recommend a stay in this hotel.

title: Perfect
text: I stayed one night recently with 5 friends and one night with my daughter. The atmosphere of rooms, restaurant and breakfast area could not be nicer. Stepping off the busy street and into the hotel is great you won’t want to leave room. Both the 2 bedroom suite and king room were perfect. We had to check our luggage when room wasn’t ready and it was waiting in our room for on checking. Most of the group was leaving right after a show and they had there luggage waiting for them to pick up. We were running late so they probably would have missed train. One friend has already booked the hotel again for another visit

title: Charm on 46th Street
text: Location,location,location! Right in the middle of Restaurant Row, The French Quarters proved to be a charming and comfortable hotel in a great location for food and theatre. The room was clean, nicely decorated with a French New Orleans theme, with comfortable beds. Very quiet. Our only quibble was with the tiny bathroom sink, a minor inconvenience. Included pastries for breakfast were fresh and provided an ample breakfast.

title: New Orleans right there in NYC!
text: We truly loved this hotel and would definitely stay again!  The management and staff were so pleasant and welcoming and our room was just outstanding.  The continental breakfast is held on the mezzanine level and was a super nice start to our day.  Thank you so much for your hospitality...

title: The only place to stay in New York
text: This hotel is is a prime location, a mere 2 x blocks from Time Square and close to some of the best restaurants in Hell's Kitchen. The attention to detail in the rooms is fantastic, with fresh, fluffy white towels daily, great beds with luxurious linen, coffee machine with plenty of pods, fridge in the room and L'occitane in the bathrooms. Shower was great too!

title: Lovely hotel in a great location!
text:
The French Quarters NYC is a classy hotel located in the theater district. Check-in was a breeze and attended by friendly and helpful staff. The room was a bit smallish (very common in NYC as visitors generally are out and about rather than staying in their room), but quite well appointed with comfortable bed, small kitchenette, and a spacious shower. The included breakfast was outstanding- way better than the usual hotel fare.  We had a later train reservation and the hotel staff kindly allowed us to store our luggage after checkout. 

The location of The French Quarters is outstanding- an easy walk to Broadway shows and plays as well as many good restaurants lining both sides of the block where the hotel is located.

title: Perfect place to explore NY
text: The location is just perfect, near the time square, bus and metro station. We stayed in a family room for four nights, the room was adequately cleaned and serviced. The breakfast has a good variety but fruits could be improved. We met Eric, the manager, he is an excellent source for additional information and guidance on things to do. Thanks Eric we will definitely be back.

title: An amazing find! a haven of comfort just round the corner from Times Square
text:
This place is so comfortable, the beds and gorgeous cotton sheets snuggle you in after a hard day sightseeing. The spec is very high, in everything.
We stayed in the two bed apartment and the balcony was great, sat looking at the skyscrapers and the nearby restaurants welcoming their guests.
The breakfast was the most amazing 'continental breakfast' I have ever had, the bagels were the freshest and biggest and THE BEST! Hosts were so pleasant and helpful and communication about our stay excellent.
The bar downstairs is like something from 'Cheers' full of locals and character and the burgers were great.
I only hope I can return one day. Top Class!! Thank you x

title: Perfect place to stay!
text: We just returned from a one night stay at this hotel.  The hotel we typically stay in is closed and appears to be undergoing reservations.  We were looking for a room with a bedroom and a living area with a sleep sofa and found The French Quarters to have the perfect room.  We always include shows in our trips and wanted something near the theaters.  The French Quarters was perfect.  We loved the location and the personal touches.  Our particular room, though right across from the elevator, was so quiet.  We had a wonderful night’s sleep.  The sleep sofa was the most comfortable I have ever slept on and the AC was perfect.  The breakfast was great and in such a cute setting.  With the background music we felt like we were at a French bistro.    We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.  They called us to let us know when our room was ready and even lent us 2 umbrellas when it was storming.  They set up a car for our ride to the airport.  It was a nice comfortable minivan.  The driver was great and handled the terrible LGA traffic perfectly.  The only issue was that he only took cash so make sure you have plenty of cash if you are going to LGA as the traffic has been awful lately. This will definitely become our go to hotel for our NYC trips.  We are already trying to decide when that will be.  We saw Moulin Rouge this time which I highly recommend and it is right around the corner from The French Quarters.

title: Good and bad, but I wouldn't return,
text: My husband and I and two of our kids (20 and 18) recently stayed 3 nights in a 2 bedroom suite.  Initially, there was a mix up in the room we booked.  The hotel has 2 bedroom suites with 1 bathroom and 2 bedroom suites with 2 bathrooms.  My husband called the hotel and asked which room he had to book to get the 2 bathrooms and was told the luxury suite.  In fact, that turned out to be the suite with only 1 bathroom and the 2 bath suite was not available during our stay.  We weren't thrilled with 4 "adults" getting ready in 1 bathroom, but the location of the hotel was so great (we were in town to see 3 shows and the hotel is very close to the theaters) so we decided to just make the best of it.  The reception staff was not rude but not terribly apologetic about the mix up.  The suite itself was comfortable (although the bathroom could use more storage) albeit a bit dark.  The first issue occurred on the first morning when my husband attempted to bring one bagel back to the room for my daughter.  The continental breakfast is laid out from 7-9am and with 4 of us using one bathroom, we weren't all ready to go down.  Eric, the manager, stopped my husband and told him food was not allowed in the room because of "vermin" issues.  My husband explained that my daughter had not had time to come down to breakfast and asked if food was not allowed, why was there a kitchenette in the room?  Clearly, Eric did not want "extra" food to be taken back to the room, but given that there were 4 of us, we did not take more than a typical amount of food for breakfast (only 2 of us went down for breakfast).  Eric's statement that food was not allowed in the room was disingenuous and his rude manner was not the welcoming attitude I'd hoped for from this small establishment.  He seemed to think we had an "extra" person in the room and rudely inquired about this although they'd taken all of our driver's licenses when we checked in so they knew who was in the room and that room is for up to 6 people.  The next issue occurred because we left our Do Not Disturb sign out for 2 days.  We are environmentally conscious and prefer to reuse our towels and we emptied our own trash.  Also, my kids did not want the sofa bed to be remade and put away, so we thought we'd be doing the cleaning staff a favor by not having them clean our room.  Apparently, Eric did not think so.  He knocked at our door on the second day and said in an accusatory tone of voice that we'd had the Do Not Disturb sign out for 2 days and insisted that New York state law mandated that he physically inspect the room.  Now whether that's true or not is not my issue.  My issue is his accusatory and offensive attitude.  I have traveled all over the world, stayed in many very nice hotels, and I understand that security is heightened these days.  That said, I really felt like he was accusing us of doing something improper or illegal in the room.  My husband invited him into the room, but he just poked his head around the door and abruptly left.  In all of our travels, I have never been treated that rudely by management.  My family and I are courteous guests and during our hotel (and airbnb) stays we act as if we are guests in someone's home.  We left for a show shortly after this encounter with Eric and I couldn't even pay attention to the first several songs in the show because I was so incensed by Eric's attitude.  I'd stopped at the front desk on my way out and told the staff member what had happened and that Eric was more than welcome to enter our room and inspect it should he feel the need.  Even the second day at breakfast, he never said good morning or smiled.  So despite the great location and the comfort of the suite, I would not return to this establishment because of Eric's ungracious and offensive attitude.

title: Pearl near time square
text: Fabulous owners, smiley and willing to give help. Authentic family owned guest house. Wonderful breakfast. Clean, elegant, quite, convinient, close to most attractions in manhattan. Rare pearl in new york !

title: 部屋は広くて立地も良くリーズナブル
text: 初めてのNYで1泊しました。タイムズスクエアやミュージカル劇場にも近くてリーズナブルな値段だったので利用しました。建物は古いですが、部屋は十分な広さで小綺麗な感じです。バスルームはシャワーだけですが、アメニティはロクシタンの物が備えてありました。セーフティボックスもあり、便利でした。朝食は数種類のパンと茹で卵程度でした。朝食の時間が8時から10時と短く、エレベーターは壊れているのかと思うくらいかなりスローな所は気を付けておいた方がいいです。

title: Estancia fantástica
text:
El hotel está situado en una zona inmejorable de la ciudad, se encuentra a unos cinco minutos andando de Times Square, y es importante mencionar que aunque es una zona de mucho tránsito y bullicio, el hotel está perfectamente insonorizado.
En cuanto a las comodidades del alojamiento, cumplieron y superaron nuestras expectativas. Es un hotel muy limpio en habitaciones y baños, el wifi funcionaba a la perfección y el desayuno es muy completo.
Repetiríamos sin duda alguna. 
Por último decir que la atención del personal fue excelente.

title: Great place to stay
text: Stayed here 4 nights with husband and two teenagers. Great location just off Times Square spacious room with two spacious beds. Air conditioning very good as stayed during heatwave. Great shower no bath that was not a requirement for us. Had fridge in room, hob and coffee maker did not need hob but handy if you needed to cook something simple. Breakfast was very tasty selection of fruits, cereal pastries bagels and juices. All good quality. Staff very friendly and welcoming would recommend and return if got an opportunity

title: Great location
text: Great food and staff. Great place to stay to see the city! Stayed in accommodation here and had dinner and drinks - cant go wrong. only a short walk to times square and all the sights of the city. Rooms nice

title: Very friendly staff!
text: I absolutely loved my stay at this hotel. The staff were so friendly and really made me feel welcome. The bed was so comfortable. The coffee and breakfast were great. One of the best parts is the location, as it is so close to the central train and bus station in New York.

title: Well located and very friendly
text: The French Quarters was brilliantly located just a few mins walk from Times Square but on a surprisingly quiet road. Staff were all very helpful and friendly, rooms comfortable and the breakfast included was great. Would happily return

title: Great location
text:
Location is great however deceiving listing, we booked a single bed room and a double however double means one king bed...
Hvac is a ceiling mounted unit and can’t be adjusted as air flow so you may find it blows straight in your face
Overall great location and friendly staff
Continental breakfast is average 
Just two clothes hangar per room
Single queen is very small, king bed room sold as double is more reasonable
Ok for short visit

title: Fantastic location. Wonderful staff. Highly recommend!
text:
We loved our stay at this hotel. The location is right next to the theaters, Times Square, subways and Central Park (jogged to the park each morning). We used this hotel as our jumping off point for trips all over Manhattan and even to Long Island. The room was large and included a kitchenette. The bathroom was roomy with an extra-large shower. 

Everything about this hotel and its location was convenient.  In addition to planning for the big touristy items, if we needed something quickly (groceries, water, convenience items), all were in close proximity and easily obtained. 

The staff was extremely nice and very helpful. We loved seeing the same faces on a daily basis.

title: Top Hotel, freundlicher Service - mitten drin im Geschehen
text: Wir sind eher durch Zufall auf dieses Kleinod mitten in NYC gestoßen. Super freundlicher Empfang von Lea und ihrem Team und wir haben uns von Anfang an sehr wohl gefühlt in diesem kleinen Hotel. Die Zimmer sind für New Yorker Verhältnisse sehr geräumig und es hat an nichts gefehlt. Sehr sauber und auch das Badezimmer mit Dusche in sehr gutem Zustand. Das Hotel liegt direkt an der Restaurant-Straße und nur 5-Minuten Fußweg vom Time Square entfernt. 15 Minuten fussläufig zum Rockefeller und 10 Minuten zur nächsten Metro-Station. Top Lage also. Der Lautstärkepegel war für uns sehr erträglich, man ist halt mittendrin und kann keine 100%-schalldichten Wände erwarten. Das Frühstück beinhaltet Kaffee, Tee - Kakao bei Bedarf. Bagels, Toast, Croissants und Nutella, Marmelade. Joghurts waren auch da. Wer Lust auf Käse und Wurst hat, darf das gerne mitbringen. Abends kann man den Tag bei einem Bier oder Cocktail im angeschlossenen Restaurant ausklingen lassen. Bei Bedarf gibt es dort auch leckeres Abendessen. Für uns steht fest - sollten wir wieder mal einen Besuch in NYC planen, wird das French Quarter unsere erste Wahl sein. Vielen Dank Lea & Team - wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt.

title: Excellent location, loads of character, excellent staff
text:
We stayed 3 nights and would definitely return.  The staff were excellent and seemed genuinely friendly and helpful.

The location is excellent - just a couple blocks from Times Square, and 4 blocks north of the metro station on 42nd.  We ate dinner at two of the restaurants there on Restaurant Row and were happy with both meals.

The rooms are comfortable, large bathroom and shower, and the place has lots of character.  Breakfast is served on the mezzanine level with a translucent roof, so it is bright with lots of plants.  Lots of choices: pastries, muffins, croissants, hard boiled eggs, juice, yogurt, cereals.  The room had a fridge, and a cooktop (which we didn't use).

title: Fantastic place to stay
text:
Stayed for 6 nights to see New York. Very well located, right by Times Square, lovely room (we had the two bedroom apartment) and very friendly helpful staff. 
In spite of location, quiet at night and fantastic air conditioning and Wifi throughout.
Highly recommend

title: Simply delightful!
text:
This could quite possibly be one of the quaintest hotels I’ve stayed in. We arrived on the 4th July for one night after a flight mix up and our original hotel couldn’t accommodate us-I’m so glad they couldn’t!
The prettily decorated (French themed) room with kitchenette was perfect-comfy beds, plenty seating, comfy cushions, good air con and a shower big enough to have a party in. The towels were fresh and not worn thin.
Complimentary self serve breakfast was provided and fitted the bill.
The hotel is nearby Times Square and a short walk from several restaurants although I’d highly recommend Bourbon Street, attached to the hotel.
All the staff we met were friendly, helpful and polite.
I’d have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel and I hope we can return at some point.

title: NYC... dieci anni dopo
text:
Dopo 10 anni ritorno a New York e la trovo ancora più affascinante, più stravagante e più bella. NYC resta nel cuore... almeno per me è così! Parliamo ora del French Quarters. Eravamo in 4 e avevamo la suite con due camere da letto, bagno, living con divano letto e terrazzino (piuttosto grande). La nostra suite appartamento era all’ultimo piano, il quinto, e siamo stati benissimo! Aria condizionata, buona insonorizzazione (i rumori della strada con le finestre chiuse si sentivano in lontananza), arredata con gusto, pulizia ok, servizio cambio biancheria quotidiano. Molto buona la colazione servita dalle 8 alle 10, forse solo un po’ ripetitiva.
L’albergo si trova a pochi minuti a piedi da Times Square e ha un pub molto buono che consiglio di provare, il Bourbon Street. Accanto al French Quarters innumerevoli locali per mangiare. Consiglio vivamente il French Quarters per un soggiorno a NYC!

title: Fun
text: The French Quarters in is fabulous! I would be sad if a room wasn't available next trip. The ambiance is very New Orleans w a touch of Paris. Staff is uniquely friendly and generous with their assistance.  This is a must stay experience minutes from Time Square, Hell's kitchen and C Park.

title: New Favorite place to stay!
text: We recently stayed for several days with our two grandsons and absolutely loved this property!  The room was so charming, the property was in top-notch condition, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The location was perfect for us as it was very close to Times Square.  The price was very reasonable and the fact that it included breakfast was an extra bonus.  Kudos to management!

title: Wonderful Staff, Great Location
text: We stayed 2 nights and were very pleased. This hotel is in an excellent location with a lot of good restaurants just outside the front door and only a 5-10  minute walk to times square. The staff and management were very friendly and accommodating. We thought the breakfast was better than most and they even provided us with gluten free options that were necessary. We stayed in a king suite. The room was large and clean and updated.

title: Great place to stay in New York
text: Great position ,so many restaurants close by with The Bourbon Street bar and restaurant below. We had a king room which had a good sized lounge and kitchenette. The apartment was kept very clean and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. One thing we liked that they were not mean with the coffee pods like most hotels.

title: Definitely recommend
text: I just stayed here for a week. I highly recommend and would definitely stay there again. When you arrive you are welcomed with a hand written note. I stayed in the 2 bedroom suite and it was great. I especially loved the balcony and sitting outside for breakfast and at night. The staff is fabulous. More than willing to help with anything you need from directions, suggestions, needing anything for the room from extra waters or coffees, (they even have umbrellas in the room for your use) etc. They service a great breakfast from bagels and croissants from a local bakery, yogurt, cereals, oatmeal, fruit, juices, coffee, etc. The hotel is also located in a great neighborhood on restaurant row with lots of places to eat (definitely try Barbetta), a few blocks from the subway, 1 block from Times Square, right by all the theaters, etc.

title: Very Good
text: Located about 10 mins from Times Square in restaurant area. Very friendly, helpful and efficient staff. Older style hotel and our room was a bit cramped and a bit noisy. Continental breakfast was included, which was a bonus. Separate bar and grill at ground level for other food

title: A Little Bit of New Orleans in NYC
text:
TFQ is a charming boutique hotel in a terrific location near Broadway.  We had a luxury 2 bedroom suite with a balcony.  The accommodations are lovely, and the staff is gracious.

I would give this hotel an "excellent" except that it's not for everyone.  If you prefer the minimalist contemporary hotel feel, there are better NYC locations for you.  While TFC is clean, comfortable and has excellent amenities, it has an "old world" decor which is not everyone's thing.  And, there is one elevator that's on the slow side.

If your book through booking.com as we did, you may want to confirm directly with the hotel if you have any special requests.

Would definitely stay again!

title: Very good choice
text:
If you prefer a small, quaint boutique hotel when you travel, this is a terrific choice. We were able to easily walk to the theatre or to the subway and packed in a lot of sightseeing in 3 days/4 nights. The very quiet, clean 
room with two double beds was roomy with comfortable beds and we slept well. The solarium where we had a great continental breakfast was amazing and very reminiscent of New Orleans. All of the staff were friendly, welcoming and accommodating. I would not hesitate to recommend or to stay again. Thanks for a great stay. You’re doing an amazing job!

title: Excellent hotel!
text: Perfect hotel in an good neighborhood with fantastic management (Eric was very helpful with any questions I had)! Definitely will stay here again on my next business trip. Will also recommend to my friends to consider this hotel on their next trip.

title: Hidden gem
text: I just returned home from NYC and this time we stayed at the French Quarter. Great location in Hell’s Kitchen/Time’s Square/Theatre district.  Lots of great restaurants near by.  Priced right with kitchenette and complimentary breakfast. We had 4 adult women with two double beds but it worked out great. We stayed on the 2nd floor and it was quiet. Will definitely will stay there again.

title: COMODIDAD, UBICACION Y DESAYUNO
text:
A pesar de no ser un hotel, como si lo fuera, tiene un estándar de calidad mas alto que algunos hoteles.
El personal es muy amable y pendiente de poder echar una mano.
Las habitaciones son amplias, limpias y con un pequeño office por si quieres hacerte o guardar comida. Las camas son grandes y cómodas. Todo los días nos hacían habitación y baño y se no cambiaban las toallas. 
En cuanto al desayuno, en nuestro caso lo llevábamos incluido, es fantástico. Tiene bastante variedad y muy buena calidad, eso sí, todo a base de dulce, pero aún así muy bueno y eso que yo prefiero desayunar algo salado.
La única pega, los aires acondicionados tanto el de la habitación como los que hay fuera del hotel son bastante ruidosos. Nosotros dormíamos sin aire por lo que el nuestro no nos molestaba y el de fuera con el cansancio que arrastrábamos tampoco es impedimento para dormir
En resumen, una gran opción por calidad, comodidad, limpieza, desayuno y personal.
El precio en la media de Nueva York pero con mucha mas calidad que la media. Recomendable al 100% si quieres estar junto a Time Square.

title: TOLLES HOTELL IN SUPER LAGE
text:
Für unseren 1 wöchigen Aufenthalt in NYC haben wir uns das French Quarters Hotel in NYC ausgesucht. 
Das Personal hat frisch übernommen und ist sehr freundlich. Unser Zimmer im 5. Stock inklusive Wohnzimmer war sehr sauber und schön eingerichtet. Es gab einen Kühlschrank, Kochmöglichkeiten und eine Kaffeemaschiene.
Die Lage in Hells Kitchen ca. 1.5 Blocks vom Times Square ist vergleichsweise ruhig aber zentral gelegen.
JEDER ZEIT WIEDER

title: Ótimo hotel
text: O hotel é muito agradável e bem localizado, com ótimos restaurantes no mesmo quarteirão, perto da Times Square, perto de estação de metrô. O pessoal do hotel é ótimo. Lemos que algumas pessoas se incomodaram com o barulho do bar que fica embaixo do hotel dependendo do quarto em que se hospedaram, como o que ficamos mesmo, mas isso não foi um problema para nós. Foi uma boa experiência e repetiremos quando voltarmos para NY.

title: Awesomely wonderful hotel!
text: Location is perfect. I can see Time Square from my window in 306 but what really sets them apart is the superb service! Moad, Collin, and Logan are the best hosts you could ever have. They are kind, helpful, and delightful. I stayed 12 nights and didn't want to leave. It was just like a family owned hotel in the Latin Quarter of Paris but with better service!

title: We prolonge en famille
text:
Nous avions un petit appartement avec deux chambres, ce qui est assez rare et appréciable à NYC (souvent chambres quadruples uniquement ou séparées). 
Terrasse, Appartement situé au dernier étage : gros bémol pour le bruit, on entend les chauffages/climatiseurs sans cesse qui créent un bruit de fond permanent 
Le petit déjeuner inclus dans le prix est de bonne qualité : du choix, bon rien à redire! 
La propreté est au rdv dans la chambre : linge de toilettes draps et ménage
Bémol sur la douche qui n a pas de pommeau, seulement du plafond et pression légère 
La localisation est bien : pas mal de restos, proche Times Square et métros à proximité 
En synthèse pas si mal pour NYC qui reste une ville hors de prix avec des services moyens souvent

title: A little oasis one block from Times Squate
text: Stayed in the attached building upon our 10:45 a.m. arrival B.C. it was available.  It did not disappoint.  It was a larger nicely appointed and quiet even as it overlooked 46th street.  The staff was very congenial (shout out to Michael at the front desk who happily carried my suitcase both up and down for me).  If stairs are an issue maybe mention when phoning to book to see what they can offer you.  Overall the staff were v hospitable and helpful.

title: Charmant mais extrêmement Bruyant !
text:
Si vous n'êtes pas noctambule, fuyez cet hôtel au premier abord vraiment charmant !

 Points positifs 
· Le style / La déco 
· Les équipements (kitchenette, machine à café...) 
· et la situation/emplacement de l'hôtel sont très bien

 Points négatifs 
· La literie est vrai très molle, 
· mais la vraie problématique pour nous a été qu'il n'y a aucune insonorisation ! Nous avions la chambre 105 et nous avions l'avions l'impression d'avoir les enceintes du bar dans notre lit avec la musique à fond !! Le son était tellement fort que les basse se diffusaient dans notre matelas ! Et bien que la musique diffusée était sympa, il nous a était impossible de fermer l'œil avant très tard (ou tôt ce matin)

title: Character, location, but...
text:
Nice little place. Quaint rooms. Well located on Restaurant Row, five minute walk from Times Square and from four subways that will cover most of Manhattan with changes.

Negatives are tight small staircase, a breakfast that, while a nice gesture, just doesn’t cut it. A bathroom with problematic plumbing.

Pricing is about the same as a a 3 to 3.5 chain hotel, which would be a better option if you couldn’t deal with the negatives.

We could, so were quite happy with stay.

We had a front room in the adjacent townhouse, so only metres away from the bar attached to the hotel - we experienced no noise issues that some have referred to. Some noise from the street but that’s what you get for the location.

Would probably return.

title: Very nice stay
text: We only stayed one night, but we were pleased with everything! The room was very clean and provided plenty of space for us. We were given a discount when we called and booked directly AND we received a free upgrade to a King room when we checked in. Emily and Monica were so personable and helpful! We arrived early so they held our bags and called us when the room was ready. They also held our bags after we checked out since our flight was much later in the evening. The continental breakfast was nice and convenient to get our day started! The going gentleman that worked the breakfast was very kind, as well. Plenty of smiles from this staff! :-) The hotel is close to good food, multiple theatres, subway station, shopping and Times Square! You can’t go staying in cute, quaint, hidden gem.

title: Great stay in the Big Apple
text:
Great first impressions, arrived slightly earlier than the normal check in time. The kind receptionist went straight away to check if our room was available and to our luck it was. Very grateful after a long flight from the UK. 

Location: Fantastic location, within a 5 minute walk to Times Square. If using the Hop on Hop off Bus, the stop is not far from the hotel at all. 

Facilities: Room was on the small side (but not unusual for New York) lovely comfortable bed. Bathroom was good nice large shower, although the hot water was a little slow to come through. The room also had a small kitchenette with coffee machine and a fridge. Some previous reviews mentioned they could ear noise from the street, don't get me wrong you can hear it but it certainly didn't keep us awake at night.

Breakfast: simple but effective, continental breakfast compromising of bagels, toast, yoghurts, pastries etc. Started the day right. 

Overall this was a great hotel and would recommend it to anyone looking for a decent hotel in the city. Would stay here again.

title: Great place to stay
text:
We had a plesant stay at French Q. The place is near Time S in the middle of everything. 
The room we had did serve us more then well even that we didn’t really learned how the TV controll worked... but that was just a minor thing.
Breakfast at FQ was good and the personell was Nice and helpfull.
We will for sure visit the place again.

title: Love this place !!
text:
A lot of reasons why I love this hotel, I think mainly because it’s so different to standard hotels in New York. 
Our room was in the building next door on the first floor, great view from the windows which is always a bonus. Amazing decorated and the bathroom is out of this world, great toiletry set they use;a very decent well known brand which doesn’t make your skin dry like other hotel products provided. 
The gent that helped out room was so friendly and helpful, unfortunately I didn’t catch his name but he went the extra mile to carry up out cases(which was very heavy)bless him. Even bringing up a free bottle of Prosecco after knowing my partner was proposing to me. 
Location is everything for this hotel !! So many good restaurants near by, at least 20 on the road so you don’t have to travel far :) time square is practically at the end of the road if you turn right out the hotel :) 
Of course I would never drop the star rating for this hotel as I loved it ... but I would say breakfast could be improved slightly, it would be nice if there was a hot food option even if there was an extra charge I would-happily pay. 
But over all thank you for the amazing stay will be returning next time

title: Wonderful experience!
text: Just stayed here and all 5 of us were delighted with the accommodations! The staff was so helpful - from the front desk to the staff at the continental breakfast. The room was spacious and well stocked with nice quality items. The location is great... next door to Restaurant Row and Broadway. We'll be returning when we visit NY again!

title: Amazing
text: From start to finish at JFK airport now as I wrote this review. The French Quarters hotel is simply amazing. Amazing location. Amazing room and great bathroom.  Staff very friendly and a special mention to Kevin at breakfast. He was very helpful and so polite. We will most certainly return to New York and region this hotel. Fridge had water. Coffee machine in room. Two big double beds. Quiet outlook to the back of the hotel. Right on 46tg street heart of Times Square. Great tv too. bar attached to hotel is great. Again friendly staff. Breakfast is continental but they have fruit, great huge yogurts and bagels with spreads, jam etc. Coffee and Tropicana juice. Can't say enough how good this hotel is. We as a couple really enjoyed it and the beds are so comfy. If you go to New York book this hotel you won't be disappointed. Thanks very much for a great holiday

title: Hidden Gem - Will be back
text: Part of me is hesitant to give a good review - as I don't want the word to get out. But I loved this hotel!  Larger than any other hotel I've been in in NY, and close to everything. It has New Orleans charm, with NY sophistication. I arrived early and let me check in early. Monica was super helpful. I will be back.

title: Mums 60th
text:
Location location! You arrive so centrally in nyc!! Right off Times Square and bars and eateries all around!   We managed to use air train  and E subway towards world trade centre, got off and walked down 4 streets from 50th station to apartments! 

You are  faced with bourbon bar and grills elaborate Mardi Gras theme -banners, tinsel, beads, tassels.  You enter  a narrow lobby is all very off putting initially.. 

Staff friendly 

Room 306 you go out reception into building next door. 

A  HUGE double double room. Up one external flight of stairs and two very narrow and steep flights of stairs, no lift in this particular building.

Huge room but space narrow between first bed and wall did catch our lower legs a few times 

Comfy bed 
storage 
free safe
fridge
coffee machine
Complimentary Prosecco 
Clean 

Breakfast included- continental - sugary cereals, skin on fruit, yoghurts, bagels, breads , pastries, coffee , tea, fresh orange and water. 

Huge beautiful shower room with l’occotaine toiletries 

Hot shower (eventually, took a while to run) 

 Slow WiFi that disconnects regularly 

Air-con variable 

Two separate electric heaters, but don’t use them at same time as trips the electric 
We had 2x power shorts / trips in our 5nights 

Take ear plugs! It’s New York and Street noise is super loud! We heard every car that past the window as there was a man hole or drain type cover they clunked  over. Lorry’s/truck woke me up first night for over an hour engine running directly below the room. Street Noise not from bourbon-  but SWING 46 and mamas piano bar across the street 

Would go back

title: Comfortable, good value, boutique hotel in great location
text: I stayed here with my mum and teenage daughter for our girls' trip to NYC. I liked that it was a small, boutique hotel surrounded by bars and restaurants so we didn't have to venture out too far after a long day out sightseeing and shopping. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom large, nice decor. We felt very safe. The hotel served a continental breakfast and had a coffee maker in the room. The kitchenette didn't have any utensils so I get the impression that it's just there for coffee and a fridge which suited us perfectly. I would have liked a kettle but made do by putting my tea bags in the coffee pouch on the coffee maker. Complimentary coffee and milk was provided. Would definitely stay again in I come back to New York.

title: Nice hotel - staff needs training
text:
We just stayed for 6 nights in the hotel and it was nice hotel as such. Rooms were big enough and beds comfortable. Rooms facing the street had nice view but were very noisy. Staff changed our room after 3 nights to one facing back and that was very nice! 

 Breakfast was modest but ok. 

BUT... the staff! Come on! In this small place it should not be a burden to be nice and at least pretend you are interested how your guests are doing, but no! As we checked out today the young lady didn’t even look at us behind the desk screen, did not ask how the stay was, welcome us again. NOTHING! We tried to ask if we were ok to leave but she did not hear us. We left. And most likely will not return. Sorry for otherwise nice place, but in this city you have options with nice and warm service!

title: Enjoyed our stay
text: Great location, and friendly staff. The breakfast was decent, could’ve been better. The rooms had an oldish-vibe to them, but we enjoyed that and they were always very clean. All in all we enjoyed our stay.

title: Great location & Great Service
text:
We had a wonderful experience at the property.  The entire staff was focused on making our stay enjoyable. One example was when a construction crew was using  a jack hammer in the street in front of our room.  The on-duty manager asked the workman to stop many times.  When they did not, he arranged to have us sleep in a room away from the noise AND keep our current room!

This is quaint property is on a block with many small amazing restaurants and bars. Yet, the area is a 5 minute walk to Times Square and the Theater District.  

This is a charming place to stay in NYC.

title: The Place Not to Stay
text: This was a trip with 4 other people, 6 total, 3 rooms. We arrived to find that our room was not only nowhere near the others, but not really in the same building. We had to go outside, down a fairly steep set of stairs, make a U turn up a steeper flight of stairs, open a door into a vestibule, unlock another door and enter. Proceed down a narrow hall, start up a very narrow staircase, another U turn to the top and our room was at the end on the right. We were 2 ladies in our seventies and did not appreciate this. Once inside, the room was very small, had only 1 chair, and the windows were extremely drafty. Breezy actually. The curtains on one did not meet. We finally overlapped them and pushed the chair against them to keep the bottom half closed.  The window 6" from my bed not only had curtains that did not meet, both ends were hanging off the rod and there was no way to reattach them. There was very little room between walls and bed. The bathroom was tiny but okay how mush time does one spend in the bathroom. It took 5 minutes minimum to get hot water, the heat was from a space heater. One had to be very careful not to get burned (not much room to maneuver. The toilet paper holder was on the wall across from the toilet and I, who am fairly tall, had trouble reaching it. My friend felt as though she would fall off trying to reach. Back to the stairs-no elevator. We washed up and retraced our steps to meet our friends. We stopped at the desk to voice all our concerns and was told by the gal at the desk that there was nothing she could do. We told her we had booked our rooms at the time our friends had and expected to be at least in the same building and   were told we should have called ahead to check (we have NEVER had to do this before, anywhere). She told us we could be moved down to the first floor. This would have been inside the @ door entry. No one else would be there as I believe that was the only room there as ours was on the second floor. She was no help. Surprising as the young man we spoke to Upon our arrival was wonderful. We had arrived early, but stopped to let them know we were in NY and drop our luggage  with part of our party who had arrived the night before. So off we go for the day. Return to go to our room (which we had not yet seen) and found this mess. So we prepared for bed and found the dead lock on the door could not be locked. It didn't even match up with the hole, I don't believe there was a plate. There was a chain which was not very reassuring. Then we saw our friends room. One couple had been upgraded to a suite, the other room was wonderful and we were not even in the same building! No one on duty there so if something happened we would have delayed help. I would recommend if you stay here you call and ask lots of questions about where you are staying.The main part of the French Quarter was quite quaint and charming, request that you stay there. I do want to congratulate the young man in charge of breakfast in the morning. He was great. Very personable,helpful and went out of his way to meet your needs. Thank you!

title: nice
text: A great little hotel with a bar underneath ( some rooms can hear). The street it is on has great restaurants with a ton of choices to pick from.   The hotel itself is great if you are going to see a show you can walk

title: Unexpected Adventure
text:
Due to an incoming snow storm, we booked The French Quarters Guest Apartments on Martin Luther King Weekend. Turns out, it didn’t snow but we had a great time!

The room was a good size in a restored brownstone. It felt like we were staying in New Orleans. Storage is limited in the rooms but we were comfortable. My daughter and I felt like we had our own apartment in midtown. As I live an hour from the city, I know how much it costs to stay in town. This is located right on Restaurant Row with tons of choices for your evening meal. A continental breakfast is included in the room rate. Le Rivage and The Hour Glass Tavern provided prix fixe meals for under 35.00 per person. 

If you are looking for a sleek hotel with a gym, this is not your place. If you are looking for a place to call home in midtown, we were able to get a decent rate and I would stay there again.  We were up on the third floor which is a walk up, but we did not have any street noise to contend with. Shows are all within a few blocks as well!

Bravo to the staff at The French Guest Quarters!

title: good location some drawbacks
text: 2nd time here, same room, not as happy as before. Great location, pub next door, handy for places to eat, short walk, 5 minutes to Times Square. However, we had 4 nights, one was a Tuesday, there was an event !! with VERY loud music, which went on to 2.30 am, even with earplugs in, the base was still so loud. Also, breakfast was poor, the poor guy, more often than not on his own, couldn't seem to keep up. Running out of juice, milk, cereal, pastries, supplying mugs / plates etc. Also, the rooms are so dark, incl the bathroom, the shower cubicle really needing a better clean. Storage space is so limited, they need to get rid of the comfy chair and install a set of drawers.  Sorry to give a poor review, but time to improve.

title: One night in NYC
text:
We chose this property on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews.  We were only going to be in New York for one night, and in fact were an hour and a half later than expected owing to flight delay. Our welcome at 2:45 am for two lady travellers (one senior) was not as warm as we'd hoped and we were initially led to believe by the receptionist that he was not aware of a late check-in (even though the hotel had emailed me in advance to request flight details which I had provided and would have alerted them to the late flight if not the delay).  However he located our details pretty quickly so our panic at having lost the room was mitigated (and unnecessary.)
Apart from the welcome, we thought the room was lovely and had a great bathroom.  Breakfast was varied and the guy serving in the breakfast area was very warm and friendly as was the lady on reception at check out.  Well located to Times Square and good value although the over bar room noise (which we knew to expect) lived up to the hype and would have kept us awake had we not been so tired!

title: Très bien
text:
Nous avons passé un très bon séjour dans cet appart/hôtel très proche de Time square.
Le personnel est discret et accueillant , les chambres sont spacieuses ... 
le général manager à l’écoute, disponible et super serviable (comme beaucoup de New-Yorkais) ... un endroit dans lequel je reviendrais sans problème.
Parfaitement situé pour visiter Manhattan et ses environs.
Je vous le recommande

title: We loved are stay!
text: Clean and beautiful rooms and very nice and friendly people working there. We had a great time staying there, with quick assess to Times Square, great view and the lovely restraint attached for quick eating. We loved are trip and have NO complaints:)

title: Best place to stay in new york
text:
Forget the swanky hotels with zero service or the budget hotels where walking sideways like a crab  is the only way to get into bed (  is the norm) this place has thought of everything. 
A beautiful classy building a stones throw from Times Square with breakfast included, coffee machine in room and fab spacious bathrooms with top notch products.
The staff are all awesome- Colin,  the fabulous Monica, knowledgable Michael, John and of course, the best breakfast manager Kevin, who is so helpful.
This place, right down to the wonderful maids who change white fluffy towels and the crispest bedding every day, complete the package.
We dined at Carmines, Red Lobster,Westway diner theBourbon bar next door  to name a few, all lovely. The Rockefeller tree lights, fifth avenue and the Saks Xmas pageant, central library and the gorgeous station all impressed. Central Park was amazing.
Second visit and there’s still so much to see. At this time of year it isn’t cheap but so worth it.
If you want a little luxury, stay in the suites with terraces and patios, the views are amazing. Thankyou so much to all the staff for making it such a fabulous stay.
Let’s just hope we can still get a booking next year- we all slept like babies in their oh so comfy beds
Thanks especially to Monica- the epitome of great service- nothing is too much trouble

title: Fantastic!!!
text:
I cannot recommend this “hotel” more! I was visiting NYC at Christmas for the first time and, as usual, was looking for accommodations that were a little “funky - I’m not a big fan of generic hotels.
I decided on The French Quarters and I could not have been happier with my decision. As soon as I arrived, I knew I was in the right spot. 
The location is perfect - a couple of blocks from Times Square, and located on “Restaurant Row”. The street is lined with a variety of restaurants and bars that are steps from the front door. Going to a Broadway show? Theatres are about 3-4 minutes away.
My room was exactly what I wanted - cozy, clean, exposed brick, high ceilings, and a super comfy bed.
Breakfast in the morning(served in the adjacent Bourbon Street Bar) had everything I needed. Kevin was a great host.
