Lastly, the entire staff was were super friendly, welcoming, and ready to help with whatever I needed. They even went the extra mile to help me out on my last day in town with a small problem I had. I can’t thank them enough!
Do yourself a favour, book a room here, settle in, open the front door and step out into a fabulous New York Experience!

Mick

title: We loved the French Quarters Guesthouse  New York
text: We really enjoyed our stay here. The rooms are lovely with a restaurant  and bar that serves great meals. Monica, Michael and Kevin were very helpful indeed. We will certainly stay here again. Five star rating.

title: Loving this place!
text: We are here for 2 nights to see the city at Christmas time, this place is very quaint, our room is immaculate, with a mini kitchen with Keurig pot and  coffee mugs. Spacious bathroom with large shower and  bench, high end Loccitane toiletries, comfy beds, and friendly staff. This is on restaurant row and is surrounded by great places to eat. Becco which is owned by Lydia Bastianich is right across the street. You can catch a cab right in front. Perfectly situated with a mile of rockafeller center, Central Park, China town, Little Italy, theatre district.....free continental breakfast awaits us. Great place to stay.

title: Simplesmente perfeito!
text:
A melhor cama que eu já dormi na vida! O hotel é perto de tudo, ao lado da Times Square e ao mesmo tempo, possui uma tranquilidade impar em uma rua charmosa. Os funcionários são extremamente atenciosos, sempre prontos a ajudar e tornar sua experiência como hóspede ainda melhor.

O café da manhã é uma delícia e a atmosfera do hotel é incrível. Realmente me faltam palavras pra descrever à altura. 

Shampoo, sabonete, condicionador e creme são Loccitane, um mimo a parte.

Certamente será meu destino quando retornar para NYC!

title: Great Room in the Perfect Location
text: The room was beautiful, roomy and had a small kitchenette.  We were withing walking distance of everything.  We highly recommend the French Quarter Guest Apartments and will definitely stay there again the next time we visit NYC.

title: Brilliant stay!!
text: This hotel is perfect, great location and the staff are really helpful. The bar next door is great and the food and drink have a good selection. Will definitely stay here again.  We stayed in the guest house next door and the room was very clean with a very comfy bed.

title: Localização muito boa, apenas o café poderia melhorar um pouco
text:
O Hotel tem uma localização excelente, próximo a Times Square, mas longe o suficiente da confusão para você conseguir ficar numa rua relativamente sossegada. Achei isso o principal ponto a favor do hotel.

As ruas do entorno, contudo, são um pouco sujas, mas é uma característica daquela região e em nada desabona o hotel. É uma escolha a ser feita: conseguir visitar a maioria dos pontos turísticos a pé ou ficar em um lugar mais agradável.

O quarto que ocupei com meu marido era ótimo, com um tamanho bom e o banheiro inteiro reformado. Gostei muito da estrutura.

O café da manhã era bom, mas um pouco restrito. A impressão que tive era que tudo era comprado em uma padaria e nada é feito ali. Eu não achei ruim, mas meu marido reclamou que não havia opções de salgado (queijo, presunto, bacon ou ovos) apenas pão com manteiga e muitos doces (brioches e outros). Pessoalmente não achei ruim, mas vale alertar. Porém nada que desabone o hotel.

Seguramente ficaria de volta.

title: Great, small hotel
text: I stayed here for 10 nights on my own and loved it.  The room was small but clean and comfortable (there is a weird kitchenette that has a stovetop but no kettle, crockery, cutlery, pots, pans or washing up materials).  They would be best to either equip this as a proper kitchenette or remove it and put in more storage as the wardrobe is tiny.  Regardless of this, the room really was good.  The noise wasn’t as bad as I was expecting (I was on the third floor in a street front room) - just take ear plugs and you’ll be fine.  The location is great - while Times Square/Midtown is the nicest area in Manhattan, it is a great point to explore the whole city.  I walked everywhere from the hotel (Brooklyn, Harlem and everywhere in between) so it was nice to have that freedom.  I wasn’t too fussed on the breakfast - I’m more of a fruit salad person, but there was certainly plenty to chose from.  The staff were really helpful and were able to organise a car to take me to the airport at the end of my stay.  There is a laundry right around the corner if you need one.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Atmospheric and local to times square
text: This hotel was amazing! 5mins walk from central time square and even though we were above the bar you couldn’t hear the music as loud as I thought you would. The rooms were spotless and the hotel had thought of literally everything from coffee machine in room to posting a daily news sheet under the door each morning. Breakfast was all inclusive and was simple but delightful with fresh fruit, bagels, pastries and cereal- even hotel drinks available for takeout. Staff were really helpful and even looked after our cases on the last day after check out so we could explore one last time. Would recommend and will be back!

title: A nice place to stay
text: Been to the city many times and each time I worry about what the hotel will be like. This place did not disappoint! Perfect location to what we needed for our weekend stay to see Harry Potter. I was also worried because the room was accidentally booked with only a double but it was big enough for me and my daughter. It was cozy and clean and the bathroom shower was a good size. The only downside was there was a bar under our room and the music was loud but after while you eventually can drown it out. The staff was very friendly and would definitely recommend staying.

title: Maravillosa experiencia
text: Viaje con mi familia quedamos encantados con el lugar. El personal muy agradable, las instalaciones muy bonitas, el desayuno abundante y variado, la limpieza de la habitación impecable, ubicación perfecta al lado de Times Square. Tiene una pequeña cocina con cafetera y muchas cápsulas de café y té para cuando te apetezca. La decoración muy bonita, así como la calidad de sábanas y toallas. Traían el periódico diariamente a la habitación. Cuenta con Wifi.

title: Fantastic hotel with best location
text: A fantastic hotel with "family" style. Located in Hells Kitchen with many excellent restaurants in the near.Great rooms with lovely beds.Fridge and coffe maschine in the room. The staff are very friendly and can always give assist if needed.Daily paper about weather forecast and what will happen in NY. Also Daily NY post in front of the door.We wil be back

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: We stayed for 4 nights in a standard double double room. Our room was located in the adjoining terrace and was on the 3rd floor. The steps are very steep and there are no lifts in the terrace, this wasn't a problem for us but could be for some people. They did help get your luggage up and down which was a huge help. The complimentary breakfast was excellent and a great start to the day. The hotel is close to public transportation, an easy 5min walk to Times Square and Theater District and has some lovely restaurants close by. We really enjoyed our stay :)

title: WOW-Times Square/NYC best hidden gem!!
text: We cannot say enough good things about French Quarters Guest Apartments! We were a quick 3 minute walk to the center of Time Square. The staff are so friendly and helpful and the rooms are very clean, comfortable and quite. The best pizza NYC has to offer is the Patzeria which on your walk to Time Square. The atmosphere and location cannot be beat!!

title: Terrific base in New York City
text: We stayed here for 5 nights in a one bedroom suite and really enjoyed our stay.  French Quarters is ideally situated on Restaurant Row less than a 10 minute walk from Times Square.   Reception staff were lovely and always willing to help with any questions we had.  Our suite was very comfortable with a King bedroom, separate sitting area, small kitchenette and very nice bathroom.  The bed was very comfortable but could do with some new pillows.  The bathroom towels were nice and fluffy which is always a good thing.  The suite was at the rear of the property on the 3rd floor which meant it was reasonably quiet, unusual for NYC!.  A continental breakfast was included, nothing fancy but very adequate.   We thought French Quarters was an ideal base from which to explore all that NYC has to offer and would recommend it and stay there again next time we're in town.

title: Great stay!
text: We stayed for a long weekend in the room over the bar. The bar noise was not an issue for us-we really only heard it on Friday night, but we brought ear plugs and that took care of it. Breakfast was great, as were all of the staff we encountered. Everyone was extremely friendly and the location of the hotel was perfect. It was a five minute walk to Times Square and many theatres, and it’s on restaurant row surrounded by tons of great food. We will definitely be staying here again!

title: Anniversary visit to the city...57th!
text: We know the city very well...including the hotels.  Finding the French Quarter "fit" our desire for something different/special.  We found it!  Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Room was just delightful/comfortable and super clean. Breakfast was just right  Location was perfect for both dining, walking and the theatre....... and the price was really reasonable!  The French Quarter will be our destination of choice on all future visits to the city.

title: Anniversary
text:
Really comfortable room.
The buffet breakfast is served above the hotels adjoining bar and grill. A visit to which I would advise.
Umbrellas were left out when the rain came which was a nice touch.
Eavh morning a note was pushed under our door with weather predictions for the day, local attraction news and other useful notes.

Great central area close to Broadway, tubes theatres and restaurants.

Great atmospheric guest house in the theatre district.

title: A maior surpresa de toda a viagem
text:
O Hotel é maravilhoso, muito bonito, limpo, o atendimento do staff é impecável - muito educados, solícitos, o dono do hotel veio nos receber quando chegamos -, o quarto é muito espaçoso, bem funcional e o ponto alto é a sua localização, a apenas 5 minutos andando da Times Square e ao lado de diversas estações de metro.

Chegamos no hotel antes do horário de check in, mas mesmo assim nosso quarto já estava pronto (eu havia trocado alguns emails com eles e me falaram que iriam tentar, mas não era certo), fomos muito bem recebidos e o quarto foi uma grata surpresa. Os hotéis em NY tem fama de terem quartos minúsculos, mas o quarto que ficamos (mais barato, sobre o bar) era enorme, o banheiro muito bom, tudo impecável. Do quarto conseguíamos ouvir o barulho vindo do bar na sexta e no sábado, mas um som bem abafado que não atrapalhou em nada o sono, para não ter este problema reserve um quarto que não seja sobre o bar, mas para mim não incomodou nem um pouco.

Recomendo esse hotel e com certeza ficarei novamente nele quando voltar a NY.

title: Great Place to Stay!
text:
We choose this hotel for its location, but what a surprise!. This friendly little hotel with both rooms and apartments was good on every level, location in/ near many restaurants and things to visit. 

We also used the bar/grill next door for evening meals. I will be staying here when I next visit New York.

title: Väldigt bra boende!
text: Detta boende var över all förväntan. Ett stort plus var frukosten som ingick i priset. Läget kunde inte ha varit bättre! Det enda negativa med boendet var att det var väldig fuktig luft inne på hotellrummet. Detta besvärade oss inte under vistelsen men man kunde känna det på lukten i kläderna då vi kom hem. Tveka dock inte på att boka detta ställe, ni kommer inte att ångra er.

title: Excelente por ubicación, servicio y precio!!
text:
Hola , viajamos en pareja mi esposo y yo, la verdad no pudimos haber encontrado mejor lugar por la ubicación, llegas a todos los principales puntos turísticos caminando como al times square o a Broadway, toda la calle esta llena de restaurantes de todo tipo y bares. Cerca de Portuary donde esta el acceso al subway y sale un bus al aeropuerto.
La habitación pequeña tiene todo lo necesario desde cafetera, minibar para guardar bebidas o alimentos,plancha,secadora de cabello, hasta un descorchador por si te compras una botellita de vino para degustar , las personas muy amables y el gerente en turno muy accesible John, nos dejo hacer late check out.
Lo recomiendo ampliamente y claro que si regresó! 

Saludos a Bulmaro el mesero que nos atendió y las camaristas que nos dejaban super limpio el cuarto!

Monica Vieyra
De Cancún, Quintana Roo. México

title: Anniversary
text: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The staff was so great, the location was perfect. The room was gorgeous. When we come back to New York, we will be staying here again. Every restaurant you can imagine with in steps of this place!!!

title: Perfect Location, Space and Comfort
text: We stayed in a 2 Bedroom (1 Bathroom) apartment on the 5th (top) floor.  Each bedroom and living area had a TV with a very good selection of Cable Channels.  The apartment fronted the street so I was concerned about noise.  Although I could hear the noise from the street it wasn't loud enough to interrupt sleep - so just perfect.  A large living area and small balcony added to the spacious feeling, and space had been something missing from most of the NYC hotels I considered.  The location is great, just a short walk to Times Square, any of the Broadway Theatres, and there are more Restaurants on the doorstep than I could have possibly imagined.  Extra touches provided included toiletries, plenty of pods for the coffee maker and there were even umbrellas! Staff were all very friendly and helpful, and the Bourbon St Bar & Grill downstairs was an  easy place to relax and have a drink or meal.  No complaints from me!

title: Great location, 2 bedroom suites were excellent
text: We (family of 4, two teenagers) stayed at French Quarters for 3 nights.  Had wanted to try this hotel even before the kids were born (more than 15 years ago).  One night in a double bedroom, then 2 nights in the 2 bedroom suite.  The hotel itself is situated very close to the theatres and excellent choice of restaurants (B side pizzeria, Pure Thai Cookhouse, Amy's bread).  The two bedroom suite was perfect for our family of 4.  It was in good shape. There was a balcony. Best of all we had two bathrooms (apparently some of the 2 BR have one bath and some have two). We could all stretch out and not be on top of each other. The two double bedroom was a tight squeeze for four of us and the floor seemed sticky and more heavily used than the the suite.  We tried the breakfast once - it was served in the restaurant, more than adequate, but nothing special. We didn't eat there the other two mornings because we had to get an early start before breakfast was served.  We will probably not go back unless we can get the 2 bedroom suite.  We interacted with 4 staff members who were all very friendly, and went out of their way to help us.

title: Only thing great about this is lication
text:
The room we had was very loud at night.  One tiny sink, no space for anything in the bathroom.  Pillows were lumpy and all bedding had a ‘wet’ feel to it.
Nothing was explained at check in; there is no real lobby.  It was expensive also.  If bathroom were bigger and the pillows were fresh; this would be an ok pla e

title: So quaint and classy and best location
text: I came to NY NY with my daughter for her 25th birthday celebration.    Mother and daughter trip      .  Hotel is in the BEST location.    Clean and comfortable.   Logan at the front desk is a sweetheart.   He was So helpful and kind.   Give this hotel a 12 star rating ( if there was such a thing).   We have three more days here and we are soooooo glad we booked this hotel to stay at.    I highly recommend it.

title: Comfortable, luxurious and central
text: I love this beautiful small hotel in the centre of Manhattan.  If you haven't read or heard about it you wouldn't find it but it is close to Times Square and is on a street with many wonderful restaurants.  Their beds are the most comfortable anywhere.  The breakfast room is delightful and well stocked to get your day off to the best start.  The staff is helpful, friendly and welcoming.  New York can be hectic and unfriendly at times.  At the French Quarters you will find a home away from home where you can truly relax and get a perfect night's sleep.   This was my third stay at this beautiful hotel and I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in NY.

title: Excellent!!
text: Our weekend in the hotel was perfect stating at French Quarters!  It was lovely and easy from check in to our beautiful room and the location couldn't be beat.  We loved our stay, the staff was warm and very helpful.  Will stay again soon!

title: Magnifica estancia
text:
Hotel situado en una calle muy tranquila muy cerca del times square. Habitaciones super limpias con una decoración al estilo francés con cama tamaño “king” y baño de en ensueño.

El desayuno muy completo y el personal super amable. El ultimo dia nos guardaron las maletas hasta la noche para poder visitar la ciudad.

Hemos tenido una estancia muy agradable. Repetiremos sin duda.

title: Ótima localização
text: O hotel é simples e bom, com uma ótima localização: próximo aos principais teatros da Broadway e do metrô. Também é bem próximo da Times Square (o que não é grande vantagem). Ficamos no quarto mais barato, em cima do bar, e apesar de ouvirmos a música do bar à noite, isso não nos incomodou. O café da manhã é simples, mas bom.

title: Hidden Gem in bustling NYC
text: Located a 5 minutes walk from Times Square and right on “Restaurant Row” this place is the perfect location to explore NYC from. Not the biggest or fanciest room, or hotel, but it was real New York, well maintained, clean, quirky and full of charm with nice little personal touches like daily news paper delivery and a daily info sheet. Attached to the hotel is an equally quirky proper New York bar and restaurant where breakfast is served. Breakfast is a relaxed comprehensive continental affair that was more than adequate. If like us, you are not into massive behemoth hotels with loads of people and massive que’s then this is the place for you .

title: Pequeño hotel de calidad en estupenda localización.
text:
Un hotel pequeño, en el centro de Manhattan. Habitación bonita, grande, y con un baño estupendo con todas las prestaciones. A destacar la ducha, muy cómoda y bien diseñada. Decoración elegante. 
Desayuno continental muy correcto, y personal amable y atento. 
La ubicación del hotel es perfecta para poder recorrer todo Manhanttan, e ideal para asistir a algún espectáculo en Broadway.

title: Excellent! Great location, friendly and helpful staff.
text:
Our room for three was relatively spacious for New York. Two Queen sized beds, a lovely bathroom with huge shower stall. Plus a bonus of a mini kitchen with hob, fridge and coffee machine. Strangely no cutlery or plates but that didn't matter to us since we didn't self cater!
Breakfast was fine - croissants, muffins, bagels, cereal, some fruit, yoghurt, juices etc and again very friendly and helpful staff.
The WiFi was a bit hit and miss when we were there but I think this was due to the thunderstorms and the staff were very apologetic.
The location was fab! Had some great meals nearby - the Bare Burger (which featured the 'Impossible Burger' that we had heard a lot about , my veggie daughters would recommend - I tried it too and agree. There is a Tapas place a few doors down that was great and a lovely Thai place on the corner of W 46th and 9th. We also tried 'Don't tell Momma''s piano bar - great fun.
The beds were comfy, the air con worked, the lovely staff offered brollies when it was wet! 
Would definitely stay here again - had previously stayed in a chain hotel nearby but much preferred this hotel.
My only word of caution is that there is a noisy bar (which looked great fun) down at the bottom - we were on the 3rd floor so it didn't bother us - but not sure what it would be like for people on the floor below..

title: Great Staff
text: the staff is easily the best staff of any hotel I have ever stayed in ! and the Hotel Itself is not bad either the rooms were a little cramped but  very clean and had the charm of the Real Narlins French quarter

title: A hidden gem in New York City.
text: Our three night stay here all we hoped for. The residence was close to many places we wanted to visit. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. The rooms were spotless and hike another review, we heard nothing during the night but slept soundly. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends and hope to visit again. Thanks for the outstanding service. You made us feel so welcomed.

title: Best hotel experience! Will come back! They deserve 10 stars
text: The room was quiet, private, and beautiful. The staff were helpful and all around wonderful to talk to. It is so close to Times Square and is literally in the best area of Manhattan. It was close to many kosher restaurants which was appealing to us.

title: Quaint
text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit which was perfect as it had a pullout sofa bed so kids didn't have to share a bed.  It's not cheap but  good option for families.  The breakfast was simple and all you needed.  They run out of food sometimes because there is only one man looking After it ..do you do have to be patient ...of don't leave breakfast to the last minute. Highly recommended.

title: Nice hotel
text: A nice gem in restaurant row near times square. While making booking check which room you are opting for, room above the bar are cheap but can be noisy. I didn't have issue with that but some people can specially if you are with children. Breakfast was OK can improve if live counter can be added. Bathrooms are awesome. One of the hotel that gives l'occitane products.

title: Love this place!
text: Such a quaint hotel. The staff are lovely and very helpful. I especially love Kevin at breakfast. The rooms are comfortable and decorated beautifully with the French toile theme. The hotel is in a great location - very central to lots of restaurants, bars and shopping. I would highly recommend The French Quarters.

title: 5 Star service
text: This is now my favorite boutique hotel in the city!  Perfect location and the customer service was over the top.  Monica and John at the front desk are fabulous. The neighborhood is outstanding.  Lots of choices for great food.

title: Superstar Service
text: What a wonderful boutique hotel centrally located to all the activities that New York has to offer. Monica at the front desk couldn’t have been nicer. I will definitely return for another great experience.

title: Extremely Noisy
text:
Never accept rooms 105-106. They are just above a disco and I couldn't sleep the whole 3 weeks I stayed. Promise the room was vibrating for hours. They should isolate better the hotel or at least don't give you those rooms.

I give them 2 stars because of the room and staff, whose were fine.

title: Horrible!!!!!
text:
Horrible experience.  A hotel where you can't sleep can't be called a hotel.

It is located above a bar, which turns into a nightclub at night, with music until the early hours of the morning. 

It's a shame, because the rooms are fine, the staff is friendly, but I strongly recommend not staying in this hotel, as you can't sleep.

title: Best Place in NYC
text: My wife and I had not visited NYC for many years. We came back for a visit when some family members came in from overseas. We decided to stay someplace new but close to Time Square. We fell in love with this place. From the moment we arrived till the moment we left we were not disappointed with our stay. The room was great, the food in the restaurant downstairs was great. I can't say enough good about our stay here. I could not imagine staying anywhere else in NYC. Do yourself a favor and book a room here you will not be disappointed.

title: What a gem
text: No faults to be found with this hotel. Fantastic location, fantastic service and fantastic rooms - loved the exposed brick! We walked to everything from here - Broadway is just around the corner as is Times Square. It is in Restaurant Row, so you are literally surrounded by great restaurants. Would definitely stay here again, loved everything about it.

title: A great little hotel yards from Times Square
text:
My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in early June. It’s a lovely hotel/guest house only one block from Times Square. Having flown into JFK we took the air train to Howard beech and then the underground to a block away from the hotel. It’s only $7.75 each.

We had a small room with the ensuite situated to the rear of the hotel. We were made aware at the time of booking about the potential noise from the bar to our room. We stayed Thursday to Monday and the only night the music was noticeable was on the Friday night, but it did not stop me sleeping.
The room was very clean with coffee machine, fridge, stove and lovely bathroom.

The continental breakfast was plentiful and the late lunch we had in the bar was very nice and well priced.

Empire states, The Rockefeller Centre, Central Park and many other places are within a 1 mile walk.
You will need a taxi or tube to get to 9/11 memorial, Statue of Liberty etc.

If you like to stay at a place with some character, with a family feel and are not bothered about a chained hotel, and do not want to pay hundreds of more dollars to be close to the centre of New York, then this is a great place to stay.

I would definitely recommend The French Quarter.

title: Two bedroom in the heart of it all
text: We loved the French Quarters guest apartments!  We booked a two bedroom suite on the 5th floor with an unbelievable balcony and spectacular views.  Very comfortable beds, truly lovely & helpful staff, and an amazing location just blocks from Times Square.  Many restaurants are just steps away.  This isn't the sort of hotel you lounge in the lobby...why waste precious NYC space on a lobby??  Our room felt like we were renting out someone’s flat, but with the bonus of great housekeeping.  I can't imagine a more authentic way to stay in NYC.

title: Great hotel!
text: Great hotel! Just a couple hundred meters from times square. Very good breakfast for the money! The staff was very good and kind. Really recommend this hotel to everyone. We stayed here 4 nights and we really enjoyed the stay.

title: Ms Sally Everlove
text: This is a great property!   The rooms are charming, the staff is extremely helpful, the breakfast is great and location is awesome.  I will always stay here when I visit New York!  The hotel is really close to time square, yet there are some great restaurants on the same street as the hotel.  Enjoy!

title: Vacation in NYC
text: French Quarters New York City was the ideal spot from which to enjoy a few days in NYC with my friends. The accommodations were lovely, clean and comfortable and service was warm and friendly. Breakfast was provided each morning - yogurt, cereals, fruit, bagels, coffee, etc.- the perfect way to start out each day. Location was ideal, just a few blocks from Times Square! Staff are happy to guide you and answer questions about how best to navigate the city. Highly recommend for a trip with friends or a romantic getaway. Enjoy!

title: Fabulous is all I can say!!!
text: This is one of my favorite places to stay.  The beds are like heaven.  Colin greeting you is priceless.  Worth it just to meet him.  It’s in the heart of everything that’s happening in NYC. It’s simply wonderful.

title: Great place to stay!
text: Spent a romantic weekend in NYC with the hubby, and couldn't have been happier staying here.  We were close to the theatre and great places to eat.  After a long day of exploring, it was so nice to come back to a comfortable and luxuriating room.  Oohh and the breakfast they provided was a perfect way to fuel up and start the day.  The staff were all super friendly, helpful, and attentive.  Will be back again!

title: Wonderful!
text: French Quarters is the best value in NYC. I've always enjoyed visiting this property. Exceptionally well-run hotel. Intimate environment and a management team that will attend to your every need. Stay here!!

title: Hotel con encanto cerca de Times Square
text: Sorprendida muy gratamente!!! La habitación que nos dieron era grande, 2 dormitorios, 2 baños, un saloncito con una pequeña cocina y una terraza ideal! Además el desayuno está incluido y, aunque no hay mucha variedad, es suficiente para comenzar el día con energía. La ubicación inmejorable, cerca de Times Square en una calle con mucho encanto, y hay muchos restaurantes ricos cerca. El personal es muy amable también, nos trataron de maravilla!!!

title: Fantastic!
text: We recieved a room in the apartments (room 208) and it was fantastic!!! Room was spacious and extremely quiet. The location of the hotel was great. We were close enough to even the happenings, but could go up to our room and escape from the noise, etc st any point. Being there for the taste times square was a bonus. We were able to people watch for hours on the steps. It was a great and affordable place that we will definitely come back to when in NYC. On a side note... The breakfast was very light. We ended up going out after the first day because they didn't have many options for us. Though when I told them I need gluten free they went out and bought some. So they go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable.

title: Do not stay here!
text: If you normally stay up until 4 AM, this place will be perfect for you. The hotel sits right on top of a nightclub and the music will shake your bed and keep you awake until the early hours of the morning. If you can, spend the extra dollars at the Hampton Inn or DoubleTree down the street...you won't regret avoiding this place.

title: Expérience très mitigée. Ca ne vaut pas son prix.
text:
Ce que je n'ai pas aimé :
La direction de l’hôtel qui nous a enfermé dans un paiement à l’avance sans annulation possible puis qui change la description de la chambre passant d'une "chambre située au-dessus d'un bar" à "une chambre située au-dessus d'un bar avec DJ jusque 4 heures du matin" deux semaines avant notre arrivée ! 
L’addition, 855$ pour 3 nuits et : « on vous a fait un prix Monsieur » alors qu'au départ c'était 654,25$ mais, au vu de mon insistance, ils ont trouvé une autre chambre alors qu'il ne devait plus y en avoir de libre...
Carrelage cassé dans la douche. (à 855 $... )
Rideau qui ne ferme plus correctement car sortis de leurs rails =) impossible de faire sombre.
A chacun de ses passages, la femme de chambre remettait des coussins décoratifs qui n’etaient plus de première fraîcheurs sur les lits, c’est franchement à oublier comme idée. C'est même limite-limite point de vue hygiène.
2 Gros sacs poubelles devant la chambre vendredi après-midi (15h), toujours présent samedi matin (10h) mais disparus samedi 22h. 
Une bouteille d’eau pour trois jours pour deux. Faut-il réserver trois fois une nuit et faire trois Check out pour avoir une bouteille par jour ? (855$...)
50 marches sans ascenseur. Ce n’est pas valable pour toutes les chambres. 
Pour le petit déjeuner, il faut donc descendre ces 50 marches, sortir à l’exterieur, prendre un couloir, remonter un étage en ascenseur pour enfin aller au comptoir du bar du restaurant-boite-de-nuit se servir. Et donc refaire le chemin inverse ensuite pour remonter dans sa chambre. C’est pénible. 
Le petit-déjeuner est vraiment moyen. Pas de charcuterie ou fromage, pas de bacon ou œufs. 
Aucun caractère français, nom complètement usurpé. Certains parlent de petit déjeuner français, gageons qu'ils n'ont jamais mis les pieds en France, pour dire une ânerie pareille. En France, c'est bon...
Le style est plutôt colonial anglais.

Ce qui est bien :
La situation. 
La taille de la chambre. 
Le « petit » personnel sans être péjoratif.
Le port des bagages pour la chambre à l’arrivée comme au départ. 
Produits « L’Occitane »

title: Fantastic stay
text: Had a 4 night stay in January and couldn’t recommend the hotel enough, upon arrival we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite with a balcony, shame it was minus 9 degrees! Right in the heart of restaurant row and only a 5 min walk to Times Square, really helpful friendly staff, great breakfast and cool American style bar below showing lots of sport! Can be very loud but from where we were we couldn’t hear anything! Would highly recommend this place.

title: in centro ma non nella confusione
text:
Hotel molto carino, molto curato nei dettagli persino direi "europeo" per essere in pieno centro a nyc. Colazione buona. In pieno centro ma fuori dalla bolgia trovandosi nella restaurant row
unica pecca la assenza praticamente della hall..
personale gentile, hanno sostituito la macchina del caffè che non funzionava
ci tornerei

title: Wonderful stay! We will be back!
text: My husband and I stayed at The French Quarters for an Anniversary weekend getaway. I cannot say enough good things about this location and the staff. Everyone we met at the front desk was so helpful with restaurant recommendations and help with the subway. The room was very nice and clean. We were in the front so later at night it was pretty loud but that was expected; we still managed to sleep just fine. Ton of restaurants around and close to Times Square. The breakfast included was very nice too. We are hoping to go back in the summer for another stay. 100% recommend The French Quarters!

title: Lovely stay!! So close to Times Square!!!
text: Our room was gorgeous! We stayed in a two bedroom suite on the 5 th floor and it was spacious, clean, and cozy! The view off our private terrace was lovely and staying on 46th, also known as food alley was very convenient. It was fantastic staying so close to Times Square.The hotel workers where very friendly and very helpful! The Burbon restaurant attached the the hotel was great! The continental Breakfast was nice and we went there for dinner twice and enjoyed it very much!

title: Amazing stay!!
text: I loved the beautiful apartment!! All staff was very sweet and attentive. The apartment was a walk away from Times Square and other tourist attractions. My children had no problem walking to and from the apartment. I will definitely stay again.

title: Small hotel that makes you feel you're home.
text: You have to try this hotel on Restaurant row and a block or so from Times square. Staff are friendly and so helpful, the room was great and the free morning newspaper  and daily updates delivered to your door each morning were appreciated. The free continental breakfast was much better than expected with lots of yoghurt, juice,fruit, cereal, pastries and bread and bagels to toast, The coffee was excellent. I will be back.

title: Great accommodation selection for our NYC Theater visit!
text: Perfect location!  We were able to fit in A LOT during our very short stay as public transportation, restaurants, the theater and NYC hot spots were all within easy walking distance.  The room was small, but made excellent use of available space with tasteful decor.  THE BED WAS SO COMFORTABLE!  We remarked how quiet it was for being in the middle of a bustling city.  There is an adjoining restaurant/club with live music but we barely heard any sound from it while in our room.   The ambiance while in that New Orleans themed restaurant, which also serves as the location for the continental breakfast, has a lot of personality.  The only real downside was breakfast, which was just O K.  Other than some quality fresh fruit, the other offerings were toast, bagels, cereals and some standard breakfast pastries.  All staff we encountered were especially friendly and helpful!  Recommended alternative to traditional hotel chains!

title: Fantastic stay at The French Quarters
text: Hotel was spotless and rooms very comfortable and spacious with coffee maker included.  Staff were lovely and couldn’t do enough to assist with any query.  Breakfast was  fab.  Centrally located just a small walk to Times Square, Theatres, Subway and plenty of great independent restaurants on the doorstep.  Honestly spoilt for choice.  We will be rebooking again and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend to family and friends.  Thank you for making our stay in NYC special.

title: Great Price & Outstanding Room!
text: This review is for Room 105. The room itself was it decent condition- a few dings on the furniture but very clean and super comfortable. The king size bed was delightful! We were concerned about the other reviewers noise complaints, however we stayed over on a Saturday and could just slightly hear it in the sleeping area though it was more audible in the bathroom. By leaving the bathroom fan on we could hear nothing. Well worth the $100+ savings for a similar room in NYC. BTW, the room was really spacious!

title: Excellent location to discover NYC
text:
We stayed for 5 nights at the French Quarters Apartments. We had a two bedroom apartment which was perfect as the sitting room also had a sofa bed for our youngest. Apartments reasonably spacious and very clean. Comfortable relaxing environment after a day of sight seeing. Three TV's and a well stocked coffee machines. We also had access to a balcony. 

The staff were excellent from the moment we checked in with the people on the desk always taking the time to have a chat.  In terms of the breakfast Kevin was a really good waiter and always friendly and available for a bit of advice on sight seeing and local restaurants. Rooms were cleaned every morning to a very high standard. 

The rooms were very comfortable and the location is very central for exploring the city. Just a few blocks from Times Square and very central for the subways to see the major sights. 

In terms of restaurants you could not be in a better location with an excellent choice of restaurants all within very easy walking distance. 

Compliments to the management on a really well managed and run establishment.  Would highly recommend and we will be back.

title: Great Location; wonderful accomodation
text: We stayed here for two nights while seeing "Hamilton"....and the experience was great. Despite the crazy, non-stop busyness of very nearby Times Square, the street that French Quarters Guest Apartments is on is much quieter, and the hotel was delightful. Our room was well-appointed, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. And there are so many places to eat just steps away....Highly recommended.

title: Mrs
text: Lovely, quaint hotel with helpful staff.  The location was perfect for Midtown and theaters.  Everything was within walking distance.  There were many delicious restaurant within walking distance as well.  The only problem was the noise. Lots of loud music and people kept us awake into the early morning hours.

title: Amazing boutique hotel, fabulous location!!
text: I stayed here last October 17 to celebrate my daughter’s 21st.  Although the rooms weren’t massive it was adequate for 3 adults.  Added bonus was a small kitchen area with fridge.  Beautifully clean and staff very helpful and friendly.  Breakfast was plentiful with a good selection.  Location was perfect, within walking distance to Times Square and surrounded by restaurants.  Would definitely return.

title: Fantastic base in New York
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights on our 1st visit to New York. What a fabulous place to find. We booked a one bedroom suite and on arrival we found that we had been upgraded to a two bedroom suite. It was superb. Beautiful and exceptionally clean and warm. Room was cleaned spotlessly every day and coffee pods refilled each day as were the bathroom toiletries. Breakfast was very very good and plenty to choose from and came complimentary. Many thanks. We ate 3 nights of our stay in the hotel restaurant... Bourbon Street Bar and Grille....which was fabulous and plenty to choose from off the menu. Offers on every day. The atmosphere was fantastic. Restaurants in New York are very expensive and always very busy. The restaurant at the hotel we found to be the most reasonable that we found and always a table was available.
We would definitely recommend staying here and we will most certainly stay on our next trip to New York. So central to everywhere. Fabulous stay. Many thanks to all at The French Quarters Guest Apartments.

title: Great Base!!
text: First time visiting New York, stayed for 7 nights over Thanks giving great location close to theatres, Time square, restaurants.  The original room we were allocated was in the annexe which was unsuitable.  The room was cold, the double bed was placed up against the wall which meant one of us had to climb out of the bed via the bottom - not ideal.  We asked to be moved to the main part of hotel which they did, the manager was very obliging.  The décor in the hotel is so stylish.  Nice touch having a coffee maker in the room along with a fridge and kitchenette area.  The beds were very luxurious.  Great bath room with a large walk in shower with lovely L'Occitane toiletries.  Breakfast was buffet style and plenty of it.  All the staff were very friendly and full of information.  The bar area has a great atmosphere, they also do great room service.  Doyle the barman really looked after us.  He gave us some good tips on getting around the city.  Would definately stay here again.

title: Premier Location, Friendly Staff
text:
Our room was right over the bar.  In many cases, I would grumble and moan and knock down the rating for that.  However, here we were warned ahead of time that it might be noisy (it was, but only one night out of 5 here), and they gave us a significant discount on the room because of that factor.  When up front, and offering a discount, I can't knock them on it.

The staff was immensely friendly and helpful.  The free continental breakfast was quite good (though "continental" -- so don't expect omelets or the like). They provide a daily sheet with things going on around the neighborhood. I wish we had time to stay a month, just to go to more of what they tell us about daily.

Absolutely a place we will return to on a future NYC trip!

title: A Delightful Respite
text:
In town for a David Bowie retrospective, we decided to spend the night at the French Quarters.  A wonderful little brownstone located between eighth and ninth avenue on west 46th street in the center of restaurant row, we arrived around 2:30 and were warmly greeted by Monica at the small front desk.  She said we’ve been upgraded to a king room and escorted us one floor up to our room.  Pointing out it was about 30% larger than a standard room, it included a small kitchen area with a small fridge containing a couple of bottles of Evian water as well as a Keurig coffee machine, k pods and creamer.  A small flat screen on the wall opposite the enormous king bed and the standard electronic safe in a large chifferobe.  Small  bathroom had a large walk in shower big enough for two with a small seat in a corner.  Adequate water pressure though it took a few minutes for the hot water to arrive.
A typical continental breakfast in the morning was available at the Bourbon Street restaurant right next door and included with our tariff.
A great overnight stay just minutes from Times Square and many theaters, I would recommend the French Quarters and look forward to a return visit.

title: Cosy home from home. Best bed I've ever slept in!
text:
My wife and I spent 4 nights here early Feb 2018 as we were doing some business in the city. We'd never stayed in NY before and were aware of small rooms - not this place though. Quite spacious in fact.

As we entered the room it stretched out ahead, revealing 2 double beds (1 each) which were amazingly comfortable, a very nice bathroom and a little kitchenette with fridge, a couple of hobs and a great pod style coffee machine (25 complimentary pods supplied which are re-filled each day -- coffee, de-caf coffee, hot choc, hot cider and tea). The flat screen TV was positioned opposite and central to both beds so we could lie on each our beds with all the 4 pillows stacked up behind to watch the very bad American adverts, with occasional programmes!

Being a sucker for hotel buffet breakfasts this place did not disappoint me. Not as sophisticated and extensive as some hotels, but this place has more of a homely feeling, less of a hotel feeling. Something for everyone though. 14 types of cereal in those little boxes to start! Little bags of oats, bagels, cream cheese, jams, fresh fruit, yogs, eggs and most importantly the coffee was good!
A very friendly chap called Kevin was in charge of breakfast and I must say he couldn't have been more helpful and obliging. Absolutely nothing was a problem. We'd chat every morning about all sorts.

A nice couple of touches was a daily sheet (things to do, weather etc) slid under the door at 6 a.m. ish as well as a 'New York Post' outside the door every morning too.

Breakfast was taken on the mezzanine level above the French brasserie below. Huge TVs everywhere so you get the news while you eat. The hotel and brasserie are sort of intertwined strangely. The various stairs are a bit confusing. No matter.
After a day slogging around town, we'd return to the front door, greet the alternating faces at the tiny desk and take the lift up to the 2nd floor to the welcoming room. Aaah!

To conclude then;
All positive basically. Miss the bed!!

Only one small niggle which I pointed out to a friend of the owner. There are no little lamps by the side of the beds for reading. A huge lamp sits on a chest inbetween the beds and there are ceiling lights. Some work to do on the bedside lighting.

We were in room 203 with the window facing the street. The piano bar opposite can be quite noisy at weekends until past midnight. Also the usual NY night sounds seep in occasionally if you sleep lightly, but overall pretty quite for being almost in central Manhattan.

We didn't visit any of the restaurants nearby in the street as we ate out during the day and hit the sack early, but there are lots to choose from.

title: Très bon hôtel !
text:
Un hôtel idéalement situé près de Times Square,  à taille humaine.
Chambre : la standard très petite (lit queen size ). De plus située près de la rue et de la porte d’entrée le bruit peu être gênant. Nous avons demandé un changement de chambre (moyennant un surcoût évidemment) nous avons alors une belle suite très confortable au 3ème étage. Les lits king size sont confortables.
Petit déjeuner : continental, ne vous attendez pas à des œufs et du bacon. Mais du café, du lait, du jus, du pain, des céréales, des yaourts, des viennoiseries, des fruits...
C’est correct.
Un bar restaurant en bas propose de bons plats cajuns.

title: Will come back to stay again
text: I have stayed in many New York hotels. First time now at the The French Quarters and it has been the best. I will come back to stay again. Friendly welcoming staff, very large comfortable, clean room (largest I have stayed in New York), Very good breakfast. The bar/restaurant downstairs an added attraction and convenience. And great location.

title: Bien placé
text:
Bon accueil , très belle chambre avec un lit 2 mètres sur 2 . Salon à côté avec canapé convertible bon couchage .
Produits Occitane dans la salle de bain 
Service de chambre parfait 
Petit bémol sur un petit déjeuner simple ( café jus d’orange viennoiserie pain beurre )
Ex : lit + canapé pour 4 personne 5 nuits : 1200$
On est à 5 min à pied de Times Square 
Rue très calme avec pas mal de restaurant et de bars sympas .
J’y retournerai car emplacement parfait pour visiter NYC

title: Excellent - Best Hotel we've stayed in NYC
text: We loved staying in the French Quarters for 6 nights over Christmas 2017. If you want a fancy reception area with a big lobby to sit etc, then this is not for you - sorry. But if you want 1) a friendly spotlessly clean hotel in NYC, 2) where you get peace to sleep, 3) which has a great breakfast, and 4) which is so well located that you can walk virtually everywhere (we did - even right down to China Town/Ground Zero and Brooklyn Bridge one day).  We were in the townhouse which is literally next door to the Hotel Door.  Old original stairs, our room was a good size 'double-double' at the very top (be aware there's no lift - but we didn't mind at all) and we weren't bothered by noise at all. NYC is a noisy city and we've had experience of little sleep before in more fancy hotels, but the 3 of us slept great here every night, and will definitely stay here again.

title: A wonderful place to stay in New York - look no further!!
text:
We recently travelled to New York from Australia for a family holiday. As there were 5 in our party, I did want to try to book an apartment. It is always nerve wracking booking accommodation when you do not know the area and as we had never been to NY I just hoped I had got it right. Well I did not have to worry - The French Quarters is sooo good. We had a 2 bedroom apartment with a balcony - that was fantastic when it snowed!!!! The rooms were beautiful, warm and quite spacious. The beds are really good - so much so, it was tempting to stay in bed and just look at the snow falling on the balcony. There is a kitchenette but we did not use it - too many great places to eat so close by :) The coffee machine was good though - hot apple cider - yum! Free breakfast was a bonus and there is plenty to eat.
Special shout out to the staff. Each member of staff was welcoming and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. Special shout out to Monica- the manager. She arranged a limo for us to travel to airport plus she organised for our laundry to be done - special little touches that we appreciated.
We were able to see so much of NY because we were so close to everything here. The theatres and restaurants are so close. We are planning our return visit now. Trust that this is the place to stay!!

title: Percection
text: We stayed for 4 nights in January 2018. We came to see Hamilton, which is literally 5 minute walk from hotel. Great location close to Times Square, Broadway, right on restaurant row. The room is so nice, clean, warm, and quiet. Can’t hear the city at all. It is decorated beautifully and has only a handful of rooms. Free breakfast and close to several bars and clubs. Love this place.

title: Great service, great price, great location, comfy room.
text: The staff was so nice - everyone, including the breakfast fella!   Helped with my bags, and also great directions and recommendations.   The area is loaded with restaurants and bars, and also right in the theater area.   I could not hear noise in the rooms from traffic - so great for NYC!   Room was comfy and clean, although I didn't spend much time in it.   Price was amazing for NYC, and my only minus to report is parking but come on, it is NY....

title: Five Star Service on a Smaller Scale
text:
The staff is accommodating and honest.  That in itself is significant.  During the recent Arctic Cold wave that engulfed the entire Eastern Seaboard, (and actually still is as of this writing) The French Quarters staff had challenges in keeping our rooms warm.  They went above and beyond in their efforts and were successful in keeping  things in balance.
The breakfast is excellent with courteous staff that is fast and appreciative of a kind word.  Thanks to Moe and the boss from Galway for their superb assistance during our stay.  We would highly recommend the French Quarters for a unique experience and a pleasant stay in NYC.

title: Amazing Experience!
text: After a one night's stay, I am now a serious fan of The French Quarters Guest Apartments. Warm and friendly was our first encounter with John,  at the front desk, and warm and friendly continued throughout our short stay  With the front entrance being small in area, I felt additionally very safe, knowing everyone coming into the building was clearly seen by staff. The room was perfect.  Clean, spacious, charming,  cozy.....a home away from home.  The location  also couldn't be  more perfect, especially if you are in New York to enjoy a Broadway show.  Located on Restaurant Row, there are so many restaurants to choose from. We loved Sangria 46, and we also loved the piano bar, Don't Tell Mama, located directly across the street.  Within blocks there is so much to do.....eliminating walking or public transportation. And, when it's January and cold....the proximity of all of our plans, an added bonus.  Thank you for a lovely night in New York!

title: great stay here
text:
We spent 4 nights here this Summer. Excellent location if you want to be in the centre of things which we did. Lovely big bedroom with huge bed, tv, coffee machine all the usual stuff. 
Staff exceptionally friendly both in reception and at the breakfast buffet. The Bourbon Bar and Grille was really nice for food and we had a lovely meal on the balcony out front. Nice to have drinks in the bar on a night too.
Breakfast was good and you could have as much as you wanted which set us up for the day. 
Could not fault this place and definitely great value for money in New York.

title: Great Again
text:
Have stayed here several times before and is our fav NY pad!  Everything was as expected from friendly and helpful check-in to great value room and great setting and location. Left in an east coast storm and they even offered us free brollies due to driving snow! 
Full marks again- will be back!
Eat in the bar- great value at lunch in particular!

title: Hell's Kitchen Heaven
text: LOVED this place! All of the people at the front desk are so friendly and accommodating - they will keep your luggage for you after you check out and offer tips about parking or whatever you need to know. The room (so much bigger than a typical NY hotel room) was beautiful, with exposed brick, an amazing bathroom and a king size bed that was so comfortable. There were tons of k-cups of every kind for the Keurig. Great to have a fridge in the room too, to put our leftovers from dinner. Speaking of dinner, we ate at Bourbon Street Bar & Grille (in the hotel) and it was delicious - and they had the best Christmas decorations; I think there are photos posted somewhere so check it out. Special shoutout to our waiter, Connor, who was really friendly and accommodating and made our dinner so much fun. Also, what a nice bonus that a free breakfast, on the 2nd floor of Bourbon Street, is included with your stay, which is really a nice treat since you know how pricey breakfast can be in NY. It was so relaxing to just chill out and have coffee and a bagel and some fruit just a few steps away from our room. And the location -- you couldn't ask for a better location! So close to everything -- the theaters, Rockefeller Center, and amazing restaurants and bars up and down the street. It's just perfect!  I almost don't want to tell anyone about this since it's not very big and I am worried that if too many people know about it, I won't get a room when I need one. Now that I've stayed here, I can't imagine staying anywhere else when I'm in New York. In case it's not obvious, highly recommend this place!

title: Una excelente alternativa...
text: Un buen hotel, cercano a la zona turística, pero alejado del ruido hace que este hotel sea una buena alternativa a la hora de reservar un hotel en Manhattan. El personal es amable y siempre dispuestos a ayudar. Las habitaciones son cómodas, limpias y bien equipadas. No duden en reservar en este sitio.

title: Clean, comfortable, great location
text: Located a few blocks from Times Square and right along Restaurant Row, you really can't find a better spot. The rooms were large in my experience in NYC, and they were exceptionally clean. The hotel is located above a bar and had a few noisy nights, otherwise it was rather quiet and just far from the bustle of Times Square. It is near several subway lines and made for good walking any time of day or night. I'll definitely be back!

title: Sharon Prudence
text: Wow these apartments are amazing. Fantastic rooms and very clean. Beds are very comfy and the bathrooms are really spacious. Breakfast was amazing with everything you could imagine. Staff are fantastic and very helpful and polite. The location of the apartments was incredible.there were 5 ladies all travelling together 1st time in new york and i would love to go back and i wouldnt hesitate at booking these apartments again. Absolutely brilliant.

title: Super Comfort in Midtown
text: My wife called our king bed the most comfortable ever after our one at home.  That alone for a traveler should merit a 5 star rating, but The French Quarters also has a staff dedicated to making the one or several night visitor feel as if he has come home after a long day in NYC.  Those looking for a location near Times Square could do no better, and --despite the busy midtown location--the small hotel is very quiet.  A nice quirk to the place is that the names of the last tenants on the next door row house that is the annex to the main hotel remain on the mailboxes.  I told the manager I hope that never changes, just like I hope the hotel never changes.

title: Amazing
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights, my husband and two children. The staff were so courteous and helpful, the domestic staff were brilliant too. These apartments are on the doorstep of Times Square, 5 minute walk away! The room was clean, tidy and had awesome little treats such as a tea/ coffee/ hot chocolate maker as well
As mineral water. They have thought of everything and we loved it- delicious breakfast with pleasant staff. This is the place to go !!!!! Thank you French Quarters !!!

title: Friendly oasis in Times Square
text: This is a hidden gem !!! From the first moment you contact them they try to be helpful and accommodating. They went so far out of their way to meet my needs. The room is small but all you need and they have L' Occitane products, good coffee and refrigerator in the room. The included breakfast was delicious. Stay here if you are going to NYC!!!

title: Perfection
text: Location, location, location... is amazing.  The suite was clean.  The bed and linens were a dream.  DIdn't want to get up and see NYC they were so nice!  The decor was lovely.  The bathroom was super tiny, but clean.The front desk and housekeeping staff are pleasant and helpful.  The Cajun restaurant attached is very good.  Can't wait to go again.

title: Want a nice place in the heart of Manhattan? This is it.
text:
First off, location is unbeatable. Right by the hubbub of Times Square but just far enough from it to be quiet. Well, New York quiet, which is it's own thing.

My wife and I were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and could have easily been travelling with another couple without vying for space. Bathroom was nice, although I will never get used to the toilets in this part of the world having virtual lakes in them. I once sat on the one in the French Quarters and accidentally dipped my bits in but I'm starting to veer off course.

Anyway, breakfast was nice but sinfully wasteful in its various tiny packagings. We did have an uninvited guest come into our room while we slept and rummage around in the bathroom but it turned out to be a UK teenage girl who, once she roused from her sleepwalking, realised she was on the wrong floor and fled in terror. We got all that sorted afterwards. I believe I may not have closed the door properly behind me so she was able to walk in. Pro tip: close your doors. It's safer.

Great location, nice staff, nice breakfast, slightly lumpy bed but there were two of them so there was plenty of space. Recommended.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Room was large enough for 3 of us comfortably- adults. Great breakfast daily, bagels, cereals, ect. Close to metro station. Safe location - close enough to the center of Manhattan without being on top of it.

title: 綺麗です、窓から見える裏通りが・・・イイ！
text:
家族3名で滞在しました。
お布団フカフカ、部屋もおしゃれ。部屋は文句なし。
劇場、レストラン、ジャズバー、タイムズスクウェア等アクセスも抜群。
但し、朝食はおまけ程度の気持ちで。
高級ホテルのバフェイとは比較してはいけません。
そして何より、窓から見える裏通りが今にもスパイダーマンが降りてきそう、
如何にもニューヨーク裏通りという感じがしてグッときました。

title: Superó todas nuestras expectativas
text:
La pequeña recepcion engaña al llegar al hotel. Una habitacion impecable, camas comodísimas y baño con mampara (lo que es dificil de encontrar en NY). además, una maquina de café con capsulas de cortesía. Cada mañana nos dejaban el periódico y una hoja con el tiempo y qué cosas podiamos hacer en el barrio y la ciudad (un detalle que me pareció ideal!) 
El desayuno bastante bien y el personal muy amable. 
Por no hablar de una ubicacion espectacular que permite ir andando a todos los rincones turisticos de la ciudad. 
Al volver, nos ayudaron con el transfer al aeropuerto. 
Sin duda, todo un acierto si quieres ir a NYC.

title: Absolute gem in the heart of Manhattan
text:
This was my second stay at The French Quarters having stayed there two years ago. The room was clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated.  The beds (two doubles in the room we had) were comfy. There is a small hotplate and fridge if you wanted to cater for yourself. There is a machine to make a variety of hot drinks with pods provided.  

The ensuite shower room was spacious and clean, complementary L'Occitane toiletries were provided at the start of the stay.  Breakfast is available on the mezzanine level and is included in the room rate.....cereals, fruit juice, bread, bagels, danish pastries, hard boiled eggs, fresh fruit, preserves, tea, coffee, hot chocolate (there were even mini marshmallows provided).

The hotel is centrally situated, literally five minutes from Times Square and five minutes fro The Port Authority. Staff are polite and keen to help, answering any questions you may have. Note: the hotel is able to arrange transport to and from the airport at an additional cost.

Like Schwarzenegger, I will return!  Definitely!!  Call the hotel for their best room rate rather than book through an app

title: Lovely stay
text: Just got back from a 5 night stay at the French Quarters. The location was perfect - a couple of minutes away from Times Square and about 10 minutes walk from Central Park. We stay in a room within the town house next to the main hotel. The room was quite small but that's to be expected in the centre of a city and it had a nice bay window overlooking the street. We did hear some noise at night from nearby bars and the street but we were so tired from all the walking that it didn't effect us and we slept through. We had a meal at the Bourbon restaurant next door which is where breakfast was served and the food was good. There was a good selection at breakfast to set you up for the day. The umbrella in the room was really useful and the coffee machine was one of the best I've had in a hotel room with a good choice of coffees/ hot chocolate etc. Customer service from the hotel was great, I would stay here again and would recommend others to.

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: We happened to find this property will looking around on the internet.  After reading some of the reviews my wife and I decided to book a queen room for our overnight stay this past week.  What a pleasant surprise.  We arrived early on Wednesday afternoon (prior to check-in time) and were informed that our room was ready and that we had been upgraded to a king room, another surprise.  We were taken to our room by the desk attendant and given a brief overview.  The room, itself, was spacious, by New York standards.  It included a kitchenette and a well appointed and spacious bathroom.  It was decorated in New Orleans style furnishings ,thus the name.  Our overnight stay was comfortable.  The next morning we were treated to an outstanding continental breakfast in the restaurant (The Bourbon Street Bar and Grill) which is located on the lower level.  Overall it was an excellent experience.

title: Great Location and Service
text: I was given a room that overlooked the road - it was lovely as I was not feeling well with a bad cold I had hot tea from the in room keurig and watched the world go by. The room was immaculate and the linen, bathtowels etc was spotless. The little touches were great - everyone was so friendly especially John who manages the property. Will definitely stay again.

title: Not Loving This One
text: Read the reviews and was aware of the noise comments but took a chance.  The lady that checked us in was lovely.  Brought us to the room which was the town house next door. The room was cute.  Little fireplace. Nice windows. A little nook with a chair. Very cozy. Looked like a place in the French Quarter in New Orleans.  The bathroom looked lovely at first glance. Big shower. White subway tile. Very nice. Unfortunately the noise is unreal.  That bar goes until 4:00 a.m.  I was shocked at how loud it was. All we heard was the bass and loud talking.  When I decided to just get up and take a shower I noticed the grout in the shower was all moldy. Just really not cleaned well.  I wanted to like this because the people were so nice but what a waste of $300+. I will not stay here again or recommend.

title: Brilliant Location & breakfast!
text:
Booked after researching hotels in NYC and it really is a hidden gem! Located only 2 minutes walk from Times Square the hotel is situated down a side street that is termed "Restaurant row" as there are a great mix of places to eat right on the door step. It is really easy to explore the city as only a few minutes walk takes you to either 42nd or 50th subway entrances, about 15/20 minutes walk gets you to Central Park.

The rooms are cosy and could benefit from a set of drawers for storage but the beds are large and really comfy. The bathrooms are fantastic and always kept spotlessly clean but I have to say has the worst designed shower ever, you have no choice but to stand under the water whilst its heating up which is not fun! The room benefits from a fridge, hot plate and coffee machine which was perfect for us.All of the standard rooms are located at the front of the building overlooking the street so if you are a light sleeper this may be the time to pay a bit more for a room at the rear. However,  It is always going to be noisy in New York! 

I have to say the continental breakfast was fantastic with lots of choice of cereals, pastries and bagels, the only downside is that the room it is served in is very cold in the mornings so lots of people were taking the food into the bar area next door, this didn't really bother us. 

Staff were all really friendly and took the time to chat anytime we passed through reception, it was a lovely experience and I would recommend the hotel to anyone planning a visit to NYC that wants to be in the heart of the city!

title: Loved it!
text: Boy were we happy with our stay. Room was clean and maid service did a fantastic job! There’s continental breakfast every morning and the restaurant has amazing food, but big portions. It’s such a quaint place in the heart of NYC. Only a 5-minute walk to Times Square and a 15-minute walk to Rockefeller Center. It’s close to the subway as well. They even called a private car service on our last day to take us to the airport. It ended up costing the same if not a little less than a taxi. Every receptionist we met was nice too. Great location! I’ll definitely be recommending this place to others!

title: Found a little diamond here
text: Booked this hotel after a lot of researching the citys hotels and locations. It did not disappoint on either front. Location is super, Times Square 2 blocks to the right, the underrated Hells Kitchen to the left on 9th Avenue at the end of the street. Far enough from all the hustle and bustle but close enough to where it all happens. Accomodation itself was good, not very big, but nowhere is in NYC and its all you need. Mini fridge, hob and coffee maker beside the little sink. The bathroom was a decent size with a great powershower. The important thing is how clean and frequent the rooms are cleaned....the answers are very clean and every day. Breakfast is continental and does what it needs to do to set you up for the day. The Bourbon Street Bar and Grill which is part of the hotel was always busy, which is a good sign. We ate here on our last night, food was good and had plenty of choice. To sum it up I would have no hesitation booking here again, its all you need and the location is excellent. Super friendly staff always helps too, and they always had a wee yarn when we were passing. Thumbs up from us, and thanks for having us!!

title: Fantastic location, great room and service
text: I went here just for one night as I was stopping over to go to Brazil. When I arrived the man at the desk was incredibly helpful, showed me to my room. For one person it was huge I was so impressed, had a great sleep and heard no noise at all. When I woke I went to breakfast that had a huge selection of food to eat. As I was new to the area I was greeted at the desk by a lovely lady who took the time to tell me whats about, how to get to places, best way to get taxi to airport etc. She was so helpful and really made my experience better. Thank you!

title: Roomy accommodations in an excellent location
text:
My family (wife and two daughters) stayed in room 305 during the week of Thanksgiving.  We found the staff at the French Quarters to be extremely friendly and overly accommodating.  The room, a 1-bedroom suite, was perfect for our family.  It was very clean and was nicely decorated.  My only complaints would be that it was a bit on the dark side (not enough interior lighting), and the beds were not the most comfortable.  However, we never had any trouble sleeping given that we ran non-stop throughout our visit to NYC.

I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Manhattan's Hell's Kitchen/Broadway district.

title: Fabulous!
text: 4 and 5 star hotels need to take a look at this place to learn how they can do better. We absolutely loved this place. I almost didn’t pick it because it said “apartments”. It is a delightful boutique hotel,centrally located,in the middle of the theaters and best restaurants. It’s also surprisingly quiet. The toiletries were L’Occitane. What a treat! The water bottle in the fridge was complimentary. I get sick of being charged $5 for a .50¢ water bottle at bigger hotels.  The Kurig was stocked with a large selection of hot drinks. The restaurant/bar next door (and attached to the hotel)was great and a simple breakfast was included. It had a great variety of local bagels, toast, pastries, cereal, hot & cold drinks, and hard boiled eggs. The service was friendly and helpful at both. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place to friends and I would definitely stay here again!

title: Blew us away a second time
text: Expensive but OH SO worth it!  Took Uber directly from LaGuardia $40 .... had asked for same room as last year - got it!  Met with the same Welcome smiling faces. Room spotless and quiet.  Breakfast perfect and location unbeatable.  I don’t have even ONE negative.

title: Quaint and convenient
text: On arrival, I was informed I had been upgraded to a double room in the adjoining townhouse. No view but quieter than rooms over the bar.  The room was big enough, and when my wife joined me the next day she was happy with the size and the decor.  A couple of aspects of the bathroom reminded us of our accommodation in Paris, usable but a bit tight.  The provided continental breakfast of juice, cereal, toast, yogurt, pastries was fine by us.  All staff were pleasant and helpful.  The location is excellent for the price, being walking distance  to many of New Yorks attractions.  The only negative is that late friday and Sat nights you can hear music from a nearby band. If you are a light sleeper, earplugs do the job.

title: Wonderful hotel
text:
Staff were so friendly and helpful.  The hotel room was absolutely stunning.  Beautifully decorated, really clean and comfortable.
Great breakfast - definitely not the usual 'continental' breakfast, there was a huge choice of food.
Only one disappointment - we were only there for one night and I would have loved to have stay for longer!
Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NY.

title: Above and beyond
text: We spent a long time searching for a cosy intimate hotel in the heart of manhattan and decided on here. After spending 4 nights there I'm so glad we did. It is a small, beautiful, intimate hotel in restaurant row. We were welcomed warmly and had a lovely bottle of prosecco in the fridge to greet us. The rooms are spacious and well equipped with a kitchenette, coffee machine, safe, ac/heating, WiFi, full cable tv and a beautiful bathroom. We are concerned that the street noise might be an issue given the busy neighbourhood and close proximity to times square... I didn't need to be. We were on the 3rd floor and hardly noticed any noise. Breakfast is a good selection of breads/cereals/pastries, this was perfect as we had something light before hitting the pavement. My advice... If you're humming and haaing as to whether to book here.... Just do it... You will not be disappointed. We have both said we will stay here again on our next trip to manhattan. Such a personable and intimate place.

title: Eisssssskalter Frühstücksraum....
text: Das Hotelzimmer ist sauber, schönes Bad. Die Lage einmalig. Ich fand es laut(Straße und Bar) im Gegensatz zu den anderen Bewertungen. Der Frühstücksraum ist ein NoGO. Eiskalt und ungeheizt. Wir sassen alle im Wintermantel dort. Der Kaffee war in Kürze kalt in den vorgekühlten Tassen. Heizstrahler helfen...

title: Fantastic place to stay in NY
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights as a family of 4 in a one bed apartment, large main bedroom, great size lounge with really comfy sofa bed and a lovely bathroom. There is a small kitchenette but we didn’t really use it
There were so many things we loved about this place which was our last stop on a world tour and we all agreed this was the best place we stayed
The buffet breakfast which is included was fantastic, I’ve seen some reviews on here which moan about lack of choice but not they must have stayed somewhere else
There was lots of cereal, toast, bagels, pastries, fruit and of course great coffee
The location on restaurant row is perfect, it is literally a 5 minute walk to Times Square which really does live up to its reputation, always felt really safe at the apartment and in NY
The Bourbon Street Bar and Grill which is attached to the apartments is a great place, fantastic food and there is a lift which takes you straight up to your apartment 
The apartment itself is beautifully laid out and the beds are so comfy

They’ve even got umbrellas in the room which you can take out with you in case of a shower

Overall we can’t recommend this place any higher and when we return to NY this is where we will stay
A true gem of a place

title: Beautiful, convenient, perfect!
text: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary this year by seeing a show and staying in the city, and we were so happy that had chosen to stay at the French Quarters. The decor was perfect- just like I'd seen in New Orleans. The location is great- just far enough from Times Square to get a good night's sleep, just close enough that you have anything you could need at your fingertips! We were incredibly lucky- the hotel upgraded our room and left a little something sparkly in the fridge for us- such a lovely touch! The service was impeccable. Every member of staff we had the pleasure of dealing with was helpful, and personable. We loved out stay and were just sad we couldn't stay for breakfast as we had to rush to work the next day!

title: Loved this place!
text: We just happened upon this boutique hotel and decided to take a chance by booking a room over the bar.  The hotel's website is very upfront that this type of room can be loud late at night due to music being played at the bar.  We arrived a little early but were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready and we had been upgraded from a queen room to a king room.  Monica, at the front desk, was incredible helpful!  She showed up to our room.  She also showed up where we could take the stairs to the breakfast area and the stairs to outside.  The continental breakfast was just that - a continental breakfast - juice, coffee, milk, cereal, pastries, yogurt and the like.  It was set up nicely and a good way to start a busy day of sightseeing.  The location of the hotel is excellent!  Its on Restaurant Row - between 8th & 9th Avenues.  Its a short walk to Times Square and lots of other tourist sights.  Back to that noise warning about rooms over the bar - yes, we could hear some music.  No, it did not impair our sleeping in the slightest.  This hotel is quite the hidden gem!  I would definitely book again in the future.

title: Totally relaxing experience.
text:
I recently met up with some old friends from college for a mini reunion.
We were there for 3 nights and I have to say that it was really the perfect situation.
We met for the complimentary breakfast in the morning, a perfect environment for us to plan our day and energize ourselves with their bottomless coffee pot.
The staff was very friendly, informative and super gracious.
We found our rooms to be very quiet, clean and spacious.
A great alternative to the "box hotel" experience. We all agreed that we would definitely be back. Thumbs up!

title: Just go!
text: This little boutique hotel has all the charm of a private estate on Bourbon Street. Perfectly located in Restaurant Row, a block from the theatre district. Let's talk details..wrought iron, beautiful bedding, attentive and accommodating staff, clean, charming, whimsical, comfortable, sweet, warm and welcoming. Is there more? Well yes, lots, but I suggest you find out for yourself. Do yourself a huge favor!! Monica at front desk is delightful. Truly, staff can't do enough for you.

title: Fantastic hotel with best location
text:
Everything is nice and cosy. 10 minutes walk to Time Square and surrounded with a lot of good restaurants in Hells Kitchen. The staff is outstanding with a very high level of service and helpfulness. Our BEST recommendations to this lovely place.
WE WILL COME BACK!!

title: Fijne kamer op perfecte lokatie
text: Dit hotel is gelegen boven een bar een een restaurant. We kwamen veel te vroeg maar werden perfect geholpen, medewerkers zijn bijzonder aardig. We hadden een voor new yorkse begrippen ruime kamer met twee, niet te brede 2 persoonsbedden, een fijne kledingkast een een superfijne badkamer. Er is koffie bij de koffiemachine en er staat wat water in de koelkast, helemaal goed. Iedere ochtend krantje en een blaadje met lokale tips. Het ontbijt is voldoende, cerial, bagels, toast, cakejes, minicroisants en fruit en jam, wat sapjes en koffie en thee in thermosflessen. Klein probleempje is dat de airco van het restaurant nogal hoorbaar was in de kamer, maar die stond zelden aan. De lokatie is perfect, je loopt in 5 minuten naar times Square, overal eettentjes, binnen 1 blok twee supermarkten. Heel fijne plek.

title: Perto de tudo em NY e uma grata surpresa!
text:
