Ficamos no The French Quarters no começo de Outubro/17. O Hotel é muito bem localizado, na 46th, muito perto da Times Square e estações de metrô como a da própria Times e também do Port Authority, de onde saem Ônibus e metrô para todas as partes da cidade e outros pontos de interesse (Outlets, o parque Six Flags, etc).

Falando do Hotel, em si, é extremamente aconchegante e bem localizado, como já dito. O quarto e o banheiro são amplos, muito bem limpos e organizados todos os dias. Há uma Nespresso disponível para tomar café a hora que quiser e não é cobrada. O café da manhã é incluso. Bem simples, mas cumpre muito bem seu papel e economiza um precioso tempo para explorar a cidade. Por perto há vários bares (inclusive do hotel) e restaurantes, para aproveitar o fim de noite ou já lanchar perto do hotel ao retornar de passeios na cidade. Recomendo bastante o bar do próprio hotel, bastante movimentado e com ótimos comes e bebes.
Para quem tem problemas com barulho para dormir, recomendo não escolher os quartos mais simples, que ficam localizados numa entrada ao lado da recepção. Como a rua é bastante movimentada à noite, o barulho incomoda um pouco.

O Staff do hotel é um caso à parte e vale reservar um capítulo inteiro para eles. Monica, Michael e John são extremamente carismáticos, solícitos e preocupados para que os hóspedes tenham a melhor experiência tanto no hotel quanto na cidade!

Definitivamente me hospedarei novamente na próxima visita à NY. Muito recomendado!

title: Couldn't be better
text: Clean, quiet, central location. No more required. Bed was maybe a tad smaller than we'd normally have but it was clean and very comfortable. Staff were helpful, a newspaper and flyer with activities/weather delivered everyday. Good breakfast served. Very happy travellers.

title: Don't book this hotel!
text: Small but reasonable room, friendly daytime staff but noise from the bar downstairs (owned by the same people) is unbearable and lasts til 4am. Night staff don't care and won't help. Using 5 of the 10,000 cents charged per bookable night to provide a proper ironing board (and undamaged iron) would also be a plus!

title: Perfect location, comfortable place
text: This was a great place to stay, right in the centre - three minutes from Times Square and yet quiet and comfortable.  We booked a two room apartment for six nights for a family of four and that gave us two bedrooms, small but adequate, and a seating area with a small kitchenette. There was also a large balcony. Overall, the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in, the people on the desk were always extremely helpful and dealt with any query immediately, and the breakfast that came with it was delicious (muffins, croissants, fruit, cereal and toast) and meant we left well prepared for the day!  A couple of small gripes - the shower was only just adequate and although they had a coffee maker in the room there was no kettle which made making hot drinks (other than coffee) a little hard, but overall this was an excellent place to stay and really contributed to a fabulous trip to New York.

title: Great place to stay!
text:
This place was an incredible place to stay. We booked a single bed room and when we arrived we were upgraded to a double bed. 
   The room and linen was clean as could be and the restrooms were just as much! Each morning there was a flyer on our door of activities going on that day, daily temperatures and suggestions on where to go! That was definitely awesome granted that we wanted to do more than  the normal tourist site attractions. The staff was amazing and helpful. Ontop of all this the hotel is a short 10 min walk to Times Square! So you’re very close without having to worry about all the  noise and lights at night.
    There were only a couple downfalls to this beautiful place. The breakfast was mainly pastries, cereal and coffee, so don’t have the mindset of a full sit down breakfast. Our room faced an alley(which honestly wasn’t a big deal to us since we did our sightseeing on foot). And no microwave.  Many times we  had left over food but had to let it go to waste because we wouldn’t be able to heat it up. 
    We loved this place and the bar next to it and will definitely be staying here again and again!

title: Excellent location, excellent service
text: Booked this accommodation in January 2017 for a 4 night stay at the end of September 2017.  The location could not be more perfect for a first time visitor within a few steps of Times Square, the theatre district and all the main subway lines.  I had e-mailed days before we arrived letting the staff know my wife & I were travelling for our first wedding anniversary and when we did arrive we were informed that we had been upgraded to a King Room and there was a bottle of prosecco in the fridge.  Absolutely fantastic service.  Plus the room was very comfortable and the continental breakfast was extensive.  Couldn't recommend more.

title: Lo mejor de lo mejor, imperdible!!,
text: La verdad es que quedamos fascinadas con el hotel! Habitaciones gigantes, nuevas, súper limpias y cuidadas. Al hotel no se le escapa ningún detalle: el desayuno es fabuloso y viene incluido en la tarifa, todas las mañanas nos dejaban el diario y el clima, paraguas de Cortesía en la habitación, baño gigante y hermoso, camas espectaculares para un merecido descanso dsp de recorrer la gran ciudad, café gratis y heladera en la habitación y la ubicación inmejorable!! Cerca de time square pero lejos del ruido intenso. Solo critico q no tienen ascensor pero puedes pedir q te carguen las valijas.

title: great place to stay in restaurant district of the city
text: The rooms were large, we had a 2 bedroom with a kitchenette, living room and balcony. It was a great location and I thought it was relatively quiet. Lots of great restaurants close by.A plus-Loccataine products for the showers

title: New York, Brownstone Bijou....
text:
The hotel is above Bourbon Street Restaurant in a lovely Brownstone building on 'restaurant row' just five minutes from Times Square.  
Our Room 201 was facing 46th Street so the sounds of the city were audible but what would you expect in the heart of New York....;) We had no issues with anything in the hotel, all the staff were very helpful our only negative was the room size; perfect for the lone traveller on a weekender or midweek break but we had gone for an eight day stay so had we realised just how small the room was going to be we would have upgraded to a larger room. Other than that I can't fault the hotel.

title: Great place to relax in the heart of NYC
text: I have nothing but positive things to say about my stay in The French Quarters. The location is only a few blocks from times square with plenty of restaurants practically on your doorstep. From the Port Authority Bus Station it's only a few minutes walk away. The staff were top class and really made an effort making us feel welcome. Breakfast was an added bonus and really set us up for our days sightseeing. The room was large with plenty of character, two large beds and a bathroom with an excellent walk in shower. I would highly recommend The French Quarters and definitely plan on staying again.

title: Great location easy on wallet
text: This was a find, the location is amazing - lots and lots of nice restaurants nearby. The apartments were clean, and pretty well equipped. Had a great stay at my first wedding anniversary. All's good if the wife loved it! :)

title: A bit of Paris in NYC
text: Reminiscent of some of the small hotels in Paris with tight ascending stairs, small elevators, but luxurious rooms. Surrounded by restaurants, nearby parking and within easy walking distance to the nearby theaters and the sights and sounds of good old Broadway. Gives one the feeling of actually living in New York for a few nights. Breakfast was included in the attached restaurant.

title: Super!
text:
Lage: 
Unweit des Time Square, ca. 10 Minuten Fußweg. Für die Verhältnisse in NY ruhige Lage. Sirenen hört man immer und überall.  Subway in der Nähe ebenso wie ein paar gute Restaurants und ein kleiner Supermarkt. 

Zimmer: 
Wir hatten gute und tolle Queen Betten. Nach 3 Nächten gibt es neue Bezüge.  Alles war sehr sauber und gepflegt.  Fön usw. war alles da. Sogar eine kleine Kochzeile. 

Service: 
Nett und freundlich.  

Frühstück: 
Ein sehr kleines französisches Frühstück wird geboten. I.d.R. mit Bagels, Creamcheese & Marmelade oder Peanut Butter. Dazu Kaffee, Milch, OSAFT & diverse Flakes und Obst. Serviert wird in der anliegenden Bar. 
Wir hätten ohnehin nix anderes gefrühstückt, von daher für uns sehr gut. Wer ein typisches amerikanisches Frühstück erwartet, ist hier falsch.  

Fazit: 
Sehr gutes Hotel für einen mehrtägigen Aufenthalt in NY. Nicht günstig, aber das Preis-Leistungsverhältnis passt bei der angebotenen Qualität.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in great location
text: We stayed a week in this lovely New Orleans inspired apart-hotel. Whilst a little on the small side (apparently a NYC norm) we were able to lay out both our suitcases and still move around. The room was comfortable and clean. A kitchenette in the room but we didn't use, we were spoilt for choice by the many restaurants around hotel. The bathroom was surprisingly roomy with a luxuriously big shower area. Terrific location, right near Times Square, in Theatre District and along Restaurant Row. Lovely staff available at desk 24 hours, special mention to John. He happily answered all of our (many) questions, readily offered advice and helped with an errant beeping device. Breakfast included, it was a light continental affair but plentiful. Bar and restaurant on site, great vibe. We were very happy with our stay at The French Quarters and would stay again.

title: Volto com certeza
text: O hotel foi uma grande surpresa. Eu já tinha lido que as avaliações eram excelentes mas mesmo assim me surpreendeu. O hotel fica a uma rua da Broadway e a 3 da Times Square. O quarto é amplo e escolhedor. Eles disponibilizam opções de chá, chocolate quente... no próprio quarto para se fazer na máquina. Tem ferro de passar roupa, secador de cabelo e cofre. A rua em que fica o hotel tem muitos restaurantes o que pode incomodar a alguns por causa do barulho. A mim não me incomodou. Mas se você não gosta de barulho, escolha um quarto mais alto. Eu peguei o 105 que fica muito próximo do restaurante/bar do próprio hotel. A cama é maravilhosa!!!! Enorme e confortável. O café da manhã é excelente. Os produtos de banho são da Loccitane. Tudo no hotel foi feito para te dar conforto. O atendimento é de primeira. Até o dono do hotel veio nos cumprimentar. O único ponto negativo é a questão do barulho, o que não me incomodou, mas pode incomodar quem tem sono mais leve.

title: Location, location
text:
I stayed here after a very long flight and found the room very clean and comfortable.
The bar and restaurant was excellent. The owners were very accommodating.
We had an early departure and they organised a breakfast to go.
Restaurants and bars, Thymes Square and the Theatre district are all walking distance.
I would recommend this boutique hotel to anyone who wants to experience the buzz of New York.

title: New Orleans in New York
text: This place and the adjoining Bourbon Grille bar feels so New Orleans. The room we had (standard) was small and had boutique feel about it. Breakfast was also a bonus. Only downside was the room was on the street level and on Saturday night you WILL NOT sleep until about 2am due to nose from bar next door. If you accept that (which we knew about) then it's fine

title: Perfect location, friendly service
text: We spent a quick overnight here and loved the personal touch service from the overnight staff person who escorted us to our room to the person handling breakfast service. Easy to get anywhere from here...lots of restaurants to choose from as well. We'd happily stay here again!

title: Gran trato de Kevin
text: El hotel está perfecto: cama cómoda, ubicación perfecta, el aire acondicionado se podía regular muy bien, había café y cafetera en la habitación, todo limpio y bonita habitación, buen desayuno. Kevin, uno de los camareros que servían el desayuno, fue muy amable y atento con nosotros. Era el único que hablaba español y era a quién le preguntábamos todo. Fue muy amable.

title: Cómodo y Tranquilo
text: Hotel estilo boutique, con habitaciones cómodas y confortables. Muy amable la atención.  Ubicación ideal, a 2 cuadras de Times Square y de una estación de subte. Muy tranquilo (aunque recomiendo pedir las habitaciones que no den a la calle). El desayuno es abundante y variado, en un bar que pertenece al hotel.  Gran cantidad de lugares de variada oferta gastronómica en la misma cuadra y hacia la 8ª avenida. Ojalá pueda regresar

title: Séjour familial
text:
Très bien situé près de times square
Rapport qualité prix correct pour NY
Personnel très avenant
 Petit déjeuner classique mais tes correct avec personnel aux petits soins.
Propre 
Pas de bruit
À 2 block des métros.
Suffisamment spacieux pour 5
Restaurant attenant  sympa avec cuisine cajun ou classique.

title: Wonderful Christmas Stay
text: My family and I stayed here for a Christmas vacation in NYC. The staff was AMAZING, with excellent customer service. The rooms were large (by NYC standards) and were very, very clean. The restaurant downstairs was very tasty and the breakfast in the morning was a perfect way to start our day. I can't say enough about the cleanliness, customer service, and location of this hotel. I Will ONLY stay here when I come to New York from now on. The only downside is the no weekend booking rule but otherwise a wonderful place to stay.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Hotel incrivelmente bem localizado a uma quadra da Times Square e perto de praticamente todos os teatros, porém em uma rua bem tranquila em que não há ruídos a noite! Hotel muito bom incluído na diária, além de todos os dias receber jornais locais e uma folha com resumo da previsão do tempo e algumas atividades disponíveis ao redor. Produtos de banheiro L'occitane. Com certeza vale a pena!

title: Hotel à taille humaine très bien placé
text:
A deux pas de Times Square, le MOMA et le Rockfeller Center sont facilement accessibles à pied depuis ce petit hotel à taille humaine.
Chambre très confortable avec une petite kitchenette (hélas pas de vaisselle).
Nombreux restaurants de qualité à proximité immédiate?
Personnel attentif et très agréable.
Petit déjeuner simple mais sympathique.

Petit bémol : chambre assez mal insonorisée : le bruit incessant de la rue est bien perceptible.

title: Close to restaurants and the theaters
text: The staff was very friendly, especially the guy who works at the free breakfast.  The hotel itself is small, but it's very close to many restaurants, bars, and things to do.  Nice continental breakfast, Keurig in room.  Rooms are small, but comfortable.  Everything was clean and in good working order.

title: Pas aussi idyllique que décrit.
text:
La principale qualité de cet hôtel est d'être situé à 2 blocks de Times Square en plein centre de Manhattan. Si vous venez de l'aéroport JFK en bus, l'arrêt Port Autority est tout proche et donc facile d'accès.
En revanche, l'hôtel est situé au dessus d'un bar dont la musique est assourdissante le vendredi et samedi soir. En dehors de ces 2 journées, tous les autres jours de la semaine, les nuits sont calmes. Si vous souhaitez être plus au calme, je vous invite à choisir les chambres donnant sur la cour intérieure plutôt que sur la rue très bruyante.
Le petit dej' inclus dans le prix de la chambre est pas trop mal mais peut mieux faire. Arrivez tôt car passé 9h, il y a beaucoup moins de choses à manger.
La chambre dans laquelle nous avons dormi était propre et proposait en kitchenette pour, normalement, faire la cuisine. Il y a donc un frigo et des plaques mais aucune poile ni couverts...

title: Great Stay Close to Theaters
text: This hotel is in the Restaurant Row area of Hell's Kitchen adjacent to the Broadway theatre district. It is super convenient, very comfortable, and well-appointed. I managed to find a very good rate which made the whole stay even more appealing. I asked if they would hold my luggage when I checked out, and they said yes without hesitation; very much appreciated. The complimentary continental breakfast in their New Orleans themed restaurant was very nice.

title: Location, Location, Location!
text:
Located just a few blocks from Times Square, Restaurant Row and the Theater District, you can't escape the ever-present NYC sirens, but we were high enough (3rd floor) to be able to sleep through the mid-week noise on the street.

Our room was quite spacious with a large bathroom, huge shower, wardrobe, desk, kitchenette with cook-top and mini-fridge, small table by the door to catch purses, cell phones, etc. on the way out, charming coat rack, wall-mounted flat screen TV, comfy chair and foot rest.  They even supplied an umbrella just in case of rain.  After reading all this, one might think that there was no room to move around, but you would be wrong.  And you may say, who needs a big room when you're not in NYC to sit in your room.  Well, so true, but it's really nice when you come back after a long day of activities.

Immaculate housekeeping, super friendly and accommodating staff, perfect location - what more could you ask for?  Welll, it was a nuisance to have to ask the front desk person to bring ice each time we needed it, but there is no room for ice machines on the floors.  Also, the elevator was very very slow at times.  Minor details.

Breakfast included, described as continental, but it is a very nice continental with good selections of pastries, bagels, cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee and hard boiled eggs.

We loved it and would definitely stay here again.

title: Um achado
text: Muito bem localizado. Extremamente limpo. Funcionários super atenciosos. Ótimo café da manhã. Ao pedirmos um transporte para o aeroporto foi providenciada uma limusine - por 10 dólares a mais que o preço de um táxi. No banheiro produtos da L'Occtane.

title: Oasis en el caos
text:
Gran hotel que parece no pertenecer a NY, por su tranquilidad.
Lo recomiendo completamente.
Está muy cerca de times square y a 2 cuadras de una estación de subte que te deja en cualquier punto de la ciudad.
El desayuno es muy bueno (frutas, yogurts, cereales).
Se encuentra en una cuadra llena de restaurants.

title: Nice location, good service
text: The rooms are quaint, the bed comfortable, the property clean. But they put so much "stuff" on the tables that there is no room for our things! We could do with more place to hang towels and clothes in the bathroom. Front desk service is nice and friendly. Wifi is good.

title: Clean and spacious
text:
We stayed in a one bedroom suit and found the room to be lovely, clean and spacious (just like the photos). Our children slept on the sofa bed and found it very comfortable, and it was easy to pack away each morning so that we could have more space.
The bathroom was clean with a very large shower (no bath) and lovely l'occitane products.
The staff were helpful and friendly, especially the breakfast guy. The location is fantastic, very close to Times Square but away from the crowds. Lots of restaurants at your doorstep.
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Kalınır
text: Herşeyden önce yeri çok iyi. Times Square'in dibi. Sokakta bir çok bar ve restoran var. Odalar şehir içi otel odası kıvamı, ufacık tefecik içi dolu turşucuk. Ama temiz. Kahvaltısı Amerikan standartlarına göre güzel. Eğer gezmek için gittiyseniz ve odaya akşamdan akşama yatmaya gidiyorsanız burayı tek geçerim.

title: Ok for the price
text: Stayed in a standard room and it was clean but shabby- rip in the curtain, wood was very worn .....but the bathroom was clean and had a very large shower! The halls and elevator are not air conditioned and it was hot. The staff was great! Great location for theatre district and restaurants.

title: Boutique Small Hotel, Great Location & Service
text: Colin and his team are very accommodating, their consideration and assistance to clients is 10/10. The hotel is an older style apartment block in an excellent position in Hells Kitchen close to restaurants and Times Square. The rooms are comfortable but not luxurious but you don't pay exorbitant prices either which NY displays. Rooms are neat & clean, they are cleaned daily. Little noise from the street on the second and third levels. Breakfast offers breads, cereals, yogurts, fresh fruit & juices, coffee, boiled eggs and a range of pastries, everything you really need before venturing out for the day. Our flight wasn't until late afternoon and Colin did not hesitate to allow us to have the room until 1.00pm (normal check out 11.00am) very accommodating. I would highly recommend The French Quarters to anyone wanting a reasonably priced hotel with great customer service in a perfect position. Thanks Colin and your team for making our stay so enjoyable.

title: Great location, decent hotel
text:
Great location! 1 block from Times Square and on restaurant row. 
We had a one bedroom suite, good size, good sofa bed, good bathroom. 
Kitchenette with complementary coffee, tea, but no utensils. 
Continental breakfast was ok. Friendly staff.
Somewhat dated hotel, but compensated by location and price. Can recommend.

title: Best of everything
text: Stayed with family, 4 nights in a 2 room suite. Big rooms, lots of space, massive shower. No issues with noise which can be a problem on lower floors. Place was immaculate, air con and WiFi worked well, thank goodness as we had two teenagers. Breakfast basic but good, Kevin the breakfast guy was lovely. Location was a surprise. Was expecting times square type set up, but the area has a much more neighbourhood type vibe, with traditional walk ups and independent cafes, delis and restaurants. Amazing as it's about a 7 minute walk away from the giant corporate pandemonium of Times Square. Not low price range but that's just Manhatten. Overall a great location and a wonderful place to stay.

title: Great😁
text: Lovely hotel, friendly staff, continental breakfast, cosy room, amazing shower. Tiny in comparison with the other hotels I've stayed at in NYC, but definitely my favourite. Right in the middle of restaurant row, 2 mins from Times Square. Will definitely be staying there again.💟

title: Gem Find
text: This privately owned hotel has a lovely home from home feel. One of the owners takes time to mingle with guests at breakfast time gaining feedback and helping with places to go visit. Friendly staff,  clean atmospheric room with adequate facilities for a week'so visit. Staff are friendly and helpful.  So close to all main attractions and within easy walkingredients distance of subways for the further awayour tourist attractions. Continental breakfast was more than adequate. Loved it. Would definitely stay here again. Thank you for a great experience of NY

title: Sehr schönes Hotel
text: Sehr schönes kleines Hotel mit gutem Service. Das Zimmer war schön eingerichtet und sehr gepflegt. Im Aufenthalt war ein Frühstück inkludiert, was für amerikanische Verhältnisse nicht selbstverständlich ist. Die Lage ist perfekt unweit vom Times Square. Die Subway ist auch in unmittelbarer Nähe. Das Personal war auch sehr nett. Wir waren bereits im Februar da. Jedoch ganz klar eine Empfehlung an dieses authentische kleine Hotel.

title: Great hotel.
text: I loved this place, great location, friendly staff and spacious room. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Times square is only minutes away and being on restaurant row, amazing food is only around the corner.

title: Reasonable but not great
text:
We tried the French quarter and it's ok .
The location on restaurant row is convenient just off Times Square .
The rooms are small and there's been an attempt to make them less bland than a chain hotel .
The hotel is located above a bar and restaurant where breakfast is served . There does seem to be a constant smell of disinfectant from the bar in the morning which is a bit off putting .
The location works but you can get a slightly larger room elsewhere .
Finding a good quality good value mid range hotel in manhattan is probably an impossible mission .
The French quarter offers reasonable value but we thought you can get a slightly larger room in a not dissimilar location for a similar price .
We probably wouldn't stay there again but continue our probably futile effort to find a good quality good value hotel in manhattan .

title: Lovely hotel very near to times square
text: Was let down by a near by Airbnb two weeks before travelling, and all I can say say is thank god ! This little hotel was absolutely lovely, we had a two bedroom suites for 5 of us , plenty of room! Although very near to Times Square was very quiet, we even had a balcony! The reception staff were very helpful and breakfast staff were very friendly.nice continental breakfast. The bourbon bar and restaurant served good food and good atmosphere. Would certainly recommend staying here .

title: What A Gem! So Happy We Found This Hotel!
text: Finding a good, reasonably priced hotel in Manhattan is hard, so my wife and I were overjoyed that we found this absolutely gem just blocks from Times Square. Very clean, impressive bathrooms, and a very friendly staff. We cannot recommend this hotel enough. Delicious continental breakfast too! We'll definitely be staying here again next time we're in NYC!

title: Perfect stay
text:
Stayed here with family for a week in a two bedroom suite. The suite was lovely with two bathrooms, two double bedrooms and a kitchenette and lounge area with pull out sofa bed. The decoration was lovely and Parisian. Air con in all rooms. The beds were very comfortable and heard absolutely zero noise at nights which meant we had lovely sleeps every night.

 Lovely coffee machine for tea / coffee / hot chocolate stocked everyday and we had a bottle of prosecco in the fridge. Maid service came every day and did a great job and replaced all shampoos etc. Had a lovely balcony which caught all of the sun looking over Times Square. Staff were all so helpful and friendly !!

Breakfast was lovely ate here every day. Pastries, croissants, toast, bagels, cereals, yoghurts etc and staff serving breakfast were lovely.
The bar below the hotel (bourbon bar and grill) was great, we ate here twice - lovely food and great atmosphere !! 

Hotel is in a great location - turn right and you're basically in Times Square. 

Would recommend anyone coming to New York to stay here , absolutely perfect with no faults.  The rest of our family who stayed in other apartments/ big hotels near by were very jealous of us!!!

title: 7 dagen verbleven in prima Hotel vlakbij Times Square
text: Met m'n dochter 7 dagen in New York. Elke dag op pad. Dan is een rustig hotel, dat goed bereikbaar is met de Metro en vlakbij Times Square een uitstekende uitvalsbasis. Bediening is uitermate vriendelijk. De kamers zeer schoon. Elke ochtend een New York Times en een A4tje met de belangrijkste punten die te doen zijn in de stad. Wij hadden een kamer aan de achterkant. Daardoor erg rustig gelegen. Prima Airco. Op de kamer een koffiemachine en koelkast. Ontbijt is in het naast gelegen restaurant, dat binnendoor te bereiken is. Nog twee tips: Koop een Metro-kaart voor een week (32 Dollar), dan kun je onbeperkt reizen. Koop een Ney York City Pass waarmee je veel korting hebt op toegang tot bekende musea en attracties.

title: rustig hotel midden in Manhattan
text:
een week in dit hotel verbleven, hele fijne bedden, schone kamer en badkamer.
In alle gemakken voorzien en uiterst vriendelijk personeel.
Ontbijten kan naast het hotel, beetje weinig keus, maar dat is eigenlijk het enige minpuntje aan dit tophotel!

title: Great hotel
text: Can't recommend this place enough had a great stay in May . Great location , fab staff and very clean will definitely visit again . On 42nd st on restaurant row very central to everything. Rooms were cleaned every day and the staff couldn't be more helpful. Also the bar down stairs was lovely and always busy

title: Perfect Location
text:
A perfect location 5 minutes walk from Times Square. A small hotel overlooking a leafy street. Room was quite small but very well equipped with a kitchenette, well stocked coffee/drink machine, fridge etc and a lovely bathroom. Plenty of choice for the continental breakfast. Lovely staff. Would definitely stay here again.
Andy and Barb

title: Zentral, ruhig, Frühstück
text:
Das Hotel befindet sich oberhalb einer Bar, von der man aber nichts merkt. 
2 Blocks Richtung Osten und man ist bereits am Time Square. 
Das Zimmer war ruhig jedoch war unser Sicherheitsschloss an der Tür defekt. Das Zimmer gegenüber hatte bereits eine neue metallene Frontplatte beim Schloss...deswege -1 Abzug.
Das Frühstück ist für amerikanische Verhältnisse wirklich toll und lohnenswert. 
Werde dieses Hotel weiterempfehlen.

title: What a terrific find!
text: We stayed at the French Quarters Apartments in April and I am so happy we found this place! My niece and I were in town to take in a show and the location was a short distance from the theater. Located on a very nice block. The room was lovely and the beds were so comfortable. We had a kitchenette and a very nice bathroom. A continental breakfast was served on the mezzanine the next morning and the owner of the hotel came over to greet us. What a lovely array of breakfast items to be had! I am in the city several times a year and I will be booking a room here again!

title: Nice gem
text: Situated on 46 th street the Hotel is in walking distance from the theatre district ,and Times Square ,it's also on Restaurant Row so lots of nice places to eat ,only 27 rooms in total elevator goes down to The Bourbon street bar food is really nice there we were situated at the back of the Hotel so very quite .one of the only places to serve a continental breakfast ,eggs ,toast ,bagels,cereal ,croissant ,muffins .Also with taking the Big Bus Tour around 25 dollars the Downtown line goes to Empire State ,Macy's ,Battery Park Etc .Recommend this Hotel!

title: Disappointed
text: Dissappointed and felt duped by french quarters . Reserved a room -charged full price . Partner and I are unable to go and when asked for a refund of any amount or rearrange the stay -received cheeky email saying that I had prepaid and wounding be eligible for a refund . So basically I gave them a blank cheque

title: Best place to stay in New York
text: I loved everything about French Quarters. Traveling with a group of friends, we had one double room and one suite with it's own balcony (!!!). The rooms were all quite spacious, especially compared to other hotels in the city. The hotel was immaculate, and the staff went above and beyond for the duration of our stay. The location couldn't be better, with a short walk to Times Square, public transportation not too far, and a good selection of bars & restaurants in the area. I would absolutely stay here again. Thanks for such a great experience!

title: New York, New York
text: Viihtyisä hotelli, ystävällinen henkilökunta, aamiainen ok ja hintaan kuuluva, sijainti 46 kadulla, 8 ja 9 avenuen välissä) erittäin hyvä. Teatterialueella, mutta päivälliselle pääsi lähiravintoloihin myös ilman pöytävarauksia. Times Square vilskeineen ja metroasemineen reilun 5 min kävelymatkan päässä.

title: Great place / great location
text:
I agree with what the other good reviews report.... John, the manager is a great guy, nice continental breakfast, comfy bed, all this and that is good.  Stay here.  No worries.....

Oh, yes, and it is a quiet street only a couple of blocks from Times Square.

title: Visit ing NYC
text: We had a wonderful stay in the French Quarters,Midtown NY...kind, friendly and helpful personal were there to assist us...and John was extremely helpful when I had to sort out my credit card problems ....certainly we can recommend this hotel in NY!

title: Fourth Time Here-- Love It
text: This was my 4th time staying in this sweet little hotel and I'll be back again.  I have now stayed in a double queen room, a king room, a two bedroom suite (with balcony!), and most recently a very small room with a double bed.  The small room is prefect for one person.  All of the rooms were warm, clean, nicely decorated.   I love the Keurig coffee maker, and having a refrigerator.  You get a newspaper and daily weather/activity suggestions each morning.  The continental breakfast is available all morning in a sunny garden room.  There is always someone at the front desk, and they have been consistently gracious and helpful. There isn't a lobby lounge to speak of, and the breakfast room is part of the restaurant during the day, so if group congregating is important outside of breakfast, you'll need to do it in the restaurant bar.  Not a problem, as it is a great bar.  The location can't be beat for a tourist.  There are lots of good restaurants steps away,  it is within blocks of all of the Broadway shows, and it is just 2 blocks from the center of Times Square, though you would never know it.  The 10 blocks to Central Park makes it walkable. It feels so comfortable,I really can't imagine staying anywhere else.

title: Comfortable room and great location
text:
Upsides:
Rm 302 - large with a stuffed chair and ottoman, small desk and chair very comfortable bed and pillows. Greeted by John and shown to our room when we arrived. Found 2 complimentary small bottles of Evian in the refrigerator on our first day and by a bottle of Prosecco with a welcome note from Colin. Informative daily information sheet with NYC activities and events. Large bathroom with soft towels.  Lovely bottles of L'Occitane lotion, shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Keurig machine with many tubs of different coffees, hot chocolate, and apple cider. Complimentary continental breakfast from 7-10am with range of options with friendly and cheerful service from Kevin. Great location to walk to theatres, restaurants, Times Square, and subway. Very helpful and friendly registration staff who looked up subway routes and helped us with transportation questions.

Downsides:
No chest of drawers in room- we used the kitchen cabinets to store belongings
No microwave or pan to use on stove top
Very thin one ply toilet paper
Only a very small shelf under the mirror in the bathroom- no counter space

title: Gran hotel!
text: El hotel está muy bien ubicado. La atención del personal es excelente. El desayuno es bueno y Kevin es muy atento y servicial. Es un verdadero hotel boutique. Las habitaciones son amplias y la limpieza está acorde con el hotel.

title: Super område i Midtown af Manhatten 46e 7/8 ave
text:
Hyggeligt lille Hotel, godt placering, serviceminded personale. 
Dog meget små dobbeltsenge😇., ellers rent og pænt. 
Området er autentisk gammel New York masser af restauranter, små butikker, jazz barer etc.

title: OK
text: Great size room although really dark. It is over a bar and you can be on the first floor which we were and it was noisy. Fantastic location only 5 minutes from Times Square but I really don't understand the ratings. This is a good functional hotel but nothing special.

title: Perfect spot - close to everything in a small 1 quaint hotel
text:
Review  French quarters

We stayed at the F.Q for 5 nights in NYC and found the hotel after reseaching Trip Advisor- the way I have always booked our international and domestic travel and have never been disappointed. 

Pros-
There are many! This hotel is in Midtown and smack in the middle of everything. Its 2 mins walk to Times Square, 10 mins walk to the intrepid aircraft museum, its sits in ‘’restaurant row’ with eateries every few steps and is surrounded by theatres for live shows. You cannot top this location.

The room- 201 was small but very characterful and looked over the st on the 2nd floor, so a great viewpoint for the world outside! Ear plugs are necessary if you are a light sleeper but this would be anywhere in NYC – it is a busy city.
	
The staff are helpful in all areas. They offer a private transfer to and from the airport if you want it, but we used the supershuttle.
	
The building is small and intimate and has been well preserved. It shares with a restaurant and bar on the left side of the building.
	
Continental breakfast is included in the room rate. It has toast, boiled eggs, cereals, croissants, bagels, muffins etc. Very nice food and plentiful.
	
They deliver a complimentary newspaper every morning along with things to see and do when you are out and about. Umbrellas are also supplied, should you need them.
	
They have the Softest towels I have ever used in a hotel in 15 years of international travelling!
	
The manager Colin is present and helpful and Kevin who does the morning breakfast room is a credit to the hotel. He is also studying and said that Colin is very supportive of this – an admirable trait it in both of them. Thank you

Cons-
Very few of note. We had issues with the room being hot, but they are able to adjust the rooms temps individually.
	
The internet was really the only problem. It is extremely sketchy and we heard others saying they had the same problems. It is slow and drops off a lot. 

Overall –
You cannot beat this hotel for location, staff are great and price was better than the bigger hotels nearby. Would definitely stay again.

title: Nice hotel in the heart of Manhatten
text: Good things about the hotel is the size of room and location.  It is close to the broadway and the central park.  Also, the room was clean.  Management had a personal note welcoming greetings.  One negative, which is a big deal, is that the room that we had was right on top of the bar.  We were there Sat night and I tell you it was loud.  You need an ear plug.  To be fair to the management of the hotel, they did warn us prior to the arrival of the hotel.  It may be better during other days of the week.

title: 50th in the big apple
text:
We spent 5 nights here to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. We arrived on a Saturday evening and quickly checked in. Very friendly lady on reception explained the basics (breakfast, door lock times, 24hr reception) and showed us to our room. 
We were in the townhouse next door to the main hotel block. You access it up a few steps and is seconds away from reception. Our room was 107 and overlooked the main street. The room was large with beautiful high ceilings which added to the spacious feel. There was a lovely fireplace which came in handy for us putting up cards and keeping stuff close to hand. There was also a comfy chair and table in the window overlooking the street. The bed on first inspection seemed small but this must have been my eyes deceiving me as once you were in it there was plenty room. We'd read reports that it was noisy on the lower floors/overlooking the street. We didn't have any issues with noise during our stay.
The fridge was full size and the coffee maker was handy and always well stocked with the 'pods' and sugar, milk, sweetener etc. There was an iron and a small board as well as a hair dryer. The T.V was huge and the list of channels was handily supplied on a menu-type card. The bathroom was quite spacious with a very large shower and lovely toiletries. The towels were plentiful and fluffy. 
Breakfast is served on the mezzanine floor of the restaurant next door, to get there from our room we had to go out of the townhouse, past reception and to the lift but this was not a problem as it is literally 45 seconds away. The guy behind the bar at breakfast was really friendly and always took time to ask how we were, what we'd got planned and how we'd enjoyed the day before. He was also great for weather reports. We found the breakfast to be plentiful and tasty, bagels, breads, cereals, fruit, croissants, cakes, yogurts, jams and spreads with plenty juice, water and hot drinks. There is a toaster and we enjoyed toasted bagels every day. 
The hotel manager often popped by at breakfast time and was also friendly and able to offer advice and recommendations. 
We really loved this hotel and it's location cannot be faulted. It's basically at the end of Times Square at one side and Hells Kitchen at the other. There's loads going on on the street and surrounding streets. Easy to get to subway stops. We travelled to the hotel via the air train from JFK and then the LIRR to Penn Station. The hotel arranged our transfer back to the airport which was excellent, a bit more expensive than a cab but very comfortable and a professional driver with bottle of water and mints provided. 
We loved every minute of our stay here and would certainly recommend/return.

title: Quiet, central location - Great Service
text: We chose The French Quarters for our first NYC trip with another couple. We loved it for the location, just two blocks from the subway and within walking distance of Times Square and many great restaurants, many of which are on the same street as the hotel. The staff was extremely helpful with restaurant reservations, subway info, and also very friendly. The continental breakfast had good variety of choices. The rooms were quiet and comfortable, and the cost pretty good for NYC. One note: Our friends had an issue with being locked out of their room while we were out because another guest had requested to switch with them, and the management wanted to speak to them about it when they returned. This was a bit of an issue as we were returning to change and rush out to ticketed event. They did not want to move, and the management was fine with that and apologized for the inconvenience, but I had never experienced this before, and our friends were not very happy about it. Still, we all agreed we would return to this hotel. Good bar/restaurant adjacent.

title: Beautiful Apartments with Excellent Location and Fantastic Staff
text: Stayed for 2 nights mid april and to say we were happy is an understatement. Apts were very spacious with air con a large bathroom and also a little kitchen with hob sink and fridge. Cannot say anything bad about apartments and the staff. All very friendly and the bourbon bar attached was also great for food as well as drink. Breakfast was included in price and was plentiful. The manager made his way around to every table and asked how everything was and if people needed anything for the day ahead. Couldnt ask for a nicer place to stay. As for location..... less than 5 min walk to Times square if thats where you want to be. Highly recommended!!! Hope to be back very soon.

title: Excellent Hotel !
text: Beautiful small hotel, excellent room and extremely comfortable bed. Friendly staff and very helpful. The free breakfast is lovely and more than adequate.  Have cancelled a Hilton booking in August and booked this hotel instead .  Nice bar alongside with decent food and very close to Times Square

title: Fantastic Hotel in NYC
text:
Just recently returned from an Easter break in NYC for my wife's 30th birthday. We stayed at the French Quarters guest apartments and it was one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had. On arrival we were upgraded to a larger room which was great, the bed was enormous and really comfortable and the bathroom was nicely finished and had a really good shower.
Breakfast was included in the price which is not something that is the norm for hotels in NYC and it was great to start the day which plenty of choice. Also Kevin that serves the breakfast in the mornings is a really good guy, so chatty and makes you feel right at home. All the staff were great, really pleasant and extremely helpful with anything we needed.
The location is great too, literally just a street away from Broadway & Times Square and close to most things in midtown, there are at least 3 subway stations close by. It is so easy to get around.
The street the hotel is on is part of Restaurant Row so there are plenty of places to eat if you don't want to stray too far from the hotel.
All in all I really loved this hotel and would 100% be back the next time I visit NYC, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Super étape à NY
text:
Très bon hôtel, idéalement placé, proche d’une station de métro et de Times Square, en plein de cœur de Manhattan.
Chambre cocon, très bien équipée, décorée et confortable.
Le personnel de l’hôtel est adorable, disponible et aux petits soins.
Un gros plus, l’hôtel propose un bon petit-déjeuner varié.

title: Perfeito
text: A localização do hotel é perfeita, a 2 minutos a pé de Times Square sem levar com a confusão da mesma. O atendimento é simpático, as instalações são amplas e confortáveis e a relação qualidade preço julgo ser imbatível. O pequeno almoço pelo preço proposto também é de aproveitar.

title: Excelente
text: Excelente todo- la ubicación lleva el primer lugar, si llegas del JFK la línea E del metro te deja a tres cuadras y estas súper cerca para moverte por toda la ciudad y ni hablar de la vida nocturna en la misma cuadra encontras varios restaurantes. Pero también es un buen lugar por la comodidad de la habitación, los amenities, la atención del personal y el desayuno.

title: Best Stay in NYC!
text: The hotel is beautiful and luxurious! However it is the staff that make this place head and shoulders above the rest.  Friendly, accommodating and genuine.  They held our bags because we arrived early and wondered the City until late.  They made great restaurant recommendations and told us about opportunities to see some musicals.  I had a great conversation with the gentleman that opened the breakfast as were the only ones there at that time.  Yes, it was more expensive and yes parking is nuts!  But I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: NYC Fun
text: We had a terrific stay at The French Quarters Guest Apartments!  The rooms are a bit small, but they are decorated nicely and the rooms are very clean. The beds are very comfortable. What makes this home away from home so unique is the great customer service and location. Monica went out of her way to help us map out a meaningful visit. All of the employees were kind, helpful and attentive. We stayed in a room facing the back and street noise was minimal. The location is perfect. It is a very short walk to Times Square and the Theatre District. It is also within walking distance of Central Park, Fifth Avenue and Chelsea Market. Subway terminals are close so you can take the train and go to Ground Zero, see the Statue of Liberty or cross Brooklyn Bridge. We had a great experience and The French Quarter added to it. Additionally they are right next to a great place to eat called Bourbon Street Grill.  The only thing a little disappointing is the complimentary breakfast. Scones and muffins are dry and there are no hot choices. It is complimentary however. If you want some fruit, yogurt or a piece of toast with coffee or juice to start your day this is it. The Bourbon Street Grill next door dies serve brunch. Overall it was all great and when we come again, this is where we will stay.

title: Meraviglioso in pieno centro
text:
In realtà ho soggiornato al French Quarter in marzo 2015, ma mi ero dimenticata di recensirlo e mi dispiace perché mi ci sono trovata divinamente! 
Ero con mio marito e mia figlia ed abbiamo preso un appartamento con due camere da letto, veramente delizioso.
Si trova in pieno centro, a due passi da Time Square. Anche se sono appartamenti, comunque ogni giorno passano a pulire le stanze e a rifare i letti e lasciano un foglio con le notizie del giorno (previsioni del tempo, eventi in città ecc).
La colazione è ottima e abbondante e se non si ha voglia di uscire per pranzo o cena, basta prendere l'ascensore e scendere al piano del pub: qui potrete mangiare in maniera ottima!!!
Se/quando torneremo a NY di sicuro sceglieremo ancora il French Quarter Perchè ci siamo trovati troppo bene!!!

title: Great Location Great Room
text: We stayed here for a short trip mainly to see Hamilton. Just a block away from the venue and tons of places to eat close by. Room immaculate and really unique decor loved it. Bfast bar standard & staff very pleasant and accommodating. Our room over the rather large bar/restaurant on site, which we received several pre-mails warning us about. Packed our earplugs and slept fine with only faint drumbeat of bar music getting through. Bed very comfy although we slept with our heads at the foot of the bed as it was higher than head.  I would stay here again no question; pros way outweigh any quirks!

title: A wonderful place to stay!
text: This hotel is a MUST place for visitors to New York. Only blocks from Times Square, it is a central destination. Immaculately clean and the staff could not have been more gracious. We were leaving at 4:30am for the airport and they offered to have breakfast sent up to us. Also, the windows were so well insulated, that the street noise did not affect our sleep. I found this hotel here on Trip Advisor and the photos are all accurate. We will most certainly stay here on another trip to New York!

title: Virkelig anbefalelsværdigt
text: Vil du bo et midt i det hele, så er The French Quaters stedet. Vi boede tre veninder på et dobbeltværelse og fik et værelse ind mod gården, så var ro om natten. Lækkert badeværelse og store gode senge, med lækre hvide dyner og puder. Dejlig morgenmad - ikke det største udvalg, men lækre nyristede bagles, juice, kaffe, frugt og div yoghurter og granola. Dejligt at kunne starter morgenen her, og ikke skulle ude og finde et sted at spise. Personalet var super venlige og serviceorienterede, som sørgede for vores bagage og vores transport til lufthavnen. Området er super charmerende, med masser af små restauranter i samme gade, og i den tilhørende cafe/restaurant på hotellet var der gang i den om aftenen, og vi fik drinks en enkelt aften her. Time Square er i 5-10 min gå afstand og det samme er Subway'en. Kæmpe anbefaling fra 3 veninder i 30'erne, som nød en uge uden mænd og børn i skønne NYC.

title: Near Time Square and Great Restaurants
text: This was the first time I had been to New York City, and I was worried about cleanliness as well as safety. We booked our room through TripAdvisor. It was amazing! It was one of the best hotels I have stayed at. The staff was incredibly friendly, and they made sure that our needs were met. The breakfast staff was super nice. It was clean. The bathroom did not feel dirty like so many hotel bathrooms do. On a rainy day, employee at the front desk noticed we had only one umbrella, and they offered us a second one. Furthermore, it was within walking distance of some really good restaurants and Time Square. We walked to our Broadway play, and we walked around at night. I would definitely recommend staying here.

title: Exceeded Expectations in Every Way
text: My friend and I stayed at The French Quarters for one night during a quick trip to the city to see a show.  This is a wonderful little hotel in a great location -- a very short walk to theatres, and right in the middle of numerous excellent restaurants.  Our room was #306, in "the townhouse" which is immediately next door to the main hotel lobby.  This portion of the hotel does not have an elevator, but that was fine with us.  Our reward for walking up those 2 flights was a lovely high-ceiling room with 2 large windows overlooking the street, 2 double beds, exposed brick walls, tasteful decoration, a small sitting area and a large, beautiful bathroom.  There was a keurig coffee maker and refrigerator with a couple of complimentary water bottles.  We were surprised by how quiet it was at night -- unlike another reviewer, we experienced no difficulty sleeping.  The staff was unerringly friendly, helpful and professional.  Breakfast (included) was a standard continental offering, but just right for our needs -- perfect for a couple of cups of coffee, some juice and a light bite.  We will definitely return to this hotel.  Location, cleanliness, charm, service and overall value were exceptional.

title: Quick Overnight Stay
text:
I actually live in New York and my parents and brother were in for the evening and got a hotel because my apartment is too small to fit everyone. They invited me to stay with them for the night and I accepted because the hotel is 10 minutes from my office. 

If you're looking to spend most of your time in the Midtown/Times Square area this is a perfect location. Great place for first timers vising the city because it's right by all of the touristy stuff you want to see (Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Bryant Park). It's between 8th & 9th Avenues so it's just far enough away from the noise of Times Square but close enough to walk to everything in that area. I've seen a few comments about the noise levels overnight and it's not that bad. Your typical NYC street noise and sirens however, I've lived here for 4 years so I'm a bit used to it. The hotel is quite small so the noise is unavoidable on any of the floors because you won't be high enough to escape. 

NYC hotels always worry me, especially in this area (bedbugs!) but the hotel is perfectly clean and very cute. Definitely a boutique style. The bathroom was the best part, all tile and very French New Orleans styled. 

The beds were nothing to write home about but were fine for one night. My parents checked out the free breakfast in the AM and said it was nice and that the attendant was very friendly. 

This hotel would be best suited for 1) First time NYC visitors 2) A quick overnight stay 3) If you're attending a Broadway show because all of theaters are within 10 minutes walking distance. 

Don't stay here if 1) You've been to New York several times and want a more authentic and less touristy area 2) You hate Times Square

Overall, great for one night and would stay again if I somehow ever get locked out of my apartment. My parents really enjoyed it.

title: Lovely hotel, great location.
text: We stayed here prior to running the NYC marathon. On arrival, our room was upgraded - it was lovely, clean comfortable and well equipped. Staff were friendly, professional and knowledgeable. Breakfast was very good, a wide choice and plenty of it. The only downside was the noise from the bar below keeping us awake - ear plugs helped ! All in all, a great hotel in a superb location 😊

title: Great stay
text: First stay at French Quarters and hope to return soon. 2 br...room 502...was perfect and quiet. Great service, friendly staff, helpful suggestions on where to eat and best way to get around town. Location cannot be beat. We spent 4 nights and wanted to stay more.

title: Not What I Expected from the Reviews
A great find
text: Affordable and PERFECT location in the middle of it all. Room is large and beds are comfortable. Excellent service- even provided umbrellas for the rainy day. Breakfast is ample with lots of choices. Would certainly return for a future NYC trip!

title: Good location for first time visit
text: Hotel is near the theaters and 2 blocks from Time's Square. On 'Restaurant Row" so many, many choices of great restaurants. Service here was friendly, nice bathroom, but zero counter space which was very unusual for a hotel - pedestal sink. Hotel room used some valuable space for a cooktop and kitchenette sink and kitchen storage, but no kitchenware, weird and poor use of space. Would have been much nicer if there were a dresser or better space to unpack luggage. We were worried about noise, but room on floor 2 was very quiet, overall a good value.

title: Restaurant District!
text: Super home-like feeling at this quaint Apartment/condos.  Walking distance to Times Square with lots of restaurants to stop at in between.  Fair prices and excellent service on all.  Love to nice walk off Time Square but yet close to get there when you want.  Loads of places to stop and shop and eat.  Apartment front door just needs work on closing a little less noisy.

title: Excellent apartments in a great location
text: Spent 5 nights here in mid March and loved the place. Decorated in a New Orleans style, it's attached to the Bourbon Bar and Grill on West 46th St, also known as Restaurant Row. The room was spacious and spotless, particularly the bathroom, which had a walk-in shower. The staff were all helpful and polite to a fault. The breakfast was a basic continental breakfast, so if you want something cooked, you would have to go elsewhere. We generally couldn't fault the place though and would highly recommend these apartments.

title: Excelente
text:
Hotel com quarto rico em conforto , assessorias de qualidade , limpeza impecável e muito conforto 
Extremamente bem localizado , perto de tudo , da pra fazer tudo a pé 
Recepção atenciosa e gentil
Bar no subsolo estilo pub muito agradável 
Ao lado de feirinha com produtos bem interessantes 
Café da manhã estilo americano mas bem aceitável

title: Loved Our Stay
text: The French Quarters was a great place to stay for our family.  We chose this due to location and reviews of previous guests.  We were welcomed the friendly staff and enjoyed a delightful 2-day stay.  The rooms were spacious by NYC standards, clean and inviting.  The breakfast was a nice continental with many selections of baked goods, yogurt, fruit, coffee and juices.  We whole-heartedly recommend the French Quarters as a great place to stay in a smaller location for a personable experience.

title: Good location and friendly staff
text: On west 46th street, location is great for shows and there's many bars right on the street as well. The bourbon bar that's next door is a good time and friendly, although you will hear the bar if you're on the first couple floors.  The rooms are normal size for NY, comfortable, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. All in all would probably stay again if going to a show

title: A little taste of Europe
text: It felt like a cute hotel in Europe. The gal at the front desk was the most helpful person, showing me my room and pointing out the features. She also gave me some awesome restaurant advice. It's a perfect location if you want to be near all of the theatres. I did pick a cheaper room above the bar which indeed is a bit noisy, but I can't deduct from my review since I was warned. The bed was comfortable so I was able to sleep well. I would not hesitate to stay again!!

title: Avis partagé ...
text:
Points positifs :
- Localisation (2 minutes de Time Square, rue animée)
- Bar-Restaurant de l'hôtel très sympa, on y mange très bien
- Personnels très accueillant
- Salle de bain fonctionnelle, sèche cheveux, planche et fer à repasser si besoin
- Lit très confortable, rien à dire
- Je conseille aussi le restaurant "Brazil" qui est sur la même rue, on y mange remarquablement bien !

Points Négatifs :
- Attention l'hôtel s'appelle "The French Quarter" mais aucun du personnels parlent Francais
- Problème de connexion Wifi
- Problème d'isolation Intérieur de l'hôtel et  Extérieur : beaucoup de bruit ce qui est embêtant quand on cherche du calme et surtout quand l'on souhaite dormir 
- Pas de coton tige dans la salle de bain
- Il y a une kitchenette dans la chambre mais aucune casserole dans les placards

Donc nous sommes partagés, si c'était a refaire nous irions ailleurs.

title: Friendly, helpful staff
text: We had a two bedroom apartment for a week. From the moment we arrived we were made feel welcome by friendly and helpful staff. The layout was conducive to a very comfortable stay. And the location is the best of the four times I've stayed in New York. Real value for money.

title: One night stay
text: I was there one night. It really is close to everything! Perfect and surprisingly quiet for its location. Be ready everything is expensive nearby. But with the price of this hotel, it helps to splurge a little. I would stay here again.

title: Cute hotel, good location
text:
We had a great stay here during our week long holiday in New York. The bedroom was clean and comfy with a nice modern bathroom. We would have liked more cupboard/ wardrobe space. A few nights were a bit noisy with sounds of music and people from a bar but nothing too awful. We came in the freezing winter and the hotel was always warm. 
Breakfast was basic and self-served but was perfect for us. 
The staff were very friendly and helpful. 
A nice touch was the daily newspaper and the hotel's own overview of the weather and things to do each day in the city, delivered to the room each morning.

title: OMG!!!!
text: What an amazing place to stay, from the moment we arrived we felt a warmth and welcome we did not expect. Our room was absolutely beautiful and was kept stick and span for our whole visit -8 nights. The staff at the hotel were wonderful with a special mention to Kevin at the breakfast servery who was attentive and super friendly greeting us each morning with a great big smile. Colin, the manager/owner was so lovely with a chat each morning and advice and info on fun things to do in the city. Other guests in the hotel were friendly we met an amazing lady who we will be friends with for a long time I am sure. The location of the French Quarters is a hop, skip and jump away from Times Square and some top Broadway theatres, not to mention the restaurants within minutes of your front door. I would highly recommend this establishment to any and all looking for great place to stay in New York, and hopefully I will get a chance to visit again.

title: Great find in the Theatre District
text: Excellent location on Restaurant row and Theatre District.  The staff is beyond accomodating and our room was even better than expected.  The breakfast offered a large variety including New York bagels.

title: Brilliant
text: We stayed here for 5 nights as a group of five with kids aged 21, 18 and 14. We were lucky to have room with terrace on the fifth floor that gave us an amazing view straight out of a movie plus we had very little if any noise from the street below. The rooms were fine for all of us with ample space and the sofa bed is a good size so our 14 and 21 old boys used this with no complaint!! Bathroom very clean and large sized shower as well. The staff here are just fantastic particularly John the front desk manager and Kevin in the breakfast restaurant who should be employed by New York tourist board he is just such a nice guy and really informative. Good wifi in rooms and breakfast was very good with good range of cereals, pastries, fruits, yogurts and drinks, just what we needed before a day of walking around nyc. Location is very good with loads of nice restaurants and American diners close by. Highly recommended.

title: Wonderful stay at French Quarters NYC! Will be back for sure!
text: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend and were very pleased with everything! Upon arrival, Monica was able to check us in early and gave us plenty of pointers and info for the subway and tourist spots we wanted to see. That was very helpful! The room was charming and spacious. Mini fridge, electric cooktop, Keurig, free wi-fi, complimentary Evian and plenty more. The complimentary continental breakfast was a nice treat too. Monica, John and all the other staff members that we met were all very nice and accommodating. We will be back again and will recommend to anyone we know going into the city. THANK YOU!!

title: A Personal Touch in the Big Apple
text:
We spent 2 nights at this location last week.The staff allowed us to check in about 2 hours early, which we really appreciated. Upon requesting a microwave oven, it was delivered promptly. The staff was very friendly and eager to answer any questions we had. Our room was very quiet as it was on the side and we stayed during the week.We heard that some rooms will hear the music from the bar/restaurant below on Thursday-Saturday nights so check on this if you stay on the weekend. 
The breakfast buffet was nicely laid out, had a good variety of items, and was never crowded. The location is on restaurant row so there are plenty of dining choices nearby. Broadway/Times Square is just a stone's throw away and the nearest subway stop is 4 blocks away. The staff really makes this place special as they ensure your needs are met and are easy to talk to.  
We will be back, especially if we can secure a competitive rate again through Booking.com

title: Quiet, comfortable, and affordable hotel in the heart of the theater district!
text: A friend and I stayed here for three nights in February 2017, and had the most marvelous time.  The hotel was located within easy walking distance of every Broadway show, Times Square, great restaurants and bars, and several subway stops.  In spite of the general hustle and bustle of the neighborhood, though, we found it easy to get a great night's sleep due to the excellent soundproofing and comfortable beds.  The staff was friendly and attentive, and took great care to make sure that our stay was as pleasant as possible.  Rooms were spacious and immaculately clean, the complimentary breakfast was tasty and plentiful, and we both found ourselves wishing that we could extend our stay in order to continue enjoying our wonderful find in the midst of New York's most exciting neighborhood. I simply can't say enough good things about the French Quarters--we will definitely be back!

title: European charm in NYC!
text: Book your stay now!  This charming hotel is located in the prime spot of Hells Kitchen and Restaurant Row as well as being just a few short blocks from Time Square. The rooms were comfortable and beautiful as well as incredibly clean.  Breakfast was included which was a wonderful addition.  But, the best part about this wonderful hotel was the staff, namely John at the front desk.  He took us under his wing and gave us great suggestions and guidance for our first time in New York.  He was absolutely one of the highlights of our trip.  We will definitely plan on staying there again, the next time we are in town.

title: Boutique hotel near Time Square
text: Terrific location near Time Square, Broadway theaters, restaurants.  Some rooms are great others can be small and obstructed by pillars, so make sure what you're getting.  The staff was very helpful.  The big reason to consider this location: its near everything and there is a feel of serenity amidst the hustle and bustle of the city.

title: Love thisxhotel
text: Great location, price and staff!! My favorite place to stay in New York City!! Can't say enough good things about this place! So helpful, friendly, accommodating! Nice atmosphere! Great breakfast!! Love love love it!!

title: Brilliant Hotel and Location.
text: A lovely little hotel down restaurant row and within a 10 minute walk of Times Square. The room was immaculate and was like having our own apartment in New York. Breakfast is very good for what you pay and the staff very helpful and friendly. Only downside was that the bar/restaurant next door played their music very loud and not just inside it was played out onto the street. Didn't affect going to sleep as we were shattered from exploring all day.

title: Terrific location near Times Squares in Hells Kitchen
text: This is a very small hotel with a single person attending the small reception area, but both people we talked to were extremely helpful.  The room was comfortable and quiet with the added bonus of having a compact refrigerator and two burners to heat food.  It was great to get a container of soup from one of the local delis and eat it later.  We had an evening flight from JFK and made arrangements for a day rate so we could continue to use the room while we toured the city.  It made a great deal of difference in being relatively alert when we arrived in Ireland the next morning. With cooking options and an included continental breakfast we felt it was an excellent value, and we particularly liked its unique New Orleans décor.

title: Hermoso!
text:
Esta muy bien ubicado, las habitaciones son muy confortables, cuentan tambien con una cafetera. Es de estilo frances y siempre esta todo muy limio.
Tiene una terraza vidriada donde sirven el desayuno. El personal es muy amable y algunos hablan español. Es una muy buena opcion!

title: Couldn't have stayed in a better place!
text:
I have just stayed at this hotel. I chose it after reading all the good reviews it has in TripAdvisor. So, off I went. The rooms were amazing, my family and I had two rooms, a very big one (402) which has 2 bedrooms and a small kitchen and living room and room 304 which had two double beds. We loved both, beautifully decorated, wonderful and very comfortable beds and linen and excellent L'occitane amenities in the bathrooms. The staff were wonderful, my big thank you for John which was of much help and very welcoming (it looked like he was the owner himself, besides he was not) so careful and willing to help he was. And also to Rafael, of of the guys from the breakfast. He was really nice and helpful. Unfortunately I did not take notes of the woman from housekeeping, she was also amazing.
Another excellent point is the fact that the hotel is very well located, it is a 2 minute walk  from Times Square and 15 from Central Park. Which means that all the good parts of the city are very close. 
Congratulations and keep doing the good work.

title: Best Kept secret - shhhhh
text: Fabulous location and very convenient to great restaurants and shows. Very close to Times Square. Ample size rooms, lovely decor, spacious bathroom and extremely courteous staff!! Breakfast was included but we had to leave early, very sorry about that - was anticipating good things. Restaurant attached is Bourbon Street Cafe - also wonderful - save room for the Pecan Pie!!

title: Our new favorite spot!
text: Very impressed by the staff, mgr. John, very hospitable. Extremely clean and very convenient to theaters, restaurants, especially Bourbon Street, (adjoining), nice continental breakfast included. Closest thing to NOLA that I've seen.  Will go back when going back to NYC.

title: New York City weekend!
text: This was a great place to stay.  Had everything we needed and the suite was very spacious!  We could walk to most everything and if needed the subway was nearby  to hop on.  They left a bottle of champagne in our room as a welcoming gift! Continental breakfast was included.  Would stay here again and the staff was great!!

title: Very nice spot in NY
text:
I would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff is very nice and they are happy to accommodate your request (for example they had a bigger room available and they gave it to us without extra charges). The rooms are beautiful and the bathrooms are very spacious. I would definitely recommend it.
The location is also great! It is in the heart of NY at five minutes walk from time square and it is surrounded by great restaurants.
Only side note: the breakfast quality (and choice) is very low and not adequate to the high standard of the hotel.

title: Excellent with Terrific Service, Great Location and Value for money
text: My fiance and I stayed for 5 days here after having been two weeks in Orlando. Well what can i say. First of all we chose a fantastic  hotel. In fact its more then a hotel its a boutique guest apartments with 150% service by all the staff who cannot help you enough. The rooms are perfect, the beds are so comfortable and large with Wifi, TV and a hot drinks maker i.e tea, coffee, sink, fridge and ironing board and iron. The bathroom is of high quality spec with a large shower area and plenty of towels.  It adjoins a grill and bar which is where you go for the continental breakfast. We was shown to our room by the desk manager and also where breakfast is served and facilities in our room.  The manager was so helpful and every morning we would see him , tell him where we would like to go and provided us with recommendations, maps, routes etc, which really helped for our days out. The locations is just so perfect, its in a picturesque area with lots of different restaurants but also way from the hustle and bustle of Times Square however it is a 5min walk away. It was always so nice to come back to after a busy day out and relax in the room or go for a drink at the bar adjoining it. Its a wonderful, well managed, excellent hotel / guest apartments where i will definitely visit again and recommend.

title: worth for the money you pay
text: Great place! Excellent location near to Times  Square, subway, bus terminal and many interesting places. At the hotel,  all the staff was really friendly and the room was very well equipped. My expectations were completely satisfied and I hope to come back again.

title: Parfait
text: Le séjour de rêve vraiment magnifique ils parlent français car notre anglais et très limité mais vraiment super grand hotel petit déjeuné américain en chambre très luxueux près de tout et surtout du Metro je reviendrai

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel! Great Location!
text: Stayed here one night, 12/27.  Visit the city often and first time staying in Hell's Kitchen.  Location is perfect, easy walk to Central Park, close to great restaurants and bars and easy to get to from Grand Central, Bus Terminal or Penn Station.  Room was fantastic! Very cozy, the brick wall was a very nice touch.  The bathroom is huge for a NYC hotel with great L'occitaine products.  The staff is top notch, very accommodating.  Room has frig, two burner stove, safe, free wifi and Keurig coffee machine.  We will definitely stay here again!

title: Excelente Hotel
text: Hotel muito bem localizado em uma rua cheia de excelentes restaurantes. Os funcionários do hotel são bastante atenciosos, principalmente o Kevin. O quarto do hotel possui camas confortáveis e excelente ducha. Ressalto que já me hospedei por duas vezes no mesmo hotel.

title: Charming with Terrific Service, Value & Location
text: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our 3-night stay for our anniversary the week before Christmas. The French Quarters is a precious oasis in the hustle and bustle of NYC. A 15-minute walk from Penn Station, just blocks from Times Square, Broadway Shows, subway and terrific restaurants steps away in any direction. The staff - front desk, maintenance, late-night, wait staff - were so accommodating, friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed getting to know the General Manager, Colin. He was even able to check my husband in a day early when his flight was rescheduled. We stayed in the beautiful 5th floor suite with private balcony / patio. Spotlessly clean, charming European-inspired decor, super comfy king-sized bed, well-appointed kitchenette (mini fridge, cook top, Keurig) large bathroom with walk-in shower (great water pressure), flat screen TVs in every room, lots of closets. It was spacious, comfortable and quiet – Definitely not your typical hotel room. Loved the staff's roster of local activities and weather report slipped under our door with the newspaper each morning. The breakfast at the adjacent Bourbon Street Bar & Grille was delicious and we also enjoyed drinks and dinner there before catching a show. We loved our meals at the Playwright Celtic Pub (Traditional Irish), Galaxy Diner (Greek), Yuri Sushi (Japanese take out), Yum Yum Too (Thai), and there's a great wine market (Vinter Wine Market) just down the street. There's a reason this boutique hotel gets such great reviews and is listed in the top 15 of ALL the hotels in NYC. This was our second time here and is now our go-to place to stay in NYC.

title: New Year in NYC
text: We stayed in this apartment/hotel for 2 nights on arrival from UK before heading up state for New Year's Eve. The staff are very friendly and helpful, especially Kevin in the breakfast room and the rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated to provide a Manhattan stay with a difference. So how much did we rate it? Well we cancelled our booking at another Manhattan hotel and reserved a room for another three nights for the remainder of our stay. Thoroughly recommend this place and it is of course perfectly located for the theatres and mid-Manhattan.

title: We'll be back! Highly recommended!
text:
What a fantastic place to stay, we loved it! Location is brilliant surrounded by restaurants & just a few minutes walk from times square.

Room was spacious, clean & extremely well equipped with coffee maker etc, huuuuuge comfy bed, plenty of storage in the room & lots of towels in the bathroom. Room cleaned daily and every day we received the paper & had a little newsletter with things to see & do locally listed along with the weather which was brilliant.

Staff all extremely helpful & chatty, Jonathan welcomed us on our first day & gave us a map, free WiFi password also printed off our tickets for the basketball from the reception desk for us (thank you!). The breakfast every morning was lovely, huge variety of food & Kevin was always there smiling asking us how our previous day had been & what we had planned for that day, helping us out often suggesting places & things to do etc - he's great! There was a young lady on the front desk in the night when we were leaving who arranged for our taxi to the airport to come a little earlier which we really appreciated, again really helpful & friendly - sorry we didn't catch your name. They looked after our luggage for our last day after we checked out as our flight wasnt until 21.30 which was really helpful too.

Everything you wanted was catered for & we felt really at home here. When we visit New York again, which I'm sure we will, we'll definitely be staying here! Thank you all for a great visit.

title: What a Gem!
text: My husband and I spent the night during Christmas week.  Wonderful boutique hotel with friendly and knowledgeable staff especially Colin, the General Manager.  Easy check in and out and clean and nicely decorated rooms.  I love the toile! Very nice continental breakfast in the lovely enclosed rooftop deck.  Even stored our luggage so that we could tour the sights in NYC after check out.  Will certainly return to this oasis in NYC!

title: Everything is clean and new.
text: We stayed for one night in a remodeled king room.Me and my friends stayed at this hotel and we all loved it .  I can safely say that I have finally found the perfect hotel.The situation is perfect.....

title: A Piece of Europe in NYC
text: This was a fabulous boutique hotel.  We only stayed one night but would have loved to stay longer.  Our room was a double-double on the third floor.  Stairs were narrow so take that into consideration when you're booking if that will be a concern for you, you can request a room with an elevator.  Right in the middle of Restaurant Row and a short walk to theater district, Central Park, etc.  More restaurant choices on 9th so you certainly won't lack for food!  The room was spacious for two people, gorgeous brick walls, fireplace, furnishings, pillows, you name it.  Nice large shower.  Stored our bags after checkout so we picked them up on our way back home.  Everyone we dealt with was very pleasant.  Our room was in the back so absolutely no noise at all.  Looking forward to returning!

title: Great Find Within the Hustle & Bustle
text:
I spent a night in the two bedroom suite and was pleasantly surprised! The "lobby" is tiny-basically just a front desk-but the staff was friendly and welcoming. Our suite was spacious-a kitchenette with a small stove top, kuerig coffee maker, sink etc. living room features a flat screen tv, sleeper sofa and desk-one bedroom had a queen bed (I believe I don't think it was a king) and the other bedroom had a double bed.
