The beds were super comfy with top of the line linens. Both bedrooms had their own flat screen tvs. The bathroom included  a large walk in shower, L'Occitante toiletries and plush towels. The suite features a lovely patio/balcony with a table and chairs-perfect for enjoying the lights from Times Square. 
The location is perfect-easy walking to Times Square, The theater district, Rockefeller Center and subway stations-and located on the same street as restaurant row. 
We didn't make it down in time for breakfast-but it sounded like a nice way to start the day. 
I would recommend the French Quarter to anyone looking for a quiet, smaller, upscale hotel within the hustle & bustle of midtown without the noise and crowds of the larger hotels.

title: Muy bonito!!
text:
Es un lugar precioso. Las personas que trabajan ahí son muy amables y simpáticas, muchas de ellas hablan español, lo que es algo bueno.
Todo muy limpio, buen desayuno, la habitación bonita y está ubicado en una posición privilegiada, cerca de Times Square y Broadway. En la esquina venden unos desayunos muy buenos por si no te levantas antes de las 10, que es el límite para el desayuno. 
Muy recomendado!!

title: Fabulous Find
text: My daughter and I stayed her for 5 days,our first time in New York.We found the staff do helpful and courteous.The location was do central and we felt very safe.The breakfast was nice and again staff so helpful.We were upgraded to a two bedroom room after booking a standard room which was a lovely gesture.Would definitely go again if visiting New York.

title: Charming hotel with Great Location
text: We loved our stay at the French Quarters. It was conveniently located very near amazing restaurants, entertainment, and shopping.  The room was charmingly decorated and large for Manhattan. The staff was friendly and helpful.  We enjoyed the restaurant which had good appetizers and drinks after a long day walking the city.  We would definitely stay again.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Great location (close to Times Square, but no too close); comfy beds; friendly staff; almost shared space with the Bourbon Street Bar and Grill.  A piece of the 'big easy' in the 'big apple'.  Reasonably priced for New York City.  Within walking distance of a lot of things.

title: First time to NYC
text: French Quarters was a great find! Room was spacious for three adults, charming, clean and quiet. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom was a good size as well. Fantastic location on restaurant row and an easy walk to Times Square. A yummy breakfast spread was included. Loved the cosy sports bar attached. Being first time visitors we found the staff provided helpful advice and directions. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Exceeded my expectations!
text: I brought my sister and niece to NYC to celebrate my sister's 50th birthday and their expectations were high as it was their first visit to the city. They were not disappointed! We were all so very pleased with our stay at the French Quarters. We appreciated the friendly greetings each time we walked in the front door. Front desk staff were genuinely helpful and kind. Then they upgraded my reservation and gave us a suite so we ended up having separate bedrooms and a walk out balcony. The room was super clean, well-appointed, comfortable and attractive. We will return! and I can hardly wait!

title: Très bon emplacement
text:
L hôtel est situé dans une petite rue à 400 mètres de Time Square.
Personnel très agréable et disponible.
Chambre et salle de bain plutôt grandes Avec une petite cuisine.
Petit déjeuner copieux.
Je le recommande car les prix sont corrects Pour NYC.

title: Susan
text:
Stayed at the French Quarters for 3 nights prior to a carribean cruise . Absolutely loved staying here a great little hotel in a great location. The room we had was quite small but the bathroom large in  comparison nice walk in shower. Great coffee maker  with loads of choice on coffee.
This hotel is so very friendly , they go out of their way to make sure you are happy, nothing is to much trouble for them whether it's booking a car or trip they even help you taking your luggage outside to a taxi.
They really have customer service down to a fine art.
Defiantly will stay again if I go back to New York .

title: BIRTHDAY WEEKEND GETAWAY
text: awesome room, great view, great staff. we loved our room we will definitely be back for another stay. we arrived a few hours early and the front desk kept our bags and had them waiting for us in our room.cant wait to visit again

title: Absolutely Fantastic Hotel
text: From check in to private car pick up everything was great.  We were shown to our room it was a double double, it was the only room available and wanted to stay here so we took it.  Room was quite spacious, 2 double beds a large tv with lots of channels. Small kitchen with a coffee maker and lots of pods, 3 varieties of coffee, hot chocolate, tea and hot apple cider, plenty of milk sachets in the fridge. Free WiFi and a port for wired internet at the desk, the bathroom was very spacious with toiletries, Delivery of a daily newspaper and news sheet of what to do every day.  Our room was 203 at the front of the hotel we did not have much noise from the street or the bar down stairs. Breakfast is in the upstairs bar area lots to choose from you won't go hungry from bagels, cereals. toast, boiled eggs, fruit and pastries. Coffee, teas and juice.  Staff are very friendly and cannot do enough for you. I printed out the wrong thing for our New York pass and could not collect it i got my daughter to email  our confirmation to the hotel and they printed it out. want to know where to go and how to get there - they even gave us a map and showed us the best way to get there showing the sights.  There are loads of restaurants and bars in the area no need to eat in the same place twice cheaper on 9th ave to eat.  Asked how to get to the airport they ordered us a private car which was great a little more expensive ($72 + tip) than the taxi but it was a luxury suv like an armchair ride. He got us to the airport in about an hour at rush hour cannot remember his name but if you ask the hotel I;m sure they will tell you.  Would recommend but don't tell too many people as I don't want it fully booked when we next go,

title: Another great visit!
text: This is my third or fourth stay at the French Quarters Guest Apartments. I try to stay here for all my business trips to NYC. My most recent stay was a multi-purpose trip with both time for work and for visiting family and friends, so my toddler came with me! I have been repeatedly amazed by the quality of my experience at this hotel. It gives you the feeling of being entertained at the home of gracious hosts who've thought of everything. That was even more true on this trip; it meant so much to me that the management and staff went out of their way to make my child's visit so comfortable and enjoyable. My little one had a wonderful time enjoying the city views from our room, running through the hallways, and eating breakfast in the dining room--with its unique combination of Mardi Gras and holiday decor. Sending a big thank you to everyone there!

title: Great Find
text: This is a wonderful small hotel in a convenient location. It includes a continental breakfast, which is unusual in New York. It is VERY well kept and clean. Parking is a block away at a discounted rate that is also reasonable for New York. We stayed in one of the small standard rooms on the second floor. The regular room are larger. The shower was huge and the bathroom and room were reasonable size for two. The only downside of a room on the second floor in the front of the building is at times it can be slightly noisy at night. The restaurant in the hotel has a nice (and reasonable) creole menu.We will definitely stay there again the next time we are in New York.

title: Excelente
text:
Limpio, cómodo, seguro, original, muy buen desayuno. 
El diseño es tipo francés, tiene café y todo lo necesario para el baño. Es pequeño pero me encantó. Hagan la prueba del colchón, está muy cómoda la cama.

title: Nobody does it better
text:
Great location on restaurant row. The 'Anne' room was a little small but we didn't care.We'd go out all day and come back to recharge before heading out to dinner and a show(always within walking distance). The staff was the best. It gets a little noisy at night (Thu through Sat) and I'd recommend staying on the 3rd floor or higher.On the other hand you are usually so tired you have a tendency to ignore the sometime noise. I prefer this very personable kind of lodging versus a chain hotel. There is a nice gathering area for the continental breakfast and a good spot to compare notes and meet fellow travelers. Subways to everywhere are within walking distance and unlike previous trips we never used a cab once!
If you prefer a smaller establishment with a very attentive staff then this is the place for you, as it was for us. I have a suspicion we'll return again and again.

title: Outstanding Small Hotel
text: Lovely centrally located hotel with very comfortable bed, walk in shower, internet, and outstanding staff ready to help in all areas. The breakfast was better than most. Pricing reasonable at the Priceline discount. On restaurant row.  I can't recommend it highly enough A minor repair was taken care of within an hour.

title: Just book
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights, in late October, in a 2 bedroom suite. As a family of 4, with older children who prefer to sleep in separate bedrooms to their parents, this suited us much better, than typical hotel rooms with a couple of double beds. Twin beds in the 2nd bedroom would have been even better (brother and sister really don't like sharing) but otherwise, it's ideal for a family. Be warned that the lift is very slow though!

The accommodation is very clean and comfortable and we welcomed the extra space of having a suite after exhausting days of exploring the city. Our room was well serviced each day - and our favourite complimentary coffee and hot chocolate pods were observed and replenished. The bathroom is small but perfectly functional.

All the staff were very pleasant and the manager made a point of chatting with guests over breakfast one morning. The complimentary continental breakfast gets the day off to a good start with plenty of choice of yoghurts, cereals, breads and pastries, and hard boiled eggs.

The outstanding feature of this property though is location, location, location. You can walk to so many places from here, and so easily. And if the subway is more your thing, it's right between 42nd and 50th St subway stations. It's particularly well located for accessing the theatre district including the many restaurants in the area, and we felt very safe wandering around the area at night.

I wouldn't hesitate to return. Finding a boutique hotel like this is always so much nicer than staying in an informal chain hotel.

title: Excellent
text: Fantastic little hotel in a great location with the best beds, great showers and fantastic staff. Have stayed there for the last 4 years and it's been consistently just a wonderful stay. Lovely spot whether as a couple, group or family..

title: Perfect boutique hotel in theater district
text: This was such a perfect place. Convenient to all theaters, right on restaurant row. I can't imagine a nicer place at such a reasonable price. Breakfast buffet (continental )  was good. Room was spotless, bed huge and comfortable. Staff was fantastic all around. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Make your stay in NYC memorable.
text: What a wonderful experience as well as location at The French Quarters! Walking distance from most points of interest we were interested in. True experience of life in the city. Understanding room size is determined by cost, this was certainly adequate and very charming. Nice breakfast provided. Couldn't have expected more.

title: One of the best hotels Ive stayed in.
text: Mum had booked this hotel for 6 of us to stay in. we booked into 2 rooms (3 guest in each room) and from the moment we stepped inside to reception we knew we booked the right place to stay. staff were very helpful and friendly and loved to make conversations with their guests. none of it felt forced or fake. Breakfast was just right with choices of toast, bagels, muffins, fruit and yogurt. and the young man who was there to help serve was very friendly and made conversation with everyone who entered the room. I believe his name was Kevin. ideal distance from everything you need and it was so quiet in the rooms to think that you were in the heart of New York. please consider this hotel if you are visitng the city.

title: Great place to stay in the heart of New York
text:
The final destination on our trip, handed back the rental car after driving through Brooklyn and Manhattan we checked into this little gem on 46th Street West. 
We loved it here.... A small but immaculate apartment... Quirky and well kitted out! Great style and warm and cosy even in January with a great coffee machine (it did hot chocolate too!). 
The reception staff were all cheery and helpful. 
Breakfast was good and we liked being able to take it back to the room so we stayed nice and warm! 
Location-wise it was perfect for us to explore New York.... We walked to most of the sights... Only had to get the underground a couple of times. 
This place comes highly recommended for value and quality - so much nicer than staying in a run of the mill hotel chain. Love love loved it! 
We actually stayed 4th-8th January 2015 (it won't let us go that far back!)

title: Amazing!   Shhhh keep it a secret!
text:
The French Quarters is amazing. Location couldn't be better - a short walk to Times Square and theatres. It is surrounded by restaurants, and there is a wonderful restaurant right there. Spotlessly clean, friendly staff, cozy nice sized rooms with beautiful brick walls, tall ceilings and black mouldings. Beautiful washrooms with walk in showers made of lovely tile work, luxurious linens, "just right" breakfast, in-room coffee and upgraded electrical and electronics.  When we checked out, the lady offered me an umbrella as it was raining!  
     Many reviews mention the noise however our stay on Monday and Tuesday night were very quiet. 
    This is definitely my no.1 hotel in New York. No other place will do.  Once you've stayed there, you won't mind the price.

title: A very lucky find
text: A great hotel in a great location. Extremely friendly, helpful staff, excellent breakfast, clean and comfortable room.  Felt very safe. A huge choice of restaurants in the street, and we had a good evening meal in the hotel itself. Highly recommended.

title: Would I stay here again? Absolutely!
text: What a fantastic hotel! If you are looking for four star luxury then this hotel is probably not for you. However, what it does offer is great value, comfortable, spacious (by NY standards) and spotlessly clean accommodation. The complimentary coffee making facilities and L'Occitane toiletries in the bathroom were welcomed. The daily newspaper and day sheet were also appreciated. The continental breakfast was very good with a selection of cereals, bagels, pastries and fruit etc. The staff are a credit to the hotel and were all friendly and helpful without exception. Oh and did I mention the great location? Situated on Restaurant Row between Times Square and Hells Kitchen it is within easy walking distance of all the main tourist attractions.

title: super séjour
text:
Hôtel à taille humaine avec personnel sympa, le tout à deux pas de Time Square.
Petit déjeuner en buffet, céréales, fruits, laitages, bagels... et le café noir est bon.
La chambre est spacieuse et la salle de bain est top avec des produits de l'Occitane.
Je recommande fortement cet hôtel

title: Best kept secret in NYC
text: Looked last minute for a hotel near Theater district. Outrages prices. Happened onto this "Boutique Hotel" and was amazed. Most hotels looked plain like a Holiday Inn or similar but this little gem looks like a beautiful flat in Paris. Free breakfast, great location, right on Restaurant Row, comfortable beds. It's a must if you're coming to NYC.

title: Ótima localização
text: Muito bom. Localizado praticamente na times square, mas tb silencioso. Cheio de restaurantes próximos e com café da manhã bem justo. Para quem quer aproveitar shows da brodway é perfeito, perto de todos os teatros.

title: Lovely hotel but take earplugs!
text: My husband and I stayed at the French Quarters from 27-30 October, when booking we got a cheaper rate as we booked a room above the bar, we were told that there may be some noise due to being above the bar. The room was lovely with a huge king size bed, fridge, coffee machine and a good sized bathroom, we also loved the added touch of l'occitaine products in the bathroom and a bottle of water. As our first night was a Thursday it was not too loud, however on the Friday we really struggled to sleep due to the loud music from the bar (more like a nightclub) below which went on until 4am, following this we brought some earplugs and it was a lot better on our final night. The hotel is in a fantastic location, within walking distance from 5th Avenue, Central Park, Times Square and the Statue of Liberty but if your planning on sight seeing during the day and a good nights sleep then make sure you take earplugs!!

title: Dearest Boutique Hotel in NY
text: This is the dearest small hotel located on Restaurant Row on the edge of the Theatre District.  The rooms are REALLY spacious with kitchenettes, wifi and cable.  Moreover, they are CLEAN and very nicely decorated.  The porter REFUSED a tip when he took us tour room and when we called for a bucket of ice, again a tip was REFUSED.  It's a converted brownstone with an elevator so stairs are not a problem.  I could not recommend it more highly.  And the rooms are VERY REASONABLE for New York.  All in all, a delightful experience.  We were there in June, 2015.

title: fantastic find!
text: This hotel is certainly out of the ordinary. set in a brownstone, what used to be apartments are now individual hotel rooms. Very quaint and cozy. A restaurant and bar attached provided a late night glass of wine and snack although dining was always booming while we were there. We never experienced a full meal. The owners and operators of this hotel were always pleasant and welcomed up with a smile and a noteworthy recommendation for sight seeing or a meal. Will definitely stay there again!

title: LO MEJOR!
text:
El hotel es de lo mejor!! Es excelente!! Es lindisimo, los cuartos súper grandes, cómodos, limpios, pintoresco. Para ser NYC el precio es ideal. Las camas realmente son muy cómodas, descansas muy bien en ellas. Los que atienden son amorosos. La ubicación es perfecta, bocas de subte en la esquina. A dos cuadras de Times Square. Rodeado de lindos restaurantes. El dasayuno es riquísimo, en la terraza del
Hotel que es realmente muy linda. Sin duda recomiendo el hotel para todo tiempo de viajero!

title: Amazing
text:
The Hotel is Wonderful so close to Times Square. The Hotel staff are the most helpful and accommodating, every day they would help with planning a great day and give great advise on what to do and how to get the most out of your day.
It is fantastic value for money with a really good Restaurant attached to the hotel.

title: extremement propre
text:
J'y ai séjourné en septembre 2016 5 jours et ce fut très agréable.  Chambre propre qui pour moi est super important.

tout a été parfait

tout près de time square très bien situé tout près du metro également

title: Gorgeous and great value
text: NYC hotels are known to be very expensive so I take that into account - and even so, this is still a great deal. The rooms are stylish and welcoming, big enough with sumptuous bathrooms (L'Occitane toiletries!), good air conditioning, and although I can't say they are very quiet, I can ask you why on earth you're booking a hotel in Hell's Kitchen if you want silence! The service is wonderful, the towels never stopped and the front desk was very helpful. The free breakfast is spot on, pastries, cereals, toast, bagels, fruit, yoghurt, etc. I don't think it'd be worth staying anywhere else in NYC.

title: Nice hotel near times square
text: Had a great stay with my siblings in this boutique hotel! All staff are very helpful and are willing to assist anytime. Beds are comfortable. Rooms are spacious enough. Room design is so nice! Location is great too! Just a few blocks away from times square. Will definitely stay in this hotel again.

title: Beautiful Hotel in the Theater District
text: My room was GORGEOUS!  Exposed brick wall, kitchenette, lovely bathroom - every little detail was PERFECT.  The staff is extremely nice and helpful.  One of the people in my group was upgraded to a two bedroom suite with a huge balcony...AMAZING!  I will definitely be staying here again.

title: Excellent
text: This hotel is real gem. From our arrival until the end we met nothing but friendly staff and helpful hosts. Rooms clean. Bed very comfortable and showers exemplary. Big walk in showers . We booked the room over the bar as it stated on bookimg.com so no complaints. Was noisy ish until 4am Fri sat n sunday as it is every weekend. A DJ plays and you van hear everything. This is only on the stated rooms though . Not every room has this problem . For the location. Which is about a 5 min walk to times Square this noise was a mere minor inconvience. Bring some ear plugs and no problem at all. Stunning hotel. Great staff and excellent location. Coukd not find one  fault with the place , even if I tried .

title: Warm and friendly reception
text: My husband and I recently spent several days in NYC to celebrate our 30th anniversary. We were watching our dollars so we just booked a small room. When we arrived, the owner had upgraded us to a suite and had champagne waiting! Needless to say, we were beyond thrilled. Of course, I would not expect this every time, but it certainly made our stay even more special. Great location, comfortable beds, clean, and charming. Definitely will be back!

title: King Size Bed Above the Bar
text:
I was there from Thursday, Oct 20 - Sunday, Oct 23. The hotel, the room, the bed, and the staff were all excellent. The location is close to so many things, it made going out fun and convenient. We went to the swing club (across the street) twice. We walked to a Broadway show, and it was only a 10 minute walk.

The noise level on Thursday night was practically non-existent save for the street noise with cars honking at each other. However, we could hear the bar noise on Friday night, and it was louder on Saturday night. I brought earplugs and took some sleeping pills and also turned on the bathroom vent for white noise to help me sleep. It didn't completely drown out the noise, but it muffled it enough so that I could fall asleep.

The bed was extremely cozy and a relief after walking all day. The room was not the closet I was expecting. It was a nice, big room with a Keurig coffee maker and lots of Keurig pod options from coffee to tea to hot chocolate. Yummy!

This was a fun, charming boutique hotel with lots of character and a wonderfully helpful and nice staff. They even provided umbrellas for us as it was raining while we were there.

title: Elopement
text:
My Fiancé and I decided to elope in NYC and stayed here. Firstly it exceeded our expectations by huge amounts. It is situated in a beautiful part of New York. Easy to get around. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful considering this was our first time to New York. The room we had was great. On the day of our wedding we came home to two champagne glasses and a bottle awaiting our arrival. This was not required or expected and it just goes to show that the staff go above and beyond their required duties to make your stay more memorable.
We will definitely be back to stay next time we are in New York.

title: Hermoso Hotel y Muy Bien Ubicado
text:
Nos hospedamos en este hotel por segunda vez el 15 de Octubre. El hotel es muy lindo.
La habitación en la que nos hospedamos, aunque pequeña, era cómodas y cuenta con un mini refrigerador y cafetera Keurig con varias opciones como chocolate, te y varios cafes.  La cama es muy cómoda. La habitación es la 101 que se encuentra ubicada justo encima del bar y por esa razón,  la tarifa para el fin de semana es menor a lo que cuestan las demás habitaciones. Yo encontré que el ruido de la calle era mínimo. 
El baño cuenta con productos de muy buena calidad.
La atención por parte del personal de la recepción es inmejorable. Te llevan a tu habitación para explicarte como usar la televisión y asegurarse que todo este bien. 
La ubicación es muy buena. Se encuentra en la calle que le llaman "Restaurant Road." En ella se encuentran varios restaurantes para todos los gustos. El hotel se encuentra a cuadra 1/2 de Time Square. 
Recomiendo ampliamente este hotel.

title: Great hidden gem in the heart of NYC!
text: Was there in July with my wife and daughter.  It was convenient to all the attractions and restaurants.  We walked the Highline, ate in Hell's Kitchen, and saw the phantom of the opera.  We ate at a cute Thai restaurant down the street.

title: Absolutely fantastic hotel
text: We stayed here for 7 days in a two bedroom suite, and wow what a suite. Two large bedrooms,one ensuite, large lounge , kitchenette with fridge microwave/oven fridge and all cutlery and dishes etc and a coffee machine which also had tea pods too. We also had an extremely large balcony about thirty feet long with views to Times Square and the the New York skyline. Breakfast was an American continental style and plentiful. In the basement and ground floor of the hotel was a great restaurant come bar, food was very good. Hotel staff could not have been any better, from the people on reception to the maids and the breakfast staff. There was not one bad comment I can put about this place, and will definately stay here next time I come, this has been our sixth time to NYC and each time we have stayed in different hotels, but we will most definately be sticking to this one now.

title: Love this place
text: Second time we've stayed here and fantastic again. Booked a two bedroom apartment with an open terrace which has amazing views of the city. It's located on restaurant row and just up the road from Times Square so location couldn't be any better. A little on the expensive side but worth every penny. It feels like you're living in NYC and not just staying as a tourist. The apartments are very comfortable and well equipped - perfect to relax in after walking around the city. The private terrace was amazing and you could chill with a glass of wine and watch the world go by from above the street getting the full New York City experience. Staff all excellent and very friendly. Special call outs for Monica on reception and Kevin who always had a smile and cheery welcome. Highly recommend and is our place of choice now whenever we visit.

title: Great location
text: The stay was great, rooms are small but overall it's great. They are located within walking distance of time square and other great NYC locations. Would stay here again when I come back to NYC. Breakfast is included and great near by bars and restaurants.

title: Quiet and Friendly
text: It was a lovely hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The room was very clean and comfortable. Wonderful location, very easy walk to Times Square and the Theater District. The restaurant downstairs was fun and the food was great.

title: Brilliant Location - Easy walking to Times Sq etc..
text:
Hopefully my title says it all.
Room was great size for a couple #202, and #206 wasn't too bad size-wise either.
Stove was there - no pans/cutlery/china though - must be expecting everyone to eat out, therefore maybe this could be revised/removed to make better use of the space??
Staff all polite and courteous, breakfasts good - continental style. bathroom good - toilet rolls good do with being of higher quality - bit like tracing paper. Brighter in-room lighting to help reading all activity brochures.
Rather noisy due to being part of restaurant/bar - make sure you do lots during the day or drink lots so you don't hear it :-)
I would use it again though all said due to location and price
Staff also booked local car firm to collect us to return to JFK - the lady who organised didn't leave work until the driver turned up.

title: Lots of charm and a great location
text: We spent 10 nights here in a king room. The size of the room and bathroom was great and while not brand new the place was clean and the bathroom modern. The bed and pillows were comfy. The included breakfast on the patio was very convenient and a nice way to start the day. The bar/restaurant down stairs (with direct lift access!), while not the cheapest in the area, was really good with very friendly and entertaining bar staff.  The staff were fantastic and went out of their way to help us with some last minute dry cleaning. Couldn't recommend a better location for exploring New York and so much better than staying in a big chain hotel.

title: Comfortable & pleasant
text: This is an excellent base for visiting Manhattan. The room was clean and spacious, staff friendly and helpful. It was definitely good value for money. We would stay there again on a future visit to New York.

title: Great location for NYC stay
text:
As described, in an excellent location, few minutes walk to Times Square, the Hop on Hop off buses are at the end of the street, with plenty of places to eat without having to walk far after a busy day. The rooms are a reasonable size for a city stay, with a cook top/ fridge if needed, and importantly, clean. Limited storage space, depends on how long you're there. The lift is !!!!! slow would be an understatement, but as it's a low rise hotel, only really needed for luggage unless you have mobility issues. Breakfast is not quite continental, but choice of cereals, toast, pasties etc was sufficient. We had a second floor room, not front facing, our friends however was, and they reported as we have all read, significant noise at the weekend. Our room was occasionally noisy, when the roof in the patio / bar/ breakfast room was retracted, when you book, ask about this. The staff are very helpful, and having a bar "next door" was very civilized, good food/ choice.
Yes I would stay here again

title: Great location and quarters
text: We had a wonderful two night stay. We booked a discount room above the bar, and were upgraded to a larger room, still above the bar. We were not bothered by the noise at all and I'm a light sleeper. Bed was super comfy and I loved the shower. Location was key!! So close to so much. The Evian and higher end toiletries were a nice touch. We would definitely return here.

title: Perfetto per chi viaggia sola come me
text: Viaggiatrice sola. Ho alloggiato nella stanza direttamente sopra il bar. Mi hanno oreavvisato che sarebbe stato rumoroso ma ho dormito benissimo: il rumore è quello di fondo che comunque si sente in stanze in centro città. Visto che avrei lasciato la stanza molto presto di mattina, mi è stata lasciata lacolazione già ka sera prima. Il personale è gentilissimo, la camera molto carina (e non tutta in moquette ma parzialmrnte piastrellata). È vicisinnsimo a Time Square e davvero centrale. Io viaggiavo sola e mi sono sentita al sicuro (nonostante la strada sia un po' buia ma comunque piena di locali). Ho chiesto io servizio in camera che di venerdi sera però non era operativo (ho prenotato e sonomscesa al pub a prelevare la cena) comunque senza problemi, si accede al pub direttamente con l'ascensore dell'hotel. La stanza è piccola come ovunque a new york, ma ero sola quindi per me non è stato un problema. C'è anche una piccola cucina con piastre elettriche. Ottima imoressione!

title: hotel très propre
text:
Je viens d'y passer 5 jours et tout a été parfait, l'accueil, la nourriture, la propreté des lieux.  Vraiment un endroit où je voudrais y retourner.

L'hotel est très bien situé, tout près de Times Square, de Broadway, là où il y l'action quoi

Franchement j'ai rien a reprocher à cet endroit

title: Wish I could give a higher rating.
text:
To begin with, this property is everything that it presents itself to be in a perfect location for exploring Times Square and Hell's Kitchen. All as advertised. We stayed in one of the units above the bar/restaurant area and we did not have any significant problem with the noise as previous reviewers have noted. Of course, we found that if you close the bar down you never have to worry about the noise! Regardless, this is one amazing guest apartment. While our unit #106 was a slightly smaller room, the amenities were outstanding. The bedding was perfect and shower/toiletries were equally as nice. An in-room safe, Keurig coffee maker, small electric stove, refrigerator and a flat screen TV rounded out the room's features. We stayed only one night but found it to be very comfortable. The morning continental breakfast was generous and we received a visit from the G.M., Colin while there. He asked about our stay and inquired about our travel plans. 
The most impressive thing I can mention though is what separates this establishment from any other I've ever stayed. The next morning we were heading out on a week long cruise and inadvertently left an iPad. We were unaware of this until I received a call from John at the front desk while we were almost at the pier. He offered to bring it to us or mail it to our home and as we had another iPad available we asked him to ship it to our home which was there before we returned. One can argue that you might find a hotel with better sheets or a bigger TV but you will never find one with a staff with more integrity and devotion to there patrons than the French Quarters. We will never stay anywhere else on return visits and I give the highest recommendations for this fine property. It just doesn't get any better than this.

title: Right Place For Sight Seeing
text:
This small hotel is in the best location. It is in walking distance to Times Square and the theatre district and easy access to the subway for heading across town.  The staff were so accommodating and their recommendations for dinner were outstanding.

The lobby is small as well as the rooms if you are looking for something on a grand scale this is not the place.  Personally, I prefer this type of boutique venue.

title: Loved the French Quarter in NYC!!
text:
It's with mixed emotions that I share my review. I Love this place and I don't want to share it with anyone!! But here goes: The staff are top notch, Colin the GM, and his fabulous staff..."Right Now" Nao, Monica, The "Oh so loved" Kevin and Leo and other staff members.  Our stay was memorable, comfortable and perfect. Sure we may have had some unrelated transportation glitches but the hotel was always there to catch us and help smooth out our bumps. Colin even served as a Trama Trip counsellor (haha!!) as my husband sat in a chair, arms in the air and surrendered to being defeated by our Hampton luxury Liner. Colin & Nao mentioned Latanzzi Restaurant across the street and WOW!! We weren't disappointed with Latanzzi and the fabulous Andreas. Lots of close by businesses, restaurants and theatres were so handy... A tasty wine store with chocolate covered pecans, a 24 hour convenience store and a juice bar with "the cure"   (a shot of anti-cold serum?) and a pub just below street level.
Ohhhh,  We can't wait to return to return!! Thank you Colin & Staff!!

title: A deux pas de Time Square
text: NEW YORK  4 sept 2016. première étape de notre voyage en famille. Notre Hôtel qui n'a rien de français , est situe a deux pas de Time square . Pour 5 nuits on avait réservé une suite avec 2 chambres séparées, un petit salon et un petit coin cuisine si besoin...l'appartement est très grand , spacieux, salle de bain dernier cri avec très grande douche a l italienne , un bonheur quand on a marche toute la journée dans les rues de NY !!! bon la deco c'est pas le top du top, un peu ringard pour ne pas dire vieillot..mais pas grave, la deco d intérieure n’était pas le but de notre voyage !! nous avions aussi une grande terrasse..mais pas utilisable car vue sur les toits des restaurants , avec des centaines et des centaines de "climatiseurs"..et bruyant au possible  (il faut dire qu'a NY le bruit incessant des climatiseurs et autres sirènes hurlantes de pompiers, policiers, ambulances est permanent 24h/24H)  pas d'autre choix que de laisser les fenêtres fermées...et la chaleur était étouffante en ce début de Sept..de toute façon a NY vous ne vivez pas les fenêtres ouvertes, car pour la plupart du temps, elles ne s'ouvrent pas..les gens vivent a l interieur au ""frais"" un calvaire pour nous autre français...bon a part ça , le petit déjeuner était copieux et le personnel très sympa, avec qui on discute le matin !! ils étaient hyper serviables et adorables.... Le prix maintenant de ce charmant havre de paix:  1800€ pour 5 nuit petit déjeuner compris pour 2 personnes.!! (1680€) C'est sur il faut casser sa tirelire.. mais on est a NY !!!  apres 5 jours non stop de marche a pied , de visite etc..on plie bagage, direction Niagara Falls !!! prochaine étape de notre voyage !!! bye!!

title: Kanonläge och toppenservice
text: Kanonhotel med stora ljusa rum och bra frukost ingår.10 min gångavstånd till Times Square och detta hotel ligger i Hells Kitchen med massor av bra restauranger inom 5 -10 min gångavstånd.SWervicen på hotellet var fantastisk och man har en bra restaurang  som tillhör hotellet.

title: DE LO MEJOR EN NY
text:
Reservamos  junto a mi esposa y nuestro hijo mayor una habitacion triple que constaba de dormitorios y estar con un divan, primer sorpresa al lllegar nos hicieron un up grade a una habitacion de dos dormitorios y estar .El hotel esta muy bien ubicado a un paso de Times Square excelente la  limpieza en las habitaciones y zonas comunes,muy buen desayuno.Tambien hay que destacar la calidad de servicio de todo el personal del hotel siempre dispuestos a ayudarte en lo que necesites.Gracias por hacer nuestra estadia en NY tan placentera.
ALTAMENTE RECOMENDABLE

title: Great location
text:
This hotel apartment us in a great location as previous reviews advise.

We were upgraded from a one bedroom suite to a two bedroom suite which was a great start to our holiday.

We were in the four floor and had a outside balcony with s view to Times Square which was very nice. Plenty of room and two bedroom suites have two bathrooms which would come in handy if travelling with a family,as well as a lounge with a small area to cook and a fridge. However no cooking utensils so not sure how you would cook anything.They also have a room safe which we appreciate. We had no problems will any noice and we faced the street.

Breakfast was fine and all the hotel staff are great. The bar attached was really great and the burgers are good if you eat here, but plenty of restaurants down the street and even more within 5 min walk.

Only one negative is that they have a small slow lift- but better than walking with suitcases up the stairs

Would recommend this hotel and would deginately stay here again.

title: Friendly & well situated on a nice restaurant street
text: We stayed in a beautiful room for 4 nights. The room was both comfortable and had a nice "atmosphere". A very good cajun restaurant was linked to the hotel. The breakfast was plentiful, although no cooked breakfast meal was available. The room overlooked the street with an "old" New York style, several ginkgo biloba trees along the street - but still just two or three blocks from Times Square. The staff is very helpful. The only drawback was that we  had no elevator.

title: Quick trip to NYC
text: Hell's Kitchen- close to restaurants and nightlife.  Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and well kept. Room was quaint and had coffee/tea/water and ample space for suitcase and for snacks or other drinks in the refrigerator.

title: Fabulous location and breakfast
text: I love a soft mattress and good pillows. This hotel delivered both, thank you. What a joy to sleep in comfort, I wish all hotels would take a leaf out of your book. I must also mentioned their breakfast in the mornings, superb and lovely staff who greeted us with a smile everyday. I highly recommend this hotel. Thank you all for such a pleasant stay.

title: Very cool, well-located lodging
text:
If your traveling objective is comfort and joy, the French Quarters is perfect.  Don't be put off by the narrow hallway and modest check-in desk -- the best is to come.  Very comfy beds, room temp just right, nice bath/shower, good amenities, fine continental breakfast with plenty of fruit and good coffee and croissants.  Wifi was fine.

While this isn't a luxury hotel per se, the personal service is reminiscent of the finest hotels.  I wandered back to the hotel after tripping on Henry St., and Colin pulled out the medical kit and got me the basic essentials until I could get to the nearest RX.  And he called my room to make sure all was good.

I'll be delighted to come back to French Quarters; it's a great find -- a treasure -- in the middle of a huge city.

title: Ideal Location in Manhattan
text:
We zeroed in on this place based on the Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. It’s a nice cozy place nestled between the 8th and 9th avenue on the 46th Street. It’s just a four to five minute walk to Times Square if you are not distracted by the restaurants & shops that dot along the way. Its location is great to cover Manhattan and surrounding places including Central Park which is a 15  minute walk. Lots of restaurants around and the Theatre District is also just a seven to ten minute walk. 

The rooms are well furnished and tastefully done. We slept well and were not disturbed by the hustle and bustle outside which some of the travelers have reported. The options for Breakfast were good and Kevin was always there to  encourage people to try out the various items on the buffet.

The staff at the reception are all too welcoming and when we checked in the lady after checking in took us to the room and explained all the facilities and was very enthusiastic in answering all our touristy questions. She really set us on our walk around the area and we loved all the details she gave us. What I liked best was their detailed printouts on almost everything that you could ask for.  For e.g. If you wanted to go see the ‘Brooklyn Bridge’, they had a printout detailing how to reach there and the things to do. Likewise they had a page on almost all important places /buildings in NY neatly placed in a folder. All one had to do was scan through that and take a page of whatever you wanted.  

Every morning along with the newspaper( yes, they did give one to every room) very thoughtfully an A4 page printout was also slipped in under the door, which contained the days weather and the interesting activities in the area, which a tourist might otherwise miss out on. They were also very accommodating in holding our luggage after check out. I strongly recommend this place and would come again here.

title: vacation
text: I love the French Quarters!  We were on a family outing and needed to be in the "heart of the city" and we found an oasis in this hideaway!  The location is, of course, the best, the room was delightful, and the price was quite competitive.  Upon check-in we were met by a very friendly and knowledgeable manager  (Colin) who knew New York and could sculpt suggestions for his guests' unique tourist desires (restaurants, shows, groovy NY stuff to do) .  There was a great Continental breakfast - coffee, danish, fruit, yogurt, etc.  The feel and vibe of this place is fantastic!  I will always stay here whenever I am in NY!

title: Cozy stay in the heart of the city
text: We stayed in the French Quarters for 2 nights and were more than happy with the choice. Located very close to the heart of the city, the rooms had a nice casual decor that was a welcome change from the standard formats that are normally seen in other hotels. The breakfast in the morning was good for a quick bite before heading out into the city. Overall a good place to stay in!

title: Excellent hotel.
text:
Just returned from a 5 night stay at the French Quarters and have nothing but praise to share. We were warmly welcomed and shown to a lovely room with a large window overlooking the street in front of the hotel. All the staff we encountered were professional, polite and helpful.
Breakfast was plentiful and set us up for the morning. 
The hotel is in a great position, surrounded by numerous bars and restaurants and just a very short walk from Times Square. Borbon Street bar, next door, was excellent for a late drink before retiring. We can recommend the po boy for a quick and easy meal (one between the two of us was more than enough)
We are planning to return to New York and will definitely be staying here again.

title: All you need for your stay in NYC
text: Fantastic location , great staff , does exactly what it says on the tin . Will definitely stay here again . Rooms spacious and well looked after even got your own kitchenette . Also a souvenir to take home as you can purchase their own brand mugs . All in all couldn't complain . I've stay in many a top hotel but the relaxed feel, friendly staff , good food , clean rooms makes this right up there with the best for a city hotel .

title: Hôtel très bien situé 8e avenue
text: Hôtel très bien situé et au calme dans la 8ème avenue, à 5min a pied de Times Square et d'une station de metro, et 10 min de Central Park. Nous avons eu une chambre pour 3 personnes avec deux grands lits. Le petit déjeuner est inclus dans le prix et est très bon. Le personnel a été très accueillant et répondaient à toutes nos questions. Je recommande cet hôtel.

title: Excellent location, large and gorgeous rooms
text:
I've Stayed in 5 stars that didn't have the quality attention to detail this room had (towels, L'octain products) only improvement would be the pillows which were saggy and lumpy. 
The King room was spacious, newly renovated bathroom and a kitchenette. 
Good selection for the included continental breakfast. Located on a fantastic street with bars and restaurants, the food in the bar downstairs was great. 
We booked into an 'above the bar' room so we had been well warned of the noise. And it was loud so if you get one of these cheaper rooms just ensure you are out to party or have sleeping tablets and ear plugs.

title: Wonderful product (hotel), wonderful people (staff), wonderful place (location in NYC).
text:
I don't think I can say enough about our stay at The French Quarters. I wish I could give this place 6 stars.

My wife and I spent the last leg of our honeymoon here, spending 2 days and 2 nights with Colin, Monica, and the staff.

Arriving on Tuesday night, we were greeted by Nue, and a few other pleasant surprises. Thanks to availability, we were given a free upgrade to a king suite. Upon arriving to the room, a handwritten welcome note and a bottle of champagne awaited us.

In the morning, we found a concise summary of "today in New York" (the day's weather, events around the city, etc.) at the door, along with a copy of the daily paper. It was a pleasure to read the paper as my Wife and I enjoyed a tasty continental breakfast in the mezzanine. 

That afternoon we met Colin, the manager. What a nice guy. He gave us advice on where to find the best Thai food (Topaz on 56th is the place to go), and how to score cheap tickets for broadway that night. 

After enjoying our day and a Broadway show, we went to Becco for dinner. If you go to NYC, you HAVE to stay at The French Quarters. And when you stay at The French Quarters, you HAVE to go to Becco. It's probably less than 100 feet from the hotel entrance, and it's amazing. In fact, most of the restaurants around The French Quarters are amazing. It is called Restaurant Row after all. 

I'm probably rambling here. But I must say, this place is truly a gem. What an amazing hotel. Whenever we return to NYC, this will be our first choice for room accommodations.

title: Ideally Situated But Very Noisy Street.
text:
Our second time in New York but this hotel seemed better situated for the attractions we visited. Our taxi (actually a limo!), to and from the airport, was arranged for us by the hotel and we paid cash to the driver. We were greeted by very pleasant staff, including Jason and Mano, who showed us to our rooms. We spoke to various staff on reception during our week, but the manager, Colin, made a point of coming and introducing himself to us one morning, as we'd not yet met him.  A lovely man, as were all the staff.   A handwritten card welcomed us to our room and on my daughter's birthday they kindly left a bottle of Prosecco in the fridge for her. I notice that someone else who has reviewed this hotel says there is no lift, which is incorrect, as we used it a couple of times!

Breakfast was taken in the adjoining Bourbon Street bar, where we also had a couple of delicious meals.  Ideal for the first night when you arrive tired and don't want to venture far, although the hotel is in the Hell's Kitchen area of the city, famed for all of it's restaurants, so there's plenty of choice. We were looked after at breakfast by a very pleasant and genuine young man called Kevin.  Nothing was too much trouble for him.  The food was the usual continental style, with cereal, pastries, bagels, fruit and yogurts and was plenty to set us up for the day.

Our room, 301, was small but comfy with a large bathroom and coffee/ tea machine.  It also had a mini kitchen area with a hob, sink and fridge but this space would have been better used to extend the tiny wardrobe.  The wardrobe was about a foot wide, with not enough hangers and a shelf half way down that made hanging dresses impossible, but you can always find a way around these things. There was a lovely old fashioned free standing coat rack, so I hung dresses off that. The double bed was comfy, although due to it being in a small room, it was pushed against the wall, which may have been an issue for someone less agile. I recommend that anyone wanting to use a hairdryer uses the one that the hotel provides in each room.  I used my own on the first day, but due to American voltage being half of ours in the UK mine was extremely slow even on top speed.  I switched to theirs and it was great. A daily sheet of 'what's on in the area' was left outside our room each day along with a free paper.

The only real negative about this hotel was the noise from the street.  I know it's a big city and you must expect noise, but when it stops you from sleeping it can make your day long and hard.  The bar downstairs is open till 4am but I don't think the noise was from there.  There are a couple of all-night bars opposite, one called Don't Tell Mama, and they have karaoke and 'singing' waiters, but the singing was too loud and awful.  There's also the constant noise of deliveries being made by refrigerated vans to restaurants in the street, sirens and bin men.  When we visited NY 2 years ago and stayed in a bigger hotel, we were able to move rooms to one higher up and at the back of the hotel, where it was really quite.  That wasn't possible here as it's a tiny hotel.

All in all, I really enjoyed my stay here.  If I'm ever in New York again I would use this hotel, but only if I could be sure of a room away from the street.  From what I could see once there, some of the suites on the top two floors were at the back, so may be worth the extra cost for some decent sleep.

title: A gem in NYC
text:
We stayed at the French Quarters from 20-27 August in rooms 201 and 301.  We were greeted by the very friendly staff on reception and shown to our rooms.  We found a hand written card in our room welcoming us to the hotel. If you need transfers from the airport contact the hotel prior to your arrival, they sorted a pick up for us and orgaised a trip back to the airport at the end of our stay.

Room 201 is quite small but adequate for our needs. It's only downside is the lack of storage for clothes, the wardrobe is tiny so I put some of my clothes on the coat rack. The room has a desk and chair, TV, ironing board, iron, hairdryer, umbrella, L'Occitane toiletries and a coffee machine. There was also a fridge with milks and a bottle of water in it. The room was very clean and very nicely decorated. There were plenty of towels in the bathroom. The rooms all have air con.

I found the curtains were quite thick so kept the light out well, although the hotel is on a well shaded street so there was no sunlight coming in to wake us anyway. 

The first night, a Saturday, we didn't sleep very well as there is a cabaret bar directly opposite which had loud music going well into the early hours. That was the only issue with noise, apart from that first night I slept well for the rest of the week. 

The breakfast is continental with a range of pastries, cereals, bagels, jams and toast. It was refreshing to find somewhere that came with breakfast as many hotels we looked at don't. Al the breakfast staff we met, Mano, Jason and Kevin, were very chatty and friendly and couldn't do enough to help you. 

Each morning  we woke to a copy of the local paper and a sheet prepared by the staff detailing the weather and local places to visit and events going on which was a lovely touch. 

During our stay I celebrated my 30th birthday. It was a lovely surprise to find a bottle of Prosecco in the fridge from the staff, thank you again for this! We were greeted by Colin, the hotel manager, on my birthday at breakfast, it was lovely to meet him.

The hotel itself is in a fantastic situation, just a 2 minute walk away from Times Square. The Intrepid air and space museum is on the same street as the hotel. There is a subway on W42nd street at Times Square, or if you want to avoid all the crowds in that area head up to W50th street to get the one from there instead. 

I cannot recommend this hotel enough, it's location and staff was perfect. I'd definitely stay here again.

I've written several reviews of the places we visited and various restaurants which I've listed just below if you're looking for some ideas.

Attractions:
Intrepid air and space museum 
Central Park
Statue of Liberty
One World Observatory
9/11 memorial museum
Brooklyn Bridge
Circle Line Cruises

To escape the city for a while you could visit Far Rockaway beach (Take the A train, change at Rockaway Boulevard and get on the express train S. Takes around an hour and a half) or take a train upstate to Cold Spring, a beautiful town on the river Hudson. You can get there by taking a train from Grand Central Station and it takes around an hour. 

Smorgasburg in Williamsburg, Brooklyn is worth a visit. It's held every Saturday and features over 100 food vendors. I highly recommend trying a maple lemonade, it is really refreshing and delicious. 

Food and Drink:
Bourbon Bar Street and Grill (next to hotel)
Bareburger (A few doors down from the hotel, head left out of the hotel)
Rice Cream Shop (Bleecker Street)
Motorino pizza (E12th Street)
Max - Italian restaurant on Duane Street (Not far from World Trade Center)
Radegast Hall (3rd Street, Brooklyn)
Moo Moo's Creamery (Ice cream parlous at Cold Spring)
The Depot (Delicious food, Cold Spring)

title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel
text: We arrived here after over 24 hour transit time. This hotel is beautiful and welcoming. These are great hotel rooms. Fantastic Boutique feel. Beautiful beds and linen, made staying here a real pleasure. Staff are friendly and helpful and location is fantastic. You will not regret a stay here.

title: Clean, convenient & comfortable
text: We arrived in New York at 1am in the morning, so our checkin to the French Quarters was at about 2am! A lovely warm welcome by Robert who personally escorted us to our room and explained the facilities. Breakfast each morning was plentiful & fresh. The service by Kevin at breakfast was just delightful - such a lovely young man - born for the hospitality industry. Our room was clean & comfortable - thank you to the housekeeing staff. The hotel was convenient to so many things. We walked 20 minutes and spent a day in Central Park. We walked 10 minutes and seen a show on Broadway. We walked 25 minutes and did the lovely High Line walk with lunch at Chelsea Markets. We walked across the street from the hotel and indulged in a scrumptious italian dinner. The hotel is a set $55US taxi fare from airport & about 1 hour travel time in peak hour. All in all an enjoyable stay.

title: Mycket positiv överraskning!
text: Lämnade väskor i receptionen på morgonen då rummet ju ej var klart. När vi kom upp till rummet på eftermiddagen var bagaget redan uppburet till vårt otroligt trevliga rum. På sängen låg ett handskrivet välkomstkort som gjorde att man kände sig väldigt välkommen. Fantastisk service i receptionen. :) Väldigt bra läge nära Times Square, Mycket prisvärt! Frukosten var bra men inte exeptionell. Mycket bra upplevelse!

title: Another Awesome Stay!
text: This was my second stay at the French Quarters and our suite was tastefully decorated, impeccably clean and beds were so comfortable! The staff was helpful in our quest to see "off the beaten path" parts of the city. Dinner recommendation led us across the street to a wonderful Italian restaurant where the food, drink and service lasted hours! A wonderful dining experience!  I have recommended the French Quarters numerous times since the first visit and will continue to do so!

title: Weekend trip for concert.
text:
The hotel itself is lovely with an attentive and polite staff. 
The room was small but comfortable, however it certainly was not luxurious. 
The only issue we had was the noise from the bar that is located directly below from our hotel room. We looked out of our window and saw the sky light roof top of the bar. It was so close to our room that we could touch it. 
The music went until 4am both Friday and Saturday nights and was so loud that our bed literally shook. We could feel the bass resonate through our bodies. That ultimately effected the quality of our stay as we were exhausted from lack of sleep. 
There should be a notice to patrons in these rooms and a discount should be given for such a disturbance. I do believe had we stayed in any other room, it would not have been as big an issue. 
It's a shame because I really like this hotel and would recommend under the guidance to book the room farthest away from the bar as possible.

title: Did not like this place!
text: We were ther now for 6 days. We were put at the 2nd floor in a very long staires without a lift. The 2 double bads were relativley small. the room was reasnable. Wifi did not work properly and we continued to be disconnected although we complained about this from 1st day. Nice breakfast but overall over priced, Will not stay there again.

title: Great Location and Great Staff
text: The French Quarters are in a great location, two blocks from Times square, yet away from all the noise. The rooms are well equipped and comfortable. The Continental breakfast in the morning was enough, if its not for you then, well it is NYC there are plenty of places to go! Staff are great in particular Kevin who hosts breakfast!

title: Great location - small bed!!
text:
It's hard to write this review as many aspects were 5* but some were 2/3* as a result I decided on 4. 

Loved - 
friendly staff in the bar/restaurant 
The bar/restaurant was integral to the hotel so our daughter could go to bed and we could have some adult time. 
Cleanliness 
Location was excellent
Tube stations only 4 blocks in each direction. 

Disliked - 
Small double bed which had a camber that made you feel you were falling out. 
Limited breakfast choices and after a week it became boring. 
Too few hangers for three people staying a week. 
Pricey

On balance it was nice and some of my complaints could easily be sorted.

title: Mid-Town Sweet Spot!
text: We were staying one night in mid-town Manhattan and this was the perfect spot! Hells Kitchen eats, walking distance to Times Square, Le Bernardin, and Kee's Chocolates! (FYI the Port Authority bus station is only a few blocks away if that is where you come in, or depart.) The hotel itself is clean and nicely decorated in French Quarter details, we were upgraded from a standard room to a King sized bed when we checked in, free and unasked, as well as shown to our room by very courteous staff, check in and check out were swift and the hotel nicely offers to hold bags before and/or after checkout so you don't have to lug suitcases around if there are still things you plan to do before departure. Free continental breakfast and friendly courtesy by all staff we encountered. I very much enjoyed my stay, and would stay again:)

title: Boutique Hotel
text: Boutique hotel muy bien ubicado (Hell's Kitchen) a pocos minutos caminando de Times Square. La habitaciones cómodas, limpias y la atención de primera. Súper recomendable, personalmente prefiero este tipo de hotel que los de cadena.

title: Great Find
text: Stopped here for 4 nights as a family of three. It's in a great location, only a few min walk from Times Square and the Theatre District and accessible by subway to the rest of the NY attractions. Also, being situated on restaurant row, there is an excellent choice of places to eat and drink right on the doorstep of the hotel, including the Bourbon Street restaurant and bar adjacent to the hotel, which was very good. The 2 x double room worked well for us and was clean, comfortable and surprisingly spacious for a Manhattan hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and having the continental breakfast included in the price saved a fortune. This self-service breakfast included cereals, toast, bagels, yoghurt etc., and was fine to get you off to a good start for the day. We enjoyed stopping here and can recommend to others. NY was having a heat wave when we stopped, it was hot and humid, the hotel air conditioning kept us sane!

title: Excellent location, friendly staff
text:
This hotel is located amidst many restaurants in the Hell's Kitchen area.  It has a small entrance that's easy to miss.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom room (501) that was fantastic:  a private terrace overlooked 46th street, and I could sit there and watch the goings on.  Despite that, the room was quiet at night.  We were in NYC in incredible heat (over 90 every day) and the room stayed cool.
There is good storage space and a small refrigerator and some cups and glasses near a sink in the common room of our suite.  Getting around the couch when someone is sitting at the desk was a little tricky.
The bathroom is on the small side, and the water pressure is a little weak.
The breakfast is basic:  toast, coffee, cereal, yogurt, and some fresh fruit.  The attendant was very friendly, though.  The hotel also gives you a sheet every day with local goings-on, which is quite helpful.
The location is very nice:  restaurants around, and about as close as one can get to Times Square without having a crowd all around you.
This is a nice boutique hotel which made us feel like we were going home in an otherwise busy metropolis.

title: Absolutely Fabulous!
text: This place is fantastic! The hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in - the beds are comfy , the rooms are very clean and beautifully decorated (we had rooms 107 and 108 located in the stylish townhouse). The attention to detail is second to none- Keurig coffee maker, lovely toiletries , amazing shower/bathroom and the daily newsletter. The breakfast is gorgeous - cereals , pastries , bagels etc. Kevin at breakfast is a credit to the hotel - helpful and friendly. All other staff , including Colin, the manager and Monica were a pleasure to deal with and happy to give advice about the city. I was concerned about the noise levels but I took earplugs and was absolutely fine even though our room faced right onto the street. This is a gem of a hotel - I would go back tomorrow!

title: Great spot
text: Great street rooms lovely and very comfortable beds. We are a family of three and the double double room was great for us. Lovely soft towels and great shower. Good coffee maker. Free paper and morning newsletter. Breakfast very good for an inclusive in NYC staff very friendly and helpful especially Kevin at the breakfast bar! Other hotels in NYC could learn a few things from FQ about being welcoming to guests! Would stay again and recommend to others

title: A Gem in the midst of a busy city
text:
The staff were very lovely. We felt welcomed and staff were also on hand to assist. The accomdation was spacious and pleasant. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

The breakfast included was also lovely. The location of the apartment is great for exploring the city. There is a restaurant attached to the apartment but there are also restaurants along the streets of the hotel, so you are spoiled for choice. 

This is really a lovely place to stay

title: Zentrale Lage und trotzdem sehr ruhig gelegen!
text: Das Hotel liegt nahe am Time Square ca. 10 Minuten zu Fuss, also sehr zentral. Als wir vor dem Hotel standen, waren wir der Wahl unsicher. Doch der erste Eindruck täuscht. Die Lage, die Ruhe, die Zimmer, das Frühstück, wirklich alles optimal. Auch der Preis war okay. Für einen Aufenthalt in New York ist diese Hotel sehr empfehlenswert. Auch die Angestellten waren immer sehr nett und hilfsbereit.

title: Amazing Boutique !!! LOCATION !!!!
text:
My friend & I stayed here for 6 nights !!!  LOCATION is great! WI FI included 
Breakfast was great perfect way to start your day !!! 
Kevin is perfect for that job !! Great to see his friendly face each day ! 
All the staff we met were fantastic and VERY helpful.
We loved the little newsletter we received each day ! 
Clean rooms and the towels were so soft !!! 
I will never stay anywhere else in NYC again .. Only the French Quarters !!!

title: Great little hotel near Times Square
text: Had 2 rooms - one was small & cosy  - kids room was more spacious. Both clean & comfy. Good breakfast, friendly staff (Kevin was always smiling and helpful). Was concerned there may be noise from street but this wasn't a problem. Would stay again.

title: Amazing Boutique and location at a reasonable price.
text:
Stayed at The French Quarter this past weekend with my girlfriend and I have nothing but great things to say about this beautiful hotel.

Goh (I believe that's her name) Was a life saver because of a mistake made by a third party when it came to our reservation. She was able to work it out and was nothing but amazing when it came to saving our weekend.

Room was small, but beautiful. Complementary WIFI, Evan water and coffee was available in our room. Room was just below the Restaurant/Bar and it was indeed noisy, but we were part of the noise for much of the evening. Really cool view of the skyscrapers on our window.

Breakfast it's pretty much Pastry,Bread,yogurt,Juices and coffee. It was decent, but the guy at the bar already knew what we wanted and that made our stay a lot more special.

I will definitely recommend this place and I will also stay here next time im in NYC.

title: Cosy Boutique Apartments
text:
This is a great place to stay if you're looking for a central location at a great price without having to compromise room size and cleanliness. The rooms are a perfect base for exploring New York; they have all of the right amenities, the bathrooms are spotless, and the beds are very comfortable. 

The free breakfast is also a nice touch and provides you with a nice start to the day. The hotel manager and the staff are very friendly and accommodating too.

title: me surpreendeu. muito bom
text:
fui de viagem para nova iorque e estava procurando um hotel que fosse confortavel, bem localizado, e com um preço acessivel. encontrei aqui. 
este hotel tem quartos aconchegantes, muito limpos, o antedimento é muito bom, sao muito atenciosos. fica proximo a times square, entao conseguia fazer tudo a pé e de metro. 
ao chamarem um taxi para o aeroporto me surpreendi. estava com muita bagagem, e me chamaram uma limosine! e o melhor, paguei preço de taxi regular. foi top.
recomendo

title: Loved it
text: Great, quirky apartments in an excellent location of New York. It is such a close proximity to Times Square, the staff were really friendly, the rooms and beds were large and comfortable. We also had an excellent free breakfast. I would recommend this place to anyone unquestionably. Such a brilliant place to stay in NYC.

title: Excellent et très bien situé
text:
Hôtel très bien situé avec de grandes chambres et surtout des vrais lits pour les enfants partageant la même chambre des parents. Ce qui n est pas toujours le cas. Souvent les chambres pour 4 sont données avec un lit et 2 lits d appoint.

Je recommande cet hôtel pour la qualité des services ainsi que la situation à
5 minutes de Time Square.

title: Great location
text: The staff is super friendly and helpful. The rooms are pretty good sized for Manhattan. The decor is unique. There is some wear and tear on the place as a hole. There is no lobby, just a check in desk. The hotel is situated on a street with several restaurants and bars. Nice, fun area. No parking on site but a garage is a short walk around the corner. No fitness center either.

title: Never disappoints - Home away from Home - Love it!!
text: Our large group stayed at the FQGA for 4 nights in July - we had two suite rooms rented - the rooms are huge and well appointed with dressers, kitchens, beautiful bathrooms, comfy seating areas, AMAZING balconies!!! and the beds are incredibly comfortable - I can not say enough about how amazing the staff are at the hotel - they go above and beyond to make your stay exceptional - French Quarters will remain our go to hotel when visiting NYC - Hidden Gem - don't tell anyone how amazing this place is!!!!!  LOL!

title: Loved it
text: So glad I stumbled across this place. The room was so much bigger than most NYC rooms, we were 3 adults with 3 cases so were so glad of the extra space! The room was immaculate, loved the decor too! Free water and newspaper and they give you a little A4 sheet every morning telling you the weather forecast and events in the city for that day which was a lovely touch! The bathroom was spacious and I loved the L'Occitaine products! The staff were really friendly, especially the guy behind the bar at breakfast, I didn't catch his name but he was really attentive and helpful. Fantastic location, just a few blocks from Times Square. Was a bit noisy with the bar next door but it's NYC, what do you expect!! Would definitely stay here again.

title: Accommodating and wonderful
text: This place is a gem! The people who work here are super sweet, especially Kevin behind the breakfast bar. The included breakfast was amazing with croissants and coffee and pastries and cereals and toasts and fruit. We got upgraded to a king size bed in a beautiful room - huge! Only downside was noise coming from the bar on a Saturday night was like a dance party in our room, but what do you expect in this fabulous location? Thank you for everything!

title: great stay - apartment feel with a bit of B&B.
text: this was a great spot for a first-time visit with the kids to NYC. rooms were very clean, charming, safe. location was excellent for most of the things we wanted to do. great food nearby. hotel folks were superb in helping us navigate the city - from the best way to get to where we wanted to go, to their favorite pizza/coffee/breakfast places, to ideas on things to do. definitely had an apartment feel, but with a touch of B&B (minus the gourmet breakfast - go out for that). no high-rise feel or formal NYC hotel in it.

title: Campbell family holiday to NYC
text: First trip to NYC for our family of two adults plus teenage boy and girl. We booked a two bedroom suite on the 5th floor which had an additional pullout bed in the living area so this worked well, pull out bed was very comfy unlike many we have suffered in the past. Air con and Wi-Fi were also both must haves for us and were excellent. We enjoyed complimentary teas, coffees, hot chocolate etc as well as breakfast each day and the staff were all very helpful. Our rooms had a balcony with stunning views of the city, also overlooking restaurants on the street below and we could see the lights of Times Square which was only a few minutes walk away. Would definitely recommend this accommodation for comfort, location and hospitality. We also recommend Bourbon bar / restaurant next door for amazing food at good prices and Amy's Pantry at the bottom of the block (on 9th) for their excellent coffee. Photos of the views from our rooms including the 4th July lights and coffee art from Amy's...

title: Fabulous hotel in great location!
text: We booked a two bedroom (1 bathroom) apartment on the fifth floor for five nights in June 2016.  We arrived late in the evening after a transatlantic flight and were amazed to find we had our own large balcony which was particularly great at night when surrounded by the lights of NYC.  Times Square was just down the end of the street.  Complimentary mineral water and a wide choice of coffee (and tea) for the coffee machine.  Great size apartment with very comfortable large beds kept very clean and serviced thoroughly each day by very attentive staff.  Without exception all the staff were helpful, friendly and nothing was too much trouble.  Wide range of choice from the continental breakfast in the roof terrace bar superbly managed by Kevin each morning.  This is a hotel we would be very happy to return to and have no hesitation in recommending The French Quarters to anyone wanting bespoke, well-priced accommodation in a fabulous location right in the heart of Hells Kitchen.

title: Great location
text: This is hotel cannot be better for price and location. It just around the Connor from time square. But just far enough that it's quite and relaxing. The restaurant attached to this hotel is good.This hotel situated and restaurant Row so there's plenty choose from.

title: A wonderful hotel!
text: My mother, my sister and myself stayed at this hotel in June and found it utterly delightful! The rooms are cosy, the beds are comfortable and the bathroom was clean and reasonably new. The included breakfast was only continental but had a good selection and the joining bar/restaurant had excellent food in the evening. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. It has an excellent location right near Times Square but also surprisingly quiet. We would definitely stay again!

title: A wonderful stay...we wished it could have been longer
text: We stayed at this hotel the Saturday night before our Sunday cruise out of New York. The woman working the front desk when we arrived was absolutely fantastic (I wish I had gotten her name). We reserved a room through booking.com but that didn't stop them from upgrading us to a nicer room. We had a nice "double double" room (#204) which had a small kitchenette area and two double beds. There was a cure egg coffee machine with a good variety to choose from including coffees, tea, hot chocolate etc.The bathroom was very nice as well. The location was also very convenient. We will be back again.

title: very nice rooms
text: the location is handy, as it is very close to the Lincoln tunnel when coming from out of town.  i wish they had a better deal with another parking lot, as it is VERY hard to drive up through times square/broadway to turn around.  we loved the stoop and the restaurant was good.  no ice machines, the restaurant brings you an ice bucket, but there is a little fridge to keep sodas and water in.  the shower and bathroom was lovely, and it felt like we were somewhere else in the city, instead of blocks from time square.

title: Best Place to Stay in NYC
text: Second time staying here. There is an ambiance that I love. Very clean, attractive room. This room was smaller than t h e last one but perfectly comfortable. Frig, Keurig, cooktop, ironing board..L'ocitane toiletries...they even had an umbrella on the coat rack in case it rained. Great Hell's Kitchen location. Close to Times Square and the theater district but more sane. Lots to do and see. Love this hotel. Restaurant /bar very entertaining. Continental breakfast. Go there

title: Excelente!!!
text:
La ubicación es perfecta, está cerca de todo y es una zona con mucho movimiento y actividades para hacer. 
Las habitaciones son muy lindas, limpias y ordenadas. Proporcionan café y te para prepararse uno en el cuarto. El desayuno es bastante completo. La atención y el servicio son excelentes.

title: Holiday
text: Excellent hotel apartment reasonably priced, excellent staff very friendly nothing is to much trouble, excellent location in Hells Kitchen, continental breakfast included excellent standard and the waiter always smiling very helpful and friendly

title: Too good to be true
text:
I never expect to find such amazing place in the heart of Hell's Kitchen at so nice price, with best ever staff in New York hotels (it's real attitude - small "almost at home" hotel, good dinning suggestions and interest what I can recommend, hand written letter of the owner "welcome back", etc.).
Good breakfast and amazing coffee and tea selection in the room with the real coffee machine and small fridge!

title: Good location
text: On 'Restaurant Row', close to Broadway. Although basic cooking facilities are provided, it's fine as a straightforward hotel, with breakfast provided in the adjacent restaurant. Reasonable value for a smallish, clean room. Decent service.

title: hotel charmant à taille humaine
text: Quel bel hôtel situé dans un quartier agréable.Nous avions une chambre 2 lits au 3 eme étage avec vue sur la rue.J'ai été très etonnée du calme (relatif car on est quand même à New york) qui régnait dans la chambre.Pas du tout gênée par le bruit de ce quartier très animée.Chambre vraiment très propre dotée d'une super literie trés très confortable.Belle salle de bain avec une grande douche. Chaque matin devant la porte journal + info du jour concernant des activités à faire.Personnel très avenant, gentil et poli toujours prêt à rendre service.Vraiment un super séjour, j'y retournerai les yeux fermés. Seule petite déception , le petit déjeuner: je le trouve vraiment pas très apaitissant.

title: BEST KEPT SECRET IN NYC
text: Perfect location, quiet, spacious and beautiful rooms, helpful employees, all reasons we LOVE this property.  A tradition on our annual girls' trip to NYC.  They are just simply amazing.  Priced right and close to EVERYTHING!!

title: Really nice in the vibrant Hells Kitchen
text:
The apartment is in the style of a New York old tenement in the centre of Hell's Kitchens restaurant area, With lots of nice restaurants and lots happening.The rooms are nicely presented and the bathrooms large and modern.The front desk are very friendly and helpful. The apartments are over two buildings, the main building has a lift.
Breakfast are taken in the main building and are continental and as you would expect..Two good Italian restaurants immediately across the street.Times Square is about 10 minute walk away.
