Front desk can arrange for a car pickup to the airport at about $10 more than a taxi,

title: A brief stay in New York
text: I spent a lot of time researching places to stay for our short trip to New York, I did not want a bland corporate hotel and I was not disappointed, friendly, welcoming, very clean and a great location in a lovely leafy avenue but just minutes away from Times square.,

title: Great spot close to everything!
text: My husband, 18 year old daughter and I stayed for 2 nights mid week.  They generously gave us an early check-in as our room was available.  They showed us up to and around our relatively spacious (for New York standards) and comfortable room.  Simple but nice breakfast with a very nice server. Keurig coffee/tea etc in the room and bottled water was free!   Great location - walked everywhere from Central Park to Parson's School of Design. Would definitely recommend!

title: Ideal City Centre hotel
text: This was our second stay at the French Quarters , and we were not disappointed . This little hotel is ideally located on 46th Street , right in the middle of restaurant row .  While it describes itself as an apartment hotel , what you get is basically a hotel room , with a very rudimentary kitchenette , not really usable for any cooking as there are no utensils whatever .  The staff are pleasant , and the complimentary continental breakfast adequate , although the same every day.  Not cheap , but that is perhaps not to be expected because of the location.

title: Awesome Accommodations
text: Wow, this is the first time I have stayed here and was very impressed with this boutique hotel right on Restaurant Row, W.46th street between 8th and 9th Ave.  The manager, Colin, was a true gentleman, very helpful and pleasant.  He escorted us up to the room and showed us where everything was.  A beautiful room; king size bed, little kitchenette with Kurig coffeemaker and dozens of varieties to choose from, a refrig. with 2 bottles of Evian water and a super size shower in the bathroom.  Very, very clean and decorated beautifully.  The only drawback was the loud music underneath us from the bar and we were told about that when we made the reservation, so get a room that is not over the bar.  Great continental breakfast in the atrium level.  Very fresh pastries, yogurt, bagels, crossaints, fresh fruit, just delicious.  The restaurant next to it has great food and drink and you're right in the heart of times square and restaurant row.  It was a great deal for the money.  I would stay there again.

title: Luna di miele
text:
Hotel molto carino e curato nei particolari. Si trova a due passi da Times Square ma nonostante la vicinanza al centro la notte si riposa bene ed è silenzioso.
Le camere sono confortevoli ed essenziali. Ottimo il rapporto qualità prezzo!

title: Fantastic hotel in a great location
text: If your thinking of booking a hotel in New York this the place to stay great staff (big shout out to Kevin, who is a ray of sunshine  in the mornings) beautiful rooms and a great location what more do you need !! Also has the bourbon bar located right next to it which is also excellent.

title: Will come back again
text: This was my 2nd stay here, this time with my daughter for her 21st birthday. Once again everything was great, we really enjoyed our stay. We had a double double room, the beds are so welcoming and comfortable. It is a fantastic alternative to the sterile big hotel chains. Everyone is more than happy to stop and chat and give you advice on what to do for the day ahead, or just to discuss the weather. The location is perfect, so many restaurants close by to choose from. The bourbon bar downstairs has a great atmosphere. I would suggest if you are staying on a weekend to have some earplugs, as the bar is really popular and I found can get a bit noisy, but it would not deter me from staying here.

title: A little gem in Hell's Kitchen
text:
My husband and I stayed here in May 2016 for 3 nights and after a weary travel over from the UK were checked in with ease and upgraded to a king suite. The room had a keurig coffee machine with around 25 separate coffee pods as well as a kitchen area with a fridge, hob and a sink. The bed was huge and we were left with a bottle of Prosecco as it was our honeymoon.
In comparison with New York standards the hotel is tiny and is situated directly above a bar. The bar is where the breakfast is served in the morning which is Continental. We did not try a breakfast even though it is included in the price as we are regular visitors to New York and we have our favourite diner - Westway Diner just round the corner on 614 9th avenue near 44th street. You'll always see cops in there!!
When we booked the hotel through booking.com we were advised that the room was above the bar. Any hotel room below the 13th level will be loud as New York City never sleeps. We were prepared for this however and we did have earplugs. Having said that the music wasn't a problem when we went to bed, it was more when we were woken up at 1:30 am with the vibrations. We would however stay in the hotel again as it wasn't really an issue for us. The hotel is in excellent, safe and leafy location within a few blocks of Times Square. It is also in a road called restaurant row where there are many different restaurants catering for everyone. Every morning we had a newspaper waiting for us outside the front door together with an information sheet as to what was going on in the city which was a nice touch. 
When coming from the airport you can either get a yellow taxi by waiting in line. There is a standard charge per taxi of around $55 which will include any tolls. Do not be tempted to talk to any other person touting around the line as they will charge you double or triple the price given half the chance and they are not licensed. The journey took quite a while due to usual heavy traffic. I think the journey took around an hour and a half. Alternatively if you are short on cash you can get the air train directly from JFK airport and you can stop at (E train) 50th Street. Price of this is approximately seven dollars per person. We will definitely stay in this hotel again. The rooms are beautifully decorated and clean although some may find them on the small side but again to us this wasn't an issue.

title: Excelente ! Super recomendado !
text:
Tivemos a  melhor estadia possivel neste hotel.
Quarto e serviços excelentes. Quarto muito limpo. Staffs do hotel super atenciosos.
Localização maravilhosa. Tudo perto, restaurantes, comercio, times square e metrô. 
Super recomendado.
Retornaria com certeza.

title: Dec 2016 Andrea Bocelli
text:
what a fabulous hotel! beautiful, small, lively and close to it all!! The staff were very helpful. location was great, about 20 mins walk to everything! the rooms were so classic, clean and cozy. it was a little more loud on the front of the building than that back for sure. 
happy hour at the bar next door was from 12:00ish till 4 ish.. :)

title: Charmoso e tem tudo que vc precisa
text: Um quarto confortável e que tem alguns utensílios domésticos que tornam sua estadia mais próxima do seu lar. A cama é confortável e o quarto é bem limpo. Funcionários atenciosos e gentis sempre dispostos a ajudar. Na rua tem um ótimo restaurante brasileiro! e É mt perto do metro e da Times.

title: Fantastic weekend break in the Big Apple!
text: Awesome hotel! Staff are very, very friendly and helpful. The Service was brilliant. The GM is a wonderful character who knows everything there is to know about NY and getting the best out of your stay! He's like a little genie in a bottle; ask him and he will deliver!! Hotel was fantastic. Location is out of this world; only 1 min 42 secs walk from Time Square! If you don't stay here you'd be a fool!  Thank you for an amazing weekend!!!😀🍾🍸🚁🗽

title: Amazing experience!
text:
We stayed at the French Quarter for 4 nights in a two bedded suite and had great service.  

The apartment was really well furnished, really clean and in a great location.  We particularly like the detail of the rooms (pillow shelves).

What made our stay was the GM. He is a lovable character and really attentive!

title: Very nice accommodations - with some shortcomings however
text:
Almost everything was fine.

Exceptions:  One of the desk clerks did't seem too bright; gave us questionable advice, recommendations, etc.  Let's leave it at that.
All the others were fine.

Another item that perturbed us was when my wife asked only for a grass of wine at a table on the mezzanine of their adjoining bar/restaurant she was told that only meals were served there and if she wanted just a glass of wine then she would have to go down to the first floor -- all while the waitress stood around doing nothing as the late afternoon passed.  We can't particular blame her since she indicated that it was establishment policy.
Well, screw that, we went elsewhere not only for the drink, but also for all evening meals the rest of the week -- and this one item might well influence us to recommend friends to stay elsewhere. Certain management decisions while perhaps at times are necessary, at other times they are downright stupid, but disproportionately do color a guest's satisfaction level.

title: Very handy hideaway in the heart of Manhattan
text:
For a first time visitor to NYC (we had just five days), The French Quarters is perfectly located on W 46th St just west of 9th Ave, on Restaurant Row, and a mere 5 minutes walk to Broadway and Times Square. Walking distance to Central Park also. In fact most major points of interest are within walking distance, or a subway ride away.

The hotel is small, the management and staff friendly and helpful. We had a reasonable sized room on 3rd floor overlooking the street. It's a little noisy at night but, hey, we wanted to be in central Manhattan. Room and facilities were clean and well presented.

Overall, an excellent and economical solution for a short stay in Manhattan.

title: Intimate hotel in theater district
text:
Great location on 46th in restaurant row. My room was upgraded to a very large one with a king bed, armchair and other amenities like a fridge and large bathroom. 

I was aware when I booked it that it would be noisy as it was directly over the bar. I would not book it again as the weather was good and the outside bar had the roof open, which compounded the noise. 

I would book the hotel again, just not this room.

title: NYC OK
text:
Stayed in a twin double bed on 2nd Floor, Clean comfortable and tended daily by Maids.
Spacious room with a great bathroom with a wonderful shower.
Breakfast in the Mezzanine level was great with Staff attentive pleasant and helpful with good choice of cereals, bagels,yoghurt, fresh fruit and condiments and juices tea and coffee.Kevin always had suggestions and ideas as where to go and what too see, the Hi Line was great.
Reception staff always helpful and good source of local knowledge, special thanks to Nao for printing off See Forever tickets for me.
Bourbon Street bar was a plus being next door & on level B in elevator(lift).
The only downside was the noise from venue opposite "Don't Tell Mamma" I think somebody should tell Mamma playing it louder doesn't make it sound any better in fact quite the opposite.
But hey this is NEW YORK the city that doesn't sleep.
Cannot fault the French Quarters Guest Apartments at all, would recommend & it's just a stroll from Times Square & subway.
Thanks for a great stay.

title: The suite was perfect for my family
text:
I was traveling with my two kids and one other adult and rented the 2BR suite. This suite was spacious and the amenities were perfect for a family - a microwave, fridge, cooktop (though we didn't use it). 

The decor was lovely. The pictures on the web don't do it justice. 

The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars was because there was no room service. Otherwise this place was fabulous and close to everything we wanted to be near.

We travelled mid week so we didn't experience the noise mentioned in some of the other reviews. 

The staff was helpful and attentive. This will be our go to NYC hotel.

title: Приятный отель
text: Приятный отель, очень маленькие номера, но чисто. Обслуживание приятное. Расположение отеля просто великолепно! Все в пешеходной доступности. Вокруг много хороших ресторанов. ПО приезду заказал доставку в отель детали для палатки и доставку задержали. Сотрудники отеля оказали максимальную помощь, за что им отдельное спасибо. В номерах есть электромашина, делает чай или кофе. Удобно. Только непонятно, есть мини плита, но ни кастрюлек не посуды нет. А так все очень удобно.

title: Great stay here
text: We spent 3 nights in New York this past weekend and I found The French Quarters through Trip Advisor. We were looking for something that was close to the bustle and this location in Hell's Kitchen in the Theater District worked out perfectly. The rooms are not the cheapest but neither are they the most expensive and for the location and quality, I think our money was well spent. The room was spacious with a large bathroom. I especially liked the bathroom layout which had a large shower and really good water pressure in the shower. The daily newsletter under our door letting us know what was going on in the area daily is a nice personal touch. Continental breakfast is included in the price of the room and there were good options with cereal, coffee, bagels,scones, fruit and juices. You can't beat free (included in the price) in NYC. The staff were great. I'd advise having ear plugs, you are in the city and they have no control over music playing across the street at night which you can hear. It is in the theater district. All in all, a good stay and I would return.

title: Great
text: We stayed in a 2-room apartment and it was excellent, especially the huge showers and the coffee machine with a very good range of beverages. Noise can be a problem is some New York hotels, but this was nice and quiet despite a bit of noise from the street at night (unavoidable in NY if your room is facing the street; on the plus-side, it had a balcony with terrific views down to Times Square and to the north). Staff were relaxed, friendly without being obsequious and extremely helpful, to the extent that they mailed (at their cost) some stuff we left behind. As a few people have mentioned, the location is terrific for the Theatre District and restaurant row. The breakfast is fine by continental standards; if you want something other than bread, cereal and fruit there are plenty of outside options available.

title: Another Great Trip
text: Our annual trip to NYC may have been the best yet.  We love this place. Location, staff, cleanliness, are all five star worthy.  I can't imagine staying any place else.  Bourbon Street bar is an added plus.

title: Perfect in every way
text: From the moment we walked in, we felt like we mattered. It was a surprise birthday trip for my wife and they treated us that way. A perfect spot, close to Times square, Central park, MSG, and great restaurants everywhere. The breakfasts are perfect to start the day. Everyone was so helpful. Room was immaculate. No issue at all. Fast wifi. We're going back.. we found our NYC hotel. You won't be dissapointed.

title: Charming and Convenient
text:
I really loved the location of this hotel right along restaurant row and a couple of blocks from the subway and Broadway.  It is small but hard to miss.  The outside looks like a Bourbon Street Bar and the inside front desk is small and cozy...old school.

The rooms were well appointed, comfortable beds, nice linen and a large shower.  Certainly not a lot of space but I did not expect much for Manhattan.  Never the less very lovely.

Continental breakfast was included with our rate and the experience was a nice start to our busy days running the street. The manager Colin was a very good host and offered tips on navigating New York. 

Attached to the hotel is a nice bar, the scene is lively and the food looked delicious.  The bartenders and wait staff was very friendly.  If you stay for a while and become bored with that bar, there are several others nearby.

I recommend this hotel for first timers because of its convenience.

title: Excellent New York City Boutique Hotel
text: My son and I stayed at French Quarters Guest Apartments for a week in late March/early April. The location is excellent, with numerous theaters, Times Square and Rockefeller Center area, and subway access only steps away. We stayed in a deluxe room on the first floor. The kitchenette with Keurig, sink, mini-refrigerator and cook top were welcome additions. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff is superb. Michael, John, Collin, Now (spelling???) and Monica were all very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast included a good selection and was very good. As others have noted, it can be a bit noisy on Thursday/Friday/Saturday nights with a bar being located below. (Perhaps staying on a higher floor would remedy this issue). In fact, that is the sole reason I did not give a 5-star rating. I would definitely stay at French Quarters again and I recommend that you do as well.

title: Best hotel service that i have ever experienced
text: From the moment we walked through the door the service was fantastic. We were taken up to our room and shown through it with all the amenities pointed out. location was fantastic, the continental breakfast was fine along with the staff who were all exceptional. The Manager was around the tables every morning and asked everyone what they were up to for the day and quick to offer any advice. My only down side (which I believe is typical for New York) is that the room was very small and the double bed up against the wall was not ideal but the rest of the hotel made up for it so don't let that put you off.

title: Beautiful place…but noisy.
text: This place is beautiful. Comfortable. Great staff. Lovely room. However, when we booked over the bar we were told that we may hear some chatting or laughing from bar patrons. What we heard was incredibly loud music til 4am. I was surprised our room wasn't shaking. I don't know whether the people on the upper floors could hear it. I don't know how they couldn't. I doubt we will stay here again which is a shame since it's such a lovely place.

title: Excellent
text: This is a gem in the heart of Nrw York. The rooms are spotless, large and well furnished with a great coffee maker. The guest house has a super bar and grill and we loved it. Two blocks (2 min walk) from Times Square it could not be better placed and one block the other way is Hells Kitchen which has some fantastic diners and deli's.

title: The best hotel I've stayed at!
text: My boyfriend and I spent one night at the French Quarters, and were very pleasantly surprised from the moment we checked in when the guy at the front desk escorted us to our room and showed us around, to the moment we left when the manager of the hotel helped us out and gave us directions to the parking garage. The service was exceptional and the staff was super nice and friendly! We loved the unique atmosphere in the hotel and the interior design of the room which was big, perfectly clean and with all sorts of amenities (including umbrellas to use if it rains outside!). The bed was extremely comfortable. Even though the hotel is in a central location in Manhattan and above a bar, we didn't hear any noise coming from the outside. There were numerous restaurants and attractions nearby. It was really the best stay we've had at a hotel so far!

title: Best spot in NYC
text: Shouldn't say this because I don't want any problems getting a reservation at the French Quarters. Perfect for a stay in the city. Such a great boutique hotel. This will always be my first choice when visiting. Greatest location in NYC.

title: Petit hôtel charmant
text:
Hotel de petite taille , situé à quelques blocks de Time Square et donc très pratique . Il est dans une rue animée , pleine de bars , de restaurants ; il est donc vivement recommandé de prendre une chambre sur cour.
Le personnel est accueillant et sympathique .
La chambre est petite et dispose d'une micro kitchenette et d'une bouilloire .Bien meublée et décorée .
Salle de bains sympa , dont la ventilation fait un bruit d'avion au décollage.
Bon petit déjeuner continental sous la verrière du restaurant attenant.

title: Great find, great service, great location
text: We stayed here when we went into the city for a show and had a great experience. A nice room with a huge bathroom and shower by NYC standards, free breakfast, walking distance to the theater district, and a very friendly front desk attendant who walked us up to our room to personally show us where everything was located, how to use the coffee maker and access the wifi etc. Great experience!

title: NYC with the family!
text:
Our family(2 adults + 2 teens) stayed at FQ last week and had the best time!  We were in the 2 bedroom suite (#501) and it was perfect for all of us!  On the 5th floor and yes, there was an elevator! 2 bedrooms connected by a living room and kitchenette.  1st bedroom had a king bed and the other had a queen.  Sofa also made out into a full sized sleeper.  1 big bathroom off of the living room area.  We also had a huge patio with outdoor dining table and chairs.  Patio and suite overlooked 46th street. Noise is there...but it wasn't bad!  It is New York!

Location if wonderful!  So many great restaurants close by!  Theaters are just a couple of blocks away!  Wonderful boutique hotel with fantastic customer service!

title: So zentral, dass die Ruhe eine Sensation ist
text: Wir, mein Sohn und ich, waren über Ostern in NYC und haben dieses Haus dank Booking gefunden. Die guten Bewertungen dort wurden hier bestätigt und wir fanden das Haus sogar noch besser. Wir hatten ein Zimmer im Townhouse, was den einzigen Nachteil hatte, dass es da keinen Aufzug gibt. Ansonsten sitzt man dort in nem Erker und glotzt auf den Times Square vor und geniesst das bunte Treiben in der Restaurant Row. Trotzdem sind die Zimmer, für NYC Verhältnisse sehr ruhig. Der Besitzer und das Personal sind äusserst freundlich und hilfsbereit, sodass wir sicher wieder mal dort einkehren werden. Positiv erwähnen muss man auch das angeschlossene Restaurant Bourbon Street Bar and Grille, wo es immer was Gutes gibt. Das nicht ganz soo abwechslungsreiche Frühstück kann den positiven Eindruck nicht im Geringsten trüben

title: French Quarters has Big Apple charm.
text:
Usually, I only stay at the national chain hotels, but my partner booked this reservation. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised and very satisfied. No complaints.

FQ is a small, unassuming brownstone walk-up. The next door building had no elevator, and we carried our own bags. No big deal. At first glance, I really liked our studio apt. #207. It had high ceilings, plenty of natural sunlight and even a bay window area with a small chair and ottoman for lounging. Nice touch! The exposed brick gave the room character, while the décor and wall treatments nicely complemented the hotel theme. (Another traveler has already posted pics of it.). The bathroom was clean, updated and a decent size.

Our room overlooked 46th St. Yes, there was plenty of street noise, but we live in a big city and hardly noticed the noise at all. It's just part of the NYC experience. 

FQ is in a great location-- only blocks away from B'way, and dozens of theaters and restaurants. The staff (Nao, Monica and Colin) were all friendly and very helpful when we briefly misplaced our tickets. I would definitely stay again at The French Quarters.

title: Charm, Good Service and Location, What More Could You Want?
text: Highly recommend this charming little boutique hotel near Time Square. The manager was wonderful, helpful, friendly and knowledgable. I have traveled all over the world and the management here ranks up there with the best I have experienced. Keep up the good work. The rooms, while not huge as expected, were very well appointed, clean and had everything one could want. The comfortable bed, great shower and The Nespresso machine in the room were all hits with us. The location was perfect as was the breakfast. Others have commented on the noise, this was not an issue for us at all but maybe that's because we are city people and let's face it, NYC is the city that never sleeps. Would definitely go again.

title: Wonderful stay!
text:
Beautiful, immaculate room, perfect location, and a friendly staff... I can't wait to go back!

My daughter and I wanted to spend a couple of days in New York, and were delighted to find this charming retreat just a few blocks away from everything we wanted to do. The bed was comfortable, the room was spacious, and the staff was great. The only minor issues were that the continental breakfast was just okay, and there were no plugs near the nightstands in our room, but neither of those issues will keep me from going back!

title: Great rooms, great location, but keep noise in mind.
text:
From check in to check out the staff in this little hotel were helpful and friendly, Our King Size room was located on the second floor, it was in good condition, spacious and with good air con. Kitchen area was small but well equipped whilst the bath room was of the highest quality. 
Location wise the hotel is perfectly placed to tour around New York, couple of Blocks to the Metro and located on a street was th a large number of varied restaurants, 
The downside of the location is that is can be noisy, but having read the reviews we took good ear plugs and were able to have good nights sleep each night, 
Breakfast is continental but plenty of variety whilst the guys tending the bar for breakfast are friendly and Bistecca FiorentinaI'll make good suggestions as to what to see nearby, 

Overall our week stay here was excellent and we will certainly try to stay here when we next return to New York.

title: Girls Weekend
text: Our annual trip never disappoints. Besides seeing a great show and having an unbelievable dinner across the street, the French Quarters feel like a home away from home. We actually even stay in on Friday night and have food and drinks in the apartment. Collin is very accommodating with what ever you need. Can't wait to go back.

title: WOW
text: Delighted to stay in this absolute Jewel of a hotel! So comfortable and quirky! Big shout out to the fantastic staff John and Colin. They were so helpful I felt that they were sharing our holiday. This is a fab hotel book it early!  The location couldn't be better with easy access to Times Square and Broadway. Onsite bar and food is perfect and I highly recommend trying out happy hour.

title: Best place for stay
text:
We have been twice during our vacation. When we return GM upgraded our room for the best one. We found cute personal card from GM.
It is the heart of Manhattan. Thanks a lot for hospitality and private limousine to the airport... 
Highly recommended

title: Sad when we can't stay there!
text: Best location! 5 min by foot to all the theaters! Walk around- save area. Best service! Perfect rooms - big enough furnished tasteful. Very friendly and very helpful people! Best value for money! When it is overbooked we get in trouble to find an alternative!

title: Très bon 3 étoiles et quartier
text:
Nous avons loué 2 chambres, les deux très spacieuses la 205 dans le bâtiment principal avec ascenseur dispose d'un très grand lit avec petite armoire pas assez grande pour deux personnes en hiver et long séjour, douche fixe, salle de bain moyenne, coin cuisine avec frigo en bref l'essentiel.
Pour la chambre avec deux lits il vous faudra vous y rendre par l'escalier de l'immeuble d'à côté la 307 est vraiment très agréable et bien disposée pas de coin cuisine dans celle ci mais machine pour café et thé mis à disposition gratuitement!
Produits occitane gratuits, petit parapluie dans chaque chambre.
L'accueil efficace et le patron toujours le mot qu'il faut et serviable et très sympathique staff très disponible mais plus discret.

Quartier super agréable proche de tout à 10 minutes de marche de Time square , nous y reviendrons sans doute.

title: Wonderful
text:
Just a one night stay to go to a Broadway show on 2/27 but this hotel was a great find!
I thought the room was much larger than anticipated,beautifully appointed and the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly.
I highly recommend it ( except for the days that we want to book it again)

title: Awesome stay!
text: We stayed at the French Quarter hotel for a girls weekend in New York City. The hotel is centrally located, can get to any major place in a couple of minutes. Times Square is two blocks away and we went to a Broadway show block away. We also ate at the restaurant and had a great time there. The room was a good size for New York City. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating with directions, holding luggage, and showing us to our room. In the room there was a Keurig with a huge assortment of options. When e arrived we all had hot chocolate together it was a nice touch. There is also complimentary water in the fridge something you never see in the city. The complimentary breakfast was also a huge plus, there was just enough of a selection to make everybody happy. It was really nice being able to stay in a small hotel in a great location and a huge city. We would definitely stay there again!!!

title: Fantastic place to stay.
text: Room was wonderful. Staff was attentive and made us feel welcome from the moment we stepped into the lobby.   We will definitely go back again.   Bourbon Street Bar and Grill is attached next door and is a great place to eat or relax with a beverage.   Owner and manager made a point of personally welcoming us as well.

title: Small boutique hotel in excellent location.
text: Second visit to this hotel - enjoyed much more second time round. We got upgraded to a larger room which was a nice touch. Reason for choosing this hotel is location - near to all the main sites/subway but far enough away to be quiet. Also enjoy the small intimate feel to the hotel, if you are someone who enjoys hanging about in a lobby or lots of common areas this is not for you however if your priority is location and a comfortable room and bed to fall into at the end of a day exploring this is definitely the place. Price wise it is competitive. Buffet breakfast is continental style and pretty basic but sufficient to get you started for the day. We would definitely stay again on our next visit to New York.

title: Hotel para poucas noites
text:
o Hotel é bem pequeno, mas muito aconchegante. Quartos bem decorados e limpos, com frigobar e cafeteira. Pela manhã eles deixam um impresso com dicas do que fazer na cidade, e com a previsão do tempo.
A localização é muito boa, perto da Times Square.

title: 5 dagen verbleven op loopafstand van Time  Squire
text:
Bijzonder hotel waarbij de gehele entourage wel iets van New Orleans heeft. Wij hadden een 2x 2 kamer. Weliswaar niet al te groot, maar ruim genoeg voor een verblijf van een dag of vijf. Heerlijke bedden en een mooie badkamer. Paar minuten van Time Squire en denk een minuut of twintig van Central Park. 
Zeer vrindelijke en attente bediening. Stuurde bv voucher voor busje naar JFK naar de receptie n nog voor ik beneden was lag deze al netjes uitgeprint klaar. Ook bij vertrek werden de koffers netjes klaar gezet bij de receptie. Ontbijt compleet, niet te. Bijbehorend restaurant is ook zeker de moeite waard om een keer wat te eten of na te borrelen. 
Enige min pintje was t ontbreken van een lift in t gedeelte waar wij verbleven . Wij hebben t echter niet als storend ervaren.

title: Enchanting Lodging at a Great Price
text: Our family of three had a fabulous time at The French Quarters. We were given a room adjacent to the main building (room 208). The hallways and room were charming with warm, well-kept-up decor. Our room and bathroom were especially spacious for NYC. Our room faced the back so we were never bothered by street noise. Monica at the front desk was a wonderful hostess and made us feel like family. The continental breakfast was nice and was served by a gracious host. The bagels were from a local bakery and the orange juice was from a half gallon container (not from one of those watered down self-serve juice machines).

title: wouldn't go again
text:
Overall I thought it was okay, by both my husband and daughter hated it.  

Pros
-- convenient to restaurant row and times square theaters; easy walk
--reasonable sized room for NY
--was able to get good price on booking.com ($200 per night with breakfast)
--unique decorating/architecture; not cookie cutter
--Coffee machine with lots of pods for tea, coffee, hot coco, hot cider and free bottle of water in room
--Continental breakfast included
--Nicely offered to pay for breakfast at a local place when their breakfast set up started an hour late due to someone oversleeping
--Our room faced away from the street and while the view was the backs of buildings next door it was super quiet for NY.
Cons
--Room was next door in a separate townhouse building, had to walk up a long narrow steep flight of stairs.  Card key was used to access street door and room no reception or hotel employees in that building just rooms, would not feel safe if I was on my own or with children.  Not good for seniors, etc. in terms of stairs.
--My husband and daughter felt the hall and room were dirty, not vacuumed, and they both thought the sheets smelled bad.  The housekeeping is limited to sheets being changed every third day of your stay, but they felt like the ones on our bed when we arrived smelled musty not fresh.  My husband said the bed was "tossed back together" in terms of housekeeping.  The grouting in the bathroom was a little moldy.
--The continental breakfast was plentiful in that there were hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereal, rolls, oatmeal packettes, muffins but the quality was not high-- the bagels and muffins were not tempting at all, like what you would buy in a grocery store.  I would skip this and got to Amy's breads around the corner for a delicious breakfast sandwich and pastry.
--No common areas at all to spend time, just a narrow hall with reception tucked in a corner in the main building.
--Weirdly the toilet paper holder was well out of reach of the toilet and the toilet was squished in so that you couldn't sit straight on it without hitting the shower door.  Very little room in the bathroom to put any toiletries, no wide sink, etc.
--Overall the decor was quite dark and a bit dreary.

title: Perfect place to stay
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this place. It is a very small hotel with only about 27 rooms. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and it was very large for a central Manhattan hotel. There was a bedroom with an enormous super king sized bed and a separate lounge with another tv, very comfortable seating and free coffee/tea maker with loads of free pods. There was also a fridge. The receptionists were all very friendly and helpful. A few quirky things to note- there are gorgeous l'occitaine toiletries but only single ply loo paper, the receptionist couldn't print out our tickets for us because the hotels firewall prevented her opening our PDFs, and there are no plates or cutlery in the room.  The lication of the hotel is perfect right in the centre of Hell's Kitchen really near the theatres and Times Square. A great place to stay -we wouldn't stay anywhere else in New York City.

title: Uma graça!!
text: Este hotel é bem pequeno mas vale muito a pena. Os quartos são muito confortáveis e bem decorados ao estilo francês (tem até itens Loccitane no banheiro) . Os funcionários são bem simpáticos. A localização é excelente, bem central.

title: Ótimo hotel!
text: Hotel excelente superando as expectativas. Destaque pela localização a 2 quadras da Times Square, dando pra fazer praticamente tudo a pé. Outro grande diferencial é o café da manhã que surpreendeu pela grande quantidade de itens além de estar incluído no valor da diária. Possui Wifi liberado e pega sem maiores problemas dentro do quarto. Todas as pessoas que conversei no hotel foram muito simpáticas e educadas, sendo que o gerente veio me cumprimentar pessoalmente perguntando sobre a minha estadia, o que mostra uma preocupação real com os hóspedes. Possui uma decoração bem interessante também, o que deixa a estadia mais agradável. O quarto possuía aquecedor, frigobar e cafeteira expressa com vários sabores de café a disposição. Todos os dias pela manhã eles deixam um jornal e um impresso com dicas para o que fazer na cidade, além de informações como a previsão do tempo para aquele dia. Com certeza é um hotel que ficaria sempre pois é bem mais pessoal do que aqueles hotéis gigantes totalmente mecanizados de NY.

title: Home in New York
text: Possibly the most enjoyable accommodation I've stayed in. Comfortable, warm and homely and that was just the staff. Colin, the manager, could not have made us feel more welcome, like we were visiting old friends (this was our first visit). A special mention too to Kevin who kept us feed at breakfast & worked hard to keep us in the loop with New York living & visiting. The room was clean, warm & comfortable & the mattress gets a special mention. If you suffer with jet lag or insomnia you're going to love these beds. Close enough to the centre to make walking into the heart of Manhatten a breeze but far enough away to make you feel like you're living in this great city, The French Quarters delivered an unforgettable introduction to the city that never sleeps but you'll want to when you get into bed. Excellent & a big thank you to all the staff (in both the hotel and bar) who made us feel so welcome.

title: great
text:
Lovely room , excellent attention to detail, superior linens, free breakfast. King size bed was very comfy. Right in the  theater district. 
The only downside to the location was the NOISE from the busy street ( nearTimes Square)  when sleeping.
Bring earplugs !  We had rare luck with street parking nearby ( holiday weekend ), don't count on it though.They recommend a slightly discounted garage nearby.

title: Lovely Quaint Place to Stay
text: Close to Times Square and the theatres. Quiet street. Clean and cozy. The staff was wonderful...very helpful and friendly. The owner/manager introduced himself in the breakfast room and was very welcoming and friendly. The Continental breakfast was very good and plentiful. Coffee was good and I am a fussy coffee drinker! Excellent bakery scones and muffins. Will definitely stay again!

title: Fantastic Accommodation in the Heart of New York
text: The French Quarters is the perfect place to stay in New York. It is close to Times Square and Broadway with good access links to all the attractions. Colin, the general manager, and the staff are very welcoming. Nothing is too much trouble. The accommodation is luxurious, despite the rates being extremely reasonable, and there are one or two nice touches in the rooms, a fab coffee maker, l'occitane products, excellent shower and a very comfy bed. I could not recommend this accommodation more highly. I will definitely be going back.

title: Great to stay in New York
text: We just returned from 10 days staying at The French Quarters and it was fantastic. Everything is as it appears on the website. The room was very comfortable and quiet as I'd requested a room at the back and they kindly obliged. There we three of us in a double room and we were very comfortable. The bathroom is spacious and clean. The staff were really helpful and friendly. Also included in the price is a buffet breakfast. The location is ideal, really in the heart of everything so it's amazing our room was so quiet. I highly recommend these lovely apartments.

title: Aconchegante!
text: Estamos adorando o hotel. Charmoso, aconchegante, acolhedor, excelente localização. Pretíssimo de times square. O bar é uma delicia, o serviço muito bom, todos cordiais.Há um restaurante brasileiro muito próximo para quem se cansar do fast food.

title: Wedding
text:
Myself and my now wife arrived at the French quarters hotel we were met with a warm welcome and shown to our room which was spacious and very well equipped with a coffee machine, iron, hair dryer and even a fridge. The room had a New Orleans feel about it and was very well presented. A Lovely continental breakfast was on offer each morning. 

We travelled to New York to get married and I have to say the staff at the French quarters added some really nice touches to our already special day. They provided us with free prosecco and arranged for a limo to take us to our venue.

We had an amazing time and can't speak highly enough of the French quarters and we will definitely be back!! 

Also the bourbon bar which is attached to the hotel and owned by the same management has a great atmosphere and lovely food especially the New York strip steak!

The prices were very reasonable too!!

Thanks v much French quarters :)

title: The BEST!
text:
It was our first trip to New York and I wanted somewhere close to a Times Square to feel the buzz! We literally couldn't have got closer, perfect location! 
Our room was in the building next door, the first one as you come in through the door. Now I am the lightest sleeper EVER and had brought ear plugs after reading reviews but I didn't need them once. The room was really spacious by New York standards with a fab bathroom and beautiful products.
I loved loved the newsletter every morning to keep us updated on what was happening that day in the city. 
We only went for breakfast twice during our week but it was fab, and the service was excellent. 
Will certainly stay here on my return to New York!

title: Great, central location/ best service in NYC
text:
The French Quarters
Great location - best service in NYC
WE came to stay at French Quarters for our honeymoon. We arrived extremely jet lagged (from Japan) and were greeted kindly by the hotel manager Colin. He informed us we'd been upgraded because we were on our honeymoon and took us upstairs and personally gave us a tour of the 'best apartment in the quarters" he wasn't joking about that! It was stunning - huge super king beds in both rooms - although we only needed one, 2 massive bathrooms stocked with beautiful L'Occtane products and a long balcony  looking over the city. Colin then offered to give us advice on a restaurant for lunch which we gladly accepted. He was so kind, so helpful, genuinely wanted to give you the best experience. I couldn't talk more highly of him. He sent us to an Amazing Mexican joint which we absolutely loved! Arriving home later that night we received a note under the door saying to call reception they had a surprise for us. After a call, they came up with a bottle of champagne to congratulate us on our wedding. Saying it was the least they could do (As if the hadn't done enough by upgrading us to the penthouse!) how thoughtful! 💟 It was my first time in NYC so Hells Kitchen is a great location to see all the sites- Central Park, Times Square, Empire State, Grand Central Statikn etc... and a short subway ride from the cooler downtown areas for dinners and shopping, or uptown to the museums. At the hotel, they will gladly give you ideas on what's the best to check off your list as well as having many walking guides and maps you can take with you. They deliver the paper and a run down on weather and events that are happening daily, which is great! Breakfast was as is / continental, nothing to write home about but you kinda want something simple if you're eating out late. All in all, if you want exceptional service and a great central location, this is the place for you! 5 stars ! Thanks Colin and all the staff at the French quarters!

title: Exactly what you want if you don't like bland chain hotels!
text:
We went to NYC with our 16 year old daughter so what we wanted was comfort and somewhere that was a bit different.  The location is excellent - we were able to walk to a different place to eat every night, you can see Times Square from the rooms and I was able to run to central Park (0.8 miles!).  The design of the room was fabulous (we had the double double) - there was loads space and the hot drink facilities were more than welcome.  The bathroom was wonderful with more towels than we ever needed and lovely toiletries.  Being able to have breakfast there each day saved us lots and the food was good and filling - thanks to Kevin who was cheerfulness personified! Oh and finally -the daily bulletins were brilliant - especially when jet lag woke us us by 5 am each day - we had something to read!

All of the staff were lovely and helpful and arranged a taxi for us and looked after our bags.  We would return in a shot if we could!

title: Return  trip just as good
text:
We first visited this hotel for my 4th in 2012 after it was recommended by a friend, and we returned 2 years later taking the inlaws. 
The rooms are large for NYC and breakfast is included in the price.
Superb location for times square and within easy walking distance to the subway.
Staff were superb and nothing was a problem.
The bar downstairs gets busy, especially during sporting events but has a great atmosphere and there is always a deal on hurricanes.
Within the restaurant area so loads of places to eat and drink.

title: Beautiful and comfortable
text:
The room is very cosy with a beautiful French style decor, comfortable bed, luxurious bathroom with l'Occitane toiletries. The personnel is very responsive and helpful. They also serve a complimentary breakfast - the variety of food is very good. Keep in mind that the neighborhood is very busy since it's Hell's Kitchen. Though the street outside is quite noisy you forget about it when you enter the hotel. I would highly recommend this guest house to everyone!

Отправлено с iPhone

title: Simply FANTASTIC
text:
I have been here before and i had a good experience, but this time it wa GREAT... we were 3 in a room and i was afraid we would be stepping on each other but the room was large and the bed super confortable, i loooove the batroom with walk in shower ! nice OCCITANE products. I also love that they have a coffee machine available with tons and tons of different coffees and teas! We got stuck there during the snowstorm, and they left us the same room until late in the afternoon in time to catch the flight... Also the manager helped us find a ride to the airport.. I am quite impressed, 
Let us not forget the FREE BREAKFAST!!! will definitly go back!!! I must say i booked early and found a real deal for the room... i'm not sure it's so affordable in full season!

title: Super Hotel an bester Lage
text:
Wahren ende September im French Quarters, hatten eine super Zeit, kann das Hotel mit gutem Gewissen weiterempfehlen.
Speziell das Personal inklusive Manager wahren sehr zuvorkommend.
Für die Qualität und Lage ist der Preis gerechtfertigt, achja, eine gute Bar ist auch gleich im Haus.

title: lindo demais!!
text: Esse hotel e uma fofura!! Fiquei apaixonada por tudo, pela entrada, pelos corredores, pelo quarto, pelo bar embaixo (comida excelente, a melhor de NY), pelos guardas-chuva, por tudo!! um hotel tao acolhedor num lugar como a big apple fez com que nos apaixonassemos ainda mais por essa cidade!! Vale muito a pena se hospedar no The French Quarters, a poucos minutos da Times Square e do buxixu!! Amei tudo!! I LOVE NY!!!

title: Lovely base to explore from, value for money, excellent service!
text:
This was my 3rd visit to New York (1st for Mum and Sister). I stayed in the Radisson on Lexington Avenue on my first stay which was a good hotel, again in a nice location (This hotel has now been refurbished and is more expensive than when I stayed) and I also stayed in the Crown Plaza in Times Square. This hotel was central but extremely busy once you exit the front door. I much preferred the French Quarters to both these hotels for its location, service and experience and would most definately stay here again and would advise others to also. 

Location - Hells Kitchen area which is 2 blocks from Times Square, very close to broadway shows - 5 minute walk away! Located in an area with a variety of food establishments so you can never go hungry. The bus terminal is a 10 minute walk from the hotel.  We could not fault the location of this guest house. 

Room - We booked a double double room which is what it says on the tin - 2 double beds which were extremely comfy and warm. The room was large, much larger than it looks on the website. A lovely, tastefully decorated room and bathroom. Spotlessly clean. Lovely hot shower which we were happy with. Safe in the room. The room was quiet, could hear a pin drop at night. 

Service - 
On arrival we were greeted by a lovely lady who checked us in and showed us to our room. She explained how the coffee machine worked, breakfast times etc.
Each morning we had a news update posted under the door informing us of what is going on that day in areas of Manhatten etc. 
Breakfast was served in a conservatory style loft. Variety of cereals, muffins, bagels, toast, yoghurts, fruit, hot and cold drinks. Plentiful and tasty. I have stayed in New York twice before and never got breakfast in with the price so this was excellent value for money. On 2 occasions during our stay the owner of the guesthouse greeted us at breakfast time and enquired about our stay etc. Lovely to see!
We had an evening flight on the way home but the hotel kept our bags safe.

Overall this guest house is value for money in a good location, easily accessible for attractions. Excellent service, polite, friendly staff. 
I hope this helps you all!

title: Good location comfortable hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here with our three daughters (17-22). We stayed in room 402 which has: one large room with queen bed, chair, ensuite; one much smaller room with queen bed and wardrobe and a shared lounge area between with bathroom , microwave, coffee machine fridge and very comfortable double sofa bed. We didn't have breakfast. Free wifi. The rooms were very clean,staff were very attentive helpful and friendly. Despite being a real 7 mins walk from Time Square in a very busy road, our room was very quiet. Lots of restaurants in the same road and Broadway is 2 blocks away. We would highly recommend this for a few nights stay.

title: Excellent Honeymoon Apartment
text:
We stayed at The French Quarters on our honeymoon and first time in NYC, lovely quaint little apartment that we'd been upgraded to as soon as we arrived - great start.
The staff even left a bottle of Champagne for us in the fridge!

Nice sizeable room with vintage style decor. Extremely comfy bed and all amenities at a clean and high standard. Staff were very pleasant and friendly, especially the guy serving us breakfast in the annexed restaurant.

Couldn't have picked a better location with a wealth of restaurants, theatres and bars all within walking distance. Would definately stay there again. Highly recommended.

title: First Class
text: We didn't know what to expect on our first trip to New York. We booked the French Quarters on the strength of previous reviews and I can honestly say we were not disappointed. Firstly the accommodation is in an excellent location with Times Square, Central Park, Empire State and so many more major attractions within walking distance. The accommodation was spacious, clean and comfortable and after a long days sightseeing it was nice to come back and feel at home. The maid came every day including Christmas day and topped up the complimentary tea and coffee and replaced the towels etc. The staff at the hotel were so friendly and could not do enough for the guests. Finally the bar below (Bourbon bar & Grille) the staff were extremely friendly and informative, it had a great atmosphere, excellent food and great place to unwind before retiring for the night.

title: Location is key
text: Loved the location next to all the exciting and fancy places. Room was big enough and clean. The service was to my standards and includes free breakfast and also wifi. Nice comfortable bed it was what I was looking for great time in new york.

title: Times square sans les inconvenients
text:
Apres avoir ecluser quelques grands hotels surpeuplés style mariott a NY,  qu il est bon de retrouver un petit hotel a taille humaine simple et charmant !
Chambre spacieuse  et confortable, accueil sympathique, quartier animé ( restaurants, diner spectable, bar) a 2 pas de la vie trepidante de times square
Bref, sans hesitation.

title: Room is fine but noise pours through the walls
text: It would be nice to actually be able to sleep but music is loud and the bass is pounding. So very disappointing and disappointed. Perhaps we are "nobodys " so the hotel didn't care where they stuck us. I know where I want to stick them.....

title: Still the best
text: Second time here in two years, so central to everything, 5 min walk to times sq, even easy to walk to Central Park , hotel is very good, great rooms, very big, comfortable king size beds, good service, stay here, you will not be disappointed .over $300 a night, but worth every cent, breakfast included , also free wifi, and very fast.

title: Mini vacation
text: Warm, friendly. We had a lovely stay. Beds are amazingly comfortable! Staff are very helpful. We drove from Boston and they have a good deal with a garage about a block away.  I left my wallet at the garage and they went above and beyond to get it back to me. The restaurant attached is beautiful. The drinks are good, the food not so much. It's not a problem as there are tons of restaurants in the area. Perfect location and an extremely comfortable stay.

title: Muy buen hotel
text:
Excelentemente ubicado. En la 46th entre la 8th y la 9th. Incluye desayuno comeleto
La atención es muy buena y las habitaciones acogedoras y cuentan con suficiente espacio. Los valores son normales para la ciudad y el sector de Manhattan en el cual se encuentra.

title: Convenient and Comfortable
text: This is a great small place on West 46th.  Easy walk to many sites, broadway shows, and metro.  Our room was smallish, but the bathroom was very nicely upgraded with a spacious walk-in shower.  The inn does have larger rooms also, for a price.   The staff is a real plus here--very helpful.  The breakfast is continental but certainly sufficent.  A nice bonus.

title: A home away from home
text:
Decided to stay here after reading the reviews on here, it was a decision well made. Having been to NYC three times before,this was by far the best place I'd stayed of the 4.

Location was perfect, only a short walk to Times Square and close to many good restaurants. 

We arrived early to be greeted by very friendly John and were told we had been upgraded and that the room was ready for us to check in.

One of the personal touches that made me know it was going to be a good stay was the card left in the room wishing us a pleasant stay. The New York Times was left outside the door every morning as well as an info sheet letting us know the weather for the day and events that were going on that day.

The room itself was a decent size, clean, kitchenette equipped with coffee machine and fridge. The bed was massive, with numerous cushions and very comfy to sleep in. 

The bathroom was beautiful and immaculate, many towels and L'occtaine toiletries were provided. The shower itself was a power shower and was very welcome after a busy day.

Continental breakfast was self serve but Kevin served cold drinks. Kevin was so friendly and always put a smile on our face, even letting us take some extras for snacks for the day. 

The one downside which did let it down was being right above the bar, it was incredibly noisy into evenings making it very difficulty to sleep. So if you do. House to stay here,ask for a room at least above the first floor! 

I would recommend The French Quarters and I will definitely be returning there next time I am in NYC.

title: Just Perfect!
text:
Just got back from a 2 night stay at this cozy and charming hotel.  The staff was wonderful, the breakfast was more than enough and noise-street or otherwise, was never a problem.  The restaurant next door, Bourbon Street, was good and nicely decorated.  I could go on an on about this place - the location is perfect - we walked everywhere - Grand Central, Strawberry Fields, Macy's, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, Sak's, Radio City.  We were celebrating our 30th Anniversary and received a complimentary bottle of Proseco, which was very nice!
Monica, Kevin and all the rest, you have a wonderful place - thanks and Merry Christmas!

title: "I'll be back"!
text: My 7th visit to New York and this is by far the best accommodation I have stayed in. In terms of location,value for money,comfort and friendliness it would be hard to beat. The staff could not be more helpful....a special mention to Kevin who ensured we got fed each morning! His helpfulness and tips about New York were great! Our suite was home from home....cosy and comfortable...great views of the city skyline from our balcony. The bar downstairs was fantastic!

title: Lovely
text: My friend booked us into this place....and we weren't disappointed.  The room was stunning, comfortable and quite frankly faultless.  The staff were also excellent and friendly. It's in a great location and excellent value for money. I would definitely stay here next time I come to NYC.

title: We found a gem here!
text: Booked this hotel through Icelandair website when we booked our flights. The room was lovely,mhad two double beds, ensuite toilet and walk in shower. There was a safe in the room as well as a small ironing board, irin, hot drink (pod style) maker, fridge and small hotplateOur room was on the third floor, overlooking Restaurant Row and, subsequently, was a bit noisy, especially when the garbage lorry visited ariund 4am each day. This in no way spoil d our enjoyment of our stay at the French Quarters. Breakfast was included in the price of our room - a wide variety of cereals, milks, fruit juice, bagels, butter, preserves, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, croissants, toast, mini kuffins as well as tea and coffee from pump flasks. After the first day, the waiter knew my friend like her tea hotter than the water from the flasks and would quickly appear with a mug of boiling water for her. The personal tiuch was further enhanced by the manager visiting the dining area every morning to check with each party that everything was ok as well as offering advice about attractions etc. All in all, this establishment offers a far more personal service than the large hotel chains and we definitely plan to return.  It is very centrally situated just off 8th avenue and within a ten minute walk of Times Square. Thoroughly recommended in all respects.

title: Muito charmoso e com ótima localização
text: O hotel é bem localizado e tem um staff simpático e solícito. Os quartos são confortáveis, limpos, bem equipados, aconchegantes. O café-da-manhã, incluso na estadia, é muito bom. Fiquei hospedada no primeiro andar (em cima do bar) - no site em que fiz a reserva, este era o último quarto disponível naquele momento e eles já me informavam deste "porém": "quarto no primeiro andar, localizado sobre o restaurante" - mas, pelo menos para mim, o barulho que chegava ao quarto era bem pouco e não chegou a me incomodar nem um pouco.

title: Return trip to the French Quarter Guest Apartments
text: This was my third visit to this wonderful cozy hotel in the last year and a half.  Each time I return with new friends and they are so impressed with not only the accomodations and the location but more importantly the best staff any hotel has to offer.  From the time you arrive until the last minute you leave they go out of their way to give the best service possible.   I will return again soon and bring more friends with me.

title: 1st class beauty
text: Stayed here with 2 friends from 3rd Dec till 7 Dec 2015. Room was lovely and big enough for the 3 of us. Reception staff were excellent giving us best way to travel, eating in the area and any other questions we had in general. Continental breakfast was excellent and we were always warmly welcomed. Great place to stay and well centrally located and only a very short walk to Times Square. Would definately love to stay here again if ever come back to NYC.

title: Outstanding Gem in New York
text:
We spent 4 days in early Dec. at the French Quarters.  This is absolutely an incredible boutique hotel with a simply amazing staff.  The rooms are perfect and the attention to detail is fantastic from Keurig coffee machines with tons of coffee, tea, etc. to small kitchens, they have left nothing out. The continental breakfast in the morning was a great way to start the day along with the news paper at your door.  The location is perfect being right in the middle of tons of restaurants, and very close to Times Square.  We had  a room above the bar and yes it does get a little noisy as does the street itself but we had no problem ignoring it.  

Perhaps one of the highlights is having the pleasure of dealing with the staff as they are all exceptional.  It is quite refreshing to deal with people that are genuinely  concerned with customer satisfaction.  John O'Neil, the front office manager couldn't do enough for us whether making reservations for dinner, arranging for a taxi or giving advice.  
If I was the owner of this hotel (and the attached bar which is also amazing) I would be VERY proud.  I know I would be.

title: Great location, lovely apartment , great staff.
text: My husband and I spent six nights here , and enjoyed every minute of are stay , room was a bit small but immaculate , comfy bed and great location just of Times Square , a free continental breakfast  was a nice touch . Staff were lovely and friendly . The restaurant next door was also fab lovely food , would stay here again when we visit New York , a little gem in New York .

title: Gorgeous place
text:
I stayed here for a night as my birthday treat and it was perfect. Great location, close to everything but far enough down the road to be out of the bustle. 
Staff were lovely, warm and welcoming.
Breakfast was tasty and plentiful. 
Strongly recommend for people wanting to be involved in the city but also a place to sleep peacefully.

title: Fantastic stay, highly recommended
text:
My family of 4 stayed at FQ for 4 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

You could be forgiven for having doubts when the taxi drops you off outside but once inside you'll be delighted. The staff are all very engaging and friendly. When we had finished checking in the receptionist (Nao?) took us up to our room only to find the cleaners were still there just finishing up. Nao asked us to leave our bags and took us downstairs to the Bourbon Street Bar and Grille and shouted us drinks to make up for the wait! A very nice, unexpectedly generous touch.

Our room (401) was a two bedroom apartment with a sofa bed in the living area (which meant our kids did not need to share a bed!). The beds are very comfortable with nice linen and the little kitchenette is packed with everything you might need (coffee machine, fridge, hot plate, etc.). There is even a large balcony overlooking 46th St.

The location is great - just a short walk along 46th St to Times Square - and close to hundreds of restaurants from every corner of the globe (Try Yum Yum III on the corner of 46th and 9th Ave). The daily breakfasts are simple but effective and set you up nicely for the day ahead. Wi-Fi is free and fast

FQ is a fantastic place to stay in NYC and we would definitely return.

title: Top
text: Kamer zien er geweldig uit. Super dichtbij Times Square en theater en hartje centrum. Ontbijten kan naast het apartment. Geen grote keuze maar voor ons meer dan voldoende. Zeker een hotel om weer naar terug te gaan.

title: Großartig
text: Tolles Hotel mit super Service, sehr schön dekorierten Zimmern, klasse Lage (einen Block vom Times Sq entfernt). Das Restaurant nebenan ist auch nur zu empfehlen (obwohl die Restaurant Row generell sehr viel zu bieten hat). Einziges Manko ist der Straßenlärm (New York eben), aber das Bett war so unfassbar gemütlich dass wir in nullkommanichts eingeschlafen sind und wirklich hervorragend geschlafen haben. Übernachtet haben wir in der 2-Zimmer Suite mit Balkon und Küche. Das Hotel ist für New Yorker Verhältnisse auch relativ preiswert - nicht billig, aber ein Traum verglichen mit dem, was man für diese Preise sonst in NYC kriegen würde.

title: Lovely boutique hotel, close to Times Square
text:
Loved this hotel! Very friendly reception staff. Room was small but had everything we needed including a coffee machine  and was decorated nicely. Gorgeous bathroom with posh toiletries. Lovely continental breakfast.
Location of hotel is great, walking distance to Times Square and close to subway stops. Very convenient if you are getting the train from JFK as its right on the E line so you don't have to change lines. Lots of restaurants and bars close by. The bar next door is great. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Great place to stay in Midtown
text:
Fully enjoyed my 4 night stay at the French Quarters and would look to stay again when I am next in New York.
I particularly liked the fact that it is small with i believe 22 rooms, which meant you felt almost like a guest in someones house. All the staff were pleasant and extremely helpful, especially the staff we met at breakfast. I think we met somebody different everyday at Breakfast, but all were equally helpful.
My wife and I stayed in a room rather than apartments and it was more than adequate for our needs, and had everything expected. What was especially pleasing was the fact that there was loads of coffee, tea, drinking chocolate provided, so it was impossible to run out. Another great feature was the fact that they issued a daily update sheet which told you what the weather forecast was for the day, and next, and gave suggestions as to what you could do, and was on.
We eat at the attached Bourbon Street Grille on two occassions, and had great meals in a great location, all done up for Christmas.
Location wise it could not be better as although it was only a block and a half from Time square, it was relatively quiet, especially during the day. Got a little busy with Traffic in the evening, but a lot quieter than just round the corner on 8th Avenue. As it was so close to Broadway and the theatres we ended up going to three shows in a four night stay. When it was only 5 minutes to a theatre it seemed foolish not to. All the shows were good, but the best by far was Les Miserables with Alfie Bowe.

title: Muy buena ubicacion hermoso hotel
text: Hotel pequeño con hermosas habitaciones ambientadas que no son muy grandes pero estan bien. Muy buena ubicacion cercano al times square! lo unico que agregaria es alguien que entienda español en la recepcion.  El desayuno muy completo y divino el lugar para desayunar, muy atenta la persona que estaba atendiendo en el. Lo recomiendo!!!

title: I Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else
text: Why is this hotel so good? Because they treat you like an individual and don't greet you with some corporate strap line. The team are warm and welcoming across the establishment and genuinely helpful. Add in all the other positives that other reviewers mention, like great location, super comfortable rooms, fabulous breakfast and I simply wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. They even mailed postcards to the UK for me at no charge - brilliant!!

title: Totaly satisfied. Excellent!
text: It was our honey moon. We say it in the details of the reservation and they effort to give us a  great experience. This place is beautiful and has a really good location. Near to good restaurants, Times Square and the hall cultural offers of the neighborhood Hell's Kitchen. Totally satisfied with the price being NYC.

title: Una muy buena opción si se quiere evitar el hotel
text: Nos quedamos allí varias noches. Los apartamentos estaban muy bien equipados, y con excelente ubicación (a una cuadra de Broadway y a pasos de Times Square). Cuando llegamos nos atendieron muy amablemente, hicimos el check in sin problemas. El apartamento estaba muy limpio.

title: My 50th birthday celebrations
text: What an amazing time I had with my mum and sister X Monica was very helpful and friendly and gave us an upgrade when we got there X the room was fantastic with a balcony. Great views X fantastic shower free tea and coffee facilities X would recommend anyone going and staying here X

title: Excellent stay
text: We chose this based on tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The location is great- just minutes from Time Square, Broadway, subway for further afield. The rooms were great (204 and 205) with everything we needed. Lovely comfortable beds ensured we slept well, although it was a little noisy Friday and Saturday nights. The breakfast provided was fine, a good selection with something for everyone. Kevin was exceptional! Always smiling and helpful.

title: Perfekt
text:
Alles hat gepasst. Super! 
Schöne saubere Zimmer. Sehr nettes zuvorkommendes Personal. Sehr hilfsbereit. Geniales Frühstück für amerikanische Verhältnisse. Ausblick aus dem Zimmer auf Skyline. Klar war es nachts laut. Aber das ist New York. Ohropax und alles ist gut. Super zentrale Lage. Ich gehe gerne wieder dorthin und kann es guten Gewissens weiterempfehlen.

title: Great location
text:
We stayed in the FreNch quarters enroute to Florida & it was fantastic. Centrally located for all the sights witch has a great bar with good food, friendly staff & great atmosphere. Breakfast, (complimentary) was lovely. 
I would recommend this hotel for any first visitors to the Big Apples as it is very central. A real New York experience. 
We loved it...

title: Excellent
text: We stayed here for four nights., could not fault the accommodation or the staff a special mention to kevin and Monica who were very helpful and very friendly We would not hesitate to stay here again and our next trip to the big apple would book here again as it's near all attractions and restaurants previous mention of any noise we never heard any

title: Wonderful Stay and we're still here
text: We are here in NYC and I had to go ahead and write this review. We booked and it was at such a reasonable price for the amenities, we honestly assumed that there might be a catch! Got here and there's no catch, just wonderful! They upgraded the size of our room due to having kids (they normally don't do this but made an exception). The room (502) is so nice and spacious with a balcony and a great view. I can't believe I'm in NYC, paid a very reasonable price and in the center of everything. The customer service has been impeccable and they have Keurigs in the rooms! We keep pinching ourselves because it's so wonderful. If you're in NYC,I highly recommend French Quarters.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Had 5 glorious days staying at the French Quarters with great staff. Kevin who served breakfast was lovely and so helpful and very friendly. The rooms are beautifully decorated with the comfiest beds ever. The apartment is so central and right in the centre of everything.  Would definitely recommend. The restaurant next door does the best chile con carne and has great atmosphere.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: This is a lovely hotel, the staff are helpful and friendly, it's in a great location a couple of blocks from Times Square.  There are theatres close by and loads of restaurants in the local area.  The subway is close by at Times Square so you can get to wherever you need to go easily, it's also easy walking distance from most of the Manhattan tourist attractions and only a few blocks from Maddison Square Gardens for events.  The hotel has free wifi which we found good and a good continental breakfast.  The room was very nice and the tea & coffee maker was a great touch.  There is a bar and restaurant attached so you can get a full meal or drinks and snacks which we found good.  The bar has a great atmosphere when the local sports fans are in watching their team.

title: Wonderful Stay at The French Quarters Guest Apartments, NYC NY
text: Absolutely loved this hotel.  The rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated.  Beds were the greatest with very good mattresses and beautiful bedding.  Bathrooms were very elegant and luxurious.  Soaps, hand lotions and shampoos were very upscale.  Staff were very courteous and helpful.  Complimentary breakfasts were the best.  Great location for good restaurants, plays, and sightseeing..

title: A Little bit of Paris in the middle of NYC
text:
Went to trip advisor to check out hotels in NYC. This hotel looked quaint and they were offering a special rate. Took a chance and was so thrilled. Rooms are extremely clean, comfortable beds and great bathroom. Coffee in room and free breakfast. The hotel staff were fabulous, especially John. The charm was unbelievable. We booked a room over the bar and were told it might be a bit noisy. DIDN'T HEAR A THING!!!!! Everything is decorated in black and white toile. The breakfast room is the rooftop bar but covered this time of year. 
      Looking forward to returning. Had tickets to a play which was just across the Avenue, parking garage across from that, besides the Boutique Hotel is right smack in the middle of Restaurant Row. All the famous restaurants are either right, left or across the street. Loved it

title: Fantastic Stay
text: Just home from NYC stayed in The French Quarters for 9 night, We were on our Honeymoon, would highly recommend a stay here, absolutely fantastic location you are literally a five minute walk from Time Square, This is a little Gem of a place, so central, the staff are very warm and friendly especially John in reception he couldn't have been any more helpful, our room was very spacious and clean, and I'm still missing that very large comfy bed!!!!! If you every get a chance to experience NYC this Hotel is ideal, you'll be right in the heart of it all, enjoy!!!!!!!

title: Hidden Gem
text:
What a brilliant find, (Thanks to Trip Advisor)
A 21 room hotel a couple of hunded feet from Times Square, who knew?
Friendly staff in both the hotel and next door in the bar "Bourbon St."
We were fortunate to get an upgrade to a 2 bed suite with a small balcony looking towards Times Square but also with a view of the top of the Empire State Building.
Local advice for places to eat was super but the food at the adjoining bar was also terrific if you wanted something to graze on whilst watching the Baseball game with a beer.
Other reviewers mention local noise but we had no problems in this regard.

title: Clean, Cozy, Great Location - bring earplugs
text:
We learned about The French Quarters through Tripadvisor and booked a 4 night stay.
Check-In was quick and friendly, we stayed on the 3rd floor facing 46th street.
The room is spacious, has a small kitchenette, complimentary coffee maker, a refrigerator, complimentary water and fast WIFI.
The location is very convenient, the nearest Subway Station is only 2 blocks away.
We enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast and the friendly staff members Kevin & Jonathan looking after us.
The downside of staying in this part of the city is the noise. Lots of restaurants and bars in the area along with a construction site make sleeping sometimes a bit of a challange. On check-out I suggested  to insulate/check the seals of the windows.
We hope to stay at this place again during our next visit to NYC.

title: A Little Gem in the Big Apple.
text:
To celebrate us both reaching 70, my wife and I decided to fulfil one of our dreams. A short holiday in New York City. Preferring self catering to large hotels after much research, we opted for The French Quarters. I would describe it as a small "boutique" hotel. 
We had booked a King room, but on arrival were upgraded to the best room in the hotel, a sumptuous two bedroom suite with a balcony on the fifth floor from which we could see Times Square, one and half blocks away. 
All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very well appointed. The bed was huge, and very comfortable. We thought the noise of a big city might disturb our sleep, but we both slept very well. 
Located on West 42nd Street between 8th and 9th Avenue, virtually all of the major attractions were within walking distance.
We had a fantastic holiday, thanks in no small part to our choice of The French Quarters Hotel.

title: Fantastic stay
text: Thank you very much for a fantastic stay at your hotel. Cosy, clean and large rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Nice breakfast included. We recommend this hotel and are looking forward to be back next time we visit New York City.

title: What a lovely surprise!
text: We just loved loved staying at this quant little hotel situated so very well in New York - only 3 streets from High Park and two blocks away the from Broadway! staff were so very helpful and the breakfast was excellent. Also enjoyed the Best Hamburgers in the Hotel Pub just below us! Highty recommended!

title: Great location, cool rooms, sweet staff
text:
I just returned home from a one night stay at this place. The hotel actual is made up of two buildings - I was in the one next door to the front desk. The bad news is that my room was up three flights of narrow stairs. The good news is that the staff insists on running your bag up and bringing you to your room! Also, when I had to leave, they came to grab my bags within minutes of calling! While I didn't spend that much time there, I was really impressed by the size of the rooms (much bigger than many in NYC!) and the helpfulness of the staff. The only reason I didn't give it five stars was due to my actual room. I had a few issues:
- the handle of the toilet flew off when I tried to use it (in the middle of the night!)
- my keurig was broken and didn't work at all (but they do have a great breakfast on the mezzanine)

All in all, a great bet for value and convenience.

title: Excellent Accomodation
text:
Just got back from 4 night stay here and could not fault it. It was in an excellent location and lucky for us we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite (room 501) with a huge terrace and amazing views of the city. Breakfast was included and was more than enough to set you for the day (muffins, croissants, fruit, cereals, bagels etc). We had a coffee machine with a variety of coffee, tea, choco pods in our room, which was complimentary as well as a bottle of water each day. Bathroom was lovely with a huge walk in shower. The street it is located on is full of places to eat (it's known as restaurant row).We went into the bar below the hotel one night and it was very lively and had nice food. We also visited the Swing 46 club across the road which was fantastic. Live Jazz band and dancing as well as lovely food and drinks. Times square was a 5-10 minute walk and we picked up the big bus tour there. Highly recommend the open top bus tour to get around the city. You can hop on and off and you get to see so much more than you would on foot. 

I would recommend The French Quarters to anyone and would definitely return here without a doubt. Staff were lovely and couldn't do enough for you.
