They allowed us to stay in our suite for an extra few hours to freshen up before our flight (at no extra charge) and arranged transport to the airport for us as well. I much prefer this to the big commercial hotels I have stayed in previously!! Thank you French Quarters for making our stay a most enjoyable one!

title: Full of character
text:
Stayed at this lovely small hotel with 3 friends for 4 nights. 2 of us stayed in a good sized 'double double' room and 2 were lucky to be upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. Our rooms were at the back of the hotel, and although there was some noise from the nearby clubs etc at night, it wasn't all that intrusive and didn't spoil our stay at all.

The rooms are elegantly decorated, have coffee makers and a fridge, and the suite also had a microwave although we didn't use it as there are so many places to eat and drink in the area. The beds and pillows are wonderfully comfortable; the bathrooms are spacious and have lovely L'Occitane toiletries, and the whole hotel is spotlessly clean. Another lovely touch were the umbrellas in the rooms, in case of rain (being Brits, we'd brought our own of course!)

A generous continental breakfast buffet was included in the price, and this set us up nicely for all the walking we did over our four day stay. 

The hotel booked us an SUV transfer back to the airport, and when it arrived, spot on time, it was actually a stretch limo - nice! 

The location is great for Times Square (5 minute walk) and within 10-15 mins you can walk to other top NYC sights, such as Rockefeller Centre & Grand Central Station. 

It was lovely to stay in a hotel with so much character and personality, which added to our NYC experience, instead of a faceless chain hotel. I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Fantastic! Highly recommended!
text: Very clean, beautiful and confortable room! The breakfast room is so agradable. Also the atendees in the front desk are fantastic. Very good localized, close to main NY touristic points, bus station and  subway. There are many very good restaurants in the street.

title: Outstanding and Affordable
text:
My wife and I stayed at The French Quarters for one Saturday night in NYC, and everything about it was excellent. I already knew that our room was above the bar, so a little bit of music coming through the floor was expected.

We dropped-off our bags in the morning before our room was ready, and the staff was cheerful and happy to accommodate us. We headed off to Time Square and received a phone call when our room was ready. Every member of the hotel staff was friendly and welcoming. The room was very spacious, clean, and comfortable, and stocked with complimentary water and coffee. 

All around, it was a perfect stay. We only stay overnight in NYC once every year or two, and even though I'm the type who wants to try something different with each trip, we would definitely return to The French Quarters with absolutely no worries.

title: The right way to manage a problem
text:
We arrived at this wonderful little hotel on a very hot afternoon to stay in the 2 bedroom apartment with friends. The air conditioning was not working properly and very soon after this was reported Colin the manager arrived and sent us off to the bar for drinks on the house while he attempted to correct this. Unfortunately the problem persisted so two fans were produced which ensured a good nights sleep. The problem was fixed the following day. 
The hotel is very attractively designed and perfectly located. I was worried about noise but this was not an issue,even over the weekend. 
The included breakfast was very good, and the Bourbon bar and grill was excellent. We ate there twice and the portions of delicious food were very generous
The hotel provided plenty of information about things to do and a daily newsletter.
Another thing that struck me was how friendly all the staff were, from the manager right down to a chambermaid we met in the lift, everyone was quick to smile and happy to engage in a few minutes chat, which feels very welcoming.
Nothing is perfect,and we only had one chaise longue on the balcony, which is not enough when four of you are sharing the apartment, so perhaps it should be 4 and 3/4 stars,but never mind we had a great time.

title: Fabulous little gem of a hotel (more than apartments)
text:
My daughter and I stayed 5 nights from 24th August this year to celebrate her 21st birthday. I had been to New York and stayed in the Theatre district. This area is know as Hells Kitchen, please do not let that put you off! Its a short walk to Times Square and the bus station, great location for sightseeing, restaurants, shopping and using the subway.
On arrival we were allocated a gorgeous but very small room with a double bed! The next morning at breakfast the manager asked every guest how they were enjoying their stay. On explain that my daughter and I had to sharer a small double room he arranged for our suitcases once repacked to be moved whilst we were out for the day. On our return we had been given a lovely big room with a balcony!
The rooms are very pretty, they have a coffee machine and fridge and the toiletries are top range - L'Octaine,
Breakfast is served in the covered courtyard restaurant situated below the hotel. Breakfast is included in your stay, a big bonus for a Manhattan hotel! It was a buffet style, plentiful and delicious,
The only one downside and nothing the management can prevent is the street noise, our room was at the front and that obviously made it worse. but if it wasn't drunk folk shouting, surrounding clubs/restaurants closing at night it was constant sirens and 5 am bin lorries,
All that aside I would recommend and stay here again. just ask for a room at the rear of the building next time.

title: Really very pleasant!
text: We had a great room on the street side and the noise for us was not a factor in sleeping. We really enjoyed the bar downstairs and the food selection they offered. We loved that we could keep up on sports there. Service was good in the hotel as well. Very friendly at the morning breakfast. Nice selections, nothing extravagant but certainly nice.

title: Fantastic
text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at French quarters. Fabulous place!!! Room was lovely, clean and well maintained. (We loved the daily NYC updates put under the door). Beds were comfy slept soooo well!! Location of hotel was fantastic literally a block n half from Times Square!! Staff were friendly!! Would absolutely recommend to family and friends!!!!!

title: Perfect!
text:
We recently had a wonderful stay at the French Quarters! The room was outstanding, spotlessly clean, light and airy... The L'occitane toiletries were a a real treat too! 
I would also like to mention the lovely breakfast server (i didn't catch his name!)... He deserves a customer service award for his hospitality, kind nature and going above and beyond in ensuring guests are comfortable and happy!

title: Gorgeous decor, authentic New York
text: I felt like I was staying in a cool NY apartment, exposed brick work, idiosyncratic plumbing, and an eye onto a busy street, lined with bars & restaurants. Just a block or two from Times Square, I found the neighbourhood a bit too busy at times, but it's a great area for restaurants and transport links. Les Miserables is playing just across the street, and all the tourist buses pick up from there. Housekeeping was great, bed was large and comfy, toiletries are excellent and front desk staff are charming. I might not stay here again as I like to experience different neighborhoods,  but I'd recommend it to anyone.

title: Fantastically located boutique hotel!
text:
Loved this apartment hotel in the heart of Hell's Kitchen, a 5 minute walk to Times Square and loads of restaurants and bars within a matter of minutes.  We caught the Air Train and the subway from JFK Airport to the French Quarter which took about an hour, but it was easy to use and find our way (plus a lot cheaper than a taxi!).
Colin, the Manager, welcomed us, he was very friendly and helpful and we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite which was amazing!
Very clean and comfortable - we will be staying here the next time we visit NYC.
Whilst it is superbly located and there are loads of things going on it was very quiet and we slept soundly each night without interruption.

title: French Quarters in Manhattan!  Awesome!
text: We booked our room through Expedia.  The location was incredible.  Our room was amazing.  There is an Irish bar below part of the apartments and you feel like you are right there in the bar with them!?!?!  And that was after they were kind enough to move us from directly over the bar to the other side apartments, first floor.  Nuts, but it was only one night, we were exhausted. Clean, great rooms though.  And cannot beat the location.  Plus continental breakfast on the outdoor terrace was included (walk thru the bar, ha ha).  Bring ear plus?  We would stay again.

title: Charmant hôtel bien situé
text:
Situé A 3mn à pied de Times Square cet hôtel est très coquet .Les chambres sont correctes très propres .
Le petit déjeuner à l'européenne est compris dans le prix de la chambre de plus il y a aussi un bar et un restaurant très bien au bas de l'hôtel.
Hôtel à conseiller

title: Wonderful
text:
we stayed at The French Quarters with our family of four (including 2 young kids). The room was clean, welcoming, and the bed was a haven. The location was perfect. The staff was friendly and eager to share knowledge of the city, best places to eat, how to get around, activities in the neighborhood, and best times to visit the popular places. 
We will stay there any time we are even near New York.

title: Très charmant hôtel !
text:
Très joli hôtel avec un nombre correct de chambre (vous n'êtes pas dans une usine à touristes mais dans un hôtel familial), les chambres sont joliment décorées et le personnel est très gentil.
La salle du petit-déjeuner est sur la mezzanine qui peut être découverte suivant le temps ! Bon petit-déjeuner, pour qu'il soit complet, il faudrait du salé.
Nous avons également essayé le resto qui est très bon !
L'hôtel est idéalement situé, pas très loin de Times Square, dans une rue pleine de restos et de cabaret. La chambre double que nous avions est spacieuse pour New York. Les produits Occitane sont à dispo dans la salle de bain.
Je conseille vivement cet hôtel, très propre, sympathique et très bien situé !

title: Very comfortable room, very friendly and helpful staff
text:
My husband and I stayed at the FQGA for 3 nights in July and were exceedingly happy with it. The staff are super friendly and helpful--at check-in, check-out, and the very sweet man at the breakfast buffet. The room was comfortable. Location is excellent. The wifi worked great. Our room was, I think, the smallest in the hotel (the bed had to be flush against one wall). Nevertheless, the room was clean and very nicely decorated. The bed was delicious. The bathroom was spacious and wonderful. REgarding noise: I was concerned, because we live in the countryside and are used to quiet nights. When we were assigned our room, I was doubly concerned, becuase I think it is probably the noisiest in the hotel — 1st floor, right above the entrance. Still, while there must have been noise (!), it didn't bother us!  
The breakfast is a small, cold buffet. It was a bit heavy on sweet foods, but still more than adequate.

title: A little midtown gem
text:
This place is a little gem in the big apple! I stayed here for two nights in a King Suite and the whole experience was just wonderful. When I arrived a lady called Monica greeted me, she checked me in and walked me up to room and checked my room key worked and then showed me around the room and how everything worked. She was so pleasant and friendly and I felt relaxed and at home right away. Checking out was breeze too, Kevin checked me out and kindly stored my bags for me as I had a night flight. I was heading out site seeing during the day and didn't want to lug a suitcase around for the day.

The decor in the hotel is lovely and quaint and all very clean, a little bit of French elegance in New York, very tasteful.

The room itself was nicely decorated and again spotless. Towels and l'occitanne toiletries provided in the bathroom which were lush! The room and bathroom was finished to a high spec and the bed so comfy! It was like sleeping on a fluffy cloud. I didn't hear any noise from the outside at all as it's on a quiet street. Room is a decent size for NYC.

Location is great! I walked everywhere, Times Square on your door stop as it the Port Authority Bus station so getting to and from JFK airport was a doddle. Also walking distance ( 20 mins ) are the high line and Central Park.

I'll be back in the NYC sometime soon and I'll most certainly be staying here if they have rooms available :)  this is now my first choice hotel for the big apple.

I've recommended this hotel to friends and family!

Thank you French Quarters for a lovely stay.

title: Lovely hotel, with thoughtful touches
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The Hotel is small and quirky, the rooms beautifully presented, with some lovely touches such as the Keurig coffee maker and L'Occitane products in the bathroom. A hotel that does that all important 'little bit extra', but it really makes a difference. 

Friendly staff, a special mention for Kevin the breakfast server, unfailingly polite, friendly, and helpful. 

The bar next door adjoins and was a great option for a late drink or two after evening out. Our room faced the street on the second floor and we heard some bar noise but not enough to be intrusive. 

We'll stay again if we're ever back in NYC.

title: Fantastic Trip to NY
text:
The French Quarters is a real gem which is amazingly close to the hustle and bustle but in surprisingly quiet surroundings. We got a cab from the airport which struggled through the busy City streets and as Times Square is a stones throw away we thought maybe we would hear traffic / revellers but far from it. The apartments have a great bar/restaurant downstairs and again we never heard any noise from there at all.
From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, every single staff member was excellent...thanks Kevin and the team. 
We had a two bedroom apartment (Two adults, Son of 19 and Daughter of 16) on the 5th floor and this had all the amenities we would need with large living areas, bathroom and kitchenette. A real home from home.
Well done on providing such great service and a fantastic experience for our early 50th birthday celebration. We will definitely return in the future.  

(Would also recommend the NY Shuttle Tours 9 hour City tour...worth every penny.)

title: Excellent choice and exemplary service
text:
The 3 of us were staying in New York for a few days before my daughter goes off to University. Wishing to avoid the large corporates, we selected an apartment at The French Quarters on West  46th Street. A really great choice. 
The apartment was large enough for all three of us, with my daughter in the adjoining room sleeping in a very comfortable sofa bed. The room had everything you would require of 3 star accommodation, including kitchenette, and it was nice that they provided some capsules for the warm drink maker.   Maid service came in every day to tidy things up. 
Breakfast was simple and fresh(fruit, fruit drinks, coffee, tea, bagels, bread, cheese, yoghurt, eggs, etc), served in the adjoining Diner, and the guy serving breakfast was very chatty & friendly. The people on reception were attentive too, but nicely understated. You felt they were there to help, without all the usual corporate hullaballoo. The boss came over to say hello one morning, again not at all ‘in your face’, but there to help.
The adjoining bar/diner was a hive of activity every evening. A typical American bar/diner, reminiscent of the sitcom ‘Cheers’, we were served by good people who seemed to be happy working there. From our room(305), we could hear the buzz of the bar during the evening, but it was background noise – not an annoyance, it somehow added to the vibrancy of Manhattan.  
The only problem during our stay was that somehow Reception screwed up making the booking for our cab to JFK airport. So, there we were at 4:30am on Sunday morning with no limo in sight and few yellow cabs around. The guy on late night reception dealt with it – ran to 9th Ave and found us a driver willing to go to JFK.  Sorted without fuss.  And that’s why French Quarters in West 46th Street gets 5 stars from us.

title: A due passi da Times Square
text:
L'hotel si trova in una zona vicinissima alla piazza di Times Square, nella zona dei ristoranti (Hell's Kitchen).
Ciò permette di raggiungere facilmente le fermate degli autobus turistici, cenare senza dover utilizzare alcun mezzo di trasporto e vivere l'atmosfera di NYC.
Ci si trova comunque in un quartiere rumoroso di una città rumorosa quindi non adatto a chi ricerca tranquillità nel ritirarsi in camera o alle famiglie con bambini.
Riepilogando, i pro:
- posizione (5 min a piedi da Times Square)
- cordialità del personale sempre a disposizione
Contro:
- zona rumorosa - se possibile non fatevi assegnare una stanza al piano terra visto che sono adiacenti ad un pub.
- colazione decisamente povera, con poca scelta
- livello di pulizia al di sotto della media degli hotel in Italia, ma comunque accettabile

Tenendo presente che i contro sono anche un po' soggettivi, se vi piace essere nel cuore della "grande mela", questo posto è decisamente consigliato!

title: Excellent hotel
text: Brilliant value for money in midtown Manhattan. Small and cosy hotel with the most wonderful and kind staff. Our room was huge comparing what we are used to on Manhattan. Free wifi, spotles cleaning. Location is perfect! Don't miss it.

title: Holiday NYC
text: Great hotel -rooms clean and modern with excellent facilities. Friendly staff and always go out of the way to help. Location can't ask for anything better not far from Times Square and situated near plenty of restaurants and bars. The bar attached to the hotel serves nice food and great beers. I wouldn't stop anywhere else but here when I return to NYC

title: Our new NYC home!
text: This was our 3rd brief visit to NYC & now our favourite place to stay! Brilliantly located near Times Square, smack bang on Restaurant Row & walking distance to sooo much! Beautiful little place, exceptional service & the nicest, friendly helpful staff you could ever meet! We stayed above the bar & were warned about the noise & slept like a charm with the windows open! Breakfast is sensational! The whole experience from the decor, location, atmosphere, comfortable room you don't want to leave and the staff make this place exceptional from the rest! You'll see us again very soon!

title: Top ranked for a reason!
text: Chose this hotel because of its affordable price yet unusually high ranking, considering some of the world's finest hotels are in the vicinity.  From the moment I arrived to the time I left, I was impressed. Whether it was the friendly staff, well appointed room (in the old part), and charming neighborhood so close to the action of Times Square and walking distance to Grand Central. Reminded me of a quaint, yet high quality, European hotel. Will definitely choose this again on future trips to Manhattan.

title: Hotel para Lua-de-mel
text: Eu e minha esposa ficamos neste hotel em nossa lua-de-mel, este hotel, apesar de não ser tão grande, é muito aconchegante, limpo, agradável e romântico, os atendentes são muito simpáticos, sua localização é maravilhosa, e o café da manhã é formidável (croissant, leites, iogurtes, bagels, geléias, muffins, cookies, cereais, sucos,...). Enfim, perfeito para quem procura um hotel com a finalidade do romantismo.

title: Perfeito
text:
Estive hospedada em abril com meu marido no The French Quarters e foi uma estadia maravilhosa desde a chegada!
O Staff é extremamente agradável e solicito, obrigada Mônica pelas dicas das redondezas.
O quarto é super agradável,  amenidades loccitane no banheiro, cama confortável,  calefacão muito eficiente e a localização não poderia ser melhor. Dá pra fazer tudo a pé.
Na parte térrea do hotel há um bar/pub muito descontraído,  com bebidas e comidas ótimas e música de excelente qualidade! Não interfere em nada em relação à barulho no quarto, pelo menos não do segundo andar pra cima.
Café da manhã muito bom! Simples, mas muito gostoso!

title: Una piccola casa a New York
text:
Siamo stati ospiti con la mia famiglia, due adulti e due ragazze, in questa bellissima sistemazione per nove giorni a fine luglio.
Abbiamo scelto una junior suite che si è rivelata perfetta per le nostre esigenze.
Innanzitutto le sistemazioni sono spaziose, in quanto concepite come piccoli appartamenti con relativo angolo cottura, frigo e macchina del caffè.
La stanza principale, la nostra, era dotata di un letto molto ampio e comodo, un armadio, cassettiera capiente e poltrona. 
Il salottino dove erano alloggiate le mie figli era dotato di un comodo divano letto cassettiera e molto spazio per le valigie ( 4 grandi e due trolley da cabina ).
In ognuna delle stanze la televisione ed un ottimo wifi.
Il bagno era abbastanza grande e con ottimi prodotti Occitaine. Apparentemente non ci sarebbe nulla di particolarmente sorprendente nella descrizione se non avessi poi alloggiato in altro albergo di New York , un boutique hotel, in cui non c'era spazio neanche per 2 valigie e il concetto di armadio era limitato al possibile ingombro di 3 grucce, il tutto in una stanza occupata da 4 persone.
Devo dire che la situazione non era certamente diversa a Boston, dove le stanze erano molto piccole e decisamente più costose del French Quarters .Per cui ritengo che questo albergo sia una valida eccezione.
Aggiungo che il valore di questa soluzione sia senza pari per altri due motivi: il primo la posizione. Si è vicini a Times Square ma lontani dal suo caos perenne, la zona  è pienissima di ristoranti per tutti i gusti e tasche. Il secondo  motivo è  la colazione inclusa, evento  peraltro molto raro negli hotel di New York .Si tratta di una colazione continentale con latte, caffè, succo d'arancia, frutta, toast, bagels,  croissant, muffins, youghurt vari,marmellata, burro, e varie soluzioni dolci e salate. Personalmente in  pieno luglio non so se avremmo retto un  vero breakfast americano. Nel caso in cui la si  poi la si voglia sperimentare ugualmente, non mancano i locali nei dintorni che possono soddisfare la voglia.
Lo staff è veramente gentile  e pronto per ogni richiesta. Pur avendo  la finestra che si affacciava sotto la terrazza del ristorante attiguo, non abbiamo mai avuto problemi per il rumore o il brusio delle persone che cenavano e bevevano a partire dalle 17 pomeridiane fino a notte.
Ci siamo sentiti per tutta la durata del nostro soggiorno come felici possessori di una piccola casa a New York, in un bellissimo quartiere dove tutto è raggiungibile per la vicinanza delle stazioni della metropolitana, e questo ha reso ancora più speciale il nostro soggiorno in una città, New York, che, quando ti prende il cuore, non lo molla più

title: Charming Hotel With Exceptional Service
text: We did not expect to find such a quaint hotel in New York City.  Arriving well before check-in time on a rainy day, the lovely young lady at the front desk held our luggage and provided us with an umbrella for our walk to breakfast.  Checking in to our clean, well-appointed, cozy room, we found under the door a hand-written note from the hotel manager.  We loved the tasteful art deco bath, supplied with L'Occitane products. Booking the last available room above the bar, we could faintly hear bar noise.  But the comfortable bed with quality linens provided a restful sleep.  I would definitely stay at the French Quarters again.

title: Wonderful
text: Ask them about the hidden martini bar just a short walk away down on the right. We adore this hotel. We have stayed in the regular rooms as well as 2 bedroom suite (with an amazing balcony). In a really lovely party of NYC, beautiful rooms.

title: amazing hotel, amazing staff
text: I stayed here with my wife and we both loved it. The reception we got at the desk was what you would expect and even more. The room was lovely and very relaxing. We will be back for a longer visit next time.

title: Really great!!!
text: We can not be happier. The hotel was really a good surprise for us. We were looking for a nice room just to stay for the weekend, and at the end we would like to have more time to enjoy our stay. The staff was very nice, they propose really nice breakfast, the location is perfect...The attention is unreadable : little gratuities in the room, coffee machine, a small fridge, clean, everything was perfect. Yes, it is a little bit noisy outside Saturday evening, but this is a part of New York. Anyways, the noise didn't disturb us at all and we look forward to return.

title: Customer Care
text: I booked a room here on booking.com and requested a quiet room. I did not realize was over a bar for the room i booked. Anyway, the hotel was kind enough to reach out to me way ahead of time to let me know this and said that for my request for super quiet room that maybe its not the best choice since this room was over top the bar. I thought that was very nice of them to do. They have other rooms that are quieter they said but right now not in my price range. Just wanted to say i thought that was very nice that they told me ahead of time even though they knew after receiving that info i would most likely cancel.. Very thoughtful and caring customer service.

title: Underbart!
text:
Stor rymlig lägenhet utan problem att få plats fem personer. Trevlig och hjälpsam personal, förklarade hur tunnelbanan fungerade, delade ut paraplyer när det regnade osv. På frukosten fanns det mesta utom gott kaffe, men det är något som vi svenskar är bortskämda med här hemma. I övrigt fanns något för alla på buffén. 

Fem minuter från Times Square, men lugnt vid hotellet. Vid hemfärd fixade de med transport till flygplatsen i god tid. Mycket bra hotell!

title: Beautiful and great location
text: We stayed at this beautiful and charming hotel for four nights. A friend suggested staying here after her wonderful experience, and my husband and I were not disappointed! The room was lovely and comfortable.  The staff were very friendly and helpful especially when we were trying to figure out the subway system. They even offered up suggestions for restaurants or landmarks to visit in certain areas of Manhattan we were planning to visit that day. I especially enjoyed that after a long day of walking around the city, you can go to the joint restaurant/ bar and grab a drink or a savoury meal and even have it sent to your room! You cannot beat the location. Staying on Restaurant Row gives you no shortage of selection of where to eat and you are mere blocks away from all major Broadway Theatres and Times Square. We really enjoyed our stay and the hospitality. A hand written note from the owner of the hotel thanking us for staying with them was a nice touch as well. Overall, lovely stay, price is right (for New York standards) and amazing location!

title: Милый отель с шикарный видом!
text: У меня был номер на самом верху с верандой с видом на небоскребы 6 авеню! Вид просто потрясающий. Особенно когда стемнеет. Тем не менее в номере было все необходимое для жизни - туалетные принадлежности, кофеварка, фен и тд. Все чисто.

title: Really great boutique hotel with lots of charm and good service.
text: My wife and I had tickets to 'Wicked' and wanted to stay in the Theater District.  I went with the previous reviews for this hotel on Trip Advisor and they were right on the money.  I would definitely recommend (for couples, not sure about families) as this was not the usual large hotel with no character.  It was a 3rd floor walk up but our room had exposed brick which I loved. Very nice continental breakfast and I liked having a newspaper delivered to our door the next morning. I look forward to returning!

title: Wonderful place to stay in New York
text: This is a fantastic boutique hotel right in the heart of the Theatre district in New York. Colin and his staff are extremely friendly and very helpful with all things to do, see and get around New York. The rooms are beautifully appointed, very clean, great air conditioning in summer, free coffee machine and breakfast included. Whilst being in the heart of the city, the rooms are very quiet at night. So totally loved staying here - would do so again if I am ever in New York. Stayed 5 nights.

title: Lovely Boutique hotel & friendly staff
text:
My wife and I stayed at the French Quarters recently while in NYC to get married. Firstly, I should say that the hotel is very nice, the staff were fantastic, really helpful and friendly and the hotel is perfectly positioned next to Times Square if that's where you need to be. We did have an issue on arrival. We booked a standard room which, when we saw it in reality, was VERY small. This was our mistake. We just didn't anticipate the standard room being as small as it was. On a normal holiday, this wouldn't really have been an issue for us, but we had a wedding photographer arriving to take pictures of my wife getting ready in the room and, in all seriousness, the 3 of us would not have fitted in the room at the same time. That said, we mentioned this to the manager and they very kindly moved us to a Kingsize room. This was a great touch from the management as, like I said, this was our mistake as we did not check the room sizes before we booked. Their reaction to our problem was classy. 

Elsewhere, the breakfast is simple, but very nice. All staff members were really helpful giving ideas and suggestions of things to do, musicals to see and giving us directions. Rooms were clean. There was a great bar attached to the hotel. Generally a really pleasant experience.

title: Sehr, sehr empfehlenswert!
text: Das Hotel bietet eine gemütliche Zuflucht vor dem Getöse der Stadt und des nah gelegen Times Squares. Die Zimmer sind sehr hübsch eingerichtet, die Betten super bequem und es ist vor allem eins : sauber! Auch das Bad ist groß und schön, wichtig für die Damenwelt. In dem Hotel ist wirklich an alles gedacht: im Zimmer hat man einen Save, Föhn, Telefon und sogar Regenschirme. Die Angestellten sind super nett und hilfsbereit. Was uns auch gut gefallen hat, ist das Frühstück, das inklusive ist; untypisch für New York. Die Bar, die an das Hotel anknüpft, ist ebenfalls ein cooler Ort, um den Tag mit einem gelungenen Abend ausklingen zu lassen.

title: Excelente
text: Ótima localização, bem perto da Times Square. Café da manhã incluso. Quartos bem equipados, limpos e espaçosos. Ótimo atendimento na recepção. Cortesias: jornal e boletim diários com sugestões de passeio. Voltaria com certeza.

title: A Wonderful Experience for some 1st Time NYC visitors...
text:
My husband and I stayed at the French Quarters while we were in NYC to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary.  We stayed six nights and we were delighted by our experiences at the French Quarters.  

The room was spacious with a kitchenette and an abundance of Keurig coffee pods for us to choose from throughout our visit.  Comfy bed, small balcony for viewing Restaurant Row, tiled bathroom with a glass-door shower were all pluses for our room.  

Breakfast was on the mezzanine level of the Bourbon Street Grill restaurant in the outdoor bar area.  On several morning the hotel manager was there greeting guests and asking about our upcoming day and offering suggestions of other things to see and possibly do.  He was sincere and genuine in this interactions with us.  

In fact, every member of the staff that we worked with was helpful, wonderful, and courteous.  When we needed assistance with navigating the Subway system for the first time - the front desk came to the rescue.  When we needed a car to get us back to the airport - the front desk was happy to assist us.  When we needed more supplies in our room - the staff was there to provide.  

We were first time visitors to the City of New York, and our experience at the French Quarters will bring us back here on any future visits.

title: Central, Comfortable - Great Balance
text: Travelled as a family in December 2014.  As the first stop in our U.S. trip we arrived in the evening jet lagged with two cranky kids in tow.  We stayed in a two bedroom suite - just right.  Comfortable, more than enough space and great place to settle the kids, recharge and recover.  The place was then a great base to explore New York from - central, convenient, not far from anywhere.  The only negative was some noise from the street at night - I guess you have to trade something for the location.

title: Outstanding in every way!!
text: We spent 5 nights in the delightful and extremely well appointed French Quarters Apartments. The staff were SO friendly and helpful and went above and beyond to make our stay perfect!! I've stayed in other NYC hotels and guest apartments and this one has surpassed all others by far!! We certainly received the outstanding quality of service and accommodation that we expected for the price charged. 2 bedroom suite was perfect for 2 couples and larger than any other guest apartment I've stayed in-relatively spacious!!

title: Appartement magnifique
text: Situation idéale proche de Times square mais dans une rue animée nombreux restaurant beaucoup de caractère, hôtel classe et confortable, l'appart est très sympa , 2 chambres kitchenette terrasse , service de boissons chaudes dans l'appartement , accessoire de bains de chez l'occitane, programme et infos sous votre porte tous les matins et un superbe restaurant bar au RDC !

title: Super klasse Hotel in New York
text: Einfach nur spitze! Das Hotel liegt nur wenige Gehminuten vom Times Square entfernt und hat ein Haupt- und ein Nebenhaus. Durch Glück bekamen wir ein Zimmer im Townhouse. Jeden Morgen wurde die "New York Post" vors Zimmer geliefert - zusammen mit einer Übersicht der wichtigsten Ereignisse des Tages. Die Betten waren super bequem und man ist sofort eingeschlafen. Das Personal war stets hilfsbereit und konnte auch bei Problemen schnell Lösungen anbieten. Außerdem war ein Kühlschrank im Zimmer. Jeden Tag (bis 10 Uhr) gab es ein Frühstücksbuffet - zur Auswahl standen heller und dunkler Toast, Bagels, Müsli, Cereals, Obst, Marmelade, Honig Butter, Streichkäse, Tee und Kaffee. Dazu gab es Orangen-, Cranberrysaft oder Wasser. Insgesamt eine glatte 1. Wir kommen gern wieder...

title: Excellent établissement et situation idéale, dommage d'avoir une vue sur les groupes frigorifiques
text:
Le General Manager vous fait partager sa passion de la Big Apple et s'occupe de vous réserver, ou de vous conseiller pour la moindre sortie. La lettre quotidienne vous indique les événements du jour. Le petit déjeuner est malheureusement européen (pas de de bacon...). Et la vue de la chambre 108 est déplorable: la chambre est au rez-de-chaussée côté cours avec une vue imprenable sur les groupes réfrigérants (et bruyants...)
Dommage, car j'avais demandé une chambre silencieuse 5 mois avant de venir à New-York.

title: Great location
text: we booked this over the pride weekend and didn't want a chain hotel. We booked a room with 2 double beds for 3 of us (we had our 16 year old daughter with us). The accommodation is a little dated but well maintained and clean. The breakfast buffet is a little limited and doesn't start until 7:30. We had an early start one morning and they left a packed breakfast in our fridge, which was ok. A nice stay overall if a little pricey.

title: Hospedagem agradável
text: Trata-se de um pequeno hotel simpático , com equipe atenciosa, café da manhã adequado, muito bem localizado. Várias opções de restaurantes nas proximidades, inclusive um com comida brasileira. Há poucas quadras da Time Square.

title: Cozy little hotel , centrally located.
text:
Liked our recent stay at this hotel. Good spacious room, very helpful staff and the biggest USP is that it's located in mid town,  Manhattan, just 0.5 to 6miles to literally everything that u would want to visit in a short trip to NYC.
We had booked the first floor room over the pub, which they had said would be noisy at night, hence much cheaper than the other rooms, however we found the noise level to be okay n not really bothersome to the extent where we couldn't sleep. So we were good!

title: Great hotel!!!
text: Wonderful staff, beautiful clean room and good location. Had our honeymoon here and will come back again and recommend this place  100%. Great bar downstairs with gorgeous woodwork and had a lovely breakfast on the second floor of the bar that the ceiling opens up for morning sunshine to come in. Simply a great hotel!

title: Nice Hotel in downtown NYC
text: ust finished a 2 day stay at the French Quarters June 28-29, 2015. A very enjoyable experience. The room was inviting and quite large for downtown NYC. King size bed was comfy with a down (or down-like) comforter and bathroom and shower were clean and well appointed. I had to set up a traveling office (laptop, printer, scanner) for my profession so the free wired - and wireless wifi - came in very handy. The hotel is located near Times Square so the outside streets are bustling with eateries and there is some noise coming off the street. The noise was not bad at all, we kept our window open at night for some fresh air (as fresh as you can get in midtown NYC) and slept soundly. The location is great for Broadway Theater, an easy 10 minute walk. The hotel staff was very attentive, showed us our our room upon arrival and even carried some of our bags. Although we are fussy eaters and didn't partake of the morning brunch offerings other than swipe some bananas, the ambiance of the brunch is great - an open 2nd floor area with skylights and good decor which a restaurant the rest of the day. All in all, a wonderful place. We will be back.

title: Somewhat different, but enjoyable and good value
text: A small, pleasant hotel using an adjacent restaurant for a simple continental breakfast. Great location for just about everything, with an extraordinary number of local restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk. Front desk staff were consistently positive and knowledgeable. Room was fairly small (OK for one person, might have been a struggle for two), bed was comfortable, bathroom modern and spacious. Large safe provided. On the third floor overlooking the street the noise from outside was not a problem. I would definitely stay here again if the rates stayed as low as they were this time.

title: A hidden jewel in New York
text:
I came across the French Quarters by chance, after I had a previous reservation in another place cancelled just a month away from my trip. On my hotel hunt I was aiming for a good location in Midtown, mainly on Hells Kitchen and I found The French Quarters, with very high praises and good reviews. One person even said that she felt a bit sorry about sharing this very well kept secret with the world and risking have it always booked. Well, after staying there I know how she feels. But the French Quarters manager and staff deserve all the praises they can get.
I was travelling with my parents and we shared a double double room, which was excellent, very spacious, clean and well lit. The beds were super comfortable and big. The adjoint bathroom was also huge and beautiful, complete with L'Occitane amenities and towels aplenty. We had a small kitchen inside our unity, which was very convenient - a counter with a sink, a small cooktop and fridge, cupboards, glasses, mugs, corkscrews and coffee maker machine.
Breakfasts were another great affair. The area reserved for it was simply charming and there was always a feast of scones, muffins, croissants and other goodies waiting for us. But the highlight, I have to say, was the service. There was this great lad waiting on the guests, and he would always make us hot chocolate mugs and bring them to our table with a friendly smile and conversation.
Everyday I would open the door and find a newspaper and a sheet prepared by the staff with the weather forecast for the day and tips on what do to and how to spend the day around town.
What can I say? I felt pampered and taken care of, which is unheard of in New York. My folks and I all agree that most places in town are celebrated for their cold luxury of marble halls and Central Park views, with efficient (if somewhat robotic) staff. And here we found this beautiful and quaint place, where the luxury provided is of another kind. It's all about the small details, the quality of products and the warmth of the staff.
The bar and restaurant downstairs is delicious and always full. The music can be a little loud if your room faces the outdoor section of the bar, like mine did, but it really wasn't a problem.
Also the neighborhood is packed with restaurants, small markets and great eating options.
I highly recommend it and will becoming back for sure!

title: Great Hotel
text:
Great place to stay. Charming Hotel, with very nice employies. I loved the amenties from L'Occitane. We got married in New York, and the hotel gave us a comlimentary bottle of Prosecco. Very central in Hells Kitchen district. Close to Times Square. Great bar in the hotel.
Will come back!!

title: Hidden gem in midtown
text:
My wife and I stayed here for just one night recently but the double double room was excellent. The room was clean and roomy with comfortable beds. The bathroom was very nice with a great shower, plenty of hot water and good water pressure. Also, the bathroom was very clean. Having a proper fridge was really nice too for grabbing some wine and cheese from a little shop just round the corner. The bar and restaurant downstairs (The Bourbon Street Bar and Grill) has decent bar food and a great selection of good bourbons and other liquors.

The other great thing about our stay here was the incredible service we received. Our room was ready upon our arrival allowing us a slightly early checkin and they were able to print out our boarding passes for us the next day. Wonderful room and service make this a great place to stay in a great location. I would advise trying to get a higher floor if you like to turn in early since the music from downstairs in the bar can be a little loud late at night.

title: Super localisation et personnel attentif
text:
Localisation top à time square, 2 blocs du métro et rue pleine de resto sympas.
établissement très propre et chambres agréables.
Seul petit bémol, les chambres donnant sur la rue sont bruyantes.
J'y retournerai!

title: Oui et oui mais...... un chouille non
text:
Hôtel idéalement situé dans hells kitchen, pas loin de time square. Adossé à un bar le Bourbon.
petite équipe extrèmemennt sympatique et c'est franchement ça qui sauve le tout.
Pour plus de 300$ une chambre minuscule, on se demande qui va utiliser le minuscule évier et cuisinière surtout au coeur de Hells kitchen....
A peine la place de mettre son pc portable pour travailler.... et bruyant.
Alors oui c'est mimi, oui l'équipe est top mais bon 300$ (TTC) la nuit... c'est un peu juste.
Autant aller au novotel ou dans une chaine...
Biz

title: Good place to stay for a romantic city break
text: Good location to base yourself. There are a number of bars down on the street below so try and get a higher room to avoid noise. Breakfast was ample and good service from the front desk. Good value for money in a city where accommodation can be pricey!

title: great place
text: We stayed at French Quarters twice, and each time it was excellent. location, obviously, can't be beat. Each time we had a room booked above the bar, and each time we were upgraded to a quiet larger room. Linens, shower, decor - everything is fresh and exciting. We walked to Broadway performances and picked up snacks at Food Emporium. Taxis are plentiful. Overall A+++ quality and service.

title: Visit with my daughter
text: This is my second stay here, and the first for my daughter.  Fantastic stay for a week - we were really lucky and were upgraded to a suite at the top floor.  The pluses - the suite was large, immaculately clean with very comfortable beds & great bathroom amenities. There were helpful and very friendly staff (with a special mention to Robert & Kevin), central location, free wifi, great (free) breakfast and the hotel is small enough to get that great personal service.  There are no shortage of excellent restaurants along the street, or the Bourbon St grill is right on site - we had a take out meal from them which was perfect. The minuses - there are none.

title: Fabulous French Quarters
text:
Stayed here just under a week while mid way through our U.S. trip.

We booked a queen room and were upgraded to a king room (thanks guys!). Wow, the room has to be the best I've stayed in during my visits to NYC. Great size bed, overlooking the busy road (this didn't bother us) with two or three windows. The room was very spacious over all. The bathroom was a good size and had a loverly large shower.

The hotel property is adjoining the bourbon street bar/restaurant which we ate at one night - not bad food at all - large portions and tasted good.

The location of the hotel was just excellent -- so close to the subway and Times Square along with restaurants and bars all around you.

The staff were friendly (especially the breakfast team) and accommodating apart from rather short responses from a Irish receptionist.

My only suggested areas of improvement would be the breakfast which was described as continental but didn't have a full range of continental choices (like cheese and ham) and after a few days it felt a bit boring and a bit of a let down. Our preference would have always been an English/American breakfast so a few hot items would have been great considering its held in the restaurant next door I would have hoped this could be achieved just to add some variety.

I'd highly recommend this hotel (and the room we had) and plan to return!

title: Style, Comfort and Location
text:
As we were New York for seven nights we wanted something comfortable, central and not requiring us to take out a mortgage for. The French Quarters is very nicely presented and furnished in a French Colonial style. It is modest and welcoming without being pretentious. Our room had no view (unless you like looking at air conditioning units) and while I note other reviews mention excess noise from the bar we found our unit very quiet. I had requested a room away from the bar and we were accommodated by way of a lower level double room next door to the bar back from the street. While the room was equipped with two double beds rather than a queen or king we actually didn’t mind too much as it provided for a peaceful sleep after a lot of walking each day. A small down side was the bathroom in our apartment was so compact the shower door knocked the toilet as you opened and closed it and the wash basin is quite awkward for brushing teeth etc. with a shelf positioned too close above it. We managed!
Adjoining the hotel is the French Quarter Bar & Grill that hosts the ample hotel continental breakfast and of an evening is well patronised by tourists and locals. Additionally you are spoiled for choice among the many restaurants and bars literally outside the door. Time Square, theatres, theatres and more theatres, hop on hop off bus access, subway and flagship stores are a mere few minutes from the hotel. The Rockefeller Centre, Central Park, St Patrick’s Cathedral and much more can be reached in around a 15 minute walk.
All the staff, especially the General Manager Colin, are very friendly and helpful. The only exception was a young man with an Irish accent on the reception desk who was rather nonchalant. Over all the hotel met my expectations and acted as a very good central address to launch our daily expeditions of New York.

title: Lovely, boutique rooms
text: The French Quarters is pretty unassuming on arrival, but the nice surprise is that the rooms are lovely, big and beautifully decorated.  Bathroom nice too with L'Occitane products.  Wifi works fine.  Loved the room, bit of noise at night, but for Manhattan very good.  Close to lots of nice places to eat.  Staff on check-in could be a bit more warm, found both on checking in and out that there was little engagement.  Restaurant for breakfast is basic continental, as I don't eat grains, there was no choice except fruit.  The guy on duty at the restaurant / bar was very friendly, warm and helpful.  Very good location to see the sights of New York - particularly if you are into the touristy stuff.  Short walk from subway and very central - would definitely stay there again.  If you don't know your way around Manhattan and need concierge services, room service etc, this will disappoint you.  However, if you are an independent traveler looking for a lovely room to come back to this is a delight.

title: ideal hotel!
text:
Arrived 1st June, travelling with my sister. Greeted by very pleasant member of staff.
Room was lovely! Everything you need and more! Perfect location just mins walk from Times Square! Second day we for upgrades to a 2 bed suite by a lovely member of staff called john! He helped us out with lending us his railcard, gave great directions and also helped us with our umbrella!! 
Would recommend this hotel without a doubt!! 
:)

title: No entiendo las demas valoraciones. Sobrevalorado.
text:
Lo elegimos para nuestra luna de miel precisamente por las valoraciones de Tripadvisor y no ha respondido a nuestras espectativas.

Elegimos un queen room (Hay mas grandes pero tambien son mas caras) y es la habitación más pequeña en la que me he alojado jamas.
Nos dijeron que por ser luna de miel nos daban una habitación mejor cosa que no hicieron. 
Un dato. No teniamos suelo para poder abrir las dos maletas a la vez y poder abrir la puerta. Parecía más una habitación individual.

La decoración quiere ser francesa pero no pasa de una mesilla  y un armario en no muy buen estado.

La limpieza y el baño si estaban bastante mejor.

El desayuno tiene lugar en la primera planta en un sitio bastante agradable pero sin mucha variedad. Apenas dulce, cafe y zumo solo de naranja.

Lo mejor la zona sin duda. A menos de 3 minutos andando de times square.

El personal un poco de todo. A las mañanas había una señora encantadora, a las noches unos chavales que no pasaban de un ey! cuando llegas al hotel.

Como guinda, tuvieron que arreglarnos la puerta del baño porque no se podía cerrar. La tele tampoco se veia bien.

Personalmente solo iria aqui si se busca exclusivamente ubicación.

title: Fantastic!
text: Arrived by taxi from jfk about 20.30 greeted by very friendly helpful member of staff,and showed to our king size room 302, great size really comfy bed balcony looking over Main Street looking down to Times Square the room was spotlessly clean, housekeeping was excellent .  We had an amazing  time in New York which was enhanced  by choosing to stay at the French quarters.(I am a light sleeper so used ear plugs to sleep quite noisy but hey it is New York husband was fine). Would definitely stay here again.

title: Kitchenette brilliant when travelling with a baby
text: We had a great stay at the French Quarters Guest Apartments. We were travelling with our 8 month old baby. The room was small-ish, but we managed to fit in all of our stuff including the stroller and a travel cot for our baby. The kitchenette (complete with sink, hob and fridge) was really useful. The en-suite shower room was spacious. The continental breakfast was great and all of the staff we met were really friendly and helpful (including the owner that introduced himself one morning at breakfast). We ate at the Bourbon Street Grill downstairs on the first night and would recommend it. The location was brilliant for Times Square. There was a bit of noise from the bar downstairs as our room was located at the back of the hotel near the roof terrace bar, but the air conditioning drowned it out so we could only really hear it from the bathroom.

title: Amazing hidden gem in the center of it all
text: We had an amazingly pampered time at this location.  We flew into JFK, took the air tram and subway E to 50th Street, and walked then 4 1/2 blocks to find the hotel so it was very easy to get to.  You can see Time's Square lights as you look down the street.  Our theater was 1 1/2 blocks away and our dining out was about 5 blocks away, so it was all very close and convenient.  They have an excellent restaurant, Bourbon Street Bar and Grille right next door and that is where they serve breakfast for free each morning with staff to assist; great food, coffee and great choices for breakfast.  We had a king size bed with a large room including 3 chairs, a beautiful brick wall, excellent décor, a kitchen area, and a very large bathroom with a large walk in glassed shower.  The soaps were L'Occitane and the white fluffy towels could not  be more comfy.  We loved our stay here and enjoyed the neighborhood area, feeling very safe and accessible to all we needed.  We walked around Times Square, went to the Metropolitan Art Museum, the WTC memorial, DB BIsto's for pre theater dinner and Skylight for our theater.  Our first night we dined on an outdoor balcony at the next door Bourbon Street Bar and Grille and loved it.  It was noisy at times from the bar, but we fell asleep well and had no issues.  We would definitely go back here again.

title: A great place that's even better now!
text: I loved this place when I stayed here a few years ago.  I had no complaints and was very happy with the room, the service, and even the location. I didn't know they'd made changes to the breakfast area. When I was there last, the breakfast room was simply a non-description room on the mezzanine level with a good spread of food, but no ambience.  When I came up this morning, I found it had been revitalized into a cool, open space.  The retracted roof let in all that fabulous sunshine and it is now an open air sort of rooftop bar that doubles as a fantastic morning cafe.  I didn't want to leave!  I'd been looking on-line for a roof bar for cocktails not even knowing there was one at my hotel!

title: If you want a peaceful sleep don't book here!
text:
We were really excited about our trip to New York and especially staying at the French Quarters after reading all of the amazing reviews. The start of our stay was great as the hotel is in the perfect location, right next to Times Square. Our room was fairly small but I loved the decor and were given a bottle of prosecco as it was our first wedding anniversary which was a nice touch! 

The breakfast was great and just the right amount. You could choose from bagels, pastries, cereal, fruit etc. My only comment would be for fresh coffee! 

Our trip started to go down hill when one evening they decided to dig up the road outside around 1am in the morning. It felt like the hotel was going to collapse with the vibrations and was impossible to sleep! We went to speak to the night staff who were very unhelpful and we actually had to go and speak to the workmen to find out what was going on. After a night with no sleep, we went to speak to the reception staff who were slightly more helpful and agreed to refund us for the night but we really had to push to get them to change our room. Our suggestion was to phone the local council to see if the work was going to continue that night but they didn't seem that keen. The lift had also broken the previous day and we overheard a very heated discussion between the manager and lift company so I don't think they were having a good day! 

Eventually we got moved to a lovely room but it was over the bar so again as we tried to sleep all we could hear was pounding music and people's voices. We don't mind a bit of noise and understood there would be some based on the location but it was impossible to sleep. So again we spoke to the front desk who denied that we could hear anything! There was one helpful person who eventually moved us to the adjoining townhouse. After that we had a great stay and we were allowed to stay in the townhouse. 

We completely understand that the roadworks were no fault of the hotels but we felt we were made to feel like we were being a huge inconvenience for asking to move and they could have been more understanding. 

Overall I would recommend this hotel but definitely ask for a room higher up and at the back as it is incredible noisy

title: Fantastic Accommodation! Looking forward to my return!
text:
My brother and I checked in here on the 25th May for 4 nights, there was a mix up with the rooms as we had booked a double room with two beds, but arrived to a room with only one double - which of course we didn't want to share, we aren't in grade school anymore - but it was absolutely no drama! They immediately and without hesitation moved me to my own room. Despite the bar downstairs and the road works outside I slept like a baby! Comfortable beds, lovely bathrooms and plenty of room! All the staff were amazing & helpful, the breakfast on the terrace was simple but lovely & in a lovely setting and nothing was too much trouble. I loved the location, rooms, decor, service and the cleanliness of the whole place! 
Some people will inevitably complain about noise, however I stayed on the first floor and right on the street but after extremely long days exploring the city and the boroughs surrounding on foot and via subway the last thing I was concerned about was a bit of street/bar noise. If you are the type of person that can not stand it then ask for the 4th or 5th floor at the back of the hotel and specify when booking. 
I can't wait to get back to New York with my partner so he can experience it also. We will not stay anywhere else!

title: You'll be pleased you booked it
text: We just spent four nights in a 2 bed suite on the 5th floor. Check-in was easy and we were delighted with the rooms, and the balcony with table and chairs was an extra treat. The view at night-time went right to Times Square, and we had some lovely times there listening to the rumble of the city and watching the world go by.46th street is a busy street, lots of restaurants and just two blocks from Broadway. The staff at The French Quarters are very helpful and friendly, and house-keeping was good. The bar and restaurant are below the hotel , the Irish  owner Keith was really nice, he helped us out when we needed to wait a few hours after checking out. The bar has a great New Orleans vibe , the food is terrific and the place is very busy at night-time. We only wished we'd realised sooner how good it was. The previous reviewers are right about this hotel, you won't regret booking it.

title: Thumbs up!
text:
Great hotel, great location, great staff, great everything.

Beautiful, clean hotel, good size room and baths. Located just a block and a half from Times Square. Due to som road work the manager didn´t charge us for the last night, great customer care.  Don´t bother search for another hotel, this is it.

title: Fantastic, a real gem!
text:
So glad to have found The French Quarters! Won't need to search for a place to stay in NY again!

It was Amazing from start to finish!we were checked in and shown to our room by John, lovely man, very helpful and Irish too! Great to chat about home with him! 

Our room was on the 2nd floor (upgraded for free from the 1st floor room I booked) we had a view on to the street, it's exactly what we wanted! I've seen some complaints here about noise, both from the street and the bar, we didn't find that at all- once the window was closed we couldn't hear a thing! 

The room was perfect for 2, clean, bed was very comfy, coffee maker, wifi, hob, HUGE shower, L'Occtaine bath products, couldn't be better! 

Breakfast was great, continental, as much as you'd like! Coffee was really good too, special thanks to Kevin who manned the breakfast both mornings we were there, so warm, helpful and friendly, we really enjoyed meeting him, he's a credit to the whole place! 

We had dinner one of the nights at the bar/restaurant attached and that was great too- And reasonable!we ate on the terrace at the front of the restaurant and really enjoyed taking it all in with dinner.  

I would recommend these apartments to anyone! We really enjoyed our stay!  They really make a huge effort here to make you welcome and comfortable, for the price you pay you really get it all, including amazing location! Just to top it all off, after checking out we were offered the option to leave our luggage at the hotel to be stored while we enjoyed the city(thanks to Colin the manager) Can't wait to go back!!

title: Fantastic
text: Great rooms, great staff, great location to Broadway and Times Square.  Stayed April 2015. We were close to everything, easy subway access too. Free breakfast too,I highly recommend!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: NYC Vacation
text:
My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our time in NYC! It was great to come back to our comfy bed after a long day of walking walking and more walking! Our room was nicely furnished, clean and mostly quiet! Considering the restaurant next door, I made the comment to my husband, you would never know! The staff went way beyond to help us when we needed help with our left behind bag in a taxi! Thank you Monica! Yes, we would stay here again!
Carol

title: Excellent service
text:
Small, clean and cosy hotel with excellent service.
Great location, 5 minutes walk to Time Square and lots of restaurants nearby. 
The room at the street side a bit noisy at nights. We could change the room and were no charged for that.
Good contacts before arrival and the staff is really helpful and good

title: A diamond of a place to stay.
text: My partner and I travelled back through New York after staying with friends in America. I wanted somewhere a little different as I have a dislike for large bland hotels. We were celebrating my partners 50th, I mailed the hotel beforehand to ask if we could have something bubbly in the room on our arrival, to my surprise, when we arrived, Colin the manager had not only supplied complementary bubble, but had also upgraded us. We were thrilled with the room, the hotel, bourbon street bar and grill, as well as the location. The room was large for NY standards, so clean and unique, we loved it as soon as we walked through the door. Bourbon street bar and grill, so fab we didn't want to go elsewhere, the staff, and the bar were superb. It's a tad noisy, but that is to be expected in the area, we had ear plugs so it didn't matter. We have already decided we are coming back next year. We'll done x

title: "NYC home sweet home"
text:
The French Qrts. is a lovely independent hotel in the heart of Manhattan, clean, with a friendly and professional staff & with a premium location. Not to mention wifi and breakfast included which is not common for New York.
We stayed here both May 2014 and 2015 for our son's graduations and commissioning. They went way beyond trying to accommodate all my demanding requests so to be able to host a small reception with family members coming to the ceremonies from all over the USA and Europe.
They were e great....Thank you Neil, John and Mr. Collins you all made us feel at home 🏡

title: Fabulous stay!
text: I surprised my husband for our 15th Anniversary and we both loved it! It's in prefect location and the card awaiting us,the daily paper with a forecast of the weather and things to do were perfect since we weren't from NY. The GM and the staff were very helpful and friendly! I would recommend this apartment to anyone wanting to stay in a great location. The bed was comfortable and temperature of the room was perfect too,but by far the roomy shower was favtastic,unlike thise you can barely fit in and I'm actually looking to go back already!

title: Faultless
text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in May, during a 5 night trip to NYC.  I had read the reviews and had high expectations - I can easily say that all of these were met and exceeded.  We checked in early in the morning and our bags were dealt with while we got on with exploring the city.  On our return we were thrilled to have been upgraded to a bigger room - whilst still not huge it had everything we needed and more.  The bathroom was beautifully appointed with complimentary L'Occitaine toiletries, the room had a coffee maker, complimentary Evian water, a fridge and even a hob along with a television.  I thought the umbrella and daily update on weather forecast and 'What's On' guide were a lovely touch.  I would not hesitiate to stay here again and couldn't recommend it highly enough.  The breakfast was very good quality and a great start to the day.  Thank you for helping to make our trip to NYC so wonderful and memorable!

title: Excellent location, lovely rooms
text: Stayed here for 3 nights in March as a birthday present and have to say the hotel lived up to the reputation on Trip Advisor. The hotel itself is just two blocks away from Times Square and is on a lovely street with plenty of eatery options (I suggest Bistecca Fiorentina for a steak) and a lively bar scene, particularly in the hotel itself. We were kindly upgraded on arrival to a double double room. The room itself was very well finished and gave that real Bourbon St feel, although the second double was somewhat unnecessary, the extra space was welcomed. Breakfast was a fairly standard continental breakfast but all the same very nice. The hotel staff were very friendly and overall I would highly recommend a stay here to get a real feel of New York.

title: Hotel lindo e atendimento incrível!!!
text:
O hotel é uma graça, o atendimento é espetacular, o carinho e cuidado que os profissionais deste tem com seus hospedes é simplesmente perfeito. Como mimos oferecem kit loccitane , água Evain e chás, cafés e chocolate no quarto, além do jornal diário e uma folha com sugestões do que fazer no dia. É ou não incrível!
O hotel fica em cima de um restaurante e o café da manhã é no restaurante, com excelentes opções e completamente fora do perfil New York de hoteis. Lá eles oferecem pães, iogurtes, cereais, café, chá, cream cheese, manteiga, leite... enfim ótimas opções. Como em um dos dias estava muito frio, decidi descer e jantar no restaurante (pub) e foi umas das melhores experiências... tb nota 10... Por fim, recomendo e voltarei a me hospedar neste hotel com toda certeza!

title: Comodo e affascinante
text: Hotel situato a due passi da Time Square e quindi in posizione strategica per visitare diversi punti della città. La via dell'albergo è piena di ristoranti e bar (ottimo il Bourbon Street, adiacente all'albergo), quindi vi è un certo rumore di sottofondo (non oltre la mezzanotte / una ad ogni modo). Rapporto qualità - prezzo discreto. Personale molto professionale. Note dolenti: qualità e quantità della colazione e rumori provenienti dalle scale (soprattutto sbattimenti della porta d'entrata).

title: Excellent place to stay in the heart of Hell's Kitchen and Times Square
text:
All of the staff were helpful when I checked in on April 12th. Bathroom was large with nice clean tiles and they supplied the Le Occitane products. Kuerig coffee maker, real creamers in the fridge along with a bottle of water. Complimentary newspaper and flyer of what was going on in the city was a great gesture. The breakfast was nice for a continental style.  
I enjoyed the stay so well, I have booked the room again for October! Can't wait!
Thank you

title: Convinient
text: Best with this hotel are the location. You gave walking distance to many of NY attractions. A lot if restaurants are also located around the hotel. Rooms are not big but they are clean. Staff are friendly are very helpful. Their breakfast are ok but i miss some warm food as i am used to that.

title: Great area to be in!
text: I came to New York this past week on a business trip and stayed here at the recommendation of a friend after knowing I would need to be in Midtown West for the majority of my trip.  The lobby is quite small, but the room was very comfortable and very clean.  The hotel is off the beaten path making for a much nicer stay as you're not entirely surrounded by the Times Square masses  The street is known as Restaurant Row and has some of the best dining NYC has to offer, making everything a quick and easy walk from outside the hotel.  Great value for the area as well.

title: Good Value in Midtown West
text: Not many options in this area. This hotel has a small lobby, just a reception desk at the end of a corridor. However, the bedrooms are well-equipped and spacious. The bathroom was well-updated with a good-sized walk-in shower. The bedroom, a little noisy at night overlooking 46th street, but also well-equipped plus a kitchenette. My total bill with taxes around $270 for the night, pretty good value for this location.

title: French Quarter Times Square New York
text: My wife and I stayed at The French Quarter this past weekend. We both found the hotel accommodations excellent.  The rooms are very clean and spacious and very well decorated and comfortable. It almost felt like I was staying in a high end bed and breakfast in the middle of Times Square.  The location of the hotel is perfect..  It is just off the beaten path but also only a very short walk from everything you want to get to. Next time I go to NYC with my wife we will be staying at the French Quarter again.

title: Lovely! Will Stay Again
text:
Located amongst a number of really wonderful restaurants and bars, you may actually pass it while searching for it, but once you do find it, it's very easy to locate. It's also walking distance from the world famous Times Square.

The entrance is a tiny space with just one desk where you have to check in. We were warmly greeted by a sweet lady behind the desk and after quick check-in, were taken to our room.

The room was very tastefully decorated and somehow you could sense that a lot of care had been put into it. It was very cozy and had a queen sized bed, a desk with a few magazines and a city guide, a TV, coffee machine, safe and a sink. The bathroom was bigger than I imagined for the size of the room. There was complimentary water and coffee and every morning you got a letter along with your newspaper that gave you suggestion on the  interesting things happening in the city, which I really liked.

Overall we had a wonderful stay with wonderful service and really wished we could have stayed for longer. Even thought we were there for only two days, it felt like home. Would I stay here again? Without a doubt!

title: WILL RETURN!
text:
Just back after a 5 night stay, room 501 a 2 bed suite was great.
location - right in the middle of everything
food - had a bar meal and it was tasty and very good value, breakfast was fine though we preferred to be out and about sampling all NYC has to offer.
staff - friendly, welcoming and efficient - a great asset!!!
value - well worth the cost
return? - certainly next time in NYC
The only drawback was the the silly mini ironing boards...useless!

title: Great Stay as usual
text: this is my third visit to the French quarters and it didn't disappoint me at all! the staff is fantastic and are always willing to go above and beyond to make your stay pleasurable. The rooms are clean and the location can't be beat. In the middle of everything yet private and quiet.

title: Just a few minutes from Times Square
text: Great hotel only a few minutes walk from Times Square. The rooms aren't huge but they are clean and well designed and I think it was good value for money. We found the staff are friendly and very helpful, I'd stay there again.

title: Delightfully comfortable and convenient
text: We have stayed at the French Quarters a couple of times and had consistently comfortable, pleasant visits.  Most recently, we stayed in a suite with teenage children.  We have found the rooms to be spotless, well-maintained and well-appointed, the included breakfast to be quite pleasant (good croissants!) and the staff to be gracious and attentive.    Breakfast is served on a patio in the back, which is now covered during wet or cold weather, but which is delightful either way.   The location is convenient to Broadway (we went to a show a block away) and the subway, as well as innumerable restaurants.  We will be back.

title: French Quarters comes through in NY
text:
I have stayed  at many hotels around the US, and was very impressed and pleasantly surprised by The French Quarters Guest Apartments on 46th in NYC. From the friendly staff(in new York city!!) to the elegant and smart décor and appointments of the room. Also the level of quality given to the small important things like an actual keurig in your room with a nice selection of pods, and wait, in the already running mini-fridge(who does that?) half and half. nicely done, French Quarters.
So, I was just nicely impressed with these new York guys, right in the thick of it on Restaurant row.
Bravo!!

title: Cheesy and overrated
text:
Having visited NYC several times, I decided to give this hotel a try several weeks ago.

If you're into the cheesy tourist trap that is times sq then maybe this hotel is for you.  This isn't a true NYC experience, however.  The whole experience was just annoying - not sure what I was thinking when I stayed here.

title: Hermoso hotel en NY
text: Me aloje con amigas en el mes de marzo de 2015, el hotel es pequeño y tiene una ubicación excelente, cerca de Time square y a cuatro cuadras del metro. El barrio donde se encuentra tiene movimiento a toda hora y me parecio muy seguro. La atención de todo el staff del hotel fue muy cordial y esmerada desde Collins el administrador a Kevin en el desayuno. El desayuno es completo y tiene distintas opciones, desde yogurt, cafe , leche, cereales, tostadas, muffins, medialunas, jugo de naranja, frutas, etc. La habitación no es muy grande pero esta bien, la limpieza es muy buena y cuenta con kichinette, heladerita y una maquina para preparar cafe o te que despúes de un largo día paseando resulta excelente. El bar que esta debajo del hotel esta muy bueno.Volveria a este hotel y ya se lo recomende a amigos.

title: Could not fault, the people, place or location
text: Lovely 2 bed apartment with 2 luxurious bathrooms. Great beds, fabulous coffee machine :-) Views from balcony to die for. Location perfect for everything. Street packed with bars and restaurants, attached bar beautiful and staff lovely too.

title: Incredible hotel, amazing location.
text:
There is nothing bad about this hotel at all. The staff are lovely - the complimentary breakfast is continental all you can eat and was great. The bar and eatery under the hotel had amazing deals drinks and good food. The hotel is on a quiet street ,(actually the restaurant row of NY) but you don't hear any noise despite being 2 blocks from Time Square and the subways. Location was perfect.

The room itself was a free upgrade we were given! We stayed in a two bedroom suite which had lots of room, coffee machines, hobs, fridge and really comfortable beds. The heating worked perfectly the bathrooms were great and it came with all the extras you could need. The cherry on the top was the free paper and hotel's guide to what's on in the city each day. They basically scoure event listings and TimeOut for you, and deliver these tips each morning, along with a summary of the weather for the day! Such a nice and useful touch. 
This hotel was pretty much perfect. 100% recommend it and won't hesitate to stay again. Absolutely worth the money.

title: Wonderful hotel!!
text:
This fabulous boutique hotel is a hidden gem! Centrally located (Times Sq, The Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park, Penn Station...), easy walking distance to everything. Tons of restaurants and cafes,and stores around.
My husband and I booked a standard room but upon arrival Niall at the front desk (I'm sorry if I misspelled your name!) surprised us with an upgrade.
Rooms are small but cozy. The bed was very comfy and had a bunch of pillows. There was a Keurig coffee machine in the room with at least 6 kinds of K-cups (tea, coffee - regular and decaf kinds, hot cocoa, hot apple cider), a fridge with complimentary drinks... there was even an electric stove top!
The bathroom was lovely. Plenty of towels. "L'Occitane" bath products.
Free newspaper in the morning. Free breakfast: cereal, hot oatmeal, yogurt, pastries, bagels, toast, fresh fruit. Free wi-fi.
I usually have trouble sleeping if the AC is too loud or impossible to shut off (i.e., if it has some sort of an internal timer or something and kicks in no matter what). No problem here. The only issue you might have with sleeping, however, is the bar across the street, "Don't Tell Mama" - they have open mic nights and things can get pretty loud. Someone kept on singing song after song till 2:30 am on a Monday night. (The man's voice was pretty good but... we probably would have appreciate it even more if it weren't at 2:30 am :)))
Overall, it is a very good hotel and we thoroughly enjoy our stay, albeit short. But we'll be back for sure!

title: the most memorable hotel ever
text:
myself and my husband stayed in early march and we couldn't praise this hotel enough. this quaint hotel with its near georgian decor was fab and its central location on 46st just off time square made it ideal. however, it was the high level of service that made this hotel stand out. every morn the daily newspaper was delivered to our room along with an information leaflet outlining weather and attractions in the area for the day. 
Colin the manager made us feel like V.I.P.'s enquiring about our day and offering friendly advice on what to see and do and John Niall & Monica on reception couldn't do enough for us. the Bourbon St Bar of the hotel was spacious and lively, offering great food from finger food, burgers, steaks to cajun, and the friendly and efficient service, especially from Megan, one of the bar staff made it a great stay.
all in all we had the most wonderful stay and will definately be back.

title: Great location to explore NYC
text: This is a great hotel. Stayed here for a week- we had a double room on the second floor. Very comfortable- great bed! There was some street noise in the evenings but to be honest, I wore earplugs and my husband didn't notice it at all. Very friendly staff- particularly the breakfast guys. We thought the daily info sheet under the door was really helpful and we ended up going to a hockey game at Madison Sq Gardens as a result- a great experience. Having the bar/ restaurant next door was great for a lazy evening when we didn't want to venture far. The area is busy with lots going on- within walking distance of theatres, subway and had a real buzz. Very helpful reception staff and a feeling you weren't in a hotel which we liked. We were sorry to leave.

title: Excellent find; unique non-chain hotel
text:
We only got to stay one night here (and were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a two-room/two-bath suite) but would love to come back for a longer stay in the future! 

Location - close to subway, Times Square, theater district, on "restaurant row" 

Accommodations - everything you could ask for and more; amazing free continental breakfast in a beautiful terrace
