Staff - every person we encountered was friendly and had a smile. Colin, the owner, introduced himself at breakfast and it's clear he takes pride in his place and values his guests. 

Can't say enough good things about French Quarters Guest Apartments - definitely looking forward to a future visit!

title: Great hotel
text:
Spent 1 night with family here and was very impressed with staff and the 2 rooms which had been upgraded to suites for us. 
Thought we would hear noise from the NY streets below but all was quiet in our back room location. 
Room was very clean and the bathroom was classy with lots of mood lighting. 
Will definitely stay here again beats the chain hotels and the short walk to Times Square and the theater district was ideal for us.

title: Excellent
text: We spent three nights at the French Quarters for a mother and daughter week-end in New York, and were very pleased with our accommodation.  We shared a twin room which was tastefully furnished, with very comfortable beds and a well appointed bathroom.  We both enjoyed undisturbed sleep followed by a continental breakfast which set us up nicely for exploring the city in the snow!  The location is great, within easy walking distance of Times Square, The Rockefeller Centre and Central Park, with the Broadway theatres right on the doorstep.  A taxi to the Metropolitan Opera House cost less than $10.  The hotel staff were very helpful as we planned our days and evenings.  They gave us useful advice and made us very welcome, particularly Colin and Monica, and we appreciated the personal touch which helped make our stay so special.  We had a wonderful time.  Thank you.

title: Great Hotel
text:
We stayed for 6 nights on our first visit to NYC and loved it.
The building has a great vibe, and the staff were great. We got an upgrade on arrival and stayed in one of the front rooms, 2nd floor, front of the building. I didn't notice much traffic noise at all and the view up the street was entertaining. The continental breakfast was good quality. The Bar and Grill downstairs made great food, a good atmosphere and good staff. Room service provided from the Bar and Grill was quick and of good quality.
Having been married a couple of days prior the hotel also tried to surprise us with a bottle of bubbly. Unfortunately we were ill and couldn't take advantage of the very thoughtful gesture. As a result we stayed in for one or two days rather than explore and couldn't have asked for more comfortable surroundings to try and recover.

title: Time square view!
text: Amazing, beautiful & gorgeous old style building. True walking distance to everything. Wonderful, gracious staff & a delicious breakfast. We were upgraded when we arrived early & jet lagged & then again to a suite when the heating failed. Loved this place, despite the bitter Winter.

title: Great Hotel
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for my 30th birthday. We stayed in the main building (originally were given a room in the building next door which I didn't like, the window was to the street so we had little privacy). We were given another room by a friendly and helpful member of staff. Breakfast was lovely, bagels, boiled eggs, croissants, plenty of jams, peanut butter spreads, philidelphia spreads etc. Greek yogurt, activia, cereals, toast, juice, plenty on offer for a good start. Location was absolutely brilliant, we were no more of a 5 min walk from the main times square, and metro station nearby. No complaints whatsoever, was a great stay at a very good price!

title: Best hotel in NYC by far!
text: Took my mother to Manhattan for her 60th birthday this week. I've previously stayed in many different hotels in NYC but this was truly the best! Upon arrival they upgraded us for free to a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite with a huge terrace! The location and staff are top notch. Even the owner knew it was my mothers birthday. Beds were comfy and breakfast was awesome! I will stay here every time going forward.

title: Don't tell anyone...
text:
what a perfect place this is! Staff are both gracious AND efficient, location could not be better. Rooms are spotless and charming -- reminded us of our Latin Quarter hotel but this was larger. The included breakfast was generous and made the price of the room an even better value. No reason for us to stay anywhere else.

A tip: if the 'restaurant row' places don't appeal, walk a block or two to Marseille or Taboon and be transported!

title: Why would I stay anywhere else?
text:
I have stayed at the French Quarters Guest Apartments twice now, and they have become a staple of my travels to Manhattan.  A few reasons why....
Location, location, location.  Can't be beat.
Staff that knew me by name - Can't be beat.
Staff that proactively contacted me after I left because they found something I forgot in my room (and offered to mail it to me) --- Priceless!
The big box brand name hotels may have some advantages, but I'll trade them any time for this hidden gem in NYC!

title: Did Not Disappoint!
text: Staying at the French Quarters continues to be a fantastic experience! My family and I choose to stay at this boutique hotel over the Christmas holidays and will stay there again with my extended family at the end of March. When it became known that a relative was celebrating a milestone birthday, we immediately thought to stay here. It is located in the heart of the Theatre District and the staff could not be more accommodating. Colin, John, and Kevin treated us beautifully at the desk, taking us to our room, and also at the delicious continental breakfast. When I forgot an article of clothing, Colin went the extra mile and had it sent to me. We are intending to have a family brunch at its adjacent restaurant, Bourbon Street. Looking forward to it.   B.M.

title: Great service and location
text: We stayed at The French Quarters for our first venture to NYC. Our five night stay was upgraded to a king room (something to do with our recent nuptials in Las Vegas). Fabulous location -- so close to everything. Continental breakfast included (thanks Kevin). Ask for one of the bay windows -- it's so nice to look out toward Times Square. Unfortunately, the French Quarters couldn't do anything about the bitterly cold weather (coldest since 1989),  but we won't hold that against them. We will be back. Thanks so much.

title: parfait petit hotel
text:
Très satisfaits de cet hotel situé à deux pas de Times Square, proche du metro ,..
L'accueil est simple et agréable , les chambres très mignonnes avec une super SDB avec ses produits "l'Occitane"..
Le petit déjeuner est très bien ,hormis pour les amateurs de "salé" puisqu'il n'y en a pas ,mais nous pouvons tout à fait prendre toutes les vitamines nécessaires à une bonne journée de marche!!
Nous avons également pu profiter du resto et du bar le soir ,franchement pas mal.
Bonne adresse !

title: Great hotel, in a great location
text:
We stayed in the French Quarters for a week in Feb 2015 during one of New York's coldest spells. Upon arrival we were upgraded without request and then shown to our rooms by John who was very friendly and helpful. Our room was number 208 in the townhouse next door, which was up one flight of stairs, this was no problem though as our bags were brought up for us and also brought down when we checked out. The room was surprisingly spacious for New York and comprised of two double beds, nice sized bathroom with L'Occitane products, large TV with around 20 channels, safe, fridge stocked with a bottle of water & two energy drinks, a great coffee machine that had 5 pods each for coffees, tea, hot chocolate, apple brew, hair dryer, ironing board and also a portable electric heater as well as the rooms own air conditioning/heater. Even though the weather had reached record lows our room was warm and also the hall outside.
The location was perfect, just a 5 minute walk from Times Square and on restaurant row. Our room was at the back so no view but it was very quiet, there was some noise on one of the nights from the bar next door that was having a Mari Gras night but nothing that would stop you from sleeping.
The breakfast was very nice and included, bagels, croissants, scones, bread, fruit, tea, coffee, orange juice, cereal, porridge, yogurt. The breakfast staff were very friendly and the eating area was upstairs of the bar. There was a nice mezzanine where the breakfast was served but it was a bit cold to sit out there at the time. Every morning around 6am a copy of the New York Post was left at our door along with a nice information sheet on events that were happening in New York that day. There were also maps in our room as well at the reception.
We had a great stay and would highly recommend this hotel, the only regret that we had was not visiting the bar and restaurant next door and also not getting to try enough restaurants on the street.
Also if travelling to New York in winter make sure to be prepared for the cold, we thought we were but I think you definitely need an extra under layer of thermals when walking around outside! Also make sure to make reservations at most restaurants or else you could be waiting a while to get a table.

title: A real gem
text:
What a find! Our second visit to NY and to this great little hotel. Colin and all his team go the extra mile to welcome and ensure you have all you need. All the staff are polite, helpful and conscientious and the added bonus of the elevator straight to the bar/grill is brilliant!
Most certainly recommend this hotel and its management and will surely be back!
Nothing they could do about the weather though :-)

title: Sweet spot
text: Spent two nights in a room with two double beds.  Warm welcome in a tiny front desk room.  Was actually brought up to the room and shown around...not my usual experience checking into a hotel!  It's a small property in a great location, easy walk to Times Square, Theaters, great restaurants.  Lovely, small room...great bathroom. Complimentary breakfast in a nice area over the bar.  Really enjoyed all aspects of this hotel.

title: Un angolo di stile a due passi dal centro del mondo
text:
Non ci sono parole per esprimere le sensazioni provate quando arrivi a JFK e ti dirigi verso Manhattan a bordo di un yellow cab; 

Non mi sono pentito nemmeno per un secondo di aver scelto questa struttura per la mia prima visita a NY e conto di ritornarci appena possibile.

Le camere sono piccole ma confortevoli al massimo. Pulizia al top ed un bagno con doccia spaziale. 

A due passi da Times Square, posizione ideale per visitare le attrazioni più note della grande mela.

Bellissimi a molto curati gli spazi comuni, specialmente il pub situato al piano terra. 

Colazione abbondante ed ottima, staff cordialissimo e pronto a venirvi incontro per ogni esigenza.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
Two friends and I stayed at the French quartersfor a week in September 2014.

It was such a lovely place to stay, the location is fantastic just a few mins walk to time square. The room it's self was lovely, quite small but that is to be expected in NYC everything was clean, the bathroom was again small but clean and well decorated.

When we arrived there was a complimentary bottle of water and a couple of soft drinks. We actually arrived very early (6am) the staff were lovely, they stored our bags and advised us where we could go until are room was ready.

Our room included breakfasts, which was quite simple there were croissants and bagels and some cereals which we're nice and all the staff were always very pleasant, the manager of the hotel came round and introduced himself to everyone in the breakfast room which I thought was lovely.

When we were checking out of the hotel, the manager very kindly arranged our transport to the airport (as we had quite a lot of bags) we were very lucky that there wasn't a mini bus availbe so instead the company he contacted sent a stretch limo for the same price!!
Overall I would strongly recommend this hotel, the staff our lovely and very helpful. The rooms are lovely and the location is fantastic. And all for a great price!!!

title: wonderful accommodations. great pricing. excellent staff and service
text: we were in nyc for just one night to see a show and go to MOMA.  my husband found this hotel on line thru booking.com and chose it for location and price.  it was better than i could have imagined.  from the moment we were warmly welcomed by a very friendly woman at the desk and shown to our room, it did not disappoint.  she upgraded us on arrival bc we had booked a double bed and was right to think we would be happier in a queen or larger.  as others have said, rooms are tastefully decorated, bed very comfortable, lovely products in the bath, soft plush towels.  the staff are all very friendly and seem genuinely interested.  they kept our luggage for us on check out day so we could go explore.  it was perfect and i would highly recommend this boutique apt/hotel!  we will go back if we need lodging in nyc again.

title: Fantastic location, great hotel
text: On arrival we were upgraded to a beautiful room. Very clean amenities and top quality toiletries. The location is fantastic! Walking distance to almost everything and if not, hop on the subway which is a 5 min walk or so. You're on restaurant row so good options are endless! The included breakfast is a great start to the day. I will definitely stay here again!

title: heart of the action for NYC
text: Location, location, location and if you like the theatre, restaurant row and Times Square then you have arrived!  The French Quarters is the place to be.  It's afordable and clean with daily continential breakfasts included.  For two people not wanting to break the bank you get a nice very small room but remember you didn't come to NYC to stay in your room.  If you want the glitz go up the street and spend double the price.  I'll be back but I'll get a bigger room next time.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff
text:
We stayed at the French Quarters for a long weekend.  The staff are extremely friendly and helpful.  The first night our room facing the street was a little noisy, so they moved us to a beautiful room on the opposite side of the hotel that was quiet and comfortable.

The rooms are large and well equipped, ours had a coffee machine and complimentary water.  The bathrooms are well fitted and come with high quality toiletries.  The restaurant also offers a complimentary breakfast which is a nice touch.

The location is perfect, a couple of blocks west of Times Square and on the edge of Hells Kitchen.  There are loads of nice bars and restaurants within a few minutes walk, and the hotel hosts a nice bar and restaurant on the ground floor, Bourbon Street.

Very nice hotel, we'll use it again when we return.

title: Tout n'était pas bien qui finit très bien!
text: Enfin un hôtel à taille humaine pour notre 4ème  visite de New York. Nous l'avions choisi pour ses bons commentaires. A notre arrivée, quelques déchets jonchaient sous l'armoire et la petite cuisine très complète etait dépourvue de vaisselle et ustensiles de cuisine, à quoi servirait une cuisine si vous n'avez rien pour cuisiner? Le lendemain, dommage le petit déjeuner était franchement nul! Dépose le long du bar devant les bouteilles d'alcool!!!!Les viennoiseries sont toute séchées et le serveur très "mou", le chariot pour reprendre le petit déjeuner était très sale! Donc, nous avons fait part de notre grand mécontentement à Monica la directrice de l'établissement, qui a très  bien compris notre requête. Elle a réglé notre problème très rapidement et fait preuve de beaucoup de compréhension. Au final, cet hôtel est tout à fait à recommander car si quelque chose ne vous convient pas, il suffit d'en parler et tout s'arrange très très vite! Merci pour TOUT. Nous reviendrons!

title: Family trip to the Big Apple
text:
Following a great stay at Hotel Drisco, San Francisco, we flew to New York - we had booked to stay at the French Quarters and I need to start by saying any accommodation is going to struggle vs. Hotel Drisco
Travelling with two grown sons we booked the 2 bed apartment
It was a lot smaller than we expected but considering its position its understandable
Great for Times Square, Theatres, Restaurants and access to subway...short walk only from Central Park
The service was great at every level
Our only comment is the room could get a little noisy not from external but the AC and perhaps cleaning could have been a little better but no real complaints
Anyone looking to a great central location would be happy with French Quarters

title: Muito bem localizado
text:
Hotel fica na parte de cima de um bar e o elevador do hotel tem ligação direta com o mesmo.
Quarto muito bem arrumado e limpo.
Apensar de ser um pouco pequeno, tem tudo que é necessário.
O banheiro tem um ótimo tamanho e muito limpo também.
Os recepcionistas deram varias dicas e sempre que tiraram todos as duvidas sobre a cidade e transporte.
Para quem vai assistir peças na Brodway, se faz tudo a pé.

title: Christmas in New York
text: This place is great! We were there during the busy holiday season and the people who work there were so friendly and helpful. The bed was comfy, room was clean, and the mini fridge was great for storing all our leftovers. We couldn't have asked for better service. After reading the reviews, I was a little nervous about the noise, but it wasn't a problem for us. This is definitely a must stay in NYC

title: We just loved this place!
text:
I am a bit late writing this review as we stayed there just before Christmas 2014.
Sadly we only stayed at this hotel for one night as we were going on a Cruise leaving from New York. We had originally been booked into another hotel by our tour company but the hotel they had chosen was off the beaten track and totally unsuitable for our needs. I did a lot of research before I chose The French Quarters as we knew our time in new York was going to be limited and we wanted to be within walking distance of Times Square.  This Hotel had such superb reviews I decided to book it.  When I started the booking process we were offered a room over the bar. The only room available at the time of booking and a great special offer price.   The Hotel was totally honest and did say that it could be noisy.  This did worry us somewhat but as the hotel was in such a good location for us we decided to risk it.  I am so pleased we did as we thoroughly enjoyed our night at the hotel.  I have to say the Staff there were amazing.  Nothing was too much trouble.  I emailed lots of questions before we arrived and because we had also been let down with transfers by our rotten Travel Company. they came to our rescue and booked a transfer to the Port for us too.  We arrived at the hotel VERY late in the evening as our transfer had not arrived at JFK to pick us up.  One travel Agent is well and truly crossed off our list! This is one customer who wont be using a Travel bag again if you get my drift!  We had a great welcome even though we were late and were taken to our room and shown how everything worked.  The Keurig coffee machine was a Godsend as we were able to have a quick drink before we went off to explore. The hotel are so generous. We had ample sachets of coffee etc a bottle of water and some juice for the morning.I particularly enjoyed the hot apple cider drink.  The room we had was quite adequate and had everything we needed. It was very nicely decorated and our view was out across the street  which was really sparkling with all the Christmas decorations.  We particularly loved the bathroom with all the lovely Occitane toiletries. Please don't be afraid to book this room if like us you don't worry about a bit of  music and like a 'Happy lively atmosphere'  The noise was minimal.  It didn't spoil our time there at all.  Breakfast was great.  We particularly liked sitting on the balcony overlooking the bar. 
We had a chat with Colin the manager over breakfast.  He really cares about his guests and we could see him talking to everyone in turn.  He did smile when I started quizzing him about Mardi Gras beads!!!  For some reason we had been asked to wear them for meeting up with people on our Cruise ship. He must have wondered what sort of cruise we were going on!  I think it was Kevin who looked after us all so well over breakfast.  We were a bit confused at first and couldn't find things but he was a great help and had a smile for everyone.  We had a very leisurely breakfast and I couldn't resist taking photos of the bar below us as it was so beautifully decorated.  To sum up.  This hotel is in a great position near lots of bars and restaurants and within a few minutes walking distance from Times Square.  We felt very safe walking around at night and enjoyed seeing all the people out enjoying their Christmas parties etc. I must admit the bar at the hotel was really lively but we didn't get a chance to go there for a drink.  We will have to save that for next time.  The highlight of our trip came right at the end.  We had booked a town cab to take us to the Port but were transported in Style in a stretch Limo.  It was such a treat for us and we smiled all the way to the Port.  It was such a great start to our holiday Cruise.  We will definitely return to New York at some point and will most definitely choose the French Quarters again.  I just wish more hotels looked after their customers so well.  Thanks to everyone who helped made our stay so memorable.  We particularly enjoyed chatting to the people at the Reception Desk who gave us loads of interesting information about the Hotel and New York.  Just one more little thing.  We got a great newsletter posted under our door in the morning to tell us all the things going on in the neighbourhood.

title: 10 e lode!
text: Ne abbiamo girati parecchi di alberghi a New York ma dobbiamo ammettere che l'incredibile gentilezza e disponibilità dello staff di questo piccolo splendido hotel ci ha lasciati letteralmente senza parole. L'hotel, pur trovandosi in pieno centro a Manhattan, è situato in una via molto carina, famosa per i teatri ed i ristorantini. Non è economicissimo ma vista la posizione e la qualità dell'hotel direi che  non ci si può proprio lamentare... All'arrivo ci hanno accolti con il sorriso anche se eravamo notevolmente in anticipo rispetto all'orario previsto per il check in. Si sono scusati perché la camera non era pronta e dopo poco tempo ci hanno contattato telefonicamente per informarci che erano riusciti a farla preparare. La nostra stanza era forse un po' rumorosa dato che si trovava sopra il pub...ma ci avevano avvisati di questo problema ed inoltre proprio per questo motivo costava meno...quindi sarebbe scorretto lamentarsi! Inoltre il Pub sottostante, sempre di proprietà dei gestori dell'hotel, molto bello e sempre affollatissimo, è l'ideale per una bella birra o un pasto veloce. La camera era piccolina ma bellissima, praticamente nuova e pulitissima, con letto alla francese e tendaggi e tessuti di pregio. Oltre alla TV c'erano anche un frigobar (bevande gratis) ed un microonde. Il bagno, anch'esso carinissimo, era spazioso e con un'enorme doccia. Un tocco di classe in più: I prodotti di cortesia erano de "l'occitane"!!!! La colazione ottima ed abbondante servita al pub sottostante (sempre di proprietà dei gestori dell'hotel). La mattina inoltre giornale in camera con aggiunta di informazioni meteo da parte della direzione. Ci hanno tenuto in deposito il bagaglio per un giorno intero gratuitamente e non hanno neppure voluto che gli pagassimo il francobollo per spedire una cartolina in Italia... Insomma possiamo dire che l'hotel perfetto esiste e miracolosamente si trova in centro a New York... si chiama The French Quarters! Raccomandatissimo.

title: Charming hotel
text:
My daughter and I stayed here from 13-16th jan 2015........ It was excellent ! We will be back. Charming boutique hotel - a stones through from Time Sq and easy walking distance to Central pk, etc . 
The staff were charming, helpful and so polite. Lovely buzzy bistro/ bar which although noisy on the last night ,did not disturb sleep. Room was well buffered from the music. 
Thank you to all.

title: Buon rapporto qualità prezzo
text:
Siamo stati ospiti io e mio nipote in  questo hotel a gennaio, siamo arrivati dal JFK con la metro e siamo scesi alla 50st. Sebbene fosse tardi l'area è abbastanza sicura e dopo due blocchi siamo arrivati all'hotel. La stanza è accogliente e confortevole, con le classiche amenities americane in più il receptionist ci accolti con una bottiglia d'acqua e del succo di limone.
La colazione era inclusa nella tariffa, e sebbene non eccezionale era passabile.
Un punto in più all'hotel arriva dal fatto che abbiamo potuto lasciare le nostre valige fino al tardo pomeriggio nonostante avevamo il check out alle 11 am.

title: Great place
text:
We have been there twice and never disappoint us. Love the "hells kitchen" location, lots to eat and drinks in that block.
Pros; the rooms are large for NYC standards, we loved the lit kitchen are which included a small fridge, coffee, microwave and sink. Great when traveling with kids! The morning breakfast was a plus. The staff was very polite and friendly. The rooms and hotel were clean and the bathroom was huge.
Cons; the entrance is so small we had to maneuver the suitcases to get in. Then there's not much of a check in desk and the elevator is right next to the desk. Very congested when checking in but I guess that's NY. The prices for this hotel keeps going up. 
The restaurant downstairs food was average but at night was a great place to hang out!

title: Lovely, Reasonable, Pleasant, Theater District
text:
Lovely, Reasonable, Pleasant, Great location in theater district, and close to good restaurants.
Clean, neat. Near a noisy bar but our room was quiet.  Great breakfast, unusually generous with lots of choices in a Solarium kind of room where the ceiling opens in warm weather

title: A PERFECT 10!!!!!
text: My wife and i stayed from 20/12/14 - 3/1/15, and we loved every minute of it. From the time we arrived the staff were fantastic. A BIG thank you to Colin and every member of his team for making our stay so great. The room was great, we had a room on the 2nd floor with a view out over the street. It got a little noisy on a Friday evening, but nothing that was to bad. The bathroom is spacious, with a great big shower.The room comes with a cooker top, coffee machine, fridge and a microwave if you request one. Not to mention the utensils, so if you don't feel like eating out you can always have something in the room. The location is prime, it is just a few hundred meters from the heart of time square. There are restaurants all over the street, no to mention even more places around each corner. The breakfasts were everything that we enjoyed, and you don't have to pay extra for it which is not something that you get at many other NY hotels. Cereal, Fruit, Yogurt, Toast, Bagels, Oats, everything you need to start the day. That was one of our biggest reasons for choosing the French Quarters. The cleaning service can be a little slow, on a few days our room was not ready until after 3pm, but if you are out all day then that shouldn't really matter. The free wifi is also helpful. We will make sure that in future visits to NY that we make this our hotel of choice.

title: Good location, big rooms, friendly staff
text: We loved our stay at French Quarters over the Bew Tear period. Staff are very friendly and helpful.  Location is great to get out and explore the city with many places we wanted to visit in walking distance

title: Great Location and Great Service
text: We stayed there the day after Christmas and couldn't have been more pleased.  The staff was friendly and helpful and the location was steps away from nightlife and Broadway theaters. Will definitely stay there again on our next visit.

title: Pleasant stay in the heart of Manhattan
text: This establishment definitely lives up to their claim to be a deluxe New York City accommodation designed with an iconic New Orleans style. The rooms are beautifully decorated, and even though my room was rather small, it was very comfortable, complete with a small writing desk. The service was excellent and the manager went out of her way to ensure a smooth early departure, with breakfast stocked in the refrigerator the evening before, the booking of a cab service, and she even walked me to the cab.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: We picked the French Quarters for its location, breakfast, and affordability.  It was more than we expected!  The staff was very helpful and friendly, room was clean...we even had a beautiful view of the city.  Even better was the fact that the subway, local eateries, Times Square and Rockefeller Center were within walking distance.  I loved the Keurig coffee maker in the room which is something little, but it was a nice touch.  There will be noise in the streets (as you are staying in NYC) but nothing that earplugs can't fix.  This place is great for everyone..families and honeymooners alike.  Would love to go again!

title: Professionali e accoglienti
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato al French Quarters per il nostro viaggio di nozze e l'abbiamo trovato davvero carino e accogliente. Le camere sono confortevoli e dotate anche di macchinetta e cialde per fare tisane e caffè (l'ideale dopo una giornata intensa in giro per New York!). Tutte le mattine lo staff mette a disposizione il quotidiano, le previsioni meteorologiche giornaliere e delle proposte su attività ed eventi a cui poter partecipare, come ad esempio l'orario e il percorso della parata prevista per il "Thanksgiving Day"!. 
Lo staff dell'albergo è molto disponibile, quando abbiamo comunicato che eravamo in viaggio di nozze, al nostro rientro in camera abbiamo trovato una bottiglia di prosecco con due flûte (Thank you Monica!!!). Prima della partenza lo staff dell'albergo ci ha consigliato una compagnia che ci avrebbe accompagnati all'aeroporto JFK per qualche dollaro in più rispetto ai classici taxi gialli... ma non sapevamo che fuori dall'hotel c'era una fantastica limousine ad attenderci!!! Splendida sorpresa!... Il fatto che poi abbiamo forato una gomma di fronte l'aeroporto... è un'altra storia!

title: Over and above our expectations!
text: Long overdue review from our trip to NYC in August 2014. Myself, my husband and our 6 month old daughter stayed 10 nights at the French Quarters on recommendation from friends who'd stayed there and we were certainly not disappointed. I booked directly with the hotel which was a very easy process and a reasonable rate. Hotel is in a great spot surrounded by restaurants and walking distance to Times Square and the Theatres. From the minute we arrived John was very helpful and our room already had the baby crib set up. John was also able to obtain us a microwave to use during our stay (for baby bottles). The room has a small kitchenette which they will stock with crockery/cutlery as requested. Bed very comfortable, room very clean and lovely bathroom with the l'occitane products. We stayed in a room on the first floor closest to the street and yes there was noise but nothing that didn't keep us or our baby from sleeping. Infact it was quite lovely hearing the music from the Jazz club across the road most nights. Breakfast was delicious and ample, such a bonus to have it included for free. Wifi is also free. We had our laundry sent out a number of times and it was always promptly brought back and placed in our room. The fee for this service was minimal, especially given how difficult it can be to have your clothes cleaned whilst on holidays. Towards the end of our stay we had a very unfortunate issue arise with our travel money cards from our bank back home where we were essentially left with no money due to no fault of our own. John and Collin couldn't help us enough with regards to this. If we were staying in a larger hotel I am certain we wouldn't have had the support and assistance that they offered to get the matter sorted. We appreciated their assistance so much and it made dealing with the issue so much easier. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and we would love to be able to stay there again when we're next in NYC.

title: Great Location
text:
Just want to thank Colin for a great stay. Forever willing to point us in the right direction.

Perfect location, great range of restaurants in the street and so close to Time Square, Subway, and Broadway.

Highly recommend,
The Aussie couple 202.

title: Well worth a stay!
text:
We stayed for three nights in December and we thought this hotel was fantastic. When we booked it we were clearly informed that our room was above the bar and therefore there would be noise. Yes there was some noise but it didn't disturb our sleep as we were prepared with ear plugs - it did not affect our stay whatsoever.

The room was spotless, the bed and pillows were very, very comfortable, the bathroom was great with a fab walk in shower, I thought the L'Occitane toiletries were a lovely touch.

The coffee/drinks machine was brilliant (I wish they sold them in the UK as I would definitely get one after using the one in the hotel!) There was also water and a funny 'hangover drink' provided in the fridge.

The staff were really helpful. The location was fantastic, about two minute walk to the heart of Times Square! Plenty of restaurants and diners around - we did eat at the restaurant underneath the hotel and the food was delicious with fantastic service from the staff.

We do not have a bad thing to say about this hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone planning a visit to NY.

title: Great place to stay
text: My husband and I had an overnight in NYC and just got back.  I was so impressed with this hotel.  The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room we got was incredibly charming - in fact we got an unexpected upgrade which was wonderful.  The hotel is right on "Restaurant Row" and at night it was so much fun walking up and down the street, choosing where we wanted to eat.  The hotel is also just down the street from Times Square, the hotel  feesl tucked away in a secret spot.  I would never stay anywhere else now.  We got great suggestions for where to eat and things to do.  The beds were very very comfortable with a thick duvet.  I love the black and white theme and the Parisian feel.  Very romantic.

title: Great hotel
text:
The best hotel  I have ever been in N.Y!!!
Nice hospitality. We got a good suggestion for restaurants and shows.
The stuffe helped us in any questions..
Great breakfast with good service.
The room is large, very comfortabale.

title: Classy.. but not pretentious
text: My husband and I stayed here recently.  It was perfect.  The rooms and bathroom are immaculately clean with a French, classy décor.  The bed and pillows are super comfortable. Our room was ready at noon when we arrived and we got to check in early (None of the "check in is not until 3:00 nonsense).  Colin, the manager, was very gracious and friendly.  The only issue was the continental breakfast was limited, but most usually are.  The hotel is in a perfect location for dinner and Broadway shows.  I can't wait to go back.

title: Awesome
text:
From the time we left to the time we went to bed the staff etc could not do enough for you. The guys on breakfast what a team polite  well good fun  friendly, attentive. Food was good room  was clean, few signs of aging no loss.
When we left we had the pleasure to meet the PM staff a gentleman of Irish desert forgot his name  but again a credit to the French quarters. The manager  came to introduce his self at Breakfast, A genuine team.So in a nutshell forget those over stated others, just stay at this place, need i say anymore.Time square etc it just outside and you wouldn't even no it.

title: Wonderful stay. Recommended!
text:
Excellent location. Room was very big, and well equipped. Nice coffee machine.
Bathroom was very good and modernly designed.
Can be noisy from the street or the nearby restaurant at night.
Breakfast was OK, good selection of cereals and fruit.

title: Great experience
text:
Stayed here on a 4 day trip to New york.  The French Quarters is impeccably clean, has great design, full refrigerator, kitchenette coffe maker.  Comfortable beds, attentive staff.  Continental breakfast with many options and friendly service.  

The neighborhood is convenient to theaters, times sqare and numerous restaurants. 

We will be back!

title: Excellent stay
text: We stayed here for 2 nights from 10/11/14. Excellent location near Times Square. The room was lovely with hob, fridge and coffee maker. The staff very helpful and friendly. A daily planner of events delivered to your room daily. Loved the French decor. Would definitely stay again

title: very nice stay in the heart of the city
text: We recently visited the big apple for 4 days and found the French Quarters to have an extremely good location (in restaurant Row and only 5 minutes walk from Times Square). Rooms are adequately sized (considering location), very clean and very well kept. Bed was very comfortable. Since my wife was celebrating her birthday, hotel manager ensured we had a bottle of prosecco waiting for us in the room which was a very nice touch . The only complaints/problems we had, was primarily the noise from outside+bar during the night. Some staff shifts eg night shift had receptionists which were not as helpful as others. Took food from bar below, highly recommended. All in all, if again in NYC would definitely stay again at this hotel.

title: Wonderful apartments
text:
Wasn't quite sure what to expect as online photos made the place look old but the reviews were good. And the reviews were right this is a small boutique hotel and it's made to look old without being old. Front desk employees were ok, the cleaners and breakfast employes were fantastic. 
Lucky we got upgraded from king room  to 2 bedroom apartment as rooms in New York are very very small.  Beds were really comfortable and we love the tea/ hot chocolate maker. Pods were replaced daily.  Breakfast was a standard continental, enough to fill you up. 

Ask for a cab they got us a limo to us to the airport. 
Communication great emails. 
The  Burbon Bar next has good meals 

Would l stay here again, mostly no. But that's not the hotel fault, there just to much contraction going on in the area. And the area it self is just too busy.

title: Aptly Named Hotel! Great Location! Lovely.
text: Be prepared for the tiny "lobby" and you will be fine - very much like Paris Hotels. The room decor was perfect! Even my standard room had a well-equipped kitchenette including cook-top and microwave.  The Keurig coffeemaker came with a cupboard full of coffee and tea varieties with real cream in the fridge!  Everything about the room and bathroom showed attention to the details of comfort and both were immaculate..  WiFi was excellent.  The continental breakfast offered a nice selection. It was Indian summer weather in the city so the roof of the bar was open into the night but I must admit it didn't bother me personally. Slept like a baby.  The location was great for everything I wanted to do and even walked to Lincoln Center for ballet. Loaded with restaurants and steps to the theaters.  Thank you to all the staff and Colin.

title: Oasis in midtown!
text: The French Quarters is unlike any other place I've stayed in NYC. It's right in the heart of it all in midtown, but when you get off the busy street it's like a home away from home! I've stayed twice, and both times my expectations were exceeded. The rooms are well appointed and sophisticated, but it still has a cozy charm that takes your mind off of the hustle happening right outside. The complimentary breakfast in the quiet atrium is an amazing treat and the staff could not be friendlier or more accommodating. I can't wait to go back and visit!

title: Очень уютный отель
text:
Нам очень понравился этот отель. Удачное расположение, все рядом. Много недорогих ресторанов в пешей доступности, мы заказывали себе супчик из китайского ресторана на первом этаже. 
В номере было все, что нужно для проживания (мыльные принадлежности, чайник, кофеварка, утюг и много еще всего). 
У нас был номер на последнем этаже отеля с террасой, вид просто изумительный. Наша подруга жила на первом этаже и номер у нее был очень шумный, это надо учитывать.

title: Pampered
text: This is a perfect small hotel to use if you are in New York to go to theater as it is in the theater district.  The block it's on is full of restaurants and clubs, and theaters are within two or three blocks.  My room was above the bar next door, so it could have been noisy, which is why I got a really good price, but the Friday night I stayed there, the only noise was from the street, and the very comfortable be had an abundance of pillows to bury one's head in.  No problem. The bathroom is a nice size with large shower and Occitane amenities. The decor is quite attractive, and there is a Keurig coffee machine and pods.  Even a small kitchenette area.  The free continental breakfast is served on the mezzanine above the Bourbon Street bar,  with cereal, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, pastries, fruit.  The small staff couldn't have been nicer.

title: Lovely small hotel in theatre district
text:
We stayed here as part of a group travelling to NYC for the marathon. The hotel is great - the rooms a good size for the area, the staff are amazingly friendly and the location is great - loads of attractions within walking distance and easy distance to a subway.

The only negatives would be the breakfast is a bit sparse and noise from the bar below on the Friday night. The noise didn't stop all night long - it drove us crazy! The breakfast perfectly adequate but for the price of the room, I'd expect slightly better than stale croissants.

title: Great place for a week in New York
text: My family of 5 adults stays here for a week in October and it was fantastic. Probs the cleanest rooms I have ever stayed in. Well done guys. We stayed on the 5th floor in a two bed apartment, with our own balcony overlooking W46th street a real bonus after a long day to sit out and get some fresh air.  Breakfast included was good and plentiful. Staff very helpful and friendly. Bar is fun, and we couldn't even hear it from our room.  Location just fantastic, close to many attractions and transport. Well worth a stay here.

title: Hotel agradável!!!
text:
Estive por 8 dias nesse hotel,sua localização é exelente,muito limpo e simpático.O quarto é um pouco pequeno,mas nada que atrapalhe a sua estada nessa cidade maravilhosa que é NY!!!!
Artigos de banheiro da L'occitane.

title: Loved it !
text: Great location stayed for two nights on the second floor in a Double Double room facing the street. The room was clean and lovely. I love that the Bar was attached to our rooms. After a long day and night out we finished of at the Bar. Our room was very quite no noises from the street or the Bar. The Bar closes at 4 am. Breakfast was fine. I absolutely loved our stay.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text:
Spent 1 night here on a whistle stop tour of NYC.
Choose this place based on Trip Advisor reviews which can be hit or miss... this was a HIT!
The staff were very welcoming and friendly. We got a standard room which was spotless and bigger than we thought,, very impressed. The manager personally came around during breakfast to ensure everyone was enjoying their stay.. a valued touch which you don't see in most chain hotels anymore.
With exception of small lobby/checkin area,, this was perfect for us. 
We will be back.

title: Einfach genial!
text: Ein charmantes Hotel unweit vom Times Square, liebevoll eingerichtete Zimmer mit Kochnische und Kaffeemaschine (Kapseln für Kaffee, Tee und Kakao), im Kühlschrank warten eine Flasche Wasser und eine Art Zaubertrank gegen den Kater nach einer durchzechten Nacht. Das Badezimmer war unser persönliches Highlight, nicht wie in vielen anderen Plastik, sondern richtige Fliesen, Ein großes Lob auch an das zuvorkommende und hilfsbereite Personal. Morgens  bekommt an ein Info-Blatt mit Wetteraussichten und Sightseeing Tipps unter der Tür durchgeschoben, außerdem wartet eine Zeitung vor der Tür. Das inkludierte Frühstück haben wir  leider verschlafen. Einziger Kritikpunkt: die laute Musik bis 4 Uhr morgens, darauf wurden wir aber auch bei Buchung ausdrücklich hingewiesen. Wir werden definitiv wiederkommen.

title: Great spot
text:
Stayed here last February and the place is great. Handy location, lovely rooms and the bar attached is great fun. All the staff were so pleasant and helpful. 
Will defo stay here on our next trip over.

title: Surpreendeu
text:
Hotel muito bom, localização excelente, perto da Times. Apesar do quarto que fiquei ser em cima do bar, não ouvi absolutamente nada.
Artigos do banheiro da marca l'occitane, recepção muita atenciosa.
Adorei ficar lá e na próxima sem duvida vou ficar lá.
Preço x localização perfeitos.

title: enchantés!
text:
Nous avons été ravis de notre séjour au French quarter, personnel au petit soin, chambres décorées avec goût, nous avons été surclassés!
Tout était parfait, et surtout nous avons apprécié le détail, le personnel ne nous demande pas deux fois notre nom, ni notre programme et personnalise son accueil à chaque entrevue.

Rien à redire, tout simplement super!

title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else
text: This is our 4th year in a row staying at the French Quarter.  The quality remains as high as the first time we stayed here.  Collin, John and Monica are always willing to make recommendations and answer questions.  We have stayed in a variety of rooms both in the hotel and in the tower...all are quaint & clean with fluffy towels and super comfortable beds.  A lot of friends and family have stayed here and we all love it!

title: Great place to stay in the heart of Times Square
text:
Would not hesitate to stay here again, good communication before our stay, when we arrived (which was quite late) we were met by friendly and helpful reception staff. Our room was full of character (after all we were staying in a brownstone!!) we were hungry and so used the restaurant next door - which provided room service (after the hours they had advertised) food was delicious and plentiful.
Breakfast was all you could need and again the staff were very friendly and helpful.
If i was particularly picky - we where in the townhouse on the third floor with no lifts - not a problem to us but maybe for others, also not particularly generous with the supplied toiletries.
All in all a great place to stay, great location - near to Intrepid, Hells Kitchen and Times Square would defiantly recommend and book again.

title: Idea llocation
text:
In the heart of NYC along Restaurant row 5 mins from Times Square,the location could'nt be better.The rooms are a good size and well equipped. The Bar and Restaurant on the Ground Floor are handy and very reasonable during 'Happy Hour'. The staff are excellent, efficient and friendly. 

Don't want to be negative however the Breakfast room and Breakfast  itself could be improved and it would be remiss not to mention the noise from the bar on Friday nights as it was excessive and lasted well into the early hours.

PS We stayed on the 1st Floor...

title: volto a me hospedar sempre que for a nova york
text: bem localizado (ao lado da times square) sem ser barulhento, café da manhã muito bom para o padrão estados unidos, quarto de tamanho razoável, limpeza satisfatória, cortesia incomparavel do stafff e por fim um conjunto de pequenas gentilezas que fazem toda diferença para o hóspede se sentir confortável e amparado. recomendo!!!

title: There's A Secret I don't Want U to Know Prt. 2
text: The review is a little late but well worth doing.  We traveled with our family and in laws in July and we were pleased with our stay.  We were welcomed by the staff and they accommodated our big party.  The bathrooms were clean and the bar down stairs was actually great as we did not have to travel far to unwind after a long fun filled day visiting the local attractions.  We enjoy the staff and there hospitality and after a long trip from South Texas was pleased with our overall experience again.  This is definitively the best place to stay in my opinion when visiting NY.

title: Helped make our trip to New York memorable
text:
We booked our 3 week trip to the US through a travel agent and I asked her to include The French Quarters in our accommodation options after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor.
We spent 7 nights here in August and we both agreed this was the best of the accommodation of all the 4 places we stayed on our trip.  (It probably helps that we loved everything about our visit to NYC!)
We had big a room overlooking West 46th Street on the 1st/2nd floor? in the separate apartment building part.  Yes, there was a set of narrow stairs to negotiate with bags but luckily John? (lovely Irishman on reception when we checked in and out) helped my husband with our bags.  We also appreciated his recommendation for the Hop on/Hop off tour provider as this backed up our decision to use the same company as we had in San Fran (Big Bus)
Starting with the location - it is super handy to restaurants, theatres, Times Square, Intrepid Sea and Air Museum and subways.
Loved the daily newsletter that appeared under the door early each morning, the L'Occitane products in the bathroom, and the daily breakfast (reasonably basic, but I was especially grateful for the hard boiled eggs and my husband loved the yoghurts). 
We had a couple of quiet nights here and a couple of very noisy ones, which we were kind of expecting with it being NYC.  The street was generally pretty quiet, the worse night was when one of the restaurants across the road had what sounded like a Karaoke competition going on.  Totally out of the French Quarters control, and luckily I had earplugs from our San Fran hotel to use!
To be honest, we spent very little time in our room since we were out exploring beyond midnight most evenings, but it was always lovely to come back to the apartment and the whole complex has a lovely boutique-y feel about it.
If we could, we would go back to New York and stay at the French Quarters again in a heartbeat.  Such a beautiful city.
Oh and to cap it all off, we booked a town car for our early morning flight to LA via Reception and a stretch limo turned up...we spent the whole trip to the airport laughing our heads off at the back of the limo in the traffic because we couldn't quite believe it!

title: A little gem in New York City
text: A small establishment but a block and a half from Times Square, in the midst of the theatre district, with an associated restaurant and surrounded by many others which is clean, friendly and helpful is a gem indeed.

title: Girls Trip to New York
text: My best friends from New Orleans met in New York for a 5 day girls trip. We rented the 2 bedroom apartment. What could be better. They had a bottle of champagne ready and chilled on arrival. We opened and sat out on our balcony over looking the city and got caught up with since we hadn't seen each other in a year. What a way to start our adventure. Great location. We walked to the theater to see A Gentleman's Guide to Love and Murder (great play, very funny). Staff  were very helpful, the bar was so much fun. They had When the Saints played they had the  game on so we partied with other Saints fans. We shopped of course. Since it was my birthday the girls took me to dinner at Beauty and Essex-what a cool place. You walk into a pawn shop and they open a back door and you enter a high end restaurant. What a great place, champagne in the bathroom.. This hotel is a great place to stay. Plenty or room, comfy beds after going all day. Becos's across the street is a great Italian restaurant. Short walk to time square. Great location.

title: Best hotel with amazing Location
text: This was our 8th time too Manhattan and we have never had a hotel/apartment like this, the location first of all is second too none, far enough away from Times Square that it's quiet, yet in the middle of Hell's Kitchen with food at every corner and then some... The hotel room itself if amazing so spacious and with plenty of room for even our 6 suitcases, beds are comfortable bathroom is small but adequate as all bathrooms in NYC are small, the maid was fantastic and we loved everything about this place, cannot wait too stay again

title: Fabulous French Quarters.
text: We loved this hotel. It's quaint and pretty and the location is superb. Times Square at the end of the street. All the restaurants you could possibly want or need in the same street.  The staff at this establishment were extremely helpful and lovely (especially Monica on the reception desk). I dropped my bags off at 9am to go off sightseeing and was given a map and directions to help get my bearings with helpful hints. (Amy's Bakery around the corner really did have a great choice of yummy goodies and good coffee). The room was beautiful (103). Huge comfortable bed, great coffee machine (with pod selection) and free soft drinks in the fridge. Breakfast was great, cereals,Bagels, muffins, bread and croissants. Juices, coffee and tea and lovely staff. We had an early departing flight (leaving the hotel at 0430) so asked Monica to book us a cab, what a lovely surprise to find a limo waiting on the kirb for our journey ($70 to JFK).  The view from our window at night was beautiful, looking up to the New York sky line. I would not hesitate to book and stay at this lovely hotel, such a pleasant change from the usual NYC larger impersonal hotels. We loved it!

title: また泊まりたい
text:
水回りの清潔さを重視して、トリップアドバイザーを参考に決めたホテルです。
女１人旅で初めてのNYだったのですが、カナダ トロントからバスで入り地下鉄で向かいました。

最寄りの地下鉄駅はエレベーターがなく、キャリーケースを引きずっての階段は苦労しました。
立地はブロードウェイの少し外れのレストラン街で、夜10時頃ミュージカル帰りも他のお客さんに混ざって歩いたので、怖くありませんでした。
少し人通りの少ない道に入るので、暗いなとは感じましたが、客層もアッパーな高そうなレストランが並んでいたので平気でした。近くには比較的大きな通りがありますが、小道に入ってる分 騒音に悩まされることもなく夜もぐっすり眠れました。
少し歩けばシェイクシャックのハンバーガー等、美味しく手頃なお店もあります。
ホテルはロビーという空間はなく、小さなフロントだけでした。お部屋の内装はため息が出るほど素敵で、心配していた水回りもとても清潔でした。毎日清掃も入ってくれて、メトロパスでマンハッタン中を動き回った後の休憩時には綺麗に清掃された部屋でくつろぐことができました。決して広くはないですが、女一人だと窮屈には感じなかったですし、キャリーケースも全開できるスペースはありました。
また、朝食もパンやカップ入りヨーグルト、果物などの軽食ではありますが美味しかったです。エネルギーを蓄えてから出掛けられたので、朝食付きホテルを選んで正解だったなと思います。

大型ホテルのような豪華なきらびやかさや賑やかさはありませんが、コスパの高い落ち着いたブティックホテルで満足しました！
他のホテルも試しに泊まってから、また戻ってきたいホテルです。

title: Just perfect!
text: Enjoyed our stay at the FQ hotel.  Staff were friendly, helpful & professional.  Room, although small, had everything possible available, including a refridgerator (stocked with a few complimentary beverages) & even a cooktop. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in!  Our room overlooking the courtyard (midweek) was very quiet.  Proximity to Times Square & the Metro. was a huge plus.  Continental breakfast was great & served up in a lovely venue. I would def.stay here again!

title: I'll never stay anywhere else!
text: My mother and I stayed here for two nights at the end of September. When we arrived, we immediately loved the location and the curb appeal of this adorable apartment-style hotel.  I was a little nervous about not staying in a well known establishment, but The French Quarters was better than I could've ever imagined. We stayed on the 1st floor facing W. 46th and loved our king room!It was clean, comfortable and cozy.  The TV had a DVD player built in (though we never had time to use it), and there was a kitchenette with a small fridge with some complimentary beverages. We loved having a Keurig with plenty of cream and sugar too. Our room was above the bar, so it did get a little noisy. It didn't bother us too much,  but if you're a light sleeper, I would avoid a room above the bar. We ate at the hotel restaurant,  Bourbon Street Bar and Grille and the food and service were fantastic! We loved sitting on the 2nd floor balcony facing the street. We also enjoyed the complimentary breakfast on the mezzanine. Bagels,  croissants, toast, fruit,  cereal, yogurt, juice and coffee. We loved everything about this place.  My mother and I both  agreed,  when we come back to NYC,  we will be staying here again! And we will be telling our friends about it too!

title: Out of this world service, convenient location, and great accommodation
text: I stayed here (sep 2014) and I was extremely happy with my stay. The place is nestled conveniently in restaurant row and is books away from Times Square, broadway, Central Park, and the high line. The place was very clean and new. They offered a Keurig in the room along with a nice continental breakfast in their downstairs restaurant which was beautiful! The room was slightly small but efficient but perfect for what we needed. No wasted space, but not crowded. The service was out of this world!!!! They let us check out late so we could run through Central Park, they suggested the high line to as a way to walk to soho, and gave us a complimentary mug because we liked it so much and offered to buy it! And it wad all for a reasonable rate! I rarely write reviews, but I was so impressed that I had to pass it along! I hope this place stays as great and as fairly priced as we found it!

title: Definitely will stay again
text:
I'm ashamed to admit that I was a little nervous that the hotel did not exist because no one had heard of it, but rest assured, it is real! It is literally a block west of the theater district and a block and a half from Times Square. The street has a lot of restaurants and bars for the crowd attending the theater. if you continue heading west to 9th, you find many more restaurants(The restaurant attached to the hotel, Bourbon Street Bar & Grille, is good). 
I stayed Sunday through Wednesday this week on the 1st floor in the front. The moment I arrived, I felt at ease.The room was charming (the name says all you need to know about the style). It included a little kitchen with complimentary bottled water, EON, and Keurig cups. The room also comes with an iron and board, umbrella, blow dryer and L'occitane products. The bed was comfy. There was some street noise but it did not disturb me. Reliable internet service.  
The staff was friendly and took good care of us. They even arranged a driver for our trip out to JFK. A continental breakfast was included.One of the best things was that everyday a flyer magically appeared under the door with events for the day in the neighborhood and city. In the lobby they have a book of 50 walks you can take in the city.

title: Great Hotel, Perfect Location
text: A great wee hotel with very friendly and professional staff. Cant fault. We had a double double room and it was lovely. Only 5 min walk to time sq and lots bars and restaurants on same street as hotel.

title: Hidden gem just off Times Square, to make your trip even more memorable!
text:
Charming boutique style hotel a few blocks away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.
Fantastic location within walking distance to all main attractions in NYC.
Would thoroughly recommend this hotel to stay to make your trip even more special and something to remember - if you like something a bit different, chic, and individual then this is the perfect place away from your typical skyscrapers.
We stayed for 4 nights over Christmas and the hotel was decorated beautifully to get you in the festive mood. Very comfortable and clean bedrooms, beautifully decorated to match the French style of the hotel. Wonderful buffet breakfast to get you started for the day.
Very helpful staff on reception who were more than happy to give tips and advise of places to visit and things to do.
The hotel is attached to a bar which offers quick and easy food and great cocktails.

title: Cosy and elegant place in the heart of NYC
text: We have stayed 2 nights at double bedroom suite, no 501, which has a terrace, sunny before noon. The apartment has a coffee maker so we could enjoy morning coffee in the September sun. There are plenty restaurants outside and the location is perfect if you want to go to Broadway show. Walking distance to majority of theatres. The breakfast is OK but rather simple.

title: Great location and service.
text:
This hotel was an amazing find.

The room was beautiful, clean, and very comfortable.  I only missed having a reading lamp.

I loved the location because we could walk to the theater, Times Square, excellent restaurants, public transportation....

The manager was very friendly and sincerely seemed to care about what was going on, and how the guests were doing. He was very kind, even after we had checked out of the hotel!  
A week later, after our cruise had ended, I called to ask if we could leave our luggage there for the day, since our plane left at night and we wanted to tour the city for a few hours.  He was more than happy to help us, and that made a big difference in our day.

This would be a place easy to recommend.  Great location, and wonderful service.

title: Absolutely loved it!!
text: Absolutely loved our stay here. The location 5 minutes from Times Square.  Superb access to local restuarants and bars.  The room was spotlessly clean and comfortable.  Softest towels ever.  We were made feel welcome before we entered the building.  Colin the manager and Niall at the desk looked after us throughout our stay.  We can't thank them enough.  Highly recommend staying here.  Loved it!!

title: I would stay again
text:
This was a really Good location and I would stay again.
there was no lift and our room was at the top of a few flights of step windy stairs which after walking around New York all day was never welcomed. On our first night after walking up the stairs I asked if there was a fire escape to which I was told no, which was wrong information I found out the next day but slightly worrying at the time. The room was nicely decorated and kept clean.
Breakfast was very basic, a lovely young man served up breakfast each day.
I wouldn't say any of the receptionists were overly friendly.
We asked for a quiet room which is why we got the top of the building and it was still extremely noisy

title: Paradise in New York City
text: I just loved this hotel! Gorgeous, great location, friendly staff, superbly comfortable bedding, lovely L'Occitane products, reliable fast wi-fi, comfortable air-conditioning, nice breakfast. I would love to stay here again. Highly recommend. Room was small but had space for everything. It felt like a place of peace in the busy city.

title: Een aangenaam hotel midden in Manhattan
text:
Ruime mooie kamers. Stijl is van de oude koloniale Franse stijl. Faciliteiten waren er voldoende: koelkast, airco, koffiemachine met verschillende keuzes en ook choco. Er was een minpuntje. We lagen net boven de bar, dus als je een lichte slaper bent, kun je beter oordoppen indoen. 
Het ontbijt kon je niets negatief over zeggen, maar ik had ietsje meer kwaliteit verwacht. Het Amerikaans industrieel brood is echt niet lekker, maar dat is natuurlijk persoonlijk.

title: Hidden Gem Right Outside of Times Square
text:
We stayed here through previous recommendations via Trip Advisor. This will be a go-to for future NYC trips to come. Highlights below:

Room:
- Nice comfy bed, fluffy pillows, and french decor.
-The room was just as described- cozy, warm, comfortable, and had nice quality touches (e.g. L'Occitane soap and hair products, Keurig coffee pods).
-We ended up booking the room above the bar, as it was half the cost, and we knew we would be out most of the night so the concern about the noise level at night didn't deter us from booking.
-The website and reviews were implicit about booking that particular room and the bar music/noise, so there were no surprises there. I appreciated the detail the hotel took in making sure we were 100% aware of this prior to booking. 
- Clean and loved having the street facing room so we could people watch as well.

Staff:
- Friendly, kind, and polite staff. We noticed there was not one moment where someone was not sitting at the front desk or didn't answer the phone.
- First night we were there, we got back late and asked for a recommendation for pizza delivery. Front desk guy called the number for us and even came to get us in the adjoining when it arrived. Pizza was killer BTW... great recommendation!
- Staff always said hello and greeted us with a smile when we came in and out. 

Overall, wonderful experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a boutique hotel off Times Square.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Great choice. excellent location. we are a family of five and the 2bedroomed apartment was perfect. Fantastic views from the 5thfloor balcony, quiet at night, comfy beds +++. The coffee maker and breakfast was a bonus. Great if you would normally need 2 bedrooms in a hotel. book it!

title: Un ottimo hotel in una location perfetta!
text: Se avete intenzione di soggiornare a new york assolutamente vi consigliamo questa struttura. Walking distance (2 minuti) da ti.es square, un sacco di ottimi ristoranti raggiungibili a piedi. Camere belle, ampie e pulite, cosa chiedere di più? Good job!!!

title: Lindo Quarto!
text: Nosso quarto (triplo) ficava no terceiro andar de um prédio antigo, típico nova-iorquino, entretanto,  no sobrado anexo. O quarto é muito bem decorado, amplo, confortável e silencioso. O banheiro é grande e muito bom, com excelentes artigos de higiene. O local é muito movimentado, com comércio, restaurantes, teatros. A recepção foi boa, familiar. O café da manhã é do tipo americano, portanto, fraco, com tudo embalado, artificial. Faltaram frutas e o ovo cozido era gelado. Há uma boa máquina de café e chocolate no quarto. Para quem tem problemas de mobilidade, é bom solicitar um quarto no primeiro andar, pois não há elevador no anexo.

title: Lovely room
text:
This place is in a great location for theatres and restaurants, couldn't be better. We were in the apartment building next to the main property. The room was quite delightful in terms of decor and I really liked it. The bed was huge and comfortable, with soft fresh linen. We could see the lights of Times Square from the window. We had no issues with noise. The air con worked well. The bathroom was spotless. 

There were a few minor issues. Cleaning of the rooms did not happen until very late. We stayed for five nights and it was always 3pm before the room was done. One day it was gone 4pm. In fairness we told the manager, a friendly Irish guy, and he apologised and stood us a drink in the bar next door while we waited. If you like a nap before hitting the nightspots, this may not be for you. I'm a bit of a tidy freak so the open rail and no drawers didn't work for me. The iron was good but no place to put the table top board without the cord crossing the bathroom door - dangerous.

Breakfast, well it is a bit of an afterthought when it could be a really great selling point for small outlay (a commercial toaster, tongs for the bread, presentation platters). 

Having said all that, have to say it was a lovely property, perfect for our needs and we would recommend it to others.

title: Très bon établissement
text:
Nous sommes 5 et avons eu un suite au dernier étage, avec 2 chambres et un canapé lit (n°502)
Rien à dire sur la taille des chambres et de la salle de bain.La literie est très confortable,ce qui est appréciable après une journée de visite à New York! Le petit déjeuner est simple mais très correct et effectivement pas de salé,mais cela ne m'a pas dérangé.
Cet hôtel est très bien situé,proche de Time Square,dans une rue pleine de restaurants et à proximité de tous les théâtres.
Petit plus sympathique:vous trouvez tous les matins devant votre porte une feuille d'infos sur New York(météo et ce qui est à faire ou à voir) et le journal du jour.

title: Great stay!
text:
We came in to Manhattan for a wedding and wanted to be close to the reception place so we picked this hotel. We were so glad we did! The rooms were a great size for a NYC hotel (given price and location) and everything was very clean. The facilities are modern and the staff are very helpful! They have a free breakfast here which was great. The bar/restaurant attached seemed to have great food (we didn't eat here but it looked good) and it was busy until late so a great nightlife atmosphere too! The outside patio bar was awesome and the bartender was really nice.
I will stay here every time I am in New York! Highly recommended!

title: Nice location
text: We both enjoyed staying here. We weren't as impressed with the restaurant/bar connected to it. They were friendly and the room we were in included a stove, but no pot or pans or microwave. The bathroom was luxurious, but I could have used a place to soak my feet after walking all day.

title: Feb 2013 Engagement Stay
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights on our first visit to New York in February last year.  We had an absolutely fantastic time and were even upgraded to a king room when I mentioned I would be proposing during our stay.

The rooms are one of the best we have ever had on a holiday, definitely the best bathrooms.  The hotel recommended a great steakhouse during our stay and even paid for our deserts.

Would stay here again when we next come over.

title: Perfect location!
text:
Nous avons passé 4 nuits dans ce petit hotel. Le personnel est très sympathique, la chambre plutôt grande pour New-York et la situatio est idéale! A 2 pas de Time Square 15-20min de Central Park, au coeur d'un très bon quartier (Hell's kitchen) où bar et resto se côtoient.
Si vous êtes sensibles au bruit, pensez aux boules Quiès:-) mais ça ne nous a pas empêcher de dormir !

title: Almost faultless
text:
That's right, almost,no draws in the room, might seem like no big deal, but we had been travelling for over three weeks, we had two normal size suitcase's and two carry on.would have been nice to be able to unpack.silly because the room is massive ,and plenty of room to put in a set of draws.the breakfast is continental with no meat and very sad and untidy.would not take much to improve on this.
Everything else is amazing, the decor,the location,unlimited choice of restaurants within minutes, great comedy club very close(ha comedy club) .so good we would not hesitate to stay again , just a pity about the, no draws thing.

title: Cannot be faulted
text: From check in to check out we were well catered for.  Colin the manager made himself known to all guests which gave a personal touch to our stay.  The bar is amazing, the staff were happy share advice and experience. The rooms were beautiful and had character. If you are looking for a personal touch with access to local dining, public transport and a home a home away from home, this is the place to stay!

title: Will definitely stay here again!
text: Great hotel - amazing location, comfortable, clean, affordable.  Everything you want and need, plus extremely friendly and helpful service.  Top notch.  I've stayed many places in the city that were much more expensive, and this one lacked nothing, in my opinion.  Definitely recommend.

title: 5-Star Stay!
text: Very Clean, comfortable and quiet! Couldn't believe we were in midtown! Rooms are so beautiful and tastefully decorated. Small fridqe with complimentary bottled water, citrus beverages and coffee maker with plenty of individual k-cups including teas, hot cider and hot cocoa! Plenty of plush towels. Lovely french guest soaps too! Walked to theater for our show. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, but have a meal next door at Bourbon Street! Close to plenty of shopping too. Wonderful continental breakfast on the patio area of Bourbon Street. Staff were all so helpful and accommodating. They stored our bags the day we checked out so we didn't have to lug them around all day! If you are coming to NYC and want to experience a wonderful boutique hotel close  to everything, stay here! You won't believe you are in the middle of NYC. Best night of sleep I ever had at a hotel!

title: Location
text: This property is awesome. Very clean, although it's an old building. Staff are very nice,  and it's walking distance to the major sites, and many restaurants near by. Nightly rates, not too bad. My husband and I will stay there again when we go back to New York....

title: Perfect hotel
text: The rooms were small, but very nice and clean. Air-conditioning was fresh and worked perfectly. The street was quiet considering the location.The location could not have been better. Breakfast could have had moore variation. Staff very friendly.

title: Simples e aconchegante
text:
Com um lobby muito discreto, estreito e pequeno numa rua agradável, arborizada e com opções de restaurantes e pessoas circulando até altas horas da noite. Me encantei por esse hotel principalmente pelo atendimento, limpeza e café da manhã muito bom para o padrão americano.
Ponto alto, o quarto, com wi-fi  e uma garrafa de água Evian grátis e café, além de produtos Loccittane no banho,  jornal e um impresso com informes de tempo e atrações diárias! Deixa a desejar apenas o fato de não ter estação de metrô muito perto, anda-se um pouquinho! Ficaria sempre que retornar a NY.

title: Close Enough and Far Enough From Times Square
text:
PROS: This is a nice place to stay. It has a B&B feel to it but the rooms are definitely “hotel” with kitchenettes. Hotel rooms in New York can be tight on space, we had a king room, decent size. They have a great continental breakfast which is included. Very friendly staff.  Located between 8th & 9th on 46th this is the perfect place to stay if you want to be near Times Square but don’t want to hear Times Square. Choice restaurants and shopping right out the door. Theaters near by. Great location. 

CONS: New York can be loud. We had a room facing the street, which wasn’t too bad. However, we were on the first floor which is above the hotel bar. It wasn’t an issue until the last night. Bass thumping from the floor. If that had happened on the first night we would have definitely switched rooms. If you want to avoid street and bar noise see if you can get a room on 2 or above and in the rear. 

More Pros than cons with this place. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Location Location Location
text: I stayed at this hotel recently with my son. This hotel is small/boutique style - just the way I like it. Our room was large (its worth paying a little bit more to upgrade to the room with 2 double beds as its a lot bigger than the standard double room). I found the location in Hells Kitchen/Midtown area very central to most things (Times Square was  a short walk).  Rooms were clean, comfortable and well appointed with a European feel about them.  The breakfast was a bit of a let down, they could improve in this regard.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  Overall, definitely recommend staying at French Quarter Apartments.  The room rates were very reasonable for a 4 star in NYC as well.

title: O.K.
text:
Positives: This is in a great location. The manager, who was irish was lovely, very welcoming. We were upgraded without request. 

We stayed in room 207, which was of nice decor and clean. The L'Occitane products on arrival were a nice surprise.. but they didn't get topped up which was a shame. 

We arrived on a saturday and the noise outside was unbearable hardly slept at all. When I made a comment the next day to the concierge the man was quite abrupt and snapped rudely that it was a saturday night.. helpful!

Breakfast was very disappointing.. it was just a cold small selection. A kettle in the room would have been good to make tea. 

The cleaners came very late.. which was annoying because after a day sightseeing it would have been nice to come back to room made up at 3/4pm.

I think you are paying for the location.. it's not cheap..

title: Great find in the heart of NYC
text: We stayed here for 5 nights in June and we were really impressed with the place. I had read that the rooms were small, but being New York I didn't expect any different.  When I was making my booking I mentioned that my husband is tall and if they could accommodate us in a bigger room we would appreciate it.  The welcome from Colin at the front desk was excellent.   He introduced himself, shook our hands and asked us about our trip and where we were from etc. He assured us of their full attention during our stay, which was a lovely welcome. Colin then told us that we'd been upgraded to a superior room, which was the icing on the cake.  When we saw the room we were thrilled.  It was gorgeous.  We've been to New Orleans and the room with balcony brought us back to heady nights in Bourbon Street. The bed was so comfortable, the shower room was immaculate with L'Occitane toiletries and snow white fluffy towels and plenty of them.  We really couldn't have asked for more. The breakfast was perfect, a lovely selection of cereal, fresh fruit, croissants, scones, bread, preserves, yoghurt etc, served in the lovely mezzanine floor above the bar.  The bar itself, attached to the suites, was fantastic also.  We ate here just once but the Creole Fish stew was delicious.  And finally, the location.  Well, if you want great restaurants, Jazz/Blues clubs/Bars, and a short walk to Times square then this is the place for you. You are in the middle of Hells Kitchen so if you are looking for a tranquil retreat then go further out of town.  We were with 6 friends from Denmark who were staying at a large chain hotel close by but when they came and saw where we were they we so jealous.  Loved this place and would definitely stay again if and when we take another bite of the Big Apple.

title: Fantastic service, staff and accommodation!
text: We had planned a special trip to NYC for our 40th birthdays and my sons 21st!! The staff made our stay a trip to remember. Always ready to recommend places to eat and help with bookings. We could not have asked for more from a hotel. Would definately recommend. Thank you to all the staff in hotel and bar.

title: Perfect place for a NYC visit
text: Trying to find a place able to accommodate a family group of 5 is challenging. Based on a Trip Advisor review I contacted them and got a prompt and very helpful reply.  Two bedroom suite with a private balcony on restaurant row and two blocks from most broadway shows. Collin and the staff were exceptional.  Most definitely will stay again.

title: I love this hotel
text:
My sister and I stayed here for 10 days in April 
We had the warmest cleanest nicest room!
The facilities were great the beds were soooo comfortable 
Breakfast was good continental and the location fabulous to get to anywhere
The bar down stairs the bourbon st grill had the loveliest bar staff Keith and Simon and two others who were also Irish and great Craic.
The staff in the hotel were helpful and fun we adored it here and wouldn't hesitate ever coming back or recommending it!
Very happy  thanks :)

title: We will be back!!
text:
This is truly a gem in an awesome location. Only a few blocks from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Located on Restaurant Row, so you are spoiled for choice when it comes to food options - some are great and some are not so good.
Staff here are friendly and inviting and made our 2 week stay here very enjoyable. We had a front room, and was a little noisy, but hey this is New York after all.
We will be back.

title: Loved this place
