text: Stayed here for 3 nights. Great place - not the usual same old boring hotel room - small but that's expected in NY. Great location - plenty of restaurants in area and bars but had no problem with noise which is important for me as I am a light sleeper!. Just a short walk to Times Square and lots to do. The Host was friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

title: Friendly, comfortable hotel
text: Really good location, happy friendly staff and comfortable rooms make this an ideal base. Do be careful about which room you select - the rooms over the bar are cheaper but as the hotel warns, they are noisy. Or just join the crowd downstairs!

title: Super Stay in Manhattan
text: I shared an 2 bedroom suite in the French Quarters with my husband and son over the Saint Patrick's week festivities.  Our accommodation was fantastic.  The bedrooms, small enough, but with huge beds, to-die-for bed linen, plenty of storage and a huge television in each bedroom.  In the living area, a huge pull out bed couch, other tables and chairs and another huge television.  A little kitchenette area, fridge, microwave and coffee-maker.  A fine sized bathroom as well.  Off the living room, we had a balcony - table and chairs out there too.  The view was fine - but at night with all the lights on the various buildings it was fantastic.  Each morning - a fact sheet was slipped under our door with the weather for the day, what to see in the neighbourhood, and what to do around the city.  Colin McCormack (General Manager) was very accommodating......

title: Bonne situation bon rapport qualité prix
text: Tout à été dit sur cet hôtel très bien situé Notre chambre No 301 est très petite (le lit pourtant pas très large pour 2 personnes) occupe pratiquement toute la largeur de la piece! Mais la salle de bains,équipée d'une douche est d'un volume satisfaisant. Nous y séjournons une semaine. Je confirme: pas de nourriture salée au petit déjeuner ( que bœufs durs....) .mais ç'est copieux et servi sur le comptoir du bar.....Amusant !. Personnel assez sympa . Notre chambre donne côté rue qui n'est pas aussi bruyante que çertains le disent....Enfin, nous n'entendons pas de bruits particuliers dus à la " boite de nuit"......!!! Le prix pour 7 nuits est quand même un peu élevé compte tenu de la promiscuité de la chambre : 2516$....

title: Great Oasis!
text: My wife and I just got back from our thoroughly enjoyable stay at The French Quarter. The room was quaint and romantic and as my wife said "completely clean and spotless." Staff was very friendly and helpful and ready to attend to our every need. The decor, artwork and furnishings really made us feel like we were in New Orleans right down to the ornate wrought iron railings. Our room was very quiet with a minimal amount of noise. Truly a romantic oasis in the heart of the city, my compliments to the owners and staff. They've done a great job creating and maintaining this wonderful getaway! I wholeheartedly recommend it!

title: Amazing stay in NYC
text:
I stayed 2 nights in this cosy and stylish apartment during a short stay in NYC
My overall experience was good . I must admit that room was a little bit small
Nevertheless everything was fine a fournished of a small Kitchen refrigerator and all you may need to cook something to eat in the privacy of your accomodation . Bathroom clean and provided with a huge shower . The manager of the hotel whom I can't remember the name has been super Kind
Unfortunately I had to delete my reservation for 2 additional stay in NYC because of change of schedule of my flight from LA
Would stay again there
Diego

title: Little Gem in NYC
text: My boyfriend and I spent nearly a week at the French quarters from 11th of May and we were very impressed with the hotel and the staff.our room was spacious, the bed was like a cloud and the bathroom nicely done out with a great shower.the manager came down to breakfast every morning to great the guests which was a nice touch.location was fantastic also, so close to everything.we would highly recommend a stay here if you want quality, comfort and a personal touch! My only one gripe and this is a small one was that they only provided complimentary water in the room on the 1st night but not the rest of the week, would be nice if they did it everyday.

title: Great location, good hotel!
text: The location is fantastic! The hotel has some lovely aspects. The staff are lovely, breakfast was good and the room was very clean. The only disappointment was the size of the room. I felt very crammed in! Otherwise a great hotel!

title: Great spot in New York
text: We stayed here for 3 nights in a double double.  I originally had booked a king but changed it based on tripadvisor reviews of the room sizes.  Glad I did as the room was spacious.  Great plumbing!   Best hot shower. Great to have a keurig in room with half and half provided in the fridge.  Can't beat the location.  Overall a charming place with a great staff.  And the hotel's adjacent restaurant and bar is not to be missed.  The place was hopping every night.

title: Boa localização e atmosfera, quarto pequeno
text: Excelente localização para teatros e passeios, com muitos restaurantes nas proximidades. O hotel tem boa atmosfera, limpo, entretanto o quarto que foi designado era bem pequeno. Apesar do andar baixo e de frente para a rua, não havia barulho que atrapalhasse o sono (provavelmente o cansaço dos dias de passeios também contribuíram). Banheiro do quarto era bom e espaçoso. Café da manhã bem simples. Staff amistoso, lobby minúsculo. Retornaria somente se fosse para um quarto maior.

title: Enjoyed our stay..
text: The French Quarter has pleasant rooms with a fridge, sink, a coffee maker in the room. The bathroom was nice but the room is narrow. The best aspect of this hotel is the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff. The not good aspects are the very narrow corridor that constitutes the lobby. There is no room for a single chair to sit down. The television reception is poor and not much selection. I would recommend the French Quarter.

title: Super hôtel avec bon rapport qualité/prix
text:
Super accueil du personnel (jamais les mêmes en journée) à notre arrivée avec explications très claires des consignes, de ce qu'il y a à faire dans le quartier ou ailleurs chaque matin via une feuille glissée sous la porte.
Le petit déjeuner inclus est sous forme de buffet, avec pas mal de choix.
Très bien situé dans une rue du Theater District avec pas mal se restos dans la rue, on a pu faire tout  à pied (pas besoin de métro ni de bus)!
On le recommande vivement!

title: best stay in NYC ever!!
text: If Unfortunately I can't give the French Quarter a higher rating than 5 stars.  From the moment my friends and I arrived when we left we were treated with the most hospitality that any traveler could ask for. The staff went over and above to make sure we had everything we needed for our 3 day mini vacation.  The rooms were so comfortable, L'Occitane toiletries in the bathroom were a wonderful touch.  When someone plans a trip to NYC the hotel is usually chosen because of location and price.  The French Quarter offers both plus so much more.  Thank you to the manager Colin, Monica and John who made our trip such a pleasure.

title: Que demander de plus... ? moins de bruit
text:
L'emplacement est idéal (à deux pas de Times Square), les chambres sont superbes, le patron et son épouse sont affables et intéressants. Donc tout serait parfait sans le bruit qui est vraiment dérangeant la nuit (la rue est très agréablement animée de sympa restaurants) pour les chambres des étages 1 et 2 côté rue. 
Donc demandez bien une chambre côté cour et vous serez sous le charme.

title: Excellent base to explore NYC
text: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. The beds were wonderfully comfortable and the complimentary continental breakfasts ample. The manager was always around when we were having breaskfast and ready to offer help and advice. The location is great - 2 blocks away from Times Square and yet it was surprisingly quiet at night. It was a great place from which to see an amazing city.

title: On y est super bien
text: Très bel hébergement, super bien placé. Le personnel est très gentil, attentionné. La chambre queen size est très agréable, avec son mini bar, sa cafetière, théière. Et le plus, surtout à New York, le petit déjeuner est inclus et est délicieux et à volonté. New York, The French Quarters...je dis YES !!!

title: Great location, fantastic beds, great service
text: Absolutely loved this place - from the welcoming front desk to the fabulously comfortable beds to the great housekeeping to the fantastic location to the lovely breakfast to the fantastic Bourbon Street Bar next door - loved every minute. Manager of the Hotel is very hospitable and bar staff are great.  Can't recommend it highly enough.

title: Sehr schoenes kleines Hotel in Manhattan
text: Eine 1A Lage hat diese kleine Familienhotel (man kann viel zu Fuss machen) und die Zimmer plus Bad sind sehr gepflegt. Aber Achtung: wir hatten ein Zimmer im 1. Stock zum Hof mit den Ablueftungsanlagen von mehreren (!!!) Restaurants direkt vor den Fenstern. Das war sogar mit geschlossenen Fenstern sehr laut und der Essensgeruch drang ins Zimmer. Wir beschwerten uns und am naechsten Tag bekamen wir ein Zimmer im 3. Stock zur Strasse, welches wunderschoen war mit Erker und Blick auf NY!! Von da an haben wir uns sehr wohl gefuehlt. Das Fruehstueck ist nichts besonderes, aber ok. Personal sehr freundlich und hilfreich.

title: Birthday get away!
text:
This was a great place to stay, great location, very comfortable and amazingly friendly staff. 
highly recommend and the bar will stay open as long as you wish to keep drinking, thank you Billy :)

One recommendation we would give is the rooms need kettles not just a coffee machine. But we have a pan :)

thank you all for make this a fantastic stay.

title: Will do again!
text: Price was a little above my range but I figure I save taxi rides if the hotel is closer to the theater.  So we spent a little more and it was worth it.  We loved everything about it.  The room was very nice and clean, modern and had a working bathroom.  The bed comfortable.  Note the room is not to common American proportions so set expectations.  It was actually larger than a lot of NY hotels but not the typical Holiday Inn configuration.  The location is perfect for walking to theaters, restaurants and times square.  We walked everywhere.  The breakfast is really continental (no eggs or meat) which is ok as I would rather have decent breads and yogurts than bad eggs like most hotels.   The coffee was actually good.   There are plenty of restaurants in the area so your entire stay can happen within walking distance.  The staff was very nice.  I don't think there is a fitness center.  I did not use the internet but it is free.   Note the person checking in also escorts guests to the room so check in can be a wait.  We were ok with this but if you demand instant everything it will annoy.  We will return.

title: Great hotel, perfect location
text:
* very clean
* very friendly and professional staff
* Very nice rooms and excellent bath rooms
* bar below is great to relax after a day in the city
* 5 minute walk from Times Square
* Would recommend to family & friends

title: Lovely property and outstanding customer service
text: Just stayed here for a work trip and our whole team was pleased.  It's the perfect location for business or pleasure.  It's right in the middle of everything but on a quiet street with plenty of restaurants to choose from.  The rooms were very comfortable with quaint decor, and felt like a home away from home. The moment I arrived Colin (the general manager) was in the process of writing me a welcome note and knew my name immediately when I checked in.  I travel a lot and stay in nice properties for work, and can absolutely recommend this as a perfect stay for NYC!

title: The Best in NYC
text: There's only one in New York and it's this one. Less than a minute away from all Broadway shows, Times Square and Transportation. Bounded by Eight Ave which shoots up north towards Central Park, Columbus Circle and the upper west side. Also bounded by Ninth Ave which will send you south to Chelsea Meatpackers, West Village and Tribeca.  Just awesome! Our second time to this home away from home in Hells Kitchen which has all the restaurants you could dream of. The French Quarters has the best staff and I am going to give away a secret. If you tell them that you are friend on Facebook they will give you a discount. Don't bother with the large hotels and their bed bugs, book here and you'll never forget it. And please don't complain about noise, YOU ARE IN THE BIGGEST CITY IN THE WORLD!

title: A+ atención A+ limpieza A++++ ubicación
text:
Tuve el agrado de alojarme en este hotel con mi mujer en el mes de Marzo de 2014.
El hotel se encuentra a 1 cuadra de Broadway.
La habitación es muy linda a pesar de ser medio pequeña (al igual que la mayoria de las habitaciónes de NY).
Cuenta con máquina para preparar cafe (muy rico), heladera con agua mineral de cortesía y todos los elementos necesarios para pasar un buen momento.
La higiene del lugar es de primer nivel, y la atención del personal es de primer nivel, super dispuestos en todo momento.
El desayuno no era de los mejores que eh disfrutado, pero estaba bien.
Lugar super recomendable.

title: gemütliches kleines Hotel in bester Lage
text: Das Hotel hat nur wenige Stockwerke und sticht dadurch aus den vielen riesigen Hotels angenehm hervor. Hier kennt man noch jeden einzelnen Gast und dementsprechend ist der Empfang sowie das Ein- und Auschecken viel netter. Auch die Zimmer sind besonders schön und gemütlich eingerichtet. Ob es die kleine Küchenzeile ist mit der Kaffeemaschine, die einen beim nach Hause kommen mit einem Kaffee,Tee, Kakao oder Apfelcidre verwöhnt oder das Bad mit den tollen Pflegeprodukten von Occitaine oder auch das Frühstück in den aufwendig dekorierten Räumlichkeiten. Alles hat uns sehr gut gefallen. Das Hotel liegt in einer Restaurantgegend, so ist es nicht schwer für jeden Geschmack das passende Lokal zu finden. Auch Verkehrstechnisch ist die Lage gut.

title: OUTSTANDING Customer Service
text: This is my go-to when staying in New York for business or pleasure...solo or with family.  As other guests have mentioned, the location, cleanliness, decor, breakfast, in-room fridge, coffee and microwave all contribute to a very comfortable visit, and honestly is expected. But from my first visit to my tenth, the staff has gone BEYOND the expected to make my stay truly outstanding. I will always choose The French Quarters.

title: Excelente opção em NY!!!
text:
Já havia visto os relatos de outros viajantes no trip advisor e tudo se confirmou. O The French Quarter é uma super opção com excelente custo benefício.
Fiquei de 13 a 16 de março/14 em um quarto que eles colocam com desconto, por ser logo acima do bar e que pode ter algum tipo de barulho nos dias mais movimentados. Bem, paguei 218 dólares a diária com todas as taxas e impostos incluídos (uma barbada para NY). O detalhe é que não ouvimos um ruído... é claro que estava muito frio e então não haviam muitas pessoas na rua, mas a ideia de pagar bem menos por um hotel super bem localizado (1 e 1/2 quadra da Times Square), onde tu tomas banho com produtos da L'occitane, tem um ótimo café da manhã e ainda conta com uma máquina para fazer cafés e chás com cápsulas free a vontade no próprio quarto... está valendo muito!
Além disso o staff é muio legal e competente. Entre outras coisas, prepararam um café as 6h da manhã só para nós que iríamos correr a meia maratona de NY e nos deixaram fazer um late checkout neste mesmo dia sem cobrar nada.
Bem, na minha opinião este hotel é uma das melhores opções, porque ele realmente vale o valor que cobra pelos quartos e porque tem essa super barbada que são os quartos na parte em cima do bar.

title: Uma grande surpresa!
text: Só tenho coisas boas a dizer sobre esse lugar! O hotel parece ser bem pequeno, mas qualquer desconfiança já acaba na entrada. Funcionários super simpáticos e prestativos, café da manhã maravilhoso, produtos L'occitane de brinde, quartos grandes e confortáveis, localização ótima (em uma rua com restaurantes ótimos a cerca de 2 quadras da Times Square). Vale a pena, certamente voltarei a me hospedar lá!

title: Book it!
text:
If you are having any doubts, don't. This a great manhattan hotel and this is coming from someone who travels to NYC regularly and has stayed at several different hotels.  The location is great. A block and a half from Times Square.  That being said, you are not in the middle of the chaos of Time Square which was mandatory for me.   We booked one of the two bedroom suites which is perfect for a family. Two rooms, one shared living room with a sofa bed and one bathroom.  Here are the pros/cons:

Pros: Location is amazing.  A couple of blocks to almost any subway line in the city. Any foodies out there? You will love this place. On restaurant row in Hell's Kitchen.    The rooms were very clean which is always the most important thing to me.  I mean really, really clean.  Very large balcony with a great view of the city.  The beds were comfy and the free continental breakfast was good.  The room was spacious as far as Manhattan goes.  The staff overall was extremely attentive.  See more in cons regarding a few issues we had.

Cons:  Saturday night we could hear a bit of the noise from the bars.  Not the hotel's fault, but something to consider. The rest of the nights we didn't hear much.  We had a few other odd issues here and there 1) none of the remote controls worked initially in our room, but as soon as we told the front desk they come up with new ones 2) only one t.v. out of the three had all the cable channels advertised in the list of channels provided by the hotel.  We reported this issue, but it was never resolved. 3) we had a strange noise coming from the pipes behind our restroom. This issue was resolved by the front desk and the staff was very apologetic and accommodating.  John at the front desk is great!

Overall, our stay was great and we will definitely be back!!! I agonized over the right hotel to book since i was traveling with family and a 5 year old, I made the right choice!

title: The perfect choice for an NYC visit!
text:
Location: this hotel is on the 46th street, which is also called the restaurant row of Manhattan. It's around 2-5 minutes walk from the Times Square, but far enough to be away from the crowds. All of our city sightseeing tours could be accessed from here easily by foot so we found the location excellent.
Rooms: the rooms are clean, nicely furnished, with stylish decoration and pefectly working equipment (including fridge, kitchen sink, coffee machine with coffee and hot chocolate, ipod docker, hair dryer; dvd player, etc.). A home away from home practically.
Service: all of the staff members we met were very friendly and helpful all the time. The reception has a good selection of NY themed DVDs which they are happy to borrow you. We also got fresh newspapers and local tips each morning delivered to our room. Upon arrival we got immediately upgraded to a better type of room (king suite I believe it was) simply because it was available (certainly free of charge). Oh, and the breakfast was also fresh and a wide selection each day!
Cons: I was certainly also wondering, what could be the problem with this hotel then? The only issue that we found was the fact that it is located right on the top of a bar&restaurant (called Bourbon). This would mainly affect the rooms on the first floor, looking to the street  - so I would suggest you to avoid threse rooms. The hotel has 3 floors, and on the first floor the following ones will be the good ones: 104, 105, 106 (these are still above the bar but not looking on the bar entrance on the street). If possible, book a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor instead, not looking on the street.
Overall: one of the best hotels on our US trip! Great service! We can only suggest this hotel!

title: Delightfully Quaint
text:
I booked this based on Trip Advisor reviews and I was not disappointed.  Arriving early I was welcomed warmly.  Monica at the front desk was very friendly and extremely helpful.  I was escorted to my room once I'd checked in, shown the conveniences in my room then shown around the small...boutique style hotel.  My particular room was "over the bar" and had a queen sized bed, TV, kitchenette which included a Keurig and an assortment of coffees, a built in hotplate and a small refrigerator and sink.  The refrigerator had free bottled water and a couple of drinks which were supposed to be magic hangover potions haha.  The room also had an ironing board, iron and blow dryer.  The personal products provided were L'occitain.  This location is about a block and a half from Times Square....close enough to walk yet far enough away from the constant crowds.  Located in the heart of Restaurant Row, there were plenty of places to enjoy dinner.  Kinky Boots theater is around the corner on 45th and Wicked was just a couple of blocks away.  This location is absolutely perfect!  I will say though, I was concerned about being over the bar and noise but didn't see anything on TA about that...if you are booking this particular room be aware that you will hear the music (especially over the weekend) from Bourbon St until about 3AM.  I was so tired when I got in each night that it really didn't bother me but I thought this might be helpful information to you.  

Lastly, since I flew in to JFK to save money, a taxi to mid-town this location is about $50+.  The day I left Monica (at the front desk) wrote out step by step directions on how to take the subway and Air Trans to JFK which ended up costing me $7.50 rather than the $50+.  She went over the directions a couple of times, then wrote them down and made sure I had her business card with telephone number in case I had any questions .... I felt like she went above and beyond to try to help me save money...I thank you Monica I made it :)  

I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will book it again my next trip!

title: Oh so good
text:
With due  thanks to Trip Advisor ,I booked these apartments ., 
I stayed 7 nights at the end of February and each one spent here was  a pleasure
So much so that  no review does it total justice .
The desk staff are the best, so friendly ,helpful,attentive and just so professional,
Likewise for the  fabulous Bourbon Street Bar  next door.
The rooms are spacious clean and very well serviced.
 A little New York noise was audible on night one but after that it was that N Y buzz only .
Location amazing so central, just minutes from Time Square 
Thank you one and all .
 Marian Gallen
 Derry N Ireland

title: A delightful home in the heart of the Big Apple
text:
This little gem of a hotel, tucked away in the heart of New York was a perfect stay for one night in New York. Celebrating my wife's 30th birthday, it had enough about it to make it feel special without breaking the bank!

Very warm decor, clean facilities and welcoming staff.

One night has had us craving for more and definitely will be back in the future!

title: Hotel conforto em Nova York
text: Hotel muito confortavel, quartos grandes, bom cafe da manhã e especialmente o atendimento acolhedor e atencioso da equipe do hotel, que se desdobram para atender as necessidades dos hospedes. São mesmo muito acolhedores. No banheiro amenities da Locitane (muito bom) fartura de toalhas, e muito proximo das melhores atrações incluindo teatros e a Time Square, e está no coração dos restaurantes de NY.

title: Beautiful apartments!
text:
Last year I stayed at the New Yorker but wanted to find a more "boutique" place this time for my 2nd visit with Hubbie.  I booked this purely on the previous reviews of TripAdvisor and was not disappointed.  It was easy to find and we were quickly booked in by reception and given the choice of two rooms.  One in the main building above the Bourbon grille or in the Townhouse (rm: 307) which might be slightly quieter (as requested) so we went for the Townhouse.  All our luggage was promptly carried up and on entering the room we were very pleasantly surprised.  Two HUGE queen beds, lovely furnishings, fridge, coffee maker and spotless bathroom with large shower.  I'm a bit fussy when it comes to dusty rooms but there was nothing to complain of here! Continential breakfast was served in the Mezzanine which consisted of eggs, a variety of breads and bagels, cereals, yoghurts, pastries, muffins etc... with plenty of tea, coffee and juices so was more than enough to kick start a long day on the tourist trail.  At the end of our trip, we had bought enough clothing that we had to buy an extra suitcase to take it all back in and Niall (reception) even offered to help wheel it down with us to the Port Authority to get the transit back!  We did manage between us in the end but the staff could not have been more helpful, the location was very close to Times Square and the subway and we didn't experience any noise throughout our stay.
I will be returning later on this year and already looking at dates to re-book.....you will not be disappointed!

title: Second Visit As Great as the First!
text: I recently stayed at The French Quarters for two nights on a business trip to NYC. This was my second stay here, and I was delighted to be back. It had the same cozy feeling (more like a private apartment than an impersonal hotel), excellent staff at the front desk and neighboring restaurant (Bourbon Street Bar and Grille), and great proximity to so much of what New York City has to offer for business or pleasure.  My room was spotless and all of the carpets, furnishings, decor and linens are well-maintained.  On several business trips, I have faced issues with spotty wi-fi, but I have never had that problem here. I also had the chance to order room service from Bourbon Street Grille and really enjoyed my dinner.  During this visit, I contended with challenging weather, but my hosts made everything as convenient as possible for me, from providing me with tips on how the trains were running to making sure I had an umbrella.  I highly recommend The French Quarters and I look forward to staying here again soon.

title: 3rd times a charm !
text: Just wanted to pass along about another really great stay at the French Quarters in Manhattan. I spent Valentines weekend there and once couldn't have been more pleased. I hope that anyone considering staying in Manhattan will give this boutique hotel a try. It's really a "special" place.

title: Charming
text: We stayed 3 nights at the French Quarter and the experience was very nice. We booked a small suite on the first floor but were upgraded to a bigger one which was a pleasant surpirse! We were aware that we could experience some noise from the bar on the ground floor (which by the way has an excellent atmosphere and stays open until very late if you fancy a last drink before going to bed - we did not eat there, though) but this did not bother us much. Do go for a high floor if absolut quietness is a must! The details as regards service indeed make the difference (newspaper and daily tips - including weather forecast for the day - on your doorstep every morning, l'occitane products, complimentary water and coffee machine). Overall, it was lovely and the location is excellent to explore midtown and the south of Manhattan. The continental breakfast is very simple and it could be improved with some ham and cheese, for example. One final thing that was a concern is that we asked reception to book a car to go to the airport very early in the morning and the driver was 15min late! As we had time, it was not an issue for us and the receptionist did point out to the driver that he was late. I hope they take serious measures as regards their car services to ensure this does not happen with other guests.

title: Enjoyable place to stay
text: We were in NYC for a two-night weekend, which included a Broadway show.  This hotel was perfectly located, and very accessible to get to other parts of the city.  The entryway is very cramped, but we found the Irish gentlemen who worked the desk to be pleasant, helpful, and friendly.  The beds were very comfortable, it was clean, nicely decorated, and adequate -- although the room was kinda small.  But since we spend very little time in our room when we visit NYC -- basically a place to sleep and shower and change clothes -- this place was quite enjoyable.  The continental breakfast offering that comes with the room is generous, with plenty of variety and good quality basic offerings.  The next-door bar, the Bourbon Street Grill, was very loud, and the food wasn't too great, so I wouldn't recommend having dinner there.  But there are plenty of great restaurants very close by, so that's no problem.

title: Great Location
text: Stayed here in November, and can say it's in a really good location, 2 blocks or so from time square. The rooms were really nice and the beds very comfortable, bathroom was also great. Breakfast, in my opinion, was pretty average. Would recommend.

title: A mixed bag
text: After extensive research my husband and I decided that the french quarters would be a perfect way to start our honeymoon albeit slightly expensive. Our reception was lukewarm and borderline unfriendly by an Irish guy who checked us in and showed us our room. Another receptionist proved unfriendly when we had some queries. The room was somewhat dark and small but overall had a luxurious feel with a large bed. The bathroom was lovely with a fabulous shower and gorgeous products. A surprise my new husband organised did not go as he had planned..he had asked for champagne and chocolates but we got champagne and a beautiful bouquet of roses which we had to reluctantly leave behind as we were off to Boston the next day. We did not say anything as we didn't want anything to spoil or sour the start of our honeymoon and the flowers were beautiful although my husband was disappointed his surprise didn't work out as planned. The breakfast was average but of similar quality to what we experienced in other hotels in America. The restaurant downstairs is worth stopping by, service and food is good with a reasonable price. Location wise this hotel is good.

title: Perfect location, friendly staff and comfortable room
text: Spent a week at the hotel and had a great time. Very comfortable beds, good breakfast and perfect location. It makes sense that the street is named 'Restaurant Row' - lot's of great options! We walked all over NY from here and really enjoyed out stay.

title: Perfect for theater-goers
text:
Due to complicated circumstances that add nothing to this discussion, I stayed at the French Quarters while on a business trip to NYC.  Although it was not especially near the venue for my conference, it was well-situated for most of midtown Manhattan.  

The room was amply large, 2 queen beds, the bathroom was very spacious, clean and modern.  There was a mini-kitchen, coffee pot, sink, fridge, etc., but it was still very nice to have the provided Continental breakfast before rushing off to day two of my conference.

title: 女一人旅で宿泊
text:
値段は高いですが、お風呂やお部屋はセンスもよく文句なしで綺麗です。
立地的には小道に入りますが、安全だと思います。
フロントの紳士はとっても素敵でした！フロントの方と少しお喋りしてたときに宿泊客のおばさまにホテルの従業員と間違えられるというハプニングが起きて、少しムカッとしましたが、良い思い出です。
朝食はパンと飲み物という簡単なモノでしたが、まぁ美味しかったです。
レストランも大通りまで出れば全く不自由しないと思います。
１泊２万円オーバーで４泊したので私にとっては高価な滞在でしたが、インテリアが素敵なので、お姫様気分を味わえました！

title: Home away from home
text:
We were visiting NYC over Christmas, before continuing on to Europe. I had heard some (horror) stories about NYC, about price gouging, tiny dogboxes of rooms, rude people ... so I spent some time researching and finally decided on the French Quarters, mainly because of its reviews. I still had my fingers crossed as we arrived in the taxi; initial impressions of W46th Street weren't great, with rubbish piled on the footpaths ... err, sidewalks ... and overflowing onto the road. This was somewhat compounded by the front desk -- a telephone box-sized area at the end of a long narrow passage.

However, within a few minutes I knew I had chosen well ... the young bloke who checked us in couldn't have been more helpful or friendlier, check-in was a breeze, and we were soon in our room. My first impression was a feeling of comfort. This was no impersonal big hotel with cookie cutter rooms; this room had been designed and furnished by humans to make the guest feel comfortable. And it worked a treat. We had a separate bathroom (large!) with L'Occitane en Provence accessories, a pod coffee maker, a microwave ... everything we needed. Our bed was large and even my crook back had no complaints. 

We later met the manager, Colin, who was a gracious and accommodating host. When I was unable to get a nightcap one night for my wife and me, he unhesitatingly handed over a bottle of his own 12-year-old Irish whisky, saying, 'Just leave what's left in the room'!! Amazing. He was happy to advise us and answer our endless questions about places to go, things to see, places to eat and hop-on, hop-off buses. Nothing seemed too much trouble for him.

As for location -- it's perfect. It's an easy 5 or 10 minute stroll (literally) to Times Square and only half a block to a major stop for hop-on, hop-off buses. At no time did we feel unsafe, even walking back to our room very late at night. On our last day, we weren't being picked up for the airport until 3.00 pm. I asked Colin if he could look after our luggage for us. 'Just keep your room until then', he said. I can't see that happening at too many hotels!!

I think we would have had a very different -- lesser -- stay in NYC had we chosen a different hotel. We would go back there in a heartbeat, and i can only heartily recommend it to anyone who's even contemplating a visit.

title: great location lovely staff
text: I stayed in the French Quarter Dec 2013. I have to say the location was brilliant and the rooms were lovely. Though a bit small as there were 4 of us sharing. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the fact that we had a fridge, microwave and coffee making facilities made the rooms even better. If I was to complain about one thing it would have to be the bed or at least my side, it was lob sided and i woke every morning with a pain in my hip. Other than that i have nothing negative to say about this hotel and i would most certainly stay here again.

title: Great Location, Friendly Service and Comfortable Room!
text:
After spending a long time trying to decide NYC hotel we would stay in, I'm pleased we chose this one.  I couldn't have picked anywhere better to stay in New York.  From the friendly welcome and easy quick check in, to the clean room; I felt we were well looked after during our stay.

The rooms tick all the boxes; they are pleasantly decorated, cleaned to a high standard, comfy bed and good shower.  Perfect place to relax after walking around New York all day.  I especially liked the nice touch of receiving a news letter every morning, which informed us of the weather and suggestions of things to do. 

The continental breakfasts are good (as far as continental breakfast go, that is), with a good choice of cereal, yoghurts etc and a whole pint of orange juice!

The location is perfect if you are going to see a show, not too far to walk to any of the theatres on Broadway.  There are a variety of restaurants on the street and not forgetting the excellent bar "don't tell mama" which is just across the road.

I would like to say a big thank you to all the staff who looked after us during our stay.

title: Inspired
text: I loved this hotel so much it even inspired the new look of our bedroom in our new house. It is absolutely gorgeous, and clean (a botique hotel)... it sits on a quiet street in a restaurant hub... About minutes walk to timesquare, easy access to the subway, laundry mat around the corner, friendly and helpful staff.. la pulperia accross the street has amazing south american food... I was devistated when we had to leave. If we ever manage to go back to NYC the french quarters is where we will be staying!

title: Perfect for New York
text:
A great location, far enough from Broadway and Times Square to be chilled out but close enough to be just a short walk to the main attractions, restaurants and crowds.  There is a bar and restaurant associated with the hotel and if you have a room on floors 1 and 2 at the back of the hotel this may be an issue for sleeping but on floor 3 we did just fine.

The breakfast is a bit weak.  Not a great selection but enough to get you going and into your first deli of the day.  Subway as it two block north and south so really easy to get down to Soho, Manhattan etc.  The 7-Day Unlimited MTA is a must, even if you are there for just 3.

I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great boutique hotel, excellent service and loca.
text: What a wonderful stay we had this winter at FQGA. From our first contact with the hotel via phone to our friendly farewell from the staff upon departure, the service we received can only be described as excellent. Although Tripadvisor may classify it as a hotel, the fine attention to detail and focus on guests' comfort makes FQGA feel more like high quality bed & breakfast. The personable, engaging staff was helpful and genuinely concerned about maximizing our experience both in the hotel and around the city. Our room was cozy, though lovely and well-appointed. The retro-tiled bath is dramatically lit, stylish and functional with a large glass walk-in shower. The linens are lush and bed is uber-comfortable with plenty of pillows and blankets. The continental breakfast (served until 10am) is simple but more than adequate and staffed by (again) very attentive waitstaff. The convenience of the location on Restaurant Row is excellent. Our room, situated at the back of the hotel but just above the (also excellent) co-located restaurant/bar, was so quiet it was easy to forget we were steps from Times Square and the Theatre District's best venues. Transportation to other parts of the city is easy, with metro stops an easy walk in 2 directions. It is hard to believe the value that this boutique hotel provides for (comparatively) affordable rates.

title: Calm Oasis in the Middle of Manhattan
text: We had a great stay at The French Quarter last summer. We usually stay at B&B’s and boutique hotels when possible, and The French Quarter definitely fits in that category. We were just there to get a few errands knocked out downtown, but if this is your first time to the city (or even if you are a NYC veteran), then this is a great pick. We drove into NY, so we needed a place to park the car, and there’s a parking garage that’s about 2 or 3 blocks away. If you tell the hotel beforehand, they can tell you the garage location that gives them a discounted rate. The hotel is located within walking distance of Times Square and the theater district and there are several nearby metro stations that are about 5-10 minutes away. The rooms are a bit small (just remember you are right next to Times Square, so small is average), but comfortable, complete with free wifi, a fridge and comfy bed. They give you a daily sheet with nearby events, the weather, and a few other things which was a great touch. There’s a good sports bar/restaurant downstairs that has great happy hour specials, and this is also where they serve the complimentary breakfast in the morning. We’d recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Manhattan for business or leisure. The value was superb, friendly and helpful staff, good food, comfortable rooms, convenient downtown location, and very fair room rates.

title: Thank you TripAdvisor!
text: Originally we had booked somewhere else as I was trying to 'economise' on our trip to NYC, coming at the end of a 3 week vacation... but my other half persuaded me to try this place after we found the reviews here, and we are so glad we did. The real stand out for us were the staff and service: really genuinely friendly (not fake) and helpful. So many great little touches. L'Occitane products in the bathroom - very classy. Great in room fridge and coffee maker plus complimentary water and soda (hangover cure!). The bed was amazing - so comfortable and cosy, especially as it was so cold out! Can't recommend highly enough and hope to come back again with more time so that we can enjoy the hotel's own restaurant and bar 'Bourbon Street'.

title: A convenient unique boutique hotel
text: It you plan to go to New York City for the theater and like small hotels, this slightly out-of-the-way spot is perfect.  The hotel is a converted brownstone located on 46th St. in the middle of "Restaurant Row."   Pros: can walk to all theaters in Broadway area,  large rooms, "essence" of a kitchen, excellent linens and décor, nice bathrooms, friendly staff, more than sufficient breakfast included in price, conveniently located to many places, clean. many restaurant choices on the block.  Cons:  no lobby - just a narrow hall with a desk, front rooms can be noisy at night, no dishes in "kitchen" cabinets or glasses for wine, no closets - just armoires, a little expensive.  But, we will stay there again in the future.

title: Ummm...  Just WOW; Just PERFECT
text:
So, Hi.  I am a little lost in terms of what to write.  And so - I am hoping that the person who wrote this review won't mind that they put into words what I would write...  So?  I've quoted most of it...

"The position of the French Quarters was great, in Restaurant Row, Theatre District, just off Hell's Kitchen. A five minute walk to Times Square and easy walking to the two Theatres we attended." (We attended three)

"FQ suited us perfectly, small, personal and immediately welcoming" the "staff were exceptional". 

The suite had a "Coffee machine with different pods, daily newspaper, "whats-on" - in the city and further afield were very welcome. Plenty of fresh food daily for continental breakfasts. Nothing was a problem, we had good food in the attached Bourbon Street Bar and Grill, the whole place was very festive for Christmas and it felt great to be in New York!! Our 4 nights there were well spent and we'd happily recommend it." (We stayed 8 nights and would say the same...!!).

The beds were incredibly comfortable -- and the in-suite heating was really quick to respond.  Being Australian, I am an bit energy-conscious and so I refused to leave the heating on when out during the day.  So - when we got home, I turned on the heating and the rooms got warm very quickly.  The TV in my room (we were in a two-bedroom suite) was an added bonus and made the nights so lovely and comfortable.

I love the tiny reception and the entry corridor...!!  This place is BLOODY GREAT.

title: Beautiful
text: it was a very nice place stay , the place is cozy &  the bed are very confortable. the decoration of the room make you very special ( new orleans style , brique walls...) the location is perfect , if you want to have a romantic get away like in the movie , it is the perfect spot.

title: Charmoso
text: O hotel é muito interessante. Algo diferente do que se está acostumado em hotéis nos EUA. O café da manhã é excelente. Muito próximo da times square, o que pode ser bom ou ruim, dependendo do espírito.

title: Couldn't be better
text: The position of the French Quarters was great, in Restaurant Row, Theatre District, just off Hell's Kitchen.  A five minute walk to Times Square and easy walking to the two Theatres we attended. Even walked to Central Park.  It was our first visit to the US and we'd researched carefully, not really liking huge hotels. FQ suited us perfectly, small, personal and immediately welcoming - Colin and his staff were exceptional, making sure everything was to our liking and helping with bookings, places to eat, etc.  So-comfortable king size bed in a good sized room.  Lots of hot water and also good sized bathroom with lovely L'octaine shampoo and conditioner. Coffee machine with different pods, daily newspaper, "whats-on" - in the city and further afield were very welcome. Plenty of fresh food daily for continental breakfasts. Nothing was a problem, we had good food in the attached Bourbon Street Bar and Grill, the whole place was very festive for Christmas and it felt great to be in New York!! Our 4 nights there were well spent and we'd happily recommend it.

title: Never again
text: Manager was possibly one of the rudest people I have ever encountered. Kicked out before even unpacking for being under 21, a rule which was never posted online. You would think there would be better service from a place where you pay a grand a night for a suite, and then travel hours just to be kicked out.

title: Home away from home
text:
Just back from staying 7 days in the French Quarter, where do i start! From the moment of check in to check out this place have your best interests at heart. The beds are the most comfortable and hard to get out of in the morning to go about your day. The complimentary breakfast is everything you could want from the freshly squeezed OJ(or cranberry), ample supply of bagels, cereals, pastries, muffins, fruit and scones. Fresh coffee, tea and hot water, lots of preserves, butter, milk and good morning America playing on the flat screen Tv's. The staff were all lovely and we certainly left the breakfast room full and ready to take on the day.  
The bathroom with endless hot water and lovely l'octaine shampoo and conditioner is an added bonus. housekeeping are invisible but there every day and leave your room perfect.
i loved the coffee machine and complimentary coffee, tea, hot chocolate and apple drinks. Each morning the newspaper and a whats in in NYC today sheet is left under your door which is a lovely touch. The complimentary wifi is great speed and we had no issues, it was great to have to plan your day ahead, every room also has a safe which we also used, although this place feels like home i'm not sure you needed it!.
This place is walking distance to Time Square, 5th Ave, Columbus Circle, all the theaters, and its only a block to the nearest subway which brings you straight in on 2 line from JFK. 
We had requested a quiet room away from the bar and were housed in the townhouse nextdoor to the main hotel, the downside no lift(we're very unfit!) the upside, complete tranquility which is hard to believe in this hotel in the center of it all but we slept soundly every night. The staff were great bringing our luggage to and from the room and also holding our luggage for the day after checkout until it was time to go. There are plenty of restaurants in walking distance and also places to takeaway a bite if you're on the go. 
This place really is a gem i will definitely go back again i was afraid to leave a good review or it may get booked out!!! Well done The French Quarter full marks, excellent service we'll be back.

title: Excellent night in NYC for Holidays.
text:
My wife and I make a pilgrimage to New York City every other year to visit family. Despite having a lot of family in the New York/New Jersey area and us usually staying with them; we wanted try something different and stay in the city at least one night. I found this hotel by reading Trip Advisor and we booked; we were not disappointed in anyway.  The hotel is like an old New Orleans hotel, where you enter off the street, go down this long corridor to a small reception area which has the front desk and the elevator.  It’s a pretty small hotel of only 27 rooms so the staff is minimal. We were checked in by Colin; he was great.  He took us to our room, made sure everything was working, even adjusted the temperature in the room for us. The next day he was ok with us having a later check out. 

The décor of the room does resemble that of an old New Orleans Hotel.  The Armoire, the end tables, the small table by the door, even the tile in the bathroom all have the “old world feeling”.  We stayed in room 202, which is a studio; there was a small kitchenette that had a small refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker, and even a small stove.  There is a restaurant /Bar attached to the hotel called Bourbon Street Bar and Grill, all set up as if it were Mardi Gras.  We did have a problem with lunch the next day due to a gigantic group of patrons coming in, insufficient staff and not much available in the kitchen. We wound up leaving, but upon check out, we were met by the GM and the Executive Chef who could not apologize enough for their mistakes and offered us free lunch right then and there; since we had already eaten we declined but they sent us a “comp” to our e-mail anytime we wanted it.  That was very unexpected and very nice and very nice to see someone taking ownership.  
We would definitely stay here again next time we are in New York.  

A few tips: 
The Hotel is on 46th Street, the parking garage that is contracted with the hotel is on 45th street.  Parking is $40 per 24 hour period.
The hotel is right in the heart of restaurant row and bars in New York stay open until 4am.  Any noise from the street did not bug us at all. 
You are within walking distance to most of the shows on Broadway and one block from the subway.

title: The search is over!  This is the place!
text: Nestled in the heart of the City, on Restaurant Row, is a gem called the French Quarters Guest Apartments.  The minute we stepped off the street we knew we had made a great decision!  We felt as if we just stepped back in time and were greeted as if we were family.  Colin and the management were so accommodating.  They personally showed us to our beautiful, immaculate room and assisted us with dining reservations, great advice on navigating NYC, and of utmost importance to them was our comfort.  (Thanks John, for making sure I had an umbrella during that snowstorm!)  Our king size bed was and is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in.  Layers and layers of sheets, blankets, pillows and comforter a top a mattress so plush it was like sleeping on a cloud!  Parking garage is close by.  We didn't have to walk far with our luggage, which is always a plus.  When visiting New York City, we will never stay anywhere but The French Quarters!

title: Beautiful and Comfortable stay,must stay!
text: i loved loved loved and enjoyed my stay! Staff is extremely friendly,rooms are very clean and breakfast was perfect.Just a couple of blocks from times square.Management is outstanding and resourceful.I will be back this coming summer,can not wait!

title: Awesome Place to Stay!!!
text:
Probably the best hotel experience I've ever had. We got a great deal on the room because we booked one over the top of the bar. We stayed over the weekend so there was loud music, but I knew that going in and it wasn't bad enough to bother me. 

The staff is second to none. I've never wrote a review for anything (although I constantly shop online and use other people's reviews/forum posts), so that should tell you just how pleased/impressed I was. Colin welcomed us and was super friendly throughout our stay. He and the rest of the staff were all outstanding hosts.

Breakfast was just right. Very cool place with a great atmosphere.

Location was perfect for us. A very short walk and you're in Times Square.

The room was super clean, plenty spacious, and just had a cozy/classy feel to it.

Highly Recommended!!! This couple from Thayne, WY was very pleased!

title: Not a single complaint
text: I went with this Hotel because of it's proximity to Times Square (3 blocks), and the theater district, and because I got a great deal on Kayak for it. We spent the weekend (Sat & Sun) in early December '13 to do some sightseeing, take in the sights and sounds of NY city at Christmastime, and to see the Rockettes Show. We arrived around 11:30am (3.5 hours before check-in), but were met with a clean room that was ready for an early check-in. The manager on duty walked notified us that we were being upgraded to a room with a King size bed at no charge, and took us up to our room and showed us around. He was very nice. The room was very nicely decorated and inviting. The room had a kitchenette (mini-fridge, 2 burner ceramic top stove, sink, and microwave), a very spacious and nicely decorated bathroom, and a king sized bed. There is a bar attached to the hotel, that is accessible through the elevator in the lobby, and is key controlled, so that only guests can use the elevator to go to the rooms. The lobby is also key controlled after 8pm. There are several parking garages close to the hotel offering good rates for parking. The walk to times square and the theater district is an easy one. It's basically a straight line to the heart of times square. There was a continental breakfast  being offered until 10am, and checkout was at 11am. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel, and will, and will, gladly stay here again.

title: Excelente achado
text: Este charmoso hotel foi um achado à apenas 1.5 quadras da Times Square. Hotel pequeno, mas bastante acolhedor, com atendimento impecável por parte das pessoas da recepção. Tivemos um tratamento que garanto muito acima do esperado, em hoteis desta categoria. O tamanho do quarto e banheiro, também superaram nossas expectativas. Os mimos de higiene são da L'Occitane. O café é simples, porem suficiente. Próximo do metrô e de tudo que importa para quem está viajando à turismo. Recomendamos e retornaremos.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: What a find in NYC. The location is excellent because it's in the theatre district and near subway. The management is outstanding and very helpful. Room is clean, comfortable and quiet. Continental breakfast is adequate.

title: recommended
text:
stayed 4 nights early nov 2013 with 2 members of my family
nice staff, helpful. good size room, 
we regret there is no lounge or nice entrance hall to chill out, sit out, plan the day,..
There is a good bar in adjoining building but it is more like a pub, bar with music and wooden chairs and table (and quite dark). 

IMPORTANT  the rooms in the annex, next door building , are much nicer , fresher, probably more recently redone ( and price is the same).

overall we recommend it

title: Thanksgiving Weekend French Quarters Style
text: What a wonderful treat, from the minute we entered and met Paul at the reception desk.  Even though it was 7:45 a.m. our room was ready and we were made to feel welcome, including letting us know that we could still get a Continental breakfast before heading to view the Macy's parade. He gave us a tip about where we could get a view and take photos.  Amenities and decor are not the typical hotel style and the accommodations were comfortable and cosy. I was with my granddaughter, and both of us would go back again. It is also very conveniently situated in the Times Square area and within walking distance of many nearby areas.  Highly recommend.

title: Attentive staff
text: Try to book a room at the back of the hotel unless you are an insomniac. The night-time noise from nearby restaurants and bars is problematic until the wee small hours at weekends if you have a room at the front. But otherwise, we we were very happy with the hotel. Expensive - like all New York hotels; reasonable buffet-style breakfast; very attentive staff who really try hard.  Only a 4 block walk to th nearest subway from the funky area of the hotel.

title: Fantastic in every way! Location, service & comfort
text: We were a group of ladies travelling to NYC for special birthday celebrations staying for 8 nights. We booked a 2 bedroom apartment and some double doubles.  All the rooms were beautifully appointed, the beds & furnishings wonderfully comfortable. A coffee machine, beautiful bathroom products, soft towels - a newspaper and a "whats happening in NYC today" daily info sheet slipped under our door every morning.  Breakfast (included in room price) was all that was needed with cereals, toast, bagels, eggs, pastries, juice, coffee/tea. The service and staff were fantastic!! Thank you to Colin (Manager), Monica, John, Michael, Tori (and anyone else I may have forgotten. They knew us by name and made us feel as though the French Quarters was our "home away from home". They were able to answer any questions we had. On our arrival the Friday evening Monica went out of her way to see that we settled in with everything we needed. The location was perfect!  2 blocks to Times Square and Theatre district and a great selection of restaurants within walking distance. The Bourbon bar and restaurant next door to the hotel was a great spot for dinner & drinks & they provided room service too. I highly recommended this hotel and look forward to going back again one day!

title: Ótima localização
text: Hotel muito aconchegante e próximo da broadway e de tudo que interessa para quem visita nova York quando se fala de turismo. Quarto espaçoso porém extremamente barulhento se ficar no 1 andar, visto que o bar funciona diariamente até as 4 da manhã, sugiro entrar no clima e curtir a festa junto ou procurar ficar em um andar mais alto, porém bem mais caro.

title: Gateway to Broadway and so much more....
text:
Step away from the lights of Broadway, the blaring of horn and sea of people in Times Square and Viola-welcome to the French Quarters.  The wrought iron railings, gas light style lamps and the sweet sound of jazz coming from the restaurant all made for a quiet haven in the city that never sleeps.
 Colin and his staff were warm and welcoming and the rooms were tastefully decorated, inviting and full of Old World charm.  Comfortable, Quiet and most of all right in the heart of the theater district, restaurant row and Times Square.
This will be one of our favorite places to stay while in NYC as it is truly a gateway to all that is happening in the city.

title: Just loved it
text: We stayed in a total of 12 hotels on our Canada/US trip and by far this was our favourite. We dealt with fantastic staff, our room was so tastefully decorated was like walking into 'home' and had so many little features (a great coffee machine with a huge array of pods, juices and soaps,lotions of beautiful quality, a daily newspaper and hotel daily "whats happening") The bed was sensational to sleep in.  Breakfast was all we needed before we headed off on our foodie days. Colin the manager came by and chatted 2 of the 4 mornings we were there, asking if all was to our liking. A huge thankyou to Tori who helped us on our booking, getting via train and taxi to the hotel and her great welcome and cheery daily chats! It is fantastically located close to the theatres, Times Square, and restaurants everywhere. The Bourbon Bar and Grille was a great spot for dinner and drinks too. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great space and comfortable feel in a great location!
text: We were planning to do the NYC tourist gig in mid-October and wanted to stay close to Times Square - Great pick!  The location is perfect for the theatre and Times Square access, yet quiet and spacious.  The staff was very helpful and there was a great selection of restaurants in a 2-3 block radius.  This place made a great home for a 4 night stay. Since breakfast was included, it was easy to get off to a well fed, healthy start each moring.  I'd stay there again!

title: A perfect base to explore NYC from
text:
It was my first trip to NYC and I couldn't have picked a better location! This hotel is placed perfectly for Times Square, Broadway - and the whole of Manhattan to be honest! The hotel is on Restaurant Row so there are plenty of places to eat and drink on the doorstep and the hotel also provides a very good breakfast for guests. The staff we met were all very helpful and friendly, and there were clearly a lot of guests who were on return visits which is always a good sign.
The room itself was quite small but stylish and the bathroom was a very good size, another plus was the coffee maker which was a great way to start the day; the only draw back was the size of the wardrobe which was impractically small but this was only a minor issue. Would definitely stay here again if in NYC

title: Beautiful, peaceful haven
text:
I have just returned from a 5 day stay with my family ( Mum and Dad and two teenagers ) at The French Quarters.  The Quarters' prime asset is the location quickly followed by the quality of the rooms and the intimate feel, it has only 27 rooms.  ( For readers of a certain age, the area reminded me of the video of the Rolling Stones' 'Waiting on a friend' ). We were only a short walk from the hustle & bustle of Times Square and as New York is a walker's city we found ourselves within striking distance of everything we wished to see.  The marvel of the Quarters is though you are in the midst of the action, above a lively bar (Bourbon Street Bar and Grille), with the sights and sounds of NYC on your doorstep, as soon as the windows are closed you are immediately cocooned in a peaceful, luxurious space of your own.  We took a 2 bedroom suite ( room 401 ) which to my very great surprise had a private balcony from which we could view NY's mid-town and 'restaurant row' (W46 street) below, featuring a good part of the world's cuisine in a single street.   The fridge was stocked for our arrival with water and an interesting herbal drink in plentiful supply.  Each day we received a free copy of the local newspaper and a 'What's happening today' fact sheet giving ideas of what to do and a guide to the weather.  This was a nice touch and typical of the manager's approach to looking after his guests.  

The King Size bed was fit for Henry VIII and the en-suite bathroom and main bathroom were exceptionally well designed and spotless every day.  A modest lounge and kitchenette separated the bedrooms though bizarrely the kitchen was stocked with neither crockery nor cutlery which suggested to us we were not really encouraged to eat in.  Frankly this was never an issue as eating out in NY has to rank as one of life's great pleasures.  Most days we would return to the Quarters tired and happy with our bellies full.  The layout of the Quarters is interesting , 2 sets of stairs only one of which will lead you to the mezzanine level for breakfast the other to the street.

There have been many comments on this site about the good quality of the buffet continental breakfasts.  We found the breakfast to be of variable quality (coffee in urns, limited choice of breakfast food) with mostly apathetic service, I lost count of the number of times I asked for hot water to make tea, and in the end we skipped in-house breakfast altogether in favour of proper coffee and tea from one of the hundreds of Starbucks throughout NYC.  Interestingly when Colin, the manager appeared I noticed the breakfast service upped its game considerably.  Similarly the approach and attentiveness of reception staff varied hugely. Still, this is New York I told myself and it's hard to impress a New Yorker with your plans for the day.

We had one negative experience.  I must stress I do NOT hold the Quarters responsible for this but I need to share this to alert other foreign visitors to NY.  One evening my wife suffered a severe allergic reaction, we suspect to sea-food eaten an hour earlier.  We rushed back to the Quarters.  The reception staff were on the ball and very attentive and called a 24 hour emergency doctor on my behalf.  The agency supplying the doctor needed my credit card details and promised to send a doctor within 30 mins.  The estimated cost given was $800.  The reception staff thought this was 'ridiculous' and suggested i took my wife to hospital.  On balance i decided to have the emergency doctor examine my wife first then take appropriate action.  One hour later the doctor arrived.  His first question was : 'may i please see your insurance documentation?'. I supplied and he read to his satisfaction.  He then turned his attention to the patient who by this time was sleeping and having taken a couple of anti-histamines appeared to be fine.  The doctor spent 5 mins examining my wife and announced she was fine and that the anti-histamines had done the job.  This was the reassurance i was looking for and i breathed a sigh of relief.  Next the doctor invited me to handover my credit card and complete AND SIGN a form which i did gladly, he then completed section 2 of the same form which included an itemisation of the costs.  The total was a staggering $3,700 !!!  When i challenged him that this was $2,900 higher than the estimate and that he'd spent only 5 mins and prescribed nothing his response was a shrug and 'the insurance will pay'.  When pressed he showed me a sheaf of a dozen or more identical forms the majority of which showed the same charge $3,700!  Having signed the form BEFORE the costs were itemised i had fallen into the trap.  The doctor, genial and friendly though he was had massively over-charged for his service.  This is a scam and well engineered to exploit people in a vulnerable state, so please, fellow travellers beware of this and never sign anything until you're clear on the total costs.  My credit card was debited the very next day with the full amount $3,700.

I alerted Colin the manager to what had happened and he was furious and called the Doctor 24 agency immediately.  This particular case will continue for some time.

However, aside from this unfortunate experience we all loved NYC and the French Quarters and I recommend it highly but please keep your eyes open and your wits about you.

title: Small NY hotel with friendly B&B personality
text: French Quarters is a tiny boutique hotel on restaurant row, a block from Times Square, and a million miles away from the impersonal, impatient, soak-the-tourist mentality of many New York hotels. My "standard" room was tiny but had everything I needed (except for a fitness center or deal with nearby club): queen bed, desk, free wifi, plus refrigerator, sink, stove, Kreuger coffee maker, very nice, modern bathroom. Nice view, too, of distant skyscrapers. Free breakfast included some excellent fresh baked scones, as well as yoghurt, muffins, apples and bananas. The biggest plus: I've never met such a friendly, helpful, eager to please staff in either a hotel or B&B. I left my iPHone on the bed when I checked out, and didn't realize till I was on the train. It had NOT disappeared, as so often happens with valuables left behind at hotels. They had it, and offered to overnight it to my home address. Is that service or what?

title: Warm, friendly & great location!
text:
Aside from the great location on restaurant row, which is a nice tree-lined street just 2 blocks from Times Square and 1 block from Hop-on-hop off bus tours, you feel as if you have arrived home when you walk  in the door.  All of the staff are very friendly and super helpful with recommendations and transportation assistance.  

The single rooms are on the small side but beautifully decorated and comfortable. They have wi-fi, a great breakfast room with continental breakfast (a large selection of pastries, cereals, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit etc.), refrigerator and coffee maker in the guest rooms - all included in the room rate.  We stayed on two separate occasions are were upgraded on our second visit to a beautiful, spacious 1 bedroom suite - an unexpected surprise.  

It is an easy walk to many theaters AND no matter what your age do not miss going across the street to Swing 46 for great live music and dancing (or watching) - their food is very good as an extra bonus.

Just more reasons to Love New York!

title: Best place to stay in NYC!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed staying for 4 nights in the heart of Manhatten in June 2013! This hotel has everything you could wish for! Located just a few blocks off of Times Square, and nestled in the middle of Restaurant Row, (amazing restaurants including Italian, Jazz Bar, in addition to the fun, lively Bourbon Street Grill next door and much more!)  You are walking distance to literally everything you'd like to see, or the front desk can arrange a yellow cab for you too!  Broadway shows, Central Park, Radio City Music Hall,  Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, Museums, Shopping and so much more! The front desk hospitality was over the top wonderful - special thank you to Tori for all the little extras you did for us to make our stay extra special! Super comfortable beds, great breakfast with lots of healthy options served in a sunroom, and our King Sized room was spacious and super clean, even had a Keurig Machine! We can't wait to return one day!
